excerpts: I got the veggie omelette with home fries and they were gracious enough to sub the bread option with a small green salad on the side.
Would definitely come back if I'm in the neighborhood.
Really cute interior decor and felt like a hip local spot :)
small green salad.author: Yin H.
small green salad.review: This seems to be the place to go for brunch in dogpatch. Even on a rainy day, there was a line but we were seated quickly enough. Great food, good service (they did mess up our order but corrected immediately). The beignets are to DIE FOR!!! They are so light with just the right amount of powdered sugar (read A LOT!). I got the veggie omelette with home fries and they were gracious enough to sub the bread option with a small green salad on the side. Would definitely come back if I'm in the neighborhood. Really cute interior decor and felt like a hip local spot :)

excerpts: All roast turkey fans -- they have a great homemade turkey sandwich!!
I LOOOVE roast turkey on drier and less sodium side.
roast turkey.author: Mami T.
roast turkey.review:
All roast turkey fans -- they have a great homemade turkey sandwich!!  I LOOOVE roast turkey on drier and less sodium side.  If you agree with me, give them a try.

It was also cool that they also fed me their turkey on weekends when they only serve brunch food, not normal lunch menu that includes sandwiches.

excerpts: Today I ordered my regular sandwich roast turkey (which is supposed to have mayo,mustard, pickles, tomatoes and lettuce) SIDE NOTE:
They have NEVER once put pickles or mustard on my sandwich even though I've asked every time.
Anyway - I ask for no lettuce and to add avocado and bacon instead (just like i do every time).
My wishes are always granted in those regards
and I'm usually charged an extra $1.00 - $1.50 at the most.
Today was a different story,
I went from paying  $7.95 (something along those lines) to paying $12.10 FOR A F'ING SANDWICH.
roast turkey.author: RC V.
roast turkey.review:
I am a frequent "just for you" customer.  I pretty much always order the same thing (either a sandwich or salad).  Every time I order I am always paying a different price which can vary from cents to as much as a dollar - no biggie right?  I don't question because I like the food and the service is pretty quick with "to-go" orders.  

Today I ordered my regular sandwich roast turkey (which is supposed to have mayo,mustard, pickles, tomatoes and lettuce) SIDE NOTE:  They have NEVER once put pickles or mustard on my sandwich even though I've asked every time.  Anyway - I ask for no lettuce and to add avocado and bacon instead (just like i do every time).  My wishes are always granted in those regards and I'm usually charged an extra $1.00 - $1.50 at the most.  Today was a different story,  I went from paying  $7.95 (something along those lines) to paying $12.10 FOR A F'ING SANDWICH.  Are you kidding me????  

When I asked the host about the incorrect charge she told me that I had ordered a side of bacon and a side of avocado.  I corrected her and said NO, I wanted a little bit of each on the sandwich - something that shouldn't cost me an extra $5.00 being that the sandwich is listed on the menu as $6.95.  The girl/lady - whoever she was, then told me that it was going to be that way from now on and SORRY!   

I think it's very poor customer service, at the very least she could have discounted the difference of what I usually pay and let me know for next time.  Now there's not going to be a NEXT TIME!!!!  I will never go back based on the service today.  

Oh - and another thing.  I don't know who she is, I assume the owner.  She was very rude to one of her employees.  She even rolled her eyes to the customer about him.  I made eye contact with another customer who was standing there waiting and he made an "uh-oh" face.  It was very weird and rude.

Overall - the food is good when they get the order right and precise, I just won't be giving my paychecks to them anymore!!!!

excerpts: Ordered the grilled chicken sandwich, buttermilk fried chicken sandwich, reuben sandwich, and beignets.
Grilled chicken was good with provolone cheese.
Fried chicken could have used more flavor on its own but with the honey butter it was very good.
Reuben had delicious corned beef.
All the sandwiches had homemade bread toasted perfectly.
Beignets were too doughy more like doughnuts.
Service was very friendly and quick.
Overall atmosphere was very fun and quirky.
reuben.author: Melissa W.
reuben.review:
Came here for lunch on a Wednesday and it was super crowded. We were still seated almost immediately. Ordered the grilled chicken sandwich, buttermilk fried chicken sandwich, reuben sandwich, and beignets. Grilled chicken was good with provolone cheese.  Fried chicken could have used more flavor on its own but with the honey butter it was very good. Reuben had delicious corned beef. All the sandwiches had homemade bread toasted perfectly. Beignets were too doughy more like doughnuts. 
Service was very friendly and quick. Overall atmosphere was very fun and quirky.

excerpts: Let me start by saying their Reuben Sandwich is just..
wow.
I've had plenty of Reuben Sandwiches but this has got to be my absolute favorite.
The customer service there was amazing from walking in to walking out.
As soon as I walked in the very respectful host asked my sister (who is 8.5 months pregnant) and I to please sign the waitlist that's outside.
No problem with us.
He called us in after not that long of a wait and immediately engaged with us and congratulating my sister on her pregnancy.
It's funny because you can tell when people are being nice because they need to know, or when they're being nice because they're genuinely nice people.
It was SO genuine.
After being seated (it is a bit tight in this cafe, and from what I've noticed it looks like it gets busy often.
We went there on a weekday for brunch and it was pretty packed) we were taken care of by a lovely waitress who checked up on us at all the right timings.
What really got me was that the general manager was walking by and greeting everyone and really helping out his team.
I thought it was overall a great experience in the cafe and will definitely go again.
reuben.author: Melanie P.
reuben.review:
This is seriously the cutest little cafe I've been to in a while. Let me start by saying their Reuben Sandwich is just.. wow. I've had plenty of Reuben Sandwiches but this has got to be my absolute favorite. The customer service there was amazing from walking in to walking out. As soon as I walked in the very respectful host asked my sister (who is 8.5 months pregnant) and I to please sign the waitlist that's outside. No problem with us. He called us in after not that long of a wait and immediately engaged with us and congratulating my sister on her pregnancy. It's funny because you can tell when people are being nice because they need to know, or when they're being nice because they're genuinely nice people. It was SO genuine. After being seated (it is a bit tight in this cafe, and from what I've noticed it looks like it gets busy often. We went there on a weekday for brunch and it was pretty packed) we were taken care of by a lovely waitress who checked up on us at all the right timings. What really got me was that the general manager was walking by and greeting everyone and really helping out his team. I thought it was overall a great experience in the cafe and will definitely go again. Possibly make it a usually brunch place. 

PS: They have a variety of delicious mimosas. Pint size for cheap. Seriously, GO!

excerpts: My daughter had the Reuben, which she found to be one of the better ones she's tried; unfortunately, I was not as lucky with my choice.
reuben.author: Chris B.
reuben.review: This was my first time in the Dogpatch area, and had decided to stop here with my daughter after a local midday acupuncture session. The place was very inviting, casually comfortable, and we sat at a nice table for two on the sidewalk. The server was friendly and prompt. The lunch menu had a good variety of sandwiches, po-boys and a several entrees that looked appealing. My daughter had the Reuben, which she found to be one of the better ones she's tried; unfortunately, I was not as lucky with my choice. I opted for the crab cake po-boy, a featured item. It looked fabulous - two generous cakes on a soft white bun with fresh tomato and lettuce. The flavor of the crab cakes was ok,  but maybe they forgot to fry it?? With the first couple bites, the nicely shaped cakes turned instantly into piles of mush that squeezed out all sides of the sandwich. It was a mess to eat and the texture was very unappealing. Was this a mistake by the kitchen staff? I can't imagine they could be so proud of those crab cakes, which were the worst I've eaten. Ever. I would come here again to try something else, or for breakfast, but being a visitor from Colorado, that's not likely. My advice is to give them a try, but avoid the crab cakes!

excerpts: Got the Reuben for lunch with a lemonade and a side of fries.
The Rueben was perfect, the lemonade nice and tart and not over sweet.
reuben.author: Joshua G.
reuben.review: Pretty solid.  Got the Reuben for lunch with a lemonade and a side of fries.  The Rueben was perfect, the lemonade nice and tart and not over sweet.

excerpts: I can also recommend the reuben sandwich there...mmm so good.
reuben.author: Matea F.
reuben.review:
Really good tasting food. And the choices to choose from are overwhelming (in a positive way)! 
I had the yummiest niçoise salad, which left me very full and happy with my choice. I can also recommend the reuben sandwich there...mmm so good.
This place is a local gem with a variety of what it looked like regular customers!

Parking on the street or take the cal train/metro, etc. it is a rather small and cozy diner, if you are curious about the size.

excerpts: Thanks for the 411 Reuben.
reuben.author: Sabrina L.
reuben.review:
I always give props to businesses for caring about their customers! Someone from JFY took the time to write that the crab cakes are Creole style & not New England style (which is the one I'm used to). I still would get a scramble over the crab cakes tho if I were to ever return.

As for their bread, while I'm personally not a fan, they are selling loaves & loaves of it out so perhaps it is simply a matter of taste.

Thanks for the 411 Reuben.

excerpts: It can be SUPER hot depending on the batch of chiles, so taste with caution if you are sensitive.), Reuben Sandwich on Rye or Huevos Rancheros.
Some more of my favorites are the Oatmeal Pancakes (wheat free!)
Cobb Salad and the house burger, which I get on Gluten-Free toast (keep in mind this is not a "gluten-free" facility, so cross-contamination is always a possibility).
Not super-expensive like everywhere else in SF these days
and they have a great vibe and comfortable atmosphere--
so don't bring your attitude, and tip generously!
They appreciate their regulars!
reuben.author: Alyce K.
reuben.review: Not only is the food amazing (the owner is a chef, and demands only the best ingredients), but the service is friendly and attentive. Even when there is a line, they do a great job of keeping things moving and trying to minimize your wait time. Also, the cooks are super fast, so even if they are busy, the wait for food is never excessive. Have the beignets and chicory coffee, or a pint sized mimosa (fresh grapefruit/Cypress Mimosa is the best), or delicious fresh juices (some organic) are another great option. Things not to miss: Chilaquiles and Corned Beef (both are specials, so get 'em when you have any opportunity), New Mexico Green Chile sauce (made with Hatch chiles and taste like the real deal according to my friends from New Mexico. It can be SUPER hot depending on the batch of chiles, so taste with caution if you are sensitive.), Reuben Sandwich on Rye or Huevos Rancheros. Some more of my favorites are the Oatmeal Pancakes (wheat free!) Cobb Salad and the house burger, which I get on Gluten-Free toast (keep in mind this is not a "gluten-free" facility, so cross-contamination is always a possibility). Not super-expensive like everywhere else in SF these days and they have a great vibe and comfortable atmosphere--so don't bring your attitude, and tip generously! They appreciate their regulars!

excerpts: There is a good selection of vegetarian items, but you can also order a delicious reuben and surprisingly not walk out feeling like you have a brick in your stomach.
The quality and freshness of ingredients is apparent throughout.
Love this place and will certainly be back.
reuben.author: Corinne R.
reuben.review:
Being a new patron of the Dogpatch, I have now been to Just for You Cafe twice. I immediately loved the atmosphere, and the signage where they threaten to pour coffee on your cell phone. Any place promoting face to face conversation is an A+ in my book. They display an awesome collection of screen printed concert posters and the atmosphere is laid back but attentive. As another reviewer put it there is really nothing pretentious about it, which is refreshing coming from the Mission.

They are one of the original purveyors of the slow food movement and their menu is New Orleans themed. Its good to know that I have a place where I can get beignets, po boys, and muffaletta sandwiches whenever I want. There is a good selection of vegetarian items, but you can also order a delicious reuben and surprisingly not walk out feeling like you have a brick in your stomach. The quality and freshness of ingredients is apparent throughout. Love this place and will certainly be back.

excerpts: Their reuben sandwich is absolutely to die for.
I'm an east coast girl that knows her Jewish deli delights...however...
Carnegie has nothing over
Just For You when it comes to the reuben!
reuben.author: Renee F.
reuben.review:
Okay.  I'll admit it.  When I first moved to the DP I was slightly annoyed by the constant congregating taking place outside this establishment.  I went in a few times for breakfast and the food was tasty.  

It wasn't until recently that I became a devout fan of this charming little spot.  

Their reuben sandwich is absolutely to die for.  I'm an east coast girl that knows her Jewish deli delights...however...Carnegie has nothing over Just For You when it comes to the reuben!

Lelakek Et Ha'etzba'ot!

excerpts: They've also taken my favorite sandwich, the veggie reuben, off of the menu.
The three stars are for the courtesy coffee outside and the unbelievable begniets, which are still worth seeking out once in a while.
But beware the hollandaise!
reuben.author: Sarah S.
reuben.review:
As one of my favorite brunch/linner spots in SF, I thought Just For You would be the perfect spot to meet up with a group of local and out-of -town friends for breakfast this morning, so we packed a half-ton of ladies into a couple of cars and made our way to Dogpatch.

Now, I'm not complaining about the wait. I knew there would be a wait, especially for a group, and everybody was apprised of this and impressed with the coffee-while-you-wait setup. We actually didn't wait too long, since we compromised the group dynamic by having 3 volunteers sit at the bar while the rest of us took a table. 

I'm also not complaining about the rapid changes to the neighborhood and is demographics, startling as they were. We actually found parking quickly, and the babies were all cute enough. I'm really not even complaining about the service, since the place is packed, although I think my girlfriend really needed more than one cup of coffee after last night, and my friend actually did want that milk and cornbread, even if it was sickening to imagine that she was going to pack it away alongside her Cowgirl breakfast. 

My REALLY BIG PROBLEM is the hollandaise. I ordered the "Special Scramble #1," which is basically 3 eggs, spinach, mushrooms, shrimp, and crab cake bits all scrambled and covered with hollandaise. Yum, right? I know, and I was really looking forward to dipping my home fries in some yolky, buttery, lemon-scented goodness. And then my food came.

Hollandaise sauce is made of egg yolks, butter, and lemon juice. All three of these foods are extremely YELLOW in color, and when emulsified into a sauce should coat a spoon or finger, like thick gravy or melted ice cream. I've eaten hollandaise sauce in many different places and at many different times. Some has been sublime, other sub par, and as long as it's not chunky I can usually cope. But never, ever, EVER have I encountered GRAY HOLLANDAISE SAUCE. Yes, gray. And chunky, like watery ricotta. It was like the discharge of various STDs is often described, actually. It was totally gonorrhea sauce. 

I sent my plate back before it even hit the table. I said, "This is wrong, the sauce is broken." That was a vast understatement of what was the matter, but I figured any cook could look at my plate and instantly know what the problem was. However, when my plate came back it was simply with naked eggs---and A GIANT SIDE OF THE GRAY HOLLANDAISE. It looked exactly like the sides of grits other people were getting. I stuck my finger in the bowl to demonstrate that it was not a proper sauce, and got a finger full of grease and chunks of what appeared to be cooked egg yolks. It tasted and smelled like hard-boiled eggs. Who the fuck would serve that to somebody? Who the fuck would want that on their eggs? I told the runner they needed to make a new batch, and proceeded to eat my unsauced eggs.

A few moments later a server came by, and told me that the kitchen could not make more hollandaise, that this was the batch for the day. OK, I know that this shit sits around, and I accept that fact because I love hollandaise and it usually doesn't make too much of a difference. But what I got should have been thrown out before it ever hit my plate, and I suspect it was never right to begin with. Plus, it only takes about 30 seconds to make, especially in the blender. I told the waitress that if they weren't going to make more sauce they needed to stop serving it to people, and at that point I didn't just mean me, I meant anybody who happened to eat at this restaurant that I've been raving about for 4 years---but then I saw a benedict come out, covered with the ghastly gray stuff.  

It makes me sad to see Just For You go downhill like that. You used to be able to taste the love, and now I detect a hint of absentee ownership and cheap kitchen labor. They've also taken my favorite sandwich, the veggie reuben, off of the menu. The three stars are for the courtesy coffee outside and the unbelievable begniets, which are still worth seeking out once in a while. But beware the hollandaise!

excerpts: The menu is quite nice as it appears you can order breakfast at anytime, but, being lunch, I ordered a Veggie Reuben and a beignet (I had to, I love beignets).
My companion had grilled cheese and a salad which she enjoyed.
The Reuben was beautiful and almost as hot as our waitress (you know the one :) ).
The veggies were wonderfully cooked and the Reuben sauce was perfectly proportioned and seasoned.
Really quite nice.
The best part was that the rye bread (made in-house) was perfectly toasted--
I love it when the center is crunchy and moist while the crust is crunchy and chewy.
Wow!
The beignets are awful.
Almost rancid.
Tasted totally store-bought mix to me.
Too salty, consistency not good at all and too much powdered sugar (a thick layer of Gu that actually turned bitter.
How is that possible?)
it could have been that the oil was either too new or too old, I guess, or is it just that they have no love for the beignets?
Just using, abusing perhaps, them as a marketing tool.
reuben.author: Roop D.
reuben.review:
This spot reminds me a bit of the NYC-- something about the interior and the street. A diverse crowd of Dotconners and artist-types were already eating (do these people ever work?). 

Upon entering, the wonderful smell of baking yeasty type treats granted me a peak back into my youth-- my dad (a rocket scientist) is an amazing baker; this fact has certainly put a little tonnage upon me (should a 6'3" vegetarian go 220, it is a fit-220), but it has also allowed me to really appreciate the sweet things.

The menu is quite nice as it appears you can order breakfast at anytime, but, being lunch, I ordered a Veggie Reuben and a beignet (I had to, I love beignets). My companion had grilled cheese and a salad which she enjoyed. It looked delicious.

The Reuben was beautiful and almost as hot as our waitress (you know the one :) ). The veggies were wonderfully cooked and the Reuben sauce was perfectly proportioned and seasoned. Really quite nice. The best part was that the rye bread (made in-house) was perfectly toasted-- I love it when the center is crunchy and moist while the crust is crunchy and chewy. Wow!
Great lemonade and appears to be 'endless'.

I was really feeling 5 stars here (8 stars for the waitress)-- I know, I know. Rest assured that I am just looking at the menu and not ordering.

Then I took a bite of beignet. How do I say this without sounding unclear?
The beignets are awful. Almost rancid.
Tasted totally store-bought mix to me. Too salty, consistency not good at all and too much powdered sugar (a thick layer of Gu that actually turned bitter. How is that possible?) and not enough of that deep-fried magic. 

It could have been a bad day for the fry cook it could have been that the oil was either too new or too old, I guess, or is it just that they have no love for the beignets? Just using, abusing perhaps, them as a marketing tool. Dough can be temperamental and insolent if ignored or taken lightly, and when scorned all the sugar in the world will not make it delicious again.

I think out this way you get soppapillas, but if you really, really want a beignet this ain't the place (The Farmer's Market in LA has a nice beignet.)

excerpts: The vegi reuben could easily be my favorite sandwich (ever).
Listen to me when I say, awesome.
AWESOME!
reuben.author: David C.
reuben.review: Can I just say, I've never been disappointed. This place is GREEEAT! It feels like I'm home in Sacramento enjoying the freshy cooked meal of my mum. I love the servers and enjoy the fresh lemonade. You will spend an average of 10-15 per meal. The vegi reuben could easily be my favorite sandwich (ever). Listen to me when I say, awesome. AWESOME!

excerpts: The reuben was the best I've had in my life.
The corned beef was very very fresh and amazingly cured.
It had no fat on it and was the perfect size.
reuben.author: Max S.
reuben.review: This place served me some of the best food I've ever had. The beignets were amazing,delicious and cheap. There must be an entire box of powdered sugar on each plate of those things. The reuben was the best I've had in my life. The corned beef was very very fresh and amazingly cured. It had no fat on it and was the perfect size. Same goes for the BLT, perfect slices of bacon. I love the style of this place too

excerpts: They've also taken my favorite sandwich, the veggie reuben, off of the menu.
The three stars are for the courtesy coffee outside and the unbelievable begniets, which are still worth seeking out once in a while.
But beware the hollandaise!

excerpts: I had the Creole crab cake sandwich on rye.
Funny thing is the bread is twice the size of the patty but everything else was on point.
The sandwich was really flavorful, complete with lettuce, pickles, and tomatoes (I think).
It was about $10.
I would definitely order again.
creole crab cake sandwich.author: Melinda Y.
creole crab cake sandwich.review: I had the Creole crab cake sandwich on rye.  Funny thing is the bread is twice the size of the patty but everything else was on point.  The sandwich was really flavorful, complete with lettuce, pickles, and tomatoes (I think).  It was about $10.  I would definitely order again.

excerpts: I had a delicious Creole crab cake sandwich here for lunch today and the owner and staff were amazingly helpful!
I was looking for a hair salon in the neighborhood and everyone gave suggestions.
The owner Arienne actually make a handful of phone calls for me trying to locate one.
She ended up finding a very nice place I have an appointment with tomorrow.
creole crab cake sandwich.author: Grant E.
creole crab cake sandwich.review: I had a delicious Creole crab cake sandwich here for lunch today and the owner and staff were amazingly helpful! I was looking for a hair salon in the neighborhood and everyone gave suggestions. The owner Arienne actually make a handful of phone calls for me trying to locate one. She ended up finding a very nice place I have an appointment with tomorrow. =)

excerpts: Favorites include the BLT, pancakes, Huevos Ranchero's and homemade chorizo.
blt.author: Mary S.
blt.review:
We live in the neighborhood and this is the best place for breakfast/brunch. Great service and food. Favorites include the BLT, pancakes, Huevos Ranchero's and homemade chorizo. 

Go early or be prepared to wait. If you do have to wait, it is well worth it!

excerpts:
:)
Biscuits and Gravy
BLT with Home Fries
The biscuits were great-not sheet goods, but actual individuals and tasty!
The milk gravy slightly sweet (as it should be) with good tasting sausage.
They knew what I meant when I asked for my BLT bacon to be limp (and it was).
The homemade bread was toasted on one side (inside) and really nice crumb.

Our friends had:
Special-Italian Omelet
Pancakes, eggs, bacon and corn (cake-
it has sugar in it)
bread
This was our first venture into the Dog Patch and we enjoyed ourselves.
This is another solid lunch/brunch place that we would visit again.
blt.author: Simon D.
blt.review:
Great food, worth the wait!
Loads of kitch here-posters and signs talking about having a good attitude; the staff does! Seems to be trying for a Southern/Louisiana theme-I am not well enough versed to say they pull it off, but the food was great so not really a concern.
The line was long though we did not get there until 1:30 and they would not seat a partial group (2 were there early). We understood this once we saw how small it was inside and they were full right up until closing.
We had several things:
Beignets--this was the item most reminiscent of LA (not the city.) Though they were a little doughy and not as light as some, they were good (Fat and Sugar!) :)
Biscuits and Gravy
BLT with Home Fries
The biscuits were great-not sheet goods, but actual individuals and tasty! The milk gravy slightly sweet (as it should be) with good tasting sausage.
They knew what I meant when I asked for my BLT bacon to be limp (and it was). The homemade bread was toasted on one side (inside) and really nice crumb.
Our friends had:
Special-Italian Omelet
Pancakes, eggs, bacon and corn (cake-it has sugar in it) bread 
This was our first venture into the Dog Patch and we enjoyed ourselves. This is another solid lunch/brunch place that we would visit again.

excerpts: Great food - friendly service - BLT on home-made white bread (or wheat if you prefer) was substantial with flavorful tomatoes and beautiful bacon.
YUMM!
Thanks for a delicious lunch.
blt.author: Laurie Anne B.
blt.review: Great food - friendly service - BLT on home-made white bread (or wheat if you prefer) was substantial with flavorful tomatoes and beautiful bacon. YUMM! Thanks for a delicious lunch.

excerpts: I tried the BLT (I wanted some A
but they ran out of avocados that morning)
and the crab cakes and
while Oralia's makes an infinitely better sandwich, what can you expect from a breakfast joint?
The crab cakes were pretty good!
blt.author: Christine P.
blt.review:
-Update- 

I've returned several times since and am still a fan. I tried the BLT (I wanted some A but they ran out of avocados that morning) and the crab cakes and while Oralia's makes an infinitely better sandwich, what can you expect from a breakfast joint? The crab cakes were pretty good! I think I make them better but that takes some time so for a quick crab cake fix without traveling too far from home, Just For You may just cut it.

-End Update-

I woke up craving buttermilk pancakes. Normally, I'll make 'em myself using my handy-dandy griddle but I didn't have any buttermilk. Who knew there was a great brunch place so close by to where I live?! 

The Boyfriend and I drove over, found a nice parking spot a few feet from the front door and after examining the menu outside, walked in to the register. I ordered a Cowgirl (two pancakes, two eggs any style, two sausage links or two bacon strips) and the Boyfriend wanted a Greg Scramble with chorizo. We also saw on Yelp that a lot of folks liked the beignets so we got some too. 

Yes, our eyes were bigger than our stomachs. I was astonished when a guy came out to us carrying three to-go boxes. The stack was almost up to my knees. The wait for a table wasn't too bad for a Saturday brunch place (I'd say it would have been about 15-30 minutes) and they have a small table set up outside with free coffee. We waited about 10 minutes for our to-go order. 

I was quite pleased with my pancakes. They were big and fluffy and the syrup wasn't any Aunt-Jemima-like-imitation. The sausage and eggs weren't anything to write home about but were passable. The Boyfriend's chorizo scramble was tasty - lots of Parmesan and chorizo and the home fries were nice and mealy. The beignets were what you'd expect - donuty taste and lots of powdered sugar. 

All in all, I'm quite happy with Just For You. As the Boyfriend said, four stars for being solid brunch food. We're planning on going back soon to try other things and maybe they'll wow us into five.

excerpts: The BLT.
It is the BEST BLT
I've ever had.
There, I've said it.
blt.author: Jackie C.
blt.review:
Super Duper retro-kitschy place with fresh, well-prepared breakfasts and lunches. This place used to be so small when it was up on 18th Street that it only had one table... their location now in Dogpatch/Potrero is much better to handle the crowds. 

As dependent as I am on mine, I still appreciate the NO CELL PHONES policy posted in multiple places around the restaurant. Threats include throwing it in the soup and pouring coffee on it!!


Food? Thick cut bacon, buttermilk pancakes, good fast cup of coffee as soon as you sit down, and eggs done the way you ask. You can get grits "just like you had in prison", but make sure you get toast on one of their homemade breads. if you're there for lunch, burgers are great, the turkey sandwich is *real* fresh roasted turkey like you'd get the day after Thanksgiving (somewhere where the turkey is cooked right)
The shining star? The BLT. It is the BEST BLT I've ever had. There, I've said it.

excerpts: Same goes for the BLT, perfect slices of bacon.
I love the style of this place too
blt.author: Max S.
blt.review: This place served me some of the best food I've ever had. The beignets were amazing,delicious and cheap. There must be an entire box of powdered sugar on each plate of those things. The reuben was the best I've had in my life. The corned beef was very very fresh and amazingly cured. It had no fat on it and was the perfect size. Same goes for the BLT, perfect slices of bacon. I love the style of this place too

excerpts: there is nothing better than a blt or burger in this joint... fast flair, new Orleans style all round.
maybe someone sometime had something not so hot... but dont let that change or sway you away...
there is nothing i mean nothing that isn't great!
Also walking distance from my pad.
Im in love...
blt.author: Rachel L.
blt.review: there is nothing better than a blt or burger in this joint... fast flair, new Orleans style all round. maybe someone sometime had something not so hot... but dont let that change or sway you away... there is nothing i mean nothing that isn't great! Also walking distance from my pad. Im in love...

excerpts: My first meal, I had poached eggs (done to perfection) with hot link (DEELISH) and the best south Louisiana style French toast I have eaten outside of my own kitchen, since moving to this great city in 1996.
hot link.author: Calla F.
hot link.review:
My first meal, I had poached eggs (done to perfection) with hot link (DEELISH) and the best south Louisiana style French toast I have eaten outside of my own kitchen, since moving to this great city in 1996. Every time we eat there, we order beignets for the table, also an authentically prepared deliciousness! And did I mention great dark roast coffee refilled happily, fresh fruit cups/bowls available, and yes they actually have righteous grits! And great iced tea...the list actually goes on to include everything we've tried on the menu.

Our weekly Koffee Klatch first met here on a Tuesday morning about 2 years ago. The service started out fabulous and has kept right on being that way.  We are a bit difficult to serve well...we are a bunch of lesbians and our friends over 50 who never know how many of us will show up. (We nosh and chat all over town at a different breakfast-y diner-ish place every Tuesday-for nearly 5 years now!). And we always want separate checks. The first time, the waiter sat us down at a table then said he'd just keep the other closest empty til we knew how many would be here. Sweet man!  The owner stopped by for a chat - she's from my neck of the woods down in Louisiana, and although I have avoided "eating Southern" in San Francisco, that is exactly what I wanted to do, so I did. Now when I want authentic taste served with San Francisco sensibility, this is THE breakfast spot in the City. It was simply so good that the Koffee Klatch repeats meeting for breakfast here, on a Tuesday, once every quarter or so! And now they know us, they get us right into the best spot for us so we can add folks as they arrive.

excerpts: Avocado toast and crab cake were obismally bland and underseasoned.
And who likes a crab cake with tons of filler?
I wanted to give the place 2 stars since my toast was dry and the avocado and arugula didn't have any oil or seasoning on it, and the crab cake was absolutely horrible.
crab cake.author: Jack R.
crab cake.review:
Just for you maybe, but not for me.

Avocado toast and crab cake were obismally bland and underseasoned. And who likes a crab cake with tons of filler? Not me.

Service was slow and my brothers chorizo omelette tasted like it was from a fast food chain. Barely any chorizo but he said he liked the homestead potatoes.

The beignet was like warm and tasted like regular fried bread, nothing tasty or special about it.

I wanted to give the place 2 stars since my toast was dry and the avocado and arugula didn't have any oil or seasoning on it, and the crab cake was absolutely horrible. But, since my brother said to give this place 3 stars so be it.

Just never coming back here again.

excerpts: Another asked for his take on the crab cake.
He said it's phenomenal and went on raving about it, so they ordered it.
The crab cake arrived burnt to a crisp -- completely black.
crab cake.author: Nic Z.
crab cake.review:
I can't explain how disappointed we were with Just For You Cafe.

It's been in my bookmarks for a couple years, and I decided to take my family when they visited because they love quirky neighborhoods and diners like this.

Service was prompt although very chaotic and disorganized; within 45 seconds, we had three different people come to our table to take our order. That is no exaggeration.

The man who ultimately took our order made suggestions for ways to alter our dishes which actually made them more expensive -- but he never mentioned the price differences.

For example, one person asked for pancake recommendations, and he said "You should do one of each!" Lo and behold, getting two different pancakes has an upcharge - but we only learned this upon getting the check.

Another asked for his take on the crab cake. He said it's phenomenal and went on raving about it, so they ordered it. The crab cake arrived burnt to a crisp -- completely black. It was unrecognizable from a properly-cooked crabcake, and obviously inedible.

At the very start, we were also poured two mugs of coffee without anyone asking if we want it, so we assumed it's included; this is the case in plenty of diners in our home state so, again, we had no idea it has a cost (or how much) until the bill came.

Coffee was poured in the beginning but never replenished, poor service continued, and the multiple instances of being given or offered things without knowing their cost is poor business, plain and simple.

excerpts: I ordered the Crab Benny - crab cake eggs Benedict - bomb and the boyfriend ordered the chicken and waffles - bomb.
crab cake.author: Marilou A.
crab cake.review:
The beignets are so good! The dough is light fresh and even better when you wash it down with Ritual coffee.  The staff is super friendly and don't give you the stink-eye when you ask what is recommended. I ordered the Crab Benny - crab cake eggs Benedict - bomb and the boyfriend ordered the chicken and waffles - bomb. 

Definitely coming back since they gave us a card for free beignets -score!!

excerpts: Two Eggs (Fried - medium) with Creole Crab Cake (with Home Fries and Biscuit) (3.5/5) -
The crab cake wasn't my favorite (it was kind of creamy? not sure), but the home fries (crispy) and the biscuit (nice buttery inside and crumbly outside) were great.
As expected, the eggs were standard.
crab cake.author: Cynthia M.
crab cake.review:
I came here on Saturday with a group of 4 around 1:30pm. We waited for about 10 minutes, so not too bad. We ordered the beignets, which came out pretty quickly, but we also ordered other dishes, which we had to wait around another 30 minutes for, which is kind of a bummer because I was realllly hungry. Aside from the slow food, service was excellent!

Beignets (4/5) - Not as greasy as other beignets I've had, which was nice. Delicious and sugary.

Two Eggs (Fried - medium) with Creole Crab Cake (with Home Fries and Biscuit) (3.5/5) -  The crab cake wasn't my favorite (it was kind of creamy? not sure), but the home fries (crispy) and the biscuit (nice buttery inside and crumbly outside) were great. As expected, the eggs were standard.

excerpts: I had the Creole crab cake sandwich on rye.
Funny thing is the bread is twice the size of the patty but everything else was on point.
The sandwich was really flavorful, complete with lettuce, pickles, and tomatoes (I think).
It was about $10.
I would definitely order again.
crab cake.author: Melinda Y.
crab cake.review: I had the Creole crab cake sandwich on rye.  Funny thing is the bread is twice the size of the patty but everything else was on point.  The sandwich was really flavorful, complete with lettuce, pickles, and tomatoes (I think).  It was about $10.  I would definitely order again.

excerpts: The crab cake eggs Benedict had such a good balance of flavors - each bite was never boring.
The hollandaise was delicious and acidic too.
I felt that the home fries were a tad under seasoned, but that is far better than getting overtly salted foods.
I am definitely curious to come back to try their chicken and waffles, as well as grits.
crab cake.author: Nathan K.
crab cake.review: I went here for the first time today, and I loved it. The crab cake eggs Benedict had such a good balance of flavors - each bite was never boring. The hollandaise was delicious and acidic too. I felt that the home fries were a tad under seasoned, but that is far better than getting overtly salted foods. I am definitely curious to come back to try their chicken and waffles, as well as grits.

excerpts: I had the dungeness crab cake sandwich..
did I spell that right?
My partner in crime got the huge hamburger.
crab cake.author: Vince N.
crab cake.review:
Awesome place. I love these independent food places that cater to it's neighborhood.

I would rather much eat here than any other chain places.

I had the dungeness crab cake sandwich..did I spell that right? My partner in crime got the huge hamburger. I think my meal was better hands down. 

The huge beignets, definitely the highlight of the meal.

The best I've had in California so far.

Well, if I'm in the neighborhood, I would come back for another crab sammy.

The waitress was great..very sweet and funky fresh.

excerpts: Despite all that, the crab cake was seasoned well and they had one of the best hollandaise sauces I've had in a long time.
I would go back based on the value, I like leaving a place full and that mission was accomplished.
crab cake.author: Gina B.
crab cake.review: Good food, crowded but good service still. The amount of food and taste for the price was worth it. I ordered the crab Benedict and it came out cold so that put a damper on the meal, but the flavor and quality was still there and I still enjoyed it. The egg was a little underdone for a Benedict and still had a bit of raw egg white inside of it. Despite all that, the crab cake was seasoned well and they had one of the best hollandaise sauces I've had in a long time. I would go back based on the value, I like leaving a place full and that mission was accomplished.

excerpts: We weren't sure what to order but with very helpful suggestions we grabbed a Rueben and a Crab Cake Sandwich on their own made bun.
crab cake.author: Kevin C.
crab cake.review:
This place was recommended by the girls at Rickshaw. 

We weren't sure what to order but with very helpful suggestions we grabbed a Rueben and a Crab Cake Sandwich on their own made bun. 

The unlimited refill Iced Tea and the Abita Root Beer rounded off a delicious lunch. 

Super friendly service combined with delicious food gives you a winner.

excerpts: I opted for the crab cake po-boy, a featured item.
It looked fabulous - two generous cakes on a soft white bun with fresh tomato and lettuce.
The flavor of the crab cakes was ok,  but maybe they forgot to fry it??
With the first couple bites, the nicely shaped cakes turned instantly into piles of mush that squeezed out all sides of the sandwich.
It was a mess to eat and the texture was very unappealing.
Was this a mistake by the kitchen staff?
I can't imagine they could be so proud of those crab cakes, which were the worst I've eaten.
Ever.
I would come here again to try something else, or for breakfast, but being a visitor from Colorado, that's not likely.
My advice is to give them a try, but avoid the crab cakes!
crab cake.author: Chris B.
crab cake.review: This was my first time in the Dogpatch area, and had decided to stop here with my daughter after a local midday acupuncture session. The place was very inviting, casually comfortable, and we sat at a nice table for two on the sidewalk. The server was friendly and prompt. The lunch menu had a good variety of sandwiches, po-boys and a several entrees that looked appealing. My daughter had the Reuben, which she found to be one of the better ones she's tried; unfortunately, I was not as lucky with my choice. I opted for the crab cake po-boy, a featured item. It looked fabulous - two generous cakes on a soft white bun with fresh tomato and lettuce. The flavor of the crab cakes was ok,  but maybe they forgot to fry it?? With the first couple bites, the nicely shaped cakes turned instantly into piles of mush that squeezed out all sides of the sandwich. It was a mess to eat and the texture was very unappealing. Was this a mistake by the kitchen staff? I can't imagine they could be so proud of those crab cakes, which were the worst I've eaten. Ever. I would come here again to try something else, or for breakfast, but being a visitor from Colorado, that's not likely. My advice is to give them a try, but avoid the crab cakes!

excerpts: Next time I'm in the Dogpatch, I would love to try their crab cake eggs benedict on the weekends!
Love their posters and signs on the walls!
Hilarious!!
Their website is cute too with links to their menu!
By the way, I did notice a slight price difference between weekday breakfast and weekend brunch for the same items.
Also they seem to serve better stuff on the weekends of course!
Service was okay.
But since it was busy our food took awhile.
Our server, Holly, was super sweet though!!
crab cake.author: CeCe C.
crab cake.review:
Friday at 10:30am, this place was still packed!! O_O Don't people have work or something? 

1. Beignet ($1.65): This is a must order!! It was big, but I was actually expecting it a lot BIGGER because everyone wrote that it was "HUGE"!!! haha So I was expecting a UFO flying saucer size :P I love adding the strawberry jam that's on the table to the beignet!!! Then it's like an awesome jelly filled donut!!! Yum!!! :D

2. Oatmeal Pancake: I could just barely finish my 1 stack. It was a bit uncooked? =\ I was intrigued. Never heard of an oatmeal pancake before. But I wasn't really crazy about it after consumption. The pancake taste wasn't there and almost too moist and mushy. bleh. I was almost sad that I didn't get the cornmeal pancakes :(

3. Cornmeal Pancake: LOVED!!!!! Luckily my friend offered me some of hers! Ahhhh It was soooo light and fluffy! Loved the cornmeal texture!!! Yummy yummy!

Julie K and I came here for breakfast last week before heading up to the North Bay! Because seating was limited inside, we were able to quickly get seats at the counter and right in front of the kitchen! Super cushiony seats! ^^ We ordered 1 beignet, 1 oatmeal pancake, and 1 cornmeal pancake. I was trying to read through the reviews the night before. No one really wrote anything about these oatmeal pancakes, and I guess I know why now. It's all about the beignets and cornmeal pancakes here!! :D

Next time I'm in the Dogpatch, I would love to try their crab cake eggs benedict on the weekends! Love their posters and signs on the walls! Hilarious!! Their website is cute too with links to their menu! By the way, I did notice a slight price difference between weekday breakfast and weekend brunch for the same items. Also they seem to serve better stuff on the weekends of course! Service was okay. But since it was busy our food took awhile. Our server, Holly, was super sweet though!! :)

excerpts: I also had the two eggs with home fries, biscuits, and a Cajun crab cake.
The biscuits were disappointing, but everything else was pretty good.
crab cake.author: Becca S.
crab cake.review:
I came here for breakfast right before driving back from San Francisco to Portland. 

As many other reviewers have stated, the beignets are worth getting. I'm not sure I've ever actually eaten a beignet before? But! I would best describe it as tasting like a funnel cake that is socially appropriate to eat with breakfast. 

I also had the two eggs with home fries, biscuits, and a Cajun crab cake. The biscuits were disappointing, but everything else was pretty good.

excerpts: Got the crab cake eggs Benedict on a biscuit and it was delicious.
My friend's bacon made me envious.
crab cake.author: Hayden P.
crab cake.review: Solid mimosas. Got the crab cake eggs Benedict on a biscuit and it was delicious. My friend's bacon made me envious.

excerpts: eggs w/ crab cakes and a side of home fries: their crab cake wasn't too bad
but we've had better.
-French Toast:
crab cake.author: Jenny K.
crab cake.review:
I'm not hyping this up for anyone but Just For You Cafe make the best beignets in the city! This, severely rained on with powder-sugar, pillow shaped pastry is soft and fluffy on the inside and has a thin crusty bite on the outside. Great flavor, great texture and tastes simply blissful with their raspberry jam! If we had ordered just the beignets and nothing else then it would be a 5 star rating, however we ordered a couple of their other breakfasts and found it to be just so-so. 

On top of the beignets, we had their: 
-Fritata of the decade w/ a side of grits: nothing out of the world but it wasn't bad either. 
-2 eggs w/ crab cakes and a side of home fries: their crab cake wasn't too bad but we've had better. 
-French Toast: My 2nd favorite after the beignets, love love the Cinnamon after taste.

Glad to know there's a place in the city to go to when one if craving for beignets!

excerpts: I opted for the crab cake benedict, except I got it on an English muffin instead of their house made toast.
And I got grits on the side just to be daring and try it for the first time.
The benedict was not bad, but it was just a little heavy.
As for the grits, I was not a fan of them at all, but at least I gave them a try!
crab cake.author: Marilyn W.
crab cake.review:
Neglected writing yelp reviews for over a year! Not good... but I'm back!

I was just at this place last Sunday, and I have to say it was just okay. I swear, San Franciscans all go gaga over Sunday brunch which is why there was a wait. But not too bad, about 20-30 mins. Cute little cafe with friendly servers. They have a lot of different breakfast selections, and I loved the various side options they offer with your entree. I opted for the crab cake benedict, except I got it on an English muffin instead of their house made toast. And I got grits on the side just to be daring and try it for the first time. The benedict was not bad, but it was just a little heavy. As for the grits, I was not a fan of them at all, but at least I gave them a try! I would have loved to tried their beignets, but I was stuffed. The location is great, and parking is not too terrible, but there are a handful of other breakfast joints in SF I rather go to.

excerpts: I got the eggs (over medium) with Creole crab cake with home fries and cornbread.
It only comes with one crab cake a little chauncey I'd say, a little cheesy, very mehhh
but I ate it anyways
cause you can't hate on crabs unless they're in your pants.
Home fries were disappointing-they were charred on the outside but still hard on the inside and bland.
You get your choice of side from a whole buttload of things like white, wheat, cinnamon raisin, biscuit, cornbread, scone, english muffins ohh my!!
I got the cornbread.. and i got a big HUGE chunk of it!!
It was okay
crab cake.author: Angela W.
crab cake.review:
I love brunch like the next fierce gay couple walking down Castro on Sunday morning after hitting the gym.. so trust me I was mucho excited to try this spot with its mean looking beignets and quirky signage.

I got the eggs (over medium) with Creole crab cake with home fries and cornbread. It only comes with one crab cake a little chauncey I'd say, a little cheesy, very mehhh but I ate it anyways cause you can't hate on crabs unless they're in your pants. Home fries were disappointing-they were charred on the outside but still hard on the inside and bland. You get your choice of side from a whole buttload of things like white, wheat, cinnamon raisin, biscuit, cornbread, scone, english muffins ohh my!! I got the cornbread.. and i got a big HUGE chunk of it!! It was okay, just plain cornbread nothing special.

The beignets lived up to the hype. They really know how I like it, hot hot hot... and fluffy.. and a little crispy on one side.. and powdery.. and they melt in your mouth/not in your hands and mmm just g dbbl o d good, and they made em just for me. Thanks!

I don't know if I'll go back, to have to wait through the crowds, but if I do I'm hoarding all the beignets to myself.

excerpts: I had a crab cake sandwich and a salad.
The side salad was basically just lettuce from my sandwich that spilled out.
The sandwich was delicious though.
I like hole in the wall and would support small time business owners like this one!
crab cake.author: Toby I.
crab cake.review:
Very nice lady who greeted me to go. She remembered my name based off of my credit card. I was standing out front waiting for my food so I didn't want to disrupt any guests while they were eating.

I would give it 5 stars but I had to go in to get my food. I thought they would see me standing outside waiting and would let me know but they were very busy.  Very nice people and the prices were legit.

I had a crab cake sandwich and a salad.  The side salad was basically just lettuce from my sandwich that spilled out.  The sandwich was delicious though. I like hole in the wall and would support small time business owners like this one!

excerpts: I ordered the special omelet yesterday, which came stocked with crab cake, green and red peppers and hollandaise.
It was a pretty rich, monster breakfast, which is exactly what I wanted because my stomach was fiercely growling.
Still, I could only eat about 2/3 of the omelet before giving up (of course, I first looted all of the crab cake from inside the last 1/3 too).
crab cake.author: Annie D.
crab cake.review:
Beignets to be reckoned with. And they are less than $2 each, so you HAVE to order one with your meal, don't you?

I ordered the special omelet yesterday, which came stocked with crab cake, green and red peppers and hollandaise. It was a pretty rich, monster breakfast, which is exactly what I wanted because my stomach was fiercely growling. Still, I could only eat about 2/3 of the omelet before giving up (of course, I first looted all of the crab cake from inside the last 1/3 too). I ordered home fries as my side, and they could've been browned a bit more, but the flavor was excellent and the manager let me know in a PM on Yelp that if you ask for well-done, they'll be perfectly browned!

The menu slants a bit Southern with corn cakes and catfish, but also things like Filipino sausage, eggs benedict and breakfast burritos. Most brunch entrees come with a side of bread (even wheat-free is available) and the OJ and grapefruit juice are both fresh-squeezed. As far as drinks, it's beer, wine or champagne... and that means a mimosa is possible. This is a great thing.

It is a very small cafe, so expect to wait on the weekends and it's probably best to call ahead for a group larger than six people. We waited about 30-45 minutes. Don't fret though---put your name on the sign-up sheet and then run down to Piccolino, where you can grab a pick-me-up while you hang out and wait with bated breath for your name to be called. 

There were just two places for improvement here... 
-the coffee: the servers kept our cups full, but the coffee itself was not great.
-the credit card policy: they can only take three credit cards per check right now. The manager let me know that they are updating their system soon and it'll allow for smoother payment with split checks.

excerpts: c. Crab cake is sinful, perfect amount of spices and herbs
d.
Homemade turkey sausage patty was my addiction for months
crab cake.author: Kimberly H.
crab cake.review:
Oh Lord, how I love this place. I have been going there almost every weekend for a year and I still can't get enough. The specials keep me from getting tired of the usual things on the menu. 

But, although I love this place and have given it 5 stars I will be honest about the bad parts. I was a hotel and restaurant major so I do see where some of the negative reviews are coming from.

BAD
1. Wait staff could use a few more sessions of training, if they even got any
            a. Service can be slow
            b. They can be rude

2. Location can be good or bad depending on your circumstances. I live in Pacific Heights so it is pretty far to travel just for breakfast, however I have a car and can always find close parking right on third street so it makes it very convenient if I have errands to run that day where I need my car.

***I have never had any problems with my food so I cannot comment on why people have said they can be inconsistent

GOOD
1. Food is amazing
        a. It is unique or hard to find New Orleans food
        b. Beignets are mouth watering..steamy hot that melts in your mouth
        c. Crab cake is sinful, perfect amount of spices and herbs
        d. Homemade turkey sausage patty was my addiction for months 
        e. Biscuits are sooo good, homemade and steamy hot

2. It is not pretentious (I wear sweats most of the time I go there) Customers are very friendly too.

3. Coffee is quite different than the typical coffee that I've had. I know someone who knows the owner of the restaurant and they say that she gets the coffee from New Orleans.

4. There is a decent wait and a list that you have to put your name on, and yes I know waiting sucks but it is a good sign if there is a wait because that means the food is worth waiting for by locals plus they give you free coffee outside...unlike Mama's on Washington Square.

Basically, whenever my family comes out to visit me I always take them there and I will be going there until they either close or I move. And while I do think the service sucks at times, it does kind of go with the personality of the restaurant...not pretentious.

excerpts: We had the creole crab cake and eggs, beignets, and hang time omelette.
All delicious and great service!
Definitely going back and recommending to others!
crab cake.author: Dre H.
crab cake.review: We had the creole crab cake and eggs, beignets, and hang time omelette. All delicious and great service! Definitely going back and recommending to others!

excerpts: Had their beignets and crab cake with eggs.
Both were delicious!
I'm always looking for a brunch place that isn't boring and like all the other brunch places in SF and this is it!
The staff is friendly and efficient, I'll definitely be returning!
crab cake.author: Margit H.
crab cake.review: Love this place! Went recently on a Saturday and got seated right away. Had their beignets and crab cake with eggs. Both were delicious! I'm always looking for a brunch place that isn't boring and like all the other brunch places in SF and this is it! The staff is friendly and efficient, I'll definitely be returning!

excerpts: The wing-woman who makes it all worth while's crab cake
crab cake.author: Milk N.
crab cake.review:
What's happened to me? I used to be hhhaaaahhdd (hard). A rough mo-fo unafraid to fling vitriol in 7-11 Super Big Gulp sized portions at all who crossed my path. Now, here I am, splayed out like a sloth after a 32 inch run, on the sofa writing a glowing fucking review for yet another local eatery. 

Ya ya, Potrero Hill/Dog Patch/3rd Street/Bayshore is so hot right now. It's true, cool kids with and without their cool new bikes and/or babies were thicker than oatmeal but the J4U staff hummed with wry efficiency. 

I love efficiency in a diner, especially on Sunday faux-morning (1PM). All the things you want minus all the frilly crap you can do with out. Beverages filled, topped off without query, sides and add-ons delivered with a friendly briskness that bespoke the Beaches of Normandy level traffic hitting the joint. 

Corned beef hash was good with plenty of textural variety that makes hash fun (fatty, crispy, meaty bits all in happy coexistence a bit like Malaysia but that's a different story), biscuits were reasonable and plentiful, gravy was spot on with a pretty perfect viscosity (dippable but not runny) and meat bit ratio (well flavored but not requiring additional chewing). The wing-woman who makes it all worth while's crab cake Benedict thing was good; solid, earthy, herby with a pinch your nose good hollandaise well slathered. 

The bar lacks bag hooks and the stools are oddly wide spaced, no elbow jostling here. 

It's good. So there, and the garage sale around the corner was offering free hugs. Awesome! No, not. But the rainbow glitter suspenders for a dollar were just the icing on an already calorie rich brunch. 

Word to your mother.

excerpts: The green-eyed baby daddy loved his crab cake benedict (and he used to live in New Orleans) and my southern granny would have been proud that I ordered and loved the grits with my bacon and tomato benedict.
crab cake.author: Gretchen T.
crab cake.review:
Grub-IN! And just a short walk away. Y'all suck for keeping this a secret from me for so long! They have stevia sweetener and whole wheat bread for the healthy girl in me, but they stay true to someone's southern roots as well with the perfect grits and creamy hollandaise sauce. The green-eyed baby daddy loved his crab cake benedict (and he used to live in New Orleans) and my southern granny would have been proud that I ordered and loved the grits with my bacon and tomato benedict. 

The staff was great as well. I guess I was expecting Mission-style ennui, but everyone was very accommodating, even of our friend's stroller and and bambino. 

I am going every weekend if Will T lets me! I'm dying to try the oatmeal pancakes.

excerpts: I think I make them better but that takes some time so for a quick crab cake fix without traveling too far from home,
Just
crab cake.author: Christine P.
crab cake.review:
-Update- 

I've returned several times since and am still a fan. I tried the BLT (I wanted some A but they ran out of avocados that morning) and the crab cakes and while Oralia's makes an infinitely better sandwich, what can you expect from a breakfast joint? The crab cakes were pretty good! I think I make them better but that takes some time so for a quick crab cake fix without traveling too far from home, Just For You may just cut it.

-End Update-

I woke up craving buttermilk pancakes. Normally, I'll make 'em myself using my handy-dandy griddle but I didn't have any buttermilk. Who knew there was a great brunch place so close by to where I live?! 

The Boyfriend and I drove over, found a nice parking spot a few feet from the front door and after examining the menu outside, walked in to the register. I ordered a Cowgirl (two pancakes, two eggs any style, two sausage links or two bacon strips) and the Boyfriend wanted a Greg Scramble with chorizo. We also saw on Yelp that a lot of folks liked the beignets so we got some too. 

Yes, our eyes were bigger than our stomachs. I was astonished when a guy came out to us carrying three to-go boxes. The stack was almost up to my knees. The wait for a table wasn't too bad for a Saturday brunch place (I'd say it would have been about 15-30 minutes) and they have a small table set up outside with free coffee. We waited about 10 minutes for our to-go order. 

I was quite pleased with my pancakes. They were big and fluffy and the syrup wasn't any Aunt-Jemima-like-imitation. The sausage and eggs weren't anything to write home about but were passable. The Boyfriend's chorizo scramble was tasty - lots of Parmesan and chorizo and the home fries were nice and mealy. The beignets were what you'd expect - donuty taste and lots of powdered sugar. 

All in all, I'm quite happy with Just For You. As the Boyfriend said, four stars for being solid brunch food. We're planning on going back soon to try other things and maybe they'll wow us into five.

excerpts: Had the beignet and crab cake with two eggs.
A-ok!
crab cake.author: C L.
crab cake.review:
Had the beignet and crab cake with two eggs. A-ok!  I want to come back and try their corned beef hash.

If you come for weekend brunch, be prepared to wait an hour for a table.

excerpts: Try the crab cake and the beignets.
crab cake.author: Addrianna R.
crab cake.review:
I was fooled by the gritty exterior.  It is actually bright, clean and comfy with the most comfortable diner bar stools these cheeks have ever sunk into.  They have a good natured attitude: bathroom sign reads "We're not asking you to be Michael Jordan, just to put your trash in the basket"; at the bar "we reserve the right to pour coffee ... on your cell phone."; outside "we love your baby, not your stroller", etc. 

Pint size mimosas!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Gluten free bread!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

The food is so tasty, fresh and creative and delivered to you by truly hip, laid back individuals.  Great place to meet locals and ole' dogpatch timers. Medium/Large size portions.

Try the crab cake and the beignets.

excerpts: The only thing I had that was half way decent was the crab cake and even then wasn't anything to write home about.
And between my dining partner and I, mine was the far better plate.
Brenda's wowed, JFY left me meh.
crab cake.author: Bryan E.
crab cake.review:
It's my contention that the thought of weekend breakfast is so powerful for most people that it completely shuts down their critical judgment capacity. Therefore, I always take a recommendation for brunch spots with a grain of salt. Since I'm not a participant in the weekend breakfast cult and brunch is demystified in my eyes, listen up.

First off, what seemingly appeared to be a crowd milling around in front led to a 10 minute wait. So far so good. (Breakfast cultists are willing to wait far longer than I and I assumed that is what I was in for here).

The menu left me unimpressed, even for a place that is going for an unassuming menu. Nothing really jumped out at me and I had to settle for a two egg breakfast. 

The food was uninspired, bland fare.  Almost warm potatoes and bread that wasn't all that was promised. The only thing I had that was half way decent was the crab cake and even then wasn't anything to write home about. And between my dining partner and I, mine was the far better plate. Brenda's wowed, JFY left me meh.

excerpts: I ordered the Crabby Benny which is a benedict with a crab cake on top.
It was reminiscent of a Trader Joe's crab patty on toast, which does not cost 12.75.
The biscuits and gravy were average.
The gravy was a bit too sweet, and you could barely taste the sausage.
crab cake.author: Steph W.
crab cake.review: 2.5 Stars.  I had particularly high expectations for this cafe.  The servers are very friendly, but the food is so-so.  I ordered the Crabby Benny which is a benedict with a crab cake on top.  It was reminiscent of a Trader Joe's crab patty on toast, which does not cost 12.75.  The biscuits and gravy were average.  The gravy was a bit too sweet, and you could barely taste the sausage.  The beignets were tasty, but they were reminiscent of Chinese fried donuts vs. actual beignets from Cafe du Monde.  I have yet to find a beignet that tastes similar to the Cafe du Monde ones.  I was pretty disappointed for a 2 person, $30 brunch.

excerpts: I've had their crab cake Benedict which was yuuummy.
I've also tried their frittata where I added longhanisa sp?
crab cake.author: Bevo T.
crab cake.review:
I love this place! The food is good and they have so much variety from scrambles, omlettes, benedicts, breakfast burritos and many more.  I've had their crab cake Benedict which was yuuummy. I've also tried their frittata where I added longhanisa sp? sausage which was mmm mm good.

When u get there u sign up and wait outside where they usually have coffee set up for their waiting customers.
  
They will call your name when seats are available. Their beinets are good too, crispy outside and soft n warm inside.

One of their specialties are their homemade breads. They have a choice of white, scones, corn bread, biscuits, and others.

They also have lots of unique decorations like old movie posters. The servers are nice and fast pace. Sometimes it's a little hard to get their attention.

The later it gets, the longer the wait so I recommend gettin there earlier. 

Overall, I highly recommend. They have something for everyone!

I am always in search for the best brunch in the city and this comes very close and will be my go-to brunch place in the city until something can outdo them!

excerpts: After I finished the eggs and the creole crab cake, all very good, I finished the beignet.
Not as great after it lost
it's warmness,
crab cake.author: Ray R.
crab cake.review:
Eat the beignets warm. They serve it first (is that typical?), so I took a bite of it and well what can I say it's a pillow of thin dough deep fried and covered in powdered sugar... it was freakin' delicious! 

After I finished the eggs and the creole crab cake, all very good, I finished the beignet. Not as great after it lost it's warmness, but still a nice sweet after breakfast treat. 

It's nice inside too. It's set up like an old 50's type diner, and the paint and decor give it a very country feel.

excerpts: In addition to finishing her meal (I'm still considering "his daughter's postprandial vacuum cleaner" as my profile name, maybe later), which was really good, I had the Creole crab cake, over medium's, potatoes, and their home made bread.
Raspberry jam on the bread and Creole mustard on the crab cake...
crab cake.author: Mike A.
crab cake.review:
This review is only for their breakfast.  

Recently went for breakfast with the snapper and hadn't been there since they were further up Goat Hill (her first time). It's a larger hole in the wall than it used be and I'm glad it hasn't outgrown it's britches, though it lacks the small, homey  feel of the old place.  Since it is larger and it was packed, it was a bit noisy, but expected.

The place was packed this past President's Day, the wait was about 20 minutes and what I expected for a holiday or weekend, no issues there.  More so, we never felt rushed by neither the staff nor those outside waiting to be seated, not even their dogs watching through the window.

Service was prompt, efficient, and friendly, whether occasionally asking if my daughter was enjoying her food, etc., (French toast and chicken apple sausage on her birthday, are you kidding?) or the constant attention to my cup of coffee, for example.  Unfortunately, it is coffee, not the coffee/chicory blend they used to serve and that which is part of what I was looking forward too...it was such a compliment to their food...

The food was great.  In addition to finishing her meal (I'm still considering "his daughter's postprandial vacuum cleaner" as my profile name, maybe later), which was really good, I had the Creole crab cake, over medium's, potatoes, and their home made bread.  Raspberry jam on the bread and Creole mustard on the crab cake...oh my...

I also bought a loaf of the bread to take home.  Whether sliced thick and toasted or for French toast or sandwiches...it is sooo good

Are there better places for breakfast in SF? Sure, and many have unique qualities to distinguish them from each other.  This one is a cool combo of a little bit of Louisiana and a lot of SF and I like it a lot.  

But, please, please, please bring back the coffee/chicory...

excerpts: I ordered the two scrambled eggs with crab cake, grits & cornbread, which was, in a word, SCRUMTRULESCENT.
crab cake.author: Pete J.
crab cake.review:
I'm nominating the entire Just For You menu for the September 2007 Heart Attack Breakfast of the Month. It's the first time I've ever dreamed up such an award, but it is nevertheless given with very high esteem.

Absolutely killer beniets are a must to start off your meal. A MUST. After that, you best order something with grits involved. This is not the kind of place where you order home fries, son. There were four of us & we all got something different. I ordered the two scrambled eggs with crab cake, grits & cornbread, which was, in a word, SCRUMTRULESCENT. I also tried some catfish & a bite of cornbread topped with homemade chili.

I really dig the neighborhood as well. In five years, 3rd Street is gonna be very much alive & kickin'.

excerpts: This is where the huevos rancheros and crab cake bennie enter my life.
Crab cake is really fresh and made with good size chunks of meat.
I ask for the creamy sauce on the side and usually use a tiny bit but mostly hot sauce.
My fiance swears by the grits (they'll bring you brown sugar if you're nice) but I always opt for the fruit because it's not just stupid cantaloupe.
We're talking real chunks of berries, bananas, grapes and well
crab cake.author: Allegra F.
crab cake.review:
So solid. I love eating meals for breakfast that I am too lazy to cook for myself. This is where the huevos rancheros and crab cake bennie enter my life. 

Why are poached eggs so magical? And how do they always make them here with the perfect yolk texture? Yes, I love me some sloppy yolks. I always go for the vegetarian red sauce which is so flavorful. Not super spicy but super good chili flavor. 

Crab cake is really fresh and made with good size chunks of meat. I ask for the creamy sauce on the side and usually use a tiny bit but mostly hot sauce. My fiance swears by the grits (they'll bring you brown sugar if you're nice) but I always opt for the fruit because it's not just stupid cantaloupe. We're talking real chunks of berries, bananas, grapes and well okay there is some melon. 

Anyway, the coffee is no frills but man does it get the job done. I had 2 cups on an empty tummy and I was very, very awake to say the least. Anyway. I will be back and am excited to check out their happy hour and a dainty pint of mimosa goodness. mmm mmm

What bumps these guys up to 5 is that their service is fast and they're super cool. I was in on a not busy morning waiting for a friend to show up for 35 mins. That's right, I sat by myself reading a magazine slurping coffee in a booth for 35 mins and they were super cool to me and kept refilling my coffee. I appreciated it because it was still foggy and a little chilly. Thanks guys!

excerpts: I came here on Memorial Day thinking that I could order the Crab Cake Po-Boy because it was a Monday.
I was disappointed to discover that because it was a holiday the only menu being offered was the weekend brunch menu (which does NOT include the Po-Boy).
So, my alternate choice was the Crabby Bennie
it's a Creole crab cake on poached egg over toast with hollandaise sauce.
I was given two choices...
English muffin or their homemade bread which was pretty much a sourdough bread.
I'm a fan of sourdough
so I couldn't pass up that option.
My dish also came with home fries.
I love a really good biscuit too
crab cake.author: Michelle N.
crab cake.review:
I came here on Memorial Day thinking that I could order the Crab Cake Po-Boy because it was a Monday.  I was disappointed to discover that because it was a holiday the only menu being offered was the weekend brunch menu (which does NOT include the Po-Boy).  So, my alternate choice was the Crabby Bennie....it's a Creole crab cake on poached egg over toast with hollandaise sauce.  I was given two choices...English muffin or their homemade bread which was pretty much a sourdough bread.  I'm a fan of sourdough so I couldn't pass up that option.   My dish also came with home fries.  I love a really good biscuit too so I ordered a side of that.

My mom ordered the special frittata (which was basically a vegetable omelette with some cheese) with grits and cornbread.

We also ordered beignets which the cafe describes as "Fresh, Fluffy Pillows of Perfection."

The beignets were soooo good, that my mom wanted to order more for later.  They look like mini pillows dusted with powdered sugar.  The taste reminded me of funnel cake that I used to get as a kid at amusement parks.  

My Crabby Bennie was drenched in hollandaise sauce.  I should have requested the sauce on the side.  My dish was just so-so.  Super heavy because of the sauce, the thick slices of homemade bread, and the huge amount of home fries.  I couldn't finish my plate.  I only took one bite of the side of biscuits I got.  One bite was enough because it was really dry.

I took a bite out of my mom's cornbread.  It was meh.  The cornbread at Momo's is by far the best I've had here in SF...so I end up using my cornbread experience at Momo's as my benchmark.

My friend ordered the catfish filet.  I didn't taste that dish because I just felt it was a little too early in the morning to eat heavily breaded fish.

Service wasn't great...quite slow.  Yes, they were busy but there were a few people to wait on the customers. I would give them 3 stars for service.  The additional star is for their really taste beignets.  We were too full from our meals that my mom didn't bother order an additional serving of beignets to take home.  By the end of the meal, all of us didn't want to see any more food.  It was time for a nap.

excerpts: I ordered the Creole crab cake with sides of grits and biscuits.
My friend ordered Greg's scramble.
Both dishes were very yummy though we had a ton of leftovers.
crab cake.author: Cindy B.
crab cake.review: We arrived around 9:15am and were able to get a seat right away.  We started off with the beignets which had some powdered sugar sprinkled over it.  It had an interesting chewy consistency and was a somewhat sour dough.  I ordered the Creole crab cake with sides of grits and biscuits.  My friend ordered Greg's scramble.  Both dishes were very yummy though we had a ton of leftovers.  Next time we'll order the beignets then just share a dish.

excerpts: I ordered the "Special Scramble #1," which is basically 3 eggs, spinach, mushrooms, shrimp, and crab cake bits all scrambled and covered with hollandaise.
Yum, right?
I know, and I was really looking forward to dipping my home fries in some yolky, buttery, lemon-scented goodness.
crab cake.author: Sarah S.
crab cake.review:
As one of my favorite brunch/linner spots in SF, I thought Just For You would be the perfect spot to meet up with a group of local and out-of -town friends for breakfast this morning, so we packed a half-ton of ladies into a couple of cars and made our way to Dogpatch.

Now, I'm not complaining about the wait. I knew there would be a wait, especially for a group, and everybody was apprised of this and impressed with the coffee-while-you-wait setup. We actually didn't wait too long, since we compromised the group dynamic by having 3 volunteers sit at the bar while the rest of us took a table. 

I'm also not complaining about the rapid changes to the neighborhood and is demographics, startling as they were. We actually found parking quickly, and the babies were all cute enough. I'm really not even complaining about the service, since the place is packed, although I think my girlfriend really needed more than one cup of coffee after last night, and my friend actually did want that milk and cornbread, even if it was sickening to imagine that she was going to pack it away alongside her Cowgirl breakfast. 

My REALLY BIG PROBLEM is the hollandaise. I ordered the "Special Scramble #1," which is basically 3 eggs, spinach, mushrooms, shrimp, and crab cake bits all scrambled and covered with hollandaise. Yum, right? I know, and I was really looking forward to dipping my home fries in some yolky, buttery, lemon-scented goodness. And then my food came.

Hollandaise sauce is made of egg yolks, butter, and lemon juice. All three of these foods are extremely YELLOW in color, and when emulsified into a sauce should coat a spoon or finger, like thick gravy or melted ice cream. I've eaten hollandaise sauce in many different places and at many different times. Some has been sublime, other sub par, and as long as it's not chunky I can usually cope. But never, ever, EVER have I encountered GRAY HOLLANDAISE SAUCE. Yes, gray. And chunky, like watery ricotta. It was like the discharge of various STDs is often described, actually. It was totally gonorrhea sauce. 

I sent my plate back before it even hit the table. I said, "This is wrong, the sauce is broken." That was a vast understatement of what was the matter, but I figured any cook could look at my plate and instantly know what the problem was. However, when my plate came back it was simply with naked eggs---and A GIANT SIDE OF THE GRAY HOLLANDAISE. It looked exactly like the sides of grits other people were getting. I stuck my finger in the bowl to demonstrate that it was not a proper sauce, and got a finger full of grease and chunks of what appeared to be cooked egg yolks. It tasted and smelled like hard-boiled eggs. Who the fuck would serve that to somebody? Who the fuck would want that on their eggs?
