I told the runner they needed to make a new batch, and proceeded to eat my unsauced eggs.

A few moments later a server came by, and told me that the kitchen could not make more hollandaise, that this was the batch for the day. OK, I know that this shit sits around, and I accept that fact because I love hollandaise and it usually doesn't make too much of a difference. But what I got should have been thrown out before it ever hit my plate, and I suspect it was never right to begin with. Plus, it only takes about 30 seconds to make, especially in the blender. I told the waitress that if they weren't going to make more sauce they needed to stop serving it to people, and at that point I didn't just mean me, I meant anybody who happened to eat at this restaurant that I've been raving about for 4 years---but then I saw a benedict come out, covered with the ghastly gray stuff.  

It makes me sad to see Just For You go downhill like that. You used to be able to taste the love, and now I detect a hint of absentee ownership and cheap kitchen labor. They've also taken my favorite sandwich, the veggie reuben, off of the menu. The three stars are for the courtesy coffee outside and the unbelievable begniets, which are still worth seeking out once in a while. But beware the hollandaise!

excerpts: I ordered Greg's Scramble (vegetarian style) and my boyfriend got the Crabby Bennie (a Creole crab cake on toast with hollandaise sauce).
I'm usually not a big breakfast person, but it was sooo good!
I've yet to find a breakfast place this good in L.A.
I had a bite of my friend's buttermilk pancakes and just about fell over in my chair....
they were unbelievable.
Next time I'm visiting SF I'll definitely be back!
crab cake.author: Shani D.
crab cake.review:
What a great little place!
My boyfriend and I were in town for a graduation and our friend brought us here and said it was his favorite breakfast spot in the city.
He wasn't lying!
We came on a Sat morning, it was pretty crowded so we had to wait about 30 min. I love how veg friendly the menu is. I figured I'd be stuck ordering something boring, but I was pleasantly surprised. 
I ordered Greg's Scramble (vegetarian style) and my boyfriend got the Crabby Bennie (a Creole crab cake on toast with hollandaise sauce). I'm usually not a big breakfast person, but it was sooo good! I've yet to find a breakfast place this good in L.A. I had a bite of my friend's buttermilk pancakes and just about fell over in my chair....they were unbelievable. 
Next time I'm visiting SF I'll definitely be back!

excerpts: I had the Crab Cake Po'Boy sandwich with a side of coleslaw and ice tea.

OK, I have my expectations; the crab cakes should taste mostly of crab, not filling; the roll should be good, but not too thick; the mayo should add something, perhaps by being really fresh or by having something a little spicy in it.
But the Crab cake tasked a bit too much of filling, the roll sort of detracted---and the mayo just didn't do it for me.
crab cake.author: Roger W.
crab cake.review:
Uh oh.  I might be a dissenter here, because everyone else wants to give 4+ stars.
But I had lunch here last week and was frankly a bit disappointed by the main course and the reverberant noise level  (the Beignets, did NOT disappoint and were everything the reviewers have promised).

First the noise: I watched servers and the manager YELL at each other to get simple orders done and at least two phone orders failed because the person on the register couldn't hear the speaker.  They have Anechoic foam blocks (the funny little pyramids) on the ceiling----but they need A LOT MORE given the noise level the flat, hard surfaces in this place generate.  Even the staff thinks so--although they might not say it to your face.

I had the Crab Cake Po'Boy sandwich with a side of coleslaw and ice tea.  OK, I have my expectations; the crab cakes should taste mostly of crab, not filling; the roll should be good, but not too thick; the mayo should add something, perhaps by being really fresh or by having something a little spicy in it.  But the Crab cake tasked a bit too much of filling, the roll sort of detracted---and the mayo just didn't do it for me.  The coleslaw was very good (not too creamy); the ice tea smooth and not bitter, the Beignets were reason enough to come here---but the main act, the sandwich, just didn't soar.  And I was saddened.
The Beignets I got to go, however, redeemed 99% of the experience.

I'll go back and give it another shot; maybe the catfish Po'Boy is the way to go.

excerpts: i ordered the crab cake po' boy, and my 2 other girls ordered the crab cake breakfast plate.
we all agreed that the crab cakes were seasoned well, and very delicious.
crab cake.author: Sheri N.
crab cake.review:
i ordered the crab cake po' boy, and my 2 other girls ordered the crab cake breakfast plate. we all agreed that the crab cakes were seasoned well, and very delicious.  they enjoyed the biscuits and grits with their breakfast.   

my only two hangups about the place are the lack of attentiveness of the wait staff.  it took us over 25 minutes till someone came to take our orders. we also had to flag them down for water and hot sauce. secondly, there were many huge flies in the place that kept dropping into our food and drinks.  2 of us pushed away our mimosas because of the fly landings.

excerpts: + Creole Crab Cake (umm!)
crab cake.author: Amit S.
crab cake.review:
OMG! OMG! OMG! OMG! OMG!

You know the worst kind of torture? 
- Worse than the Avada Cadavra curse used by "he-who-must-not-be-named" on "he-with-the-weird-scar-on-his-forehead"?
- Worse than Stupefy, Imperius, Expelliarmus AND Obliviate put together??

It's running by Just For Your Cafe with my marathon training group at 9AM Saturday morning on the 17th mile and getting the tantalizing, arousing and enchanting aroma of warm Beignets smothered in sugar and served with warm syrup, and of warm coffee and the sound of the spoon stirring in the milk..... DROOL!

THE FIRST LOVE:
- Two eggs any style with:
   + bacon (classic!)
   + Louisiana sausage (hot n spicy... like moi!)
   + Chicken apple sausage (as if mom were cooking it!)
   + Longanisa (Oink! Oink! on the grease and fat!)
   + Creole Crab Cake (umm!)
- Beignets powdered with sugar (their speciality and my vice and best way to win my stomach... and hence, me heart!)
- Frittata of the Decade (Can't go wrong with the all veggie goodie with zucchini, mushrooms, onion, garlic, spinach & tomato, topped with cheddar cheese)
- Chilli Scramble (and they don't kid when they say "chilli")
- Pancakes (you can beat my pancakes anytahm!)
- Chorizo Con Huevos (Perfect for oiling away that nasty hangover but watch it! It is spicy, fattening and greasy as hell)
- A PINT... I'll say that again... A PINT of mimosa!
- Coffee (run-o-the-mill but satisfying)
- Great service and the ladies behind the counter are funny, treat you like family and really look after you
- Great energy to the place with mostly locals frequenting it
- Lots of parking if you're driving and the T-Third stops a block away and if you're a runner like me, run here!

THE HEARTACHE:
- They only take cash so daddy's plastic don't gonna work here, baby. There is an ATM in the liquor store next to this place
- There is almost always a wait (25-30 mins) but they serve coffee and the place on the opposite corner serves Blue Bottle coffee... shh!
- Place is compact so its a bit tight if you're sitting at the bar
- That said, if you're 1 to 2, sit at the bar. If you're bigger, ask for a table
- I live in the Inner Sunset, so either I take the T-Third to get there (its on 22nd Street at 3rd Street) or I go here as I'm mid-way through my run (F@#K!) 

THE NOTES:
- Leave any attitude outside or at home. Don't complain about the wait or the small space
- This place is laid back and the hosts treat you like you were eating in their kitchen... be nice and tip well
- Look at all the art and signs on the wall.. frigging awesome!
- If you see me run by, throw me a Beignet will you?... pretty please!

... and yes, I'm currently reading Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows... Accio Beignet!

excerpts: The crab cake omelet is tasty and I like the scramble with blue cheese and artichoke hearts.
crab cake.author: Jen L.
crab cake.review:
I've found out the trick to Just for You's beignets. As a Baton Rouge native and former New Orleans resident, I have noticed that the beignets can be somewhat off. Sometimes they are great and sometimes they are a bit yeasty.

However, I have found a pattern to the problem and a simple reason behind it. Apparently, beignet quality is determined partly by ambient humidity. When it is raining or drizzling out, the beignets are excellent. If it's sunny, better to skip them. It's always humid in Louisiana so it's not a problem there.

I would prefer if the beignets were served with a powdered sugar shaker, as they always are in Louisiana. Sometimes the sugar doesn't cover the top of the beignet and sometimes it's all over the plate but not all over the beignet. It's nearly impossible to get powdered sugar off the plate with a beignet. If it does not come from above it doesn't stick.

Other food there is not humidity sensitive and some of it is pretty good. I don't find many places here that offer grits and sometimes grits really hit the spot. (And no, I have never been to prison.) Always grits with cheese, please. The crab cake omelet is tasty and I like the scramble with blue cheese and artichoke hearts.

Check the back of your grocery receipts for Just for You coupons.

excerpts: I had the crab cake benedict, which didn't seem to have enough crab taste.
Get one of the egg combos with the cornbread.
The grits are good here.
Serious kinda place, so no foolin' around.
Besides, the people watching you will make you feel guilty if you do anything other than ...order, eat, & leave.
Usually a line, so have patience Grasshopper.
crab cake.author: Arlene C.
crab cake.review: Start with the beignets, then have breakfast. I had the crab cake benedict, which didn't seem to have enough crab taste. Get one of the egg combos with the cornbread. The grits are good here. Serious kinda place, so no foolin' around. Besides, the people watching you will make you feel guilty if you do anything other than ...order, eat, & leave. Usually a line, so have patience Grasshopper.

excerpts: I had a delicious Creole crab cake sandwich here for lunch today and the owner and staff were amazingly helpful!
I was looking for a hair salon in the neighborhood and everyone gave suggestions.
The owner Arienne actually make a handful of phone calls for me trying to locate one.
She ended up finding a very nice place I have an appointment with tomorrow.
crab cake.author: Grant E.
crab cake.review: I had a delicious Creole crab cake sandwich here for lunch today and the owner and staff were amazingly helpful! I was looking for a hair salon in the neighborhood and everyone gave suggestions. The owner Arienne actually make a handful of phone calls for me trying to locate one. She ended up finding a very nice place I have an appointment with tomorrow. =)

excerpts: I also dabbled in the crab cake Benedict (perfectly cooked crab and egg) and the amazing, creamy biscuits and gravy.
The portions were huge (I was able to pass along my little heaven to my hung over friend who spent breakfast sleeping in my car).
Did I mention the erroneous selection of condiments, I am talking in the upper teens...
a little delight for everyone.
Also a plus is the mimosa served in a pint glass- much classier than the often too small $8 mimosa served in a champagne flute.
crab cake.author: Alicia J.
crab cake.review: This restaurant was the victim of my Sunday Fun Day. I had a delightful little meal here. The food was delicious. I started out with some beignets, which were amazing! The biggest things I have ever seen drowning in powdered sugar. I also dabbled in the crab cake Benedict (perfectly cooked crab and egg) and the amazing, creamy biscuits and gravy. The portions were huge (I was able to pass along my little heaven to my hung over friend who spent breakfast sleeping in my car). Did I mention the erroneous selection of condiments, I am talking in the upper teens...a little delight for everyone. Also a plus is the mimosa served in a pint glass- much classier than the often too small $8 mimosa served in a champagne flute.

excerpts: The crab cake Po Boy is amazing!
crab cake.author: jeff p.
crab cake.review: Loves it! I was super excited to find beignets in SF but the food is soo good I forgot all about them. The crab cake Po Boy is amazing!

excerpts: I enjoyed my egg and crab cake thingy.
crab cake.author: J L.
crab cake.review:
I've waited for months to eat at this place because every time I want to have brunch there, there's an intimidating line outside. Fortunately, the line moves much more quickly than you'd think.

My friends enjoyed their scrambles (the hangover cure with oysters was a particular favorite). I enjoyed my egg and crab cake thingy. 

We'll visit again!

excerpts: I had the Catch of the Day, which was blackened catfish with string beans and a baked potato.
Wash it down with a soda and a beignet
and I'm a happy camper.
Parking can be a little pain to find in this area.
catch of the day.author: Jeff H.
catch of the day.review: Quaint place for lunch and some good food.  I had the Catch of the Day, which was blackened catfish with string beans and a baked potato.  Wash it down with a soda and a beignet and I'm a happy camper.  Parking can be a little pain to find in this area.

excerpts: There was a group of five of us, and we ordered everything from a breakfast food to the pasta of the day.
Everything came out relatively quickly, and we all liked the food.
If I was in the area again I'd definitely be back.
pasta of the day.author: Megan V.
pasta of the day.review: Stopped here for a quick business lunch when in the area.  There was a group of five of us, and we ordered everything from a breakfast food to the pasta of the day.  Everything came out relatively quickly, and we all liked the food.  If I was in the area again I'd definitely be back.

excerpts: Other dishes on the table included the breakfast burrito (HUGE burrito filled with eggs, beans, and your choice of fillings), bowl of yogurt with fresh fruit and granola (this too, looked awesomingly delicious) and their pasta of the day, which was linguine with lots of veggies in a light sauce.
pasta of the day.author: Kimberly S.
pasta of the day.review:
Great cozy breakfast/lunch spot hidden away in the Dogpatch!

My co-workers and I came to this spot for lunch. It was after 1pm and the place was still busy! So I glanced at the menu posted on their window. Before getting here, I thought I wanted a bowl of soup to soothe me on this cold afternoon. However, after checking out their menu, I quickly changed my mind. I don't know if it was because I was starving, but just about everything on the menu from the pancakes, huevos rancheros to the po-boy's sounded so much more comforting! 

We started with the beignets. WOW! Large doughy, air-filled pillows covered with lots of yummy powdered sugar. Melts in your mouth. They aren't exactly like the traditional tasting beignets in New Orleans, but close enough for me.

I ended up getting two eggs with a grilled pork chop, grits, and homemade cornbread. That meal did it's job - my hunger was fulfilled and my soul was soothed. The cornbread was a little dry for me, but nothing that a little bit of jelly couldn't fix. The pork chop had just the right amount of seasoning and went well with my eggs. 

Other dishes on the table included the breakfast burrito (HUGE burrito filled with eggs, beans, and your choice of fillings), bowl of yogurt with fresh fruit and granola (this too, looked awesomingly delicious) and their pasta of the day, which was linguine with lots of veggies in a light sauce. Everyone was happy and satisfied with their choices. 

Young, hip, and friendly staff!

NOTE: Cash or check only. Yes, you can write a check for your food, odd as it sounds (My co-worker actually did so that day).

excerpts: At this point I've tried pretty much all of the omelettes, benedicts, and scrambles, along with the breakfast burrito, the chili con carne, the regular pancakes, the beignets, and the coffee (both the regular light roast and the dark chicory roast) and *everything*
I've had is great!
Pretty huge portions, awesome flavors, fresh and tasty ingredients all make for excellent dishes, every single time.
I've never been disappointed by a visit to
Just For You and the only reason I don't go even more often is that I'd gain waaaaay too much weight if I did that!
beignets.author: Jeffrey S.
beignets.review:
I'm a big fan of brunch and this is my favorite overall brunch spot in all of San Francisco! I honestly was shocked to see that I hadn't written a review for this place earlier as I've been going there consistently for almost 2 years now!!

The vibe is chill and relaxed and fun, the staff are all super nice and attentive and friendly, the food is amazing, the menu is pretty huge, and the prices are fair. The *ONLY* downside is that it gets pretty crowded in the morning and early afternoons on weekends because it's so popular. That being said, they do move fairly quickly, and there's a cute little parklet with some seats and greenery right in front of the restaurant where you can hang out while waiting.

At this point I've tried pretty much all of the omelettes, benedicts, and scrambles, along with the breakfast burrito, the chili con carne, the regular pancakes, the beignets, and the coffee (both the regular light roast and the dark chicory roast) and *everything* I've had is great! Pretty huge portions, awesome flavors, fresh and tasty ingredients all make for excellent dishes, every single time. I've never been disappointed by a visit to Just For You and the only reason I don't go even more often is that I'd gain waaaaay too much weight if I did that!

excerpts:
Slave girl and friend got a classic beignets to share, and carnita omelet and chilaquiles as their main dish.

Beignets were whatever, but then again I don't really care for sweets usually.
beignets.author: Fan H.
beignets.review:
Slave girl and I met up with a friend in San Francisco for brunch, and friend picked Just For You Cafe. It looked like a long wait when we got there, but we only waited for 8 minutes. Woohoo!

The menu had plenty to offer. I took our server's suggestion and got hangtown fry. I also got a side of gravy for my biscuit. Slave girl and friend got a classic beignets to share, and carnita omelet and chilaquiles as their main dish.

Since I didn't try too much of their food, I couldn't say much about it other than it tasted good on the first bite. Beignets were whatever, but then again I don't really care for sweets usually.

My hangtown fry though, was very good. It had 3 eggs scrambled with bacon, oyster, and onions. The menu was a little misleading because the 3 deep fried oysters were actually placed on top of the scrambled eggs, not scrambled WITH the eggs. That didn't change how good my food tasted. The oysters were juicy and perfectly fried. The eggs couldn't go wrong with bacon and onions. It was a very good combination. I got cheese grits as my side and that was also delicious.

The gravy was what I didn't get. It was mildly sweet and I never had gravy tasted like that before. I asked the server about the taste and they told me they would check with the kitchen as they took it away. They never told me if that was how they usually make it, but they took the gravy off the bill. I never got my biscuit back...sad days.

Overall it wasn't a bad spot. The cafe had a lot of personality and the food was decent. I would go back if our friend asked us to dine there again.

excerpts: They have the best beignets I've ever had... even better than New Orleans.
beignets.author: Kristina W.
beignets.review:
Great food with over the top service. Our breakfast was delish!! They have the best beignets I've ever had... even better than New Orleans. 

We had our luggage since we were heading to the airport and they were so accommodating and even put our stuff in their office. 

Great spot and look forward to returning when we are in SF next.

excerpts: A close friend of mine mentioned about their beignets.
I love beignets and decided to give it a try.
I came here with my friend and we ordered other dishes and had beignets as dessert to share.
Omg.
The beignets were very delicious.
The beignets were so fresh and melt in your mouth.
It comes with 3 pieces
and we each has a piece and share the 3rd one.
We shared the scrambled and tofu with mixed-veggies with a side of sausage.
I was going to get beignets on the side but decided not to since it's a lot of food already.
Probably just get their beignets with cup of coffee.
I think that's what I am going to do next.
beignets.author: Candice Y.
beignets.review:
This is my second time visited this joint and the food and service are consistent. Which is great. 

Both times I came here there was a huge line outside but the wait was reasonable and both got seated within 20 mins.  

 A close friend of mine mentioned about their beignets. I love beignets and decided to give it a try.  I came here with my friend and we ordered other dishes and had beignets as dessert to share.  Omg. The beignets were very delicious.  The beignets were so fresh and melt in your mouth.  It comes with 3 pieces and we each has a piece and share the 3rd one.  We shared the scrambled and tofu with mixed-veggies with a side of sausage. It was a lot of food but we finished them because they were all so good. 

2nd time I came. We each had our own plate since we were sitting at the community table which is hard to share.  So my friend got cowgirl and I got the cowboy.  I was going to get beignets on the side but decided not to since it's a lot of food already. Good thing i didn't because the French toast was big and I actually have to give some to my friend too.  

Next time. Probably just get their beignets with cup of coffee. I think that's what I am going to do next.

excerpts: My husband and friends loved the beignets and all the entrees they ordered.
beignets.author: Randi B.
beignets.review:
My friend chose this place for breakfast because we were on a time constraint and needed to get to the airport. The waits are short here compared to other place in the city, or so they say. 

I can say that the waits are short if you have a party of 2. We were a party of 4 around 9:30 AM. We waited an hour. Parties of 2 were seated and seated and seated and seated. Everybody ahead of us got seated, everybody after us got seated. This is a tiny place with limited seating. My friend was ready to say that we could just do two parties of 2, when they eventually seated us at a community table. 

As for the food? Everybody in my party liked it. I happened to be sick and had no appetite. The food looked great. I ordered toast and an egg and it was fine for what I was feeling that day. My husband and friends loved the beignets and all the entrees they ordered.

Once seated the service was fast and cordial. Just watch out for the wait if you have more than 2 people.

excerpts: Split the beignets, waffles, eggs and bacon with my husband.
All of which were perfectly prepared.
Nice outdoor seating area.
Best breakfast place
I've been to in the Dog Patch.
beignets.author: Ealon H.
beignets.review: Fantastic menu. Ate there last week. Service was quick. Split the beignets, waffles, eggs and bacon with my husband. All of which were perfectly prepared. Nice outdoor seating area. Best breakfast place I've been to in the Dog Patch.

excerpts: We ordered the beignets, chicken and waffles, and the crabbie bennie.
The beignets were amazing; being a sugar fiend, I wish it was covered in more powdered sugar.
The chicken was super moist and perfectly battered.
beignets.author: Ang W.
beignets.review:
My husband and I got here at 1130 and the wait for 2 was 10 minutes. They got us seated at the bar and coffee in our hands within a minute of sitting down. Service was quick. 

We ordered the beignets, chicken and waffles, and the crabbie bennie. The beignets were amazing; being a sugar fiend, I wish it was covered in more powdered sugar. The chicken was super moist and perfectly battered. The crab bennie was delicious too; egg was perfectly poached. 

We would definitely come back for the reasonably priced food and quick service!

excerpts: On the outside they had a sign which said beignets and let me tell you, it is amazingly delicious and the portion of the donuts is a great size to share even tho
beignets.author: Brittany L.
beignets.review:
Recently just came here with a group and got a variety of different breakfast items. 

My first reaction coming here is that its a cute little breakfast and brunch restaurant. On the outside they had a sign which said beignets and let me tell you, it is amazingly delicious and the portion of the donuts is a great size to share even tho we got two orders haha!

I ordered the cowgirl which came with 2 pancakes, sausage or bacon and two eggs any style. I like the options that they had to offer for the pancakes because you could either have chose oatmeal, buttermilk, and cornmeal.

I'm willing to come back here again!

excerpts: Coffee was good and the we ordered two beignets to share for the table.
Service was super nice, attentive and quick to deliver on requests.
Would recommend and will look forward to returning
beignets.author: David O.
beignets.review: Wait is worth it. I had the breakfast burrito with bacon and green chili sauce and wasn't disappointed. Coffee was good and the we ordered two beignets to share for the table. Service was super nice, attentive and quick to deliver on requests. Would recommend and will look forward to returning

excerpts: The beignets were warm, fresh and chewy.
beignets.author: Karen L.
beignets.review:
My friends and I are from out of town. We were also in San Francisco during the 4th of July weekend. This cafe was one of the few that was open.

When we arrived we were greeted and seated immediately. They were friendly and not pushy about the time you spent eating. Louisiana sausage sure was spicy but it was delicious! Their biscuits were large and fluffy. The beignets were warm, fresh and chewy. They also serve Ritual coffee. 

Overall, it was a wonderful experience! We really enjoyed the Deep South/Cajun styled breakfast! I would definitely come back here!

excerpts: The only item worth having are the beignets.
That's it.
beignets.author: Helen H.
beignets.review:
I've given this place several tries and I'm always disappointed. I just had a shrimp Caesar. The shrimp were overcooked and rubbery and the romaine was limp and over dressed. It was $15 and I didn't even get a hunk of bread to go with it. 

The only item worth having are the beignets. That's it.

excerpts: Tried the beignets - a huge serving, too big for one person,
beignets.author: Nikki R.
beignets.review:
On a short trip and in need of a solo lunch place, I wandered upon Just For You Cafe, and was very glad I did! Tried the beignets - a huge serving, too big for one person, but oh so delicious - and the fried chicken benedict, a treat for any Southerner traveling anywhere outside of the south.

I found all of the food well prepared and with great flavor - and almost too big for one person, but hey, who can complain about that! Would definitely visit again on another trip.

excerpts: We got some beignets to share, which were amazing!
I got their Eggs Benedict and there was so much food it was insane.
Everything was so delicious.
Everyone was super friendly and helpful.
I definitely want to come back here when I visit SF again!
beignets.author: Sam T.
beignets.review: This was the cutest little breakfast place! I went here as my last meal before going home from San Francisco with a bunch of friends. They were able to accommodate all of us (I believe there was a total of about 8 of us). We got some beignets to share, which were amazing! I got their Eggs Benedict and there was so much food it was insane. Everything was so delicious. Everyone was super friendly and helpful. I definitely want to come back here when I visit SF again!

excerpts: We shared coffee, the beignet flight, and huevos rancheros between the two of us, and we both loved the beignets, especially dipped in coffee.
The huevos were good and very spicy, but we'll probably try something else next time instead of ordering it again.
Sadly, they were out of the corned beef hash special, but the prices were right and the service was excellent.
Overall, we'd return for the beignets and mimosa pitchers and to try the spicy mimosa!
beignets.author: First L.
beignets.review: We shared coffee, the beignet flight, and huevos rancheros between the two of us, and we both loved the beignets, especially dipped in coffee. The huevos were good and very spicy, but we'll probably try something else next time instead of ordering it again. Sadly, they were out of the corned beef hash special, but the prices were right and the service was excellent. Overall, we'd return for the beignets and mimosa pitchers and to try the spicy mimosa!

excerpts: I took a freshly squeezed orange juice, the crabbie bennie, and we shared an order of beignets.
The beignets were super tasty, fresh out of the fryer with a soft fluffy interior texture--probably some of my favorite beignets in SF!
It was a little slow to get our food given our group size and timing
but when it did come out, the crabby benedict was perfect--nicely seasoned crabcakes (with a cajun seasoning of some sort & a little bit of sweetness", rich hollandaise over perfectly cooked eggs.
My side of grits was super filling (and I wasn't able to finish) but with a little bit of butter, it helped cut the richness of benedict nicely.
beignets.author: Nerissa C.
beignets.review:
Came here on a whim with our group of 7 at 1ish pm, we were able to get a table pretty quickly right inside. This is your cozy, diner sort of place with chill people serving you and fun artwork of movie posters and old school stuff everywhere. 

I took a freshly squeezed orange juice, the crabbie bennie, and we shared an order of beignets. The beignets were super tasty, fresh out of the fryer with a soft fluffy interior texture--probably some of my favorite beignets in SF! It was a little slow to get our food given our group size and timing but when it did come out, the crabby benedict was perfect--nicely seasoned crabcakes (with a cajun seasoning of some sort & a little bit of sweetness", rich hollandaise over perfectly cooked eggs. My side of grits was super filling (and I wasn't able to finish) but with a little bit of butter, it helped cut the richness of benedict nicely. The rest of my table took a mixture of benedicts, pancakes, scrables, and burgers, all of which seemed to be very good--particularly my friend's pancakes, which were HUGE and fluffy :)

Aside from it being a little slower in service for the food, I had to ask our server 3 times for water and I even asked another server who came by to refill coffee for water as well but we didn't get it until the 4th time asking, after all of our food had come (probably just because of the small kitchen and busy brunch hours). Otherwise, this place was pretty good and I'd recommend it if you're in the dogpatch area.

Side note, you can order a PINT of mimosa here!!!

excerpts: Classy joint for beignets and breakfast!
They have art from my "See-Hing!
beignets.author: Curtis L.
beignets.review:
Classy joint for beignets and breakfast!  They have art from my "See-Hing!"

Try to come early and find a parking spot!

excerpts: The beignets are so good!
The dough is light fresh and even better when you wash it down with Ritual coffee.
The staff is super friendly and don't give you the stink-eye when you ask what is recommended.
Definitely coming back since they gave us a card for free beignets -score!!
beignets.author: Marilou A.
beignets.review:
The beignets are so good! The dough is light fresh and even better when you wash it down with Ritual coffee.  The staff is super friendly and don't give you the stink-eye when you ask what is recommended. I ordered the Crab Benny - crab cake eggs Benedict - bomb and the boyfriend ordered the chicken and waffles - bomb. 

Definitely coming back since they gave us a card for free beignets -score!!

excerpts: Ordered the beignets to get us started and as good as the ones I had in New Orleans.
Coffee came in strong or regular brew, started with the strong and worked well with the beignets.
The shrimp and grits were delicious, covered with a bacon and cream sauce.
Corn bread that it came with was ok, maybe it would have been better if it was was warmed up.
Nice neighborhood place on a hip street in Dogpatch.
beignets.author: T C.
beignets.review: Great brunch. Came with a group of 6 but the wait was not too bad at all. We all enjoyed our food. Ordered the beignets to get us started and as good as the ones I had in New Orleans. Coffee came in strong or regular brew, started with the strong and worked well with the beignets. The shrimp and grits were delicious, covered with a bacon and cream sauce. Corn bread that it came with was ok, maybe it would have been better if it was was warmed up. Nice neighborhood place on a hip street in Dogpatch.

excerpts: Service and beignets were a 5.
Very friendly service and the beignets were fresh and hot.
beignets.author: rebecca r.
beignets.review:
Service and beignets were a 5. Very friendly service and the beignets were fresh and hot. 

Our main meals were cold. We ordered chicken and waffles and fried chicken Benedict 

Waffles had been pre made at least an hour before  

Chicken was pre made as well. Cold and hard. 
Biscuit ....... cold 

Unreal. No reason to pre make food to turn and burn the guests. 

Not going back.

excerpts: To start off the meal, we ordered some of the beignets.
beignets.author: Ryan R.
beignets.review:
Went here with some friends to grab a bite to eat on a Sunday morning. The place was pretty packed, but we were able to beat the 10am rush and get seated right away.

To start off the meal, we ordered some of the beignets. These were decent--not as memorable as the ones I had in New Orleans, but not bad.

For my main meal, I decided to go with the Greg's scramble with chorizo and grits and corn bread. While this was not the lightest breakfast I have ever had, it sure was a tasty one. The scramble was tasty and the corn bread and grits were both unexpected hits as well.

Overall, this place serves up some quality food at reasonable prices and has quite a following. This place is the perfect setting for a brunch catch up with friends or to chase a hangover with a significant other. Definitely worth checking out if you're in the neighborhood, just be sure to get there before 10am to beat the rush.

excerpts: I believe they're known for their beignets, though my friends and I did not order.
beignets.author: Diane T.
beignets.review:
Definitely a fan of this place. Love their selection of good ole comforting breakfast items. 
Came by on a sunday mid-morning. Had a wait of approx 30mins. They have a small seating area outside for you to wait. I believe they're known for their beignets, though my friends and I did not order. 

The ambiance and atmosphere in Just for you cafe is very homey. Not too "hipster-ish" and very inviting. Seating is a bit tight, so don't expect to have lots of room. 

I ended up ordering this one hangover skillet, breakfast cure thing that involved fried oysters, lots of eggs, a large heapings of home potatoes and some other meats--it was huge. The portions here are definitely on point here and the dish was AMAZING. Still drooling just thinking about it. 

They have a good assortment of more southern style breakfast items. Definitely dont come by if you're concerned for the your belly..it's not a diet and eat a salad kind of place, otherwise, i would take friends and family here.

excerpts: We got the 3 beignets for about $6 to share between the four of us.
If you're from South Bay--or Cantonese at all, you'll know what I mean when I say it's a prettier and square version of Cantonese donuts (ref:
Cooking Papa in Santa Clara).
Snowed in powdered sugar, you don't need extra syrup...
it's perfect as it.
beignets.author: Jodi H.
beignets.review:
Came here for brunch/lunch with the fam late Saturday around 1-2PM, and we had no wait at all. That's right. Brunch in SF? On a weekend? No wait? I think the brunch gods blessed us.

We got the 3 beignets for about $6 to share between the four of us. If you're from South Bay--or Cantonese at all, you'll know what I mean when I say it's a prettier and square version of Cantonese donuts (ref: Cooking Papa in Santa Clara). Snowed in powdered sugar, you don't need extra syrup...it's perfect as it. I had the veggie burrito with fries on the side, had a bite of their home fries and delicious crab benny, while the 'rents had biscuits and gravy and the Greg's omelette with a delicious scone.

In all, service was so chill. We had a super cool server with a gorgeous pixie haircut and relaxed demeanor, she was not pushy with our orders and was prompt with refilling our waters. The food servers and staff were all on their A game...shoutout to the friendly Mexican guy who greeted us as we asked for a table, and quickly took our dirty plates away. 

It's not a super fancy cafe, but it's got such a "Sunday morning/lazy neighborhood cafe" vibe without the pretentious avocado toasts and ginger-banana-dragonfruit-cleanse shakes. I love Just for You, and so did the older sweet couple next to us and the young twenty-somethings snapping their food on our other side. Kudos JFY, we'll be back soon. Pro Tip: Parking is a-plenty around the corner along the residential areas.

excerpts: Our table got 3 beignets to share and they were nice, light and delicious.
I ordered the blackcomb Benedict which had bacon and tomatoes with hollandaise sauce on an English muffin with home fries on the side.
The bacon was perfectly crisp and the hollandaise sauce was really good.
Everything was great from the service to the food, would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a brunch option.
beignets.author: Jennifer H.
beignets.review: Had a group of 6 on a Sunday morning and there was only a 10 min wait to get us in. As soon as we sat down the waitress got our drink orders and then quickly returned to take our orders. She was great and came back multiple times to fill up our water glasses and was very attentive. The food came out quickly and was delicious. Our table got 3 beignets to share and they were nice, light and delicious. I ordered the blackcomb Benedict which had bacon and tomatoes with hollandaise sauce on an English muffin with home fries on the side. The bacon was perfectly crisp and the hollandaise sauce was really good. Everything was great from the service to the food, would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a brunch option.

excerpts: Their beignets and fresh baked breads are legit... and they have a wonderful variety of offerings to please any palate.
I always go for their scrambles, while my husband loves their breakfast burritos.
This is a neighborhood gem
beignets.author: Erin C.
beignets.review: We have been coming to Just for You cafe for almost 10 years and love the consistent, delicious and affordable brunches they serve here. Their beignets and fresh baked breads are legit... and they have a wonderful variety of offerings to please any palate. I always go for their scrambles, while my husband loves their breakfast burritos. This is a neighborhood gem

excerpts: Also, beignets were amazing ( add some Jam & honey)....
beignets.author: Lei F.
beignets.review:
Came to JFY after seeing multiple reviews on yelp, so thought I would check it out! Great quaint place with parking. I loved that they had outside seating as well, but you know SF weather so I ended up sitting inside.. so now to what matters the food! 
Must HAVES: Grits were BOMB, I would definitely get them again! Also, beignets were amazing ( add some Jam & honey).... 

I would not get biscuits again they were dry! 

Otherwise - Greg Scramble was a good choice!

excerpts: The other day we agreed to a slightly smaller table (group of 5), and our server awarded us a card that we could use for a free order of Beignets.
These powdery treats were absolutely delightful, and the gesture from our server was so kind.
I will certainly continue coming here for brunch on many more occasions.
beignets.author: Alex E.
beignets.review:
I am a big promoter of Just For You Cafe. I have been here several times, and never been let down. Most recently, I brought my brother and some friends, and we had another great experience.

I was initially won over by the pint size mimosas. Yes, I said pint size mimosas.  Gone are the days of paying $ for a tiny little champagne flute with mostly orange juice. Just For You has really stepped it up here.  More importantly, the juices they use are fresh squeezed and delicious. I highly recommend the grapefruit/orange juice combination. 

I love brunch, so I absolutely love the food here. Biscuits and gravy is one of my favorite items to order.  I also love the Chicken and Waffles, but you really cannot seem to go wrong on this menu.  The classic breakfast items are always well prepared.

The other day we agreed to a slightly smaller table (group of 5), and our server awarded us a card that we could use for a free order of Beignets. These powdery treats were absolutely delightful, and the gesture from our server was so kind. I will certainly continue coming here for brunch on many more occasions.

excerpts:
Chicory in the coffee is a nice touch
and remember to try the beignets.
beignets.author: Dan B.
beignets.review:
Vinny Gambini: Are we to believe that boiling water soaks into a grit faster in your kitchen than on any place on the face of the Earth?

Mr. Tipton: I don't know. 

Vinny Gambini: Well, perhaps the laws of physics cease to exist on your stove.

I love the law . . . I mean the laws of physics . . . in accordance to Hollywood conventions that is.

What does this all have to do with Just For You Cafe you might be asking (or maybe you're already accustomed to my flight of fancy)?  Grits, baby.  Grits.

To which you could say, kiss my . . . but if you got that reference you are obviously very, very . . . well versed in tv.

Anyways, I got the Greg's scramble with chicken-apple sausage and a side of grits.  I got to say, it's been awhile since I've had a really good scramble: you get that crisp bite from the onions, sweet component from the sausage, and nice little bit of salt from the parm.  Yum.  So yum.  And I was totally feeling the grits (not literally, of course): simple yet very satisfying and it complimented all the flavors of the scramble.

Great service.
Neighborhood feel is a plus.
Neighborhood parking is not.

Chicory in the coffee is a nice touch
and remember to try the beignets.

excerpts: We only came for one thing really, the beignets, and it was WORTH IT!
Fresh powdered beignets with mediocre coffee is the way to go.
Loved every bite.
beignets.author: Roman V.
beignets.review:
We only came for one thing really, the beignets, and it was WORTH IT! Rain and all, it was worth the trek coming across the city.

Fresh powdered beignets with mediocre coffee is the way to go. Loved every bite. If they would have come in a paper bag, I would have lost my shit and gone wild about it! 

We will be back to explore the menu and boost this to a 5 star, everything looked and smelled great coming out of the kitchen.

excerpts: (3) Beignets
- this came HOT!
Fresh from the fryer!
So delish... doughy!
It was topped with powder sugar and it's mmmMMm.. more please!

5 stars
(4) Filipino sausage with toast and eggs
- I love the sausage!
**MUST GET: Beignets!
Hot, fresh, and doughy!
Love it!
beignets.author: Mindy Y.
beignets.review:
EVENT: the girls plus the Mr. needed some brunch... there's tons of cute little brunch places around this area... but hell... the wait is forever! But, not Just For You Cafe! No wait!!!! And it's the best!!!

PARKING: a lot of meter parking... kinda quiet around here. Not much cars! We walked here and it was a nice little walk

SERVICE: We got sat down right away! Server totally cool! Gave us water and menu. The menu was so long... and sound so good... we wanted everything and needed more time! Server is totally patient.

FOOD:
(1) French Toast - sweet and delish!
(2) Pancakes - mmMm! Super fluffy! Jam on the table!
(3) Beignets - this came HOT! Fresh from the fryer! So delish... doughy! It was topped with powder sugar and it's mmmMMm.. more please! 5 stars
(4) Filipino sausage with toast and eggs - I love the sausage! Very unique... never had this before but goes really well with toast and eggs!

**MUST GET: Beignets! Hot, fresh, and doughy! Love it!

excerpts: We did the beignets too and they were super doughy
and
and it turns out
, they were raw, and we realized this after we ate the first two.
My boyfriend split the last one and saw how raw the dough was, it was literally dough spilling out.
Hopefully the ones we ate weren't too raw, but it did leave a yeast taste in our mouths.
The beignets were taken off the bill, but still, beignets are kind of their staple item so they should have been cooked properly.
P.S.
Their beignets are nothing like Cafe du
Monde's, I don't care what others have to say.
beignets.author: Samantha C.
beignets.review:
Wait isn't too bad.  People leave every few minutes and others are quickly seated afterwards.  Probably waited 15 minutes and this was on a long weekend.  The food is just descent though.  There's really nothing special about their breakfast items.  

We did the beignets too and they were super doughy and and it turns out, they were raw, and we realized this after we ate the first two.  My boyfriend split the last one and saw how raw the dough was, it was literally dough spilling out.  Hopefully the ones we ate weren't too raw, but it did leave a yeast taste in our mouths.  The beignets were taken off the bill, but still, beignets are kind of their staple item so they should have been cooked properly.  P.S. Their beignets are nothing like Cafe du Monde's, I don't care what others have to say.

excerpts: Ordered the grilled chicken sandwich, buttermilk fried chicken sandwich, reuben sandwich, and beignets.
Grilled chicken was good with provolone cheese.
Fried chicken could have used more flavor on its own but with the honey butter it was very good.
Reuben had delicious corned beef.
All the sandwiches had homemade bread toasted perfectly.
Beignets were too doughy more like doughnuts.
Service was very friendly and quick.
Overall atmosphere was very fun and quirky.
beignets.author: Melissa W.
beignets.review:
Came here for lunch on a Wednesday and it was super crowded. We were still seated almost immediately. Ordered the grilled chicken sandwich, buttermilk fried chicken sandwich, reuben sandwich, and beignets. Grilled chicken was good with provolone cheese.  Fried chicken could have used more flavor on its own but with the honey butter it was very good. Reuben had delicious corned beef. All the sandwiches had homemade bread toasted perfectly. Beignets were too doughy more like doughnuts. 
Service was very friendly and quick. Overall atmosphere was very fun and quirky.

excerpts: Fresh beignets with powdered sugar?
Why, hell yes!
I've been dreaming of them for 6 months and stumbled upon this gem this morning.

Perfectly perfect, this great breakfast filled the spot, 'Cowgirl' gets you eggs, pancakes and sausage or bacon, great service, we sat outside in the sunlight and it was clean, affordably priced, and the beignets, did I mention the beignets?
Well, you had me at hello!
I'll be back again.
Thank you 'Just For You'
beignets.author: Lisa L.
beignets.review: What a wonderful way to get my body started this morning! Fresh beignets with powdered sugar? Why, hell yes! I've been dreaming of them for 6 months and stumbled upon this gem this morning. Perfectly perfect, this great breakfast filled the spot, 'Cowgirl' gets you eggs, pancakes and sausage or bacon, great service, we sat outside in the sunlight and it was clean, affordably priced, and the beignets, did I mention the beignets? Well, you had me at hello! I'll be back again. Thank you 'Just For You'

excerpts: Beignets are made fresh to order and yummy, although NOLA is a lot better.
But whatcha gonna do this is the Bay Area.
beignets.author: Vanessa K.
beignets.review: A really great spot for breakfast. It's a small place, so be prepared to wait if they're busy. Beignets are made fresh to order and yummy, although NOLA is a lot better. But whatcha gonna do this is the Bay Area.

excerpts: Started with the pint-sized mimosa and beignets.
Mimosa was about as good as one could expect for a pint-sized mimosa, and the beignets were very good but not sweet (ask for honey).
We got the hangtown fry, fried chicken benedict, cornbread, biscuit, grits, and home fries.
Everything was solid except for the biscuits, which were a little heavy and flavorless compared to the best homemade biscuits.
beignets.author: Young J.
beignets.review:
Tasty and gigantic brunch. Started with the pint-sized mimosa and beignets. Mimosa was about as good as one could expect for a pint-sized mimosa, and the beignets were very good but not sweet (ask for honey). We got the hangtown fry, fried chicken benedict, cornbread, biscuit, grits, and home fries. Everything was solid except for the biscuits, which were a little heavy and flavorless compared to the best homemade biscuits. Great service and experience overall.

Update: I've been back a few times since my first visit, and the menu overall has been disappointing. The service has been terrific every time, but I've ordered a variety of scrambles and they all come with large undercooked chunks of onion inside, and when the scramble contains bacon it's always undercooked as well. They need to sufficiently cook the fillings first and then add the eggs--it tastes like they cook them all together. The huevos rancheros were the worst huevos rancheros I've ever tasted. I've had way better huevos rancheros in New York, which is saying something. Dry and flavorless, it's like they slapped the ingredients together with zero effort. With that said, I'm leaving my rating at four stars because the place has such a nice vibe and servers, and because they do staples (basic eggs, bacon, etc.) very well.

excerpts: From buttermilk pancakes to grits and eggs to po-boys with shrimp, to biscuits and gravy, to fish tacos to peanut butter and jelly and Mickey Mouse Pancakes for kids, to Beignets!!
What??
Po-Boy Shrimp sandwich and cornbread and chili were our choices.
Excellent!
So looking forward to our next visit to enjoy another great meal!
Parking is a little difficult in Dogpatch area but this restaurant is worth it!
Popular place for locals and workers in the area.
Great for large groups and families!
Fast service and friendly staff!
Looking forward to another great meal at
Just For You!
Moderate prices and large Mimosa's!
Winner!!
beignets.author: Barbara n.
beignets.review:
Just For You in San Francisco was Just Wonderful!!! 
First time culinary experience at this restaurant and we weren't disappointed! Sat outside and enjoyed the most delicious Grapefruit Mimosa's before our amazing brunch! The incredible menu selections were so vast that it took us a long time to decide what to order! A distinct Louisiana flare of selections made it difficult to decide what to eat!  
From buttermilk pancakes to grits and eggs to po-boys with shrimp, to biscuits and gravy, to fish tacos to peanut butter and jelly and Mickey Mouse Pancakes for kids, to Beignets!! What?? Po-Boy Shrimp sandwich and cornbread and chili were our choices. Excellent! So looking forward to our next visit to enjoy another great meal! Parking is a little difficult in Dogpatch area but this restaurant is worth it! Popular place for locals and workers in the area. Great for large groups and families! Fast service and friendly staff! Looking forward to another great meal at Just For You! Moderate prices and large Mimosa's! Winner!!

excerpts: I came by for beignets and ended up getting lunch here.
The beignets were quite fresh and bigger than the devil's teeth ones.
The jambalaya that I got was good and came with corn bread.
My only downside is that one of the waitresses seemed to ignore me and never gave me eye contact the times I flagged her down.
beignets.author: Dan C.
beignets.review: I came by for beignets and ended up getting lunch here. The beignets were quite fresh and bigger than the devil's teeth ones. The jambalaya that I got was good and came with corn bread.  My only downside is that one of the waitresses seemed to ignore me and never gave me eye contact the times I flagged her down.

excerpts: Beignets were delicious though.
Strawberry mint mojito was 2/5.
Strong but no flavor of strawberry or mint.
I'll probably come back and try something  else.
beignets.author: Khiara H.
beignets.review: I have to agree with the other posters.. avocado toast was weak. Not seasoned well. Server was nice , as was host but server didn't check in. French fries were deep fried with pieces on fried chicken . Beignets were delicious though. Strawberry mint mojito was 2/5. Strong but no flavor of strawberry or mint. I'll probably come back and try something  else.

excerpts: People come for the beignets.
I've had the famous beignets in New Orleans
beignets.author: Viyada S.
beignets.review:
Breakfast for Breakfast
Breakfast for Lunch
Breakfast for Dinner

Get it? I like breakfast. 

Food: I've had many things on the menu. I worked in the Dogpatch for 2 years. I've had many of the breakfast items and all are delicious. My latest visit was Duck Eggs Benedict on homemade bread. In my belly please.

People come for the beignets. I've had the famous beignets in New Orleans so I don't think it's fair of me to compare. 

Service: Always friendly but does get busy so plan accordingly. I enjoy sitting at the counter and watching the controlled chaos. These employees work hard.

Ambiance:  I love diners but I wouldn't classify Just For You Cafe as a true diner. However, it looks like a diner.

excerpts: Beignets are the best thing on their menu.
They are huge and tasty.
Not soggy, not overly fried.
And loaded with powered sugar.
One of the best in San Francisco.
The wait isn't super long which is nice.
beignets.author: Sandy B.
beignets.review: Just okay. Service is always friendly tho but I feel like the food is not very consistent. They always serve me brunt and last pieces of their house potato. I'm always so bumped about that. You can clearly see it on my plate. Their **Beignets are the best thing on their menu. They are huge and tasty. Not soggy, not overly fried. And loaded with powered sugar. One of the best in San Francisco. The wait isn't super long which is nice.

excerpts:
Beignets!  
Wonderful, huge, fabulous beignets!  
And then I added an order of beignets to take home.  
They said they would wait until I was about halfway done w my breakfast before firing up the beignets, so that they would be nice & hot when I took them home.

Refilled my coffee on their own, & didn't forget to fire up my beignets to go.

When they brought the beignets to me, I opened the container to take a look...
beignets.author: Veronica M.
beignets.review:
Beignets!  Wonderful, huge, fabulous beignets!  
They're light & airy pillows of perfection.

I sat down @ the counter.  I ordered the chili scramble w cornbread & home fries.  And then I added an order of beignets to take home.  They said they would wait until I was about halfway done w my breakfast before firing up the beignets, so that they would be nice & hot when I took them home.

Nice!

I did not know how large they were, so I opted for 3 instead of just 1.  

My breakfast arrived in no time. 

Let's talk about the sublime texture contrasts...
the chili con carne,
the scrambled eggs,
the cheddar cheese,
the diced onion,
all piled high on top of the cornbread...

You know what all of these things together equals?  One rock star heavenly breakfast pyramid, that's what!  OMG good.  I tried to get some of each component in every single bite.  The new breakfast of champions.  

The eggs were scrambled the right way; they had fork, but were still soft.  The chili had enough spice to please but not overwhelm.  The cornbread was fantastic.  Moist & flavorful.  Good down home southern cornbread.

Huge portion.  And with the home fries, it looked & felt like the plate weighed a couple of pounds.  The home fries were just ok.  Next time I'll opt for a different side.  I ate maybe a third of it, & boxed the rest.  This turned out to be 3 small meals for me.

Service was friendly & attentive.  Refilled my coffee on their own, & didn't forget to fire up my beignets to go.

When they brought the beignets to me, I opened the container to take a look...

What beauties.  What huge beauties.

I ate one as soon as I got to my car.  I meant to only take a bite, but it was so good all my resolve went out the window in about 2 seconds.

They taste as good as they look.

JFY Cafe is one cool neighborhood joint.  Good food, good people.

5 stars.

excerpts: The beignets are what brought me here
and they didn't disappoint.
While I wouldn't come back for their brunch menu, I would come back for their beignets.
beignets.author: Steph F.
beignets.review:
Come early or be prepared for a wait.

I came here on ac Sunday morning for brunch with family and waited about 20 minutes for a table. There's not much seating inside and a couple of tables right out front. 

The beignets are what brought me here and they didn't disappoint. They were light, airy, fluffy, and not greasy like other places. 

I wasn't that impressed by the rest of the food though that was brought to the table. The home fries were burnt and lacked flavor. The grits looked even worse than the instant stuff. The pancakes I ordered were okay. I was expecting a little more than a couple slices of fruit though. Lastly, the coffee could use some improvement.

Our server was friendly and refilled our waters without having to ask. While I wouldn't come back for their brunch menu, I would come back for their beignets.

excerpts: The beignets are awesome, the breakfast food is delicious and the staff is friendly.
Can't ask for a whole lot more.
beignets.author: Brian O.
beignets.review: Good breakfast.  Even a convenient little urban park out front which is great since there's normally a wait.  The beignets are awesome, the breakfast food is delicious and the staff is friendly.  Can't ask for a whole lot more.

excerpts: The beignets are supersize.
I just had scrambled eggs which were fine perfectly with longanisa sausage which was yummy.
I chose the grits as a side and not wanting more carbs like biscuits or toast the server offered to add cheese to the grits.
Unfortunately the grits were horrible.
I expected creamy served on the side of the eggs and they were served in a rice bowl with the cheese melted on top.
That wasn't a big deal but the grits were about the same consistency as a bowl of  rice and the melted cheese a bit leathery like it had been overheated in the micro.
beignets.author: Steven B.
beignets.review: Friendly, fast accommodating service staff in a homey diner type environment. They serve up a variety of hearty breakfast eater fare. The beignets are supersize. I just had scrambled eggs which were fine perfectly with longanisa sausage which was yummy. I chose the grits as a side and not wanting more carbs like biscuits or toast the server offered to add cheese to the grits. Unfortunately the grits were horrible. I expected creamy served on the side of the eggs and they were served in a rice bowl with the cheese melted on top. That wasn't a big deal but the grits were about the same consistency as a bowl of  rice and the melted cheese a bit leathery like it had been overheated in the micro.

excerpts: The beignets are to DIE FOR!!!
They are so light with just the right amount of powdered sugar (read A LOT!).
beignets.author: Yin H.
beignets.review: This seems to be the place to go for brunch in dogpatch. Even on a rainy day, there was a line but we were seated quickly enough. Great food, good service (they did mess up our order but corrected immediately). The beignets are to DIE FOR!!! They are so light with just the right amount of powdered sugar (read A LOT!). I got the veggie omelette with home fries and they were gracious enough to sub the bread option with a small green salad on the side. Would definitely come back if I'm in the neighborhood. Really cute interior decor and felt like a hip local spot :)

excerpts: The beignets are delicious.
Ours were a little overcooked, but still mouthwatering non the less.
beignets.author: Nikole D.
beignets.review:
Excellent place tucked away in the dog patch. Friendly customer service and people from all walks of life. This is your neighborhood cafe. Locals and workers come here to distress and get some quality food. 

I got the eggs, chicken sausage, with cheesy grits. The eggs and sausage were average but good. The grits were a little plain but adding salt brought out more taste to the side. 

The beignets are delicious. Ours were a little overcooked, but still mouthwatering non the less. I this place would be a bring a friend out here to try out kinda place.

Looking to try out other menu options before I make a final decision, but for now it's a 3.

excerpts: I had to try their famous beignets and it didn't disappoint.
Very traditional cafe du monde-esque beignet with powdered sugar.
beignets.author: Semuteh F.
beignets.review:
Best brunch! Lovely neighborhood, delicious food, gracious service.

The scrambles are da.bomb.dot.com. I got Greg's with bacon, homefries, and cornbread. I love all the bread/side options. I didn't get grits this time but I appreciate that it's an option. Cornbread was SO GOOD! Homefries were also delicious. Portions very generous.

I had to try their famous beignets and it didn't disappoint. Very traditional cafe du monde-esque beignet with powdered sugar. Much more airy/lite than Brenda's. 

Just go to Just for You...it's JUST the best ;)

excerpts: I also shared a side of beignets with my friend.
The beignets look really big but the inside of the beignet is quite hollow so you're not really eating that much actually.
beignets.author: Danielle C.
beignets.review:
I'm not a huge fan of brunch places in general but I thought this one was pretty decent, and I'd go back again sure!

The lines during the weekend can get pretty long but they move fast. My party of two was seated in about 15 minutes or so.

The food is typical brunch food with some southern flavors like grilled catfish thrown in the mix. They even have grits!

I got the eggs and bacon with grits. The eggs were okay although they needed some salt. The bacon was quite delicious and full of flavor. This was probably one of my favorite bacon pieces I've ever had in a brunch place! The grits were disappointing since they didn't have too much flavor - I didn't notice the jar of butter until it was too late, otherwise I would have put some butter there.

I also shared a side of beignets with my friend. The beignets look really big but the inside of the beignet is quite hollow so you're not really eating that much actually. It was still quite good and the powdered sugar is awesome.

The biscuits are fluffy and the scone was quite good, not too sweet. There were cranberries in the scone.

excerpts: Ordered the Crab Benedict with fries and the beignets.
The Crab Benedict was delicious and the fries looked more like country potatoes but without the bell peppers nevertheless it was tasty.
The beignets were so fresh it just melted in your mouth.
beignets.author: MG D.
beignets.review:
Ordered the Crab Benedict with fries and the beignets. The Crab Benedict was delicious and the fries looked more like country potatoes but without the bell peppers nevertheless it was tasty. The beignets were so fresh it just melted in your mouth. 

I ordered my food togo because it was raining and didn't want to wait in the rain. The person who took my order told me about 15 to 20 mins but it only took me 5 mins to get there and as soon as I walked to the cash register I heard my name for the togo order and it was ready!

excerpts: So, check those beignets!
Oh yeah, I said it.
I take my GF (glutenease) pill
and I GO FOR IT!
beignets.author: Saundra D.
beignets.review:
I love this little spot in Dogpatch in SF.  I don't get to the city often, but when I do (and it is the breakfast hour) I head to this joint.  I usually have the eggs (add summa dem mushrooms and cheddar) but that is because I am a creature of habit.  They have SO MANY options and I really need to stretch myself and try something new...I will, I promise.  So, check those beignets! Oh yeah, I said it.  I take my GF (glutenease) pill and I GO FOR IT!  The dark roast coffee sets these little lovelies OFF and I am here for it ALL.

They have and extensive breakfast menu and you really can't go wrong with their egg dishes and the grits (yeah...grits).

The servings are generous and the service is consistently attentive and courteous.

excerpts: Started out with the Beignets...
You get 3 huge ones so prepare to share...or make it a meal.
Your choice.
Next i had the "Frittata of  the Decade".
I opted for no onion
but i think the spinach overpowered the zucchini, which is my favorite ingredient.
Still good, but would customize this one a but more in the future.
Great potatoes and the scone was so-so.
Tasted like they heated it too long in the microwave to be honest.
beignets.author: Mark C.
beignets.review:
Found this place for breakfast due to great reviews.  I concur.  Love the atmosphere and delicious food.  Started out with the Beignets... You get 3 huge ones so prepare to share...or make it a meal.  Your choice.  Next i had the "Frittata of  the Decade". I opted for no onion but i think the spinach overpowered the zucchini, which is my favorite ingredient.  Still good, but would customize this one a but more in the future.  Great potatoes and the scone was so-so.  Tasted like they heated it too long in the microwave to be honest.  My friend had the raisin toast and that was much better.

Service was unorganized.  3 different servers rotated around and in the end, none of them wanted to give us our check until we flagged one down. I am pretty sure we could have easily dined and dashed (for you criminals out there reading this).  

Still, worth a return visit.

excerpts: We also ordered three beignets.
beignets.author: Tommy L.
beignets.review:
Came here Friday 1/2/15 around 11am for brunch. First brunch of the new year. There was a wait but they had a Parklet out front with seats so it wasn't too bad. At most we waited for about 20 mins. 

I ordered the two eggs any style with grilled catfish/grits/biscuits. The grits were ordinary, nothing to write about. The biscuits looked undercooked from the color but they were surprisingly pretty good. The catfish wasn't flavored enough so it was pretty underwhelming. We also ordered three beignets. They were decent but not the best.

I most likely won't come back here again unless I need a place with easy access to parking...which is why I chose this place in the first place.

excerpts: Beignets were really good!
beignets.author: Melinda C.
beignets.review:
Beignets were really good! must order

Came on sunday for brunch. Had to wait about 35 min but totally worth it :)

excerpts: With my friend and I, we started off ordering individual beignets and LOVED them (can you say BOMB)!
They are very pillow-like: very fluffy, light, and airy, then dusted with powered sugar on top.
In our opinion, we felt JFY's beignets are better than Brenda's.
Honestly, if you came here JUST for beignets and a cup of joe or tea, that's really enough.
But if you're desiring something more substantial, the chicken shiitake omelette is a good brunch dish: tender, white-meat chicken, sun-dried tomatoes, and shiitake mushrooms.
2 people enjoying 2 egg dishes (1 benedict and 1 omelette), 2 beignets, and 1 cup of joe all for $40 tip included is very reasonable.
The overall food was good and staff was very friendly.
beignets.author: Jessica S.
beignets.review:
Just For You cafe is a lesser known brunch place with very comparable southern-style food as Brenda's.  With my friend and I, we started off ordering individual beignets and LOVED them (can you say BOMB)!  They are very pillow-like: very fluffy, light, and airy, then dusted with powered sugar on top.  In our opinion, we felt JFY's beignets are better than Brenda's.  
 
Honestly, if you came here JUST for beignets and a cup of joe or tea, that's really enough.  But if you're desiring something more substantial, the chicken shiitake omelette is a good brunch dish: tender, white-meat chicken, sun-dried tomatoes, and shiitake mushrooms.  For the side (included) I suggest their creamy grits, which taste like Chinese-style plain porridge (baak jook), and their moist, home-made cornbread.  

2 people enjoying 2 egg dishes (1 benedict and 1 omelette), 2 beignets, and 1 cup of joe all for $40 tip included is very reasonable.  The overall food was good and staff was very friendly.

excerpts: Our waiter greeted us so kindly and since it was our first time, he offered us a free order of beignets!
beignets.author: Janet P.
beignets.review:
What a gem! I came here on a Sunday afternoon and waited less than 15 minutes to be seated. Our waiter greeted us so kindly and since it was our first time, he offered us a free order of beignets!

There's a good selection of food items on the menu. We ordered chicken and waffles and the pastrami scramble. The portions were just right! 

Chicken and waffles:  nicely fried boneless chicken. The waffles had a taste of cinnamon, but were a little soggy, not as golden with a slight crisp like I usually like them.

The customer service is why I would come back. Each server was super friendly and accommodating. Very welcoming environment :-)

excerpts: I love the beignets, the hangtown fry is awesome, and the New Mexico green chile sauce is a winner.
The service is friendly and attentive.
I would go twice per week, but in this area of Dogpatch parking just sucks.
I have had to park blocks down Illinois and hike.
Not their fault -
it's just the neighborhood - I don't visit Dogpatch Saloon or Hard Knox as much as I'd like either.
I hear it's even worse on the weekends.
Anyway, JFYC is highly recommended.
beignets.author: Ken P.
beignets.review: i just need to get over how expensive SF is.  Two eggs, potatoes, bacon and toast is $12 in the city.  That's just the way it is.  So once I get past the prices, which are average for this part of the city, this place is a winner.  Great food and great service.  I love the beignets, the hangtown fry is awesome, and the New Mexico green chile sauce is a winner.  The service is friendly and attentive.  I would go twice per week, but in this area of Dogpatch parking just sucks.  I have had to park blocks down Illinois and hike.  Not their fault - it's just the neighborhood - I don't visit Dogpatch Saloon or Hard Knox as much as I'd like either.  I hear it's even worse on the weekends.  Anyway, JFYC is highly recommended.

excerpts: The beignets are really good, no doubt about that!
For the rest, the portions are very generous and I like the option to get grits instead of fries, adds character.
But there is no too much flavor to the food.
We had two (!) special omelets - chicken avocado, since the rest of the menu seemed a little intimidating to the guys.
I opted for vege frittata, which was really generous on the vegetables, but I felt it could be much better if it had some herbs in it.
So, get the beignets, get the fries... everything else is optional :P
beignets.author: Marianna K.
beignets.review:
So, -1 star for the worst experience getting seated, +1 star for all the humorous signs inside and outside.  
The food is a solid 4 star!
This was my second time at the cafe.  The first time I had very mixed feeling about the food, and I am not sure I have more "clarity" after my second time here.  The beignets are really good, no doubt about that! For the rest, the portions are very generous and I like the option to get grits instead of fries, adds character.  But there is no too much flavor to the food.
We had two (!) special omelets - chicken avocado, since the rest of the menu seemed a little intimidating to the guys.  I opted for vege frittata, which was really generous on the vegetables, but I felt it could be much better if it had some herbs in it. Home fries are a must have! 

So, get the beignets, get the fries... everything else is optional :P

excerpts: get the beignets, so damn good.
all made hot and fresh, best in san francisco.
its a small place that serves up a big delicious menu.
The brunch menu is solid, fantastic portions and a good price.
For brunch in san francisco i think it was on the cheaper side.
the size of place is a bit tight but its worth it for the food.
beignets.author: Peter P.
beignets.review: get the beignets, so damn good. all made hot and fresh, best in san francisco. its a small place that serves up a big delicious menu. The brunch menu is solid, fantastic portions and a good price. For brunch in san francisco i think it was on the cheaper side. the size of place is a bit tight but its worth it for the food.

excerpts: I was curious about beignets as they seem to be mentioned in every review
and I didn't know what they are.
Glad I tried them.
My bleu scramble was pretty good too.
Their cornbread is heavenly.
beignets.author: Gaurav V.
beignets.review: I went here on a busy Saturday afternoon and got a seat fairly quickly. I was curious about beignets as they seem to be mentioned in every review and I didn't know what they are. Glad I tried them. My bleu scramble was pretty good too. Their cornbread is heavenly.

excerpts: Advertised as "light, fluffy New Orleans style donuts smothered in powdered sugar", their beignets fit the description well, and they were the main reason I wanted to give this place a try.
beignets.author: Priscilla W.
beignets.review:
Situated near 3rd Street, which seems to be the only restaurant-filled strip in the Dogpatch neighborhood, Just For You Cafe deems itself as a homey, comforting, and friendly spot that's perfect for weekend brunch. Although they have a couple outdoor tables and a parklet, there's isn't much of a view.

They serve standard breakfast dishes, but their sugar beignet is the real star. Advertised as "light, fluffy New Orleans style donuts smothered in powdered sugar", their beignets fit the description well, and they were the main reason I wanted to give this place a try. The slightly crunchy edges and fluffy, but chewy center make this deep-fried goodness a sweet breakfast treat, whether it's by itself, accompanied with a cup of coffee, or before a more savory meal.

The Crabby Bennie consists of two Creole crab cakes on muffins (or toast), topped with two poached eggs and hollandaise sauce. The crab cakes were good, but there weren't any large chunks of meat, giving me the impression that it's canned. The hollandaise sauce was thick and creamy. But the poached eggs were overcooked; the white had fully set and the yolk held together and wasn't runny at all. It was a huge disappointment, because they advertise their eggs as "poached to perfection". But they were FAR from perfection...

House potatoes were seasoned very lightly, but not enough because they were still a little bland. I needed to add some salt and pepper and dip them in ketchup in order to finish them.

The service was very friendly and food arrived promptly. The cafe is relatively small, seating around 25-30 people. But there was no wait when we visited on a Saturday afternoon, an hour before closing. Overall, Just For You Cafe is a decent breakfast spot, but there aren't a lot of unique options on the menu that would urge me to return.

excerpts: The beignets are amazing.
And join t the start.
I had the biscuits and gravy.
Very good.
Around the table were various iterations of lluevos rancheros and other egg dishes.
A great place to "break the fast" and start the day.
The benedicts are only served on the weekends.
beignets.author: Tara B.
beignets.review: Great find for breakfast. The beignets are amazing. And join t the start. I had the biscuits and gravy. Very good. Around the table were various iterations of lluevos rancheros and other egg dishes. A great place to "break the fast" and start the day. The benedicts are only served on the weekends.

excerpts: This time around we decided to get beignets to start with (to share) and I went with the chili scramble.
It was so good.
I mean I love a good egg dish
wth chili on top and cornbread.
The cornbread was dense and held the chili and scrambled eggs well.
The chili was a bit spicy with some great flavors.
Pro tip: beignets!
beignets.author: Nina Y.
beignets.review:
My friend from the South Bay decided he wanted to come up to see me in SF. I definitely told him to choose a place since he never comes to the City. This place was his choice since it was close to Caltrain. 

I have been here before but decided why not to try it again. This time around we decided to get beignets to start with (to share) and I went with the chili scramble. It was so good. I mean I love a good egg dish wth chili on top and cornbread. The cornbread was dense and held the chili and scrambled eggs well. The chili was a bit spicy with some great flavors. Definitely enjoyable. 

Overall it's a nice decent wait but the food was amazing and well worth it. 

Pro tip: beignets!

excerpts: Get the beignets and don't miss out on the grits.
The beignets are out of this world!
beignets.author: Liz O.
beignets.review: I love LOVE JFYC! Nestled in the heart of the Dogpatch neighborhood, the location couldn't be better. Within walking distance from Potrero Hill, Mission Bay and SOMA. The place has a down to earth, homey vibe and the staff and decor are very entertaining (if you visit, you will know what I mean)! Not to mention: their brunch fare is classic and consistently awesome. The servings are solid and you will never leave hungry. Get the beignets and don't miss out on the grits. The beignets are out of this world!

excerpts: Big ass beignets swamped in powdered sugar, crunchy French toast bathed in sugary syrup, poached eggs sitting on top of Cajun sausages and house-made white toast, plus a cup of hot, strong coffee, what else could you ask for?
beignets.author: Joseph L.
beignets.review:
It's rainy, it's cold, and you are still recovering from the hangover from last night. If that's the situation you are in, do yourself a favor by coming to Just For You Cafe. This would be the best decision you've ever made.

Big ass beignets swamped in powdered sugar, crunchy French toast bathed in sugary syrup, poached eggs sitting on top of Cajun sausages and house-made white toast, plus a cup of hot, strong coffee, what else could you ask for?

excerpts: We started off with the beignets as we had read about them.
Tons of powdered sugar and very messy but worth it.
We got our son the Mickey Mouse pancake with strawberries and he loved it.
