I got the bacon blue omelet.
I've never had blue cheese in an omelet before and it was a great combo.
My wife had the ham and swiss frittata and enjoyed it.
beignets.author: Blake B.
beignets.review:
Great little neighborhood breakfast spot which gets packed if you don't get there early.  After several tries to eat here, we decided to come right when it opened and we got in no problem.

The staff was super friendly and helpful.  We started off with the beignets as we had read about them.  Tons of powdered sugar and very messy but worth it.  We got our son the Mickey Mouse pancake with strawberries and he loved it.  I got the bacon blue omelet.  I've never had blue cheese in an omelet before and it was a great combo.  My wife had the ham and swiss frittata and enjoyed it.  Her favorite part was the biscuits.

A great spot for families if you get there early.

excerpts: You was a tiny, single counter hole in the wall that exuded warmth, great coffee, great breakfast, hot coffee, and amazing beignets.
I was heartened to see the new place, and see that the owner had expanded not only the space and continued the funky ambiance, great food, hot coffee, and yes, amazing beignets.
Always a treat.
beignets.author: Antonio T.
beignets.review:
Centuries ago I worked at Colossal Pictures, an animation house on DeHaro. As I lived in Oakland, the only way to beat the (horrific) traffic was to get out of bed at 6, hit the road by 6:30 to cross the bridge by 7:30. As the studio opened by 9, killing time was important. 

The original Just For You was a tiny, single counter hole in the wall that exuded warmth, great coffee, great breakfast, hot coffee, and amazing beignets. It was a second home for me. 

I was heartened to see the new place, and see that the owner had expanded not only the space and continued the funky ambiance, great food, hot coffee, and yes, amazing beignets. Always a treat.

excerpts: I've been coming here for years for their beignets mostly.
Just had my daughter go in and pick up an order in her pj's and she apparently didn't hear the owner Arienne Landry say excuse me twice.
The 3rd time the owner said loudly, 'Did I stutter?!'
My daughter being raised to respect her elders just apologized and let it go.
While this owner continued to heckle her in front of the customers.
I just called her myself and her response was, 'well MOST teenagers don't respond to her respectfully and THATS why she responded as so.
Then she mentioned that my daughter was in pjs and how that's tacky.
I'm asking ALL yelpers to discontinue support.
The one star is for the employee that was nice.
beignets.author: Fia S.
beignets.review: I've been coming here for years for their beignets mostly. Just had my daughter go in and pick up an order in her pj's and she apparently didn't hear the owner Arienne Landry say excuse me twice. The 3rd time the owner said loudly, 'Did I stutter?!' My daughter being raised to respect her elders just apologized and let it go. While this owner continued to heckle her in front of the customers. I just called her myself and her response was, 'well MOST teenagers don't respond to her respectfully and THATS why she responded as so. Then she mentioned that my daughter was in pjs and how that's tacky. I'm asking ALL yelpers to discontinue support. The one star is for the employee that was nice.

excerpts: I will have to return for the beignets!
beignets.author: Allie L.
beignets.review: So worth the wait if you have a chance to go here. I had the special which was a smoked salmon eggs benny. Fantastic. I will have to return for the beignets!

excerpts: Famous for their Beignets.
beignets.author: David G.
beignets.review:
I've been a customer of Just For You since the early 1890's. Maybe the 1880's, been so long it's hard to remember for sure, going back to when it was up on Potrero HIll, before it moved to Dogpatch and helped make DP the destination hood it is today.

Simply a great California style American diner. Fun decor - great concert and movie posters, and it took me (because i'm so quick) a long time to recognize the fake bear in the back of the photo with the woman stealthfully holding the enormous fish (look for it!). 

You can get huevos rancheros, which are very different from the usual but have a quality of its own, and you can ask for Hatch green chile sauce, from a town in New Mexico, which has a subtle flavor and kick, or more standard red. Lots of great dishes such as the Greg's Omelettes, Crab Cakes, Breakfast Burritos, Cowgirl, and many more. I'm not a coffee drinker but i hear people always being asked if they want light or dark roast - and i often get the Organic Carrot Apple Juice, as flavorful as it is healthy.

Very flexible on mixing and matching side dishes. Great lunch specials. Amazing homemade soups you could write home about. Intelligent, engaging, fun, smart, sophisticated, very experienced manager and staff. Famous for their Beignets. Very cooperative on to-go orders, large or small.

Owner is a real for-real chef, who after owning and operating for years, finally found that manager she can trust and even takes vacations now (well deserved). The chefs and cooks on duty are great, and they've been educated in cookery and recipes by her - and the breads, including Cornbread, are fresh-baked on location by a fresh baker baking freshly. 

And the customers are also smart and friendly. It's a great neighborhood spot but the kind where I also bring friends and family from out of town.

You can sit in the intimate and quiet area in back, in the lively and sometimes noisy front, or outside. 4-seater counter service, too. There's also a parklet with comfortable benches. Open until 3 during the week, to 5 on weekends.

Four Pro Tips for the price of one - 

(1) There are 2 bathrooms, not just one, the second is small but private and all the way in the back.

(2) "Crabbie Bennie" on weekends (Eggs Benedict with crab, very rich, but very good).

(3) Speaking of crab, try their Creole Mustard if you order crab cakes.

(4) Whole fresh loaves of bread, baked onsite by their own baker, available to take home.

excerpts: I initially chose this place for the hot Beignets and Chickory coffee.
I needed my New Orleans Cafe Du Monde fix.
beignets.author: Robert D.
beignets.review:
I am a tourist outside of my neighborhood.  This is a local joint.  After all, why would a tourist venture to a neighborhood called "Dogpatch."  Yet I never felt out of place.

Wonderful food.  I initially chose this place for the hot Beignets and Chickory coffee.  I needed my New Orleans Cafe Du Monde fix. Good call and much closer than Bourbon street.

This is a very simple restaurant with cool posters on the wall and character oozing out the door.  There is no full time hostess, just a signup list hanging on the front door--meaning they are sustained by neighborhood regulars seeking good food, not by single visit tourists.

excerpts: And the beignets are just the best
beignets.author: wing c.
beignets.review:
Friendly services! Big mean! The portions are huge to share with others! Love their juices too!
Been there few times with friends, they all happy with it. And the beignets are just the best

excerpts: We ordered the beignets, which came out pretty quickly, but we also ordered other dishes, which we had to wait around another 30 minutes for, which is kind of a bummer because I was realllly hungry.
Beignets (4/5) - Not as greasy as other beignets I've had, which was nice.
beignets.author: Cynthia M.
beignets.review:
I came here on Saturday with a group of 4 around 1:30pm. We waited for about 10 minutes, so not too bad. We ordered the beignets, which came out pretty quickly, but we also ordered other dishes, which we had to wait around another 30 minutes for, which is kind of a bummer because I was realllly hungry. Aside from the slow food, service was excellent!

Beignets (4/5) - Not as greasy as other beignets I've had, which was nice. Delicious and sugary.

Two Eggs (Fried - medium) with Creole Crab Cake (with Home Fries and Biscuit) (3.5/5) -  The crab cake wasn't my favorite (it was kind of creamy? not sure), but the home fries (crispy) and the biscuit (nice buttery inside and crumbly outside) were great. As expected, the eggs were standard.

excerpts: I had heard about this place from several people, including a couple seated next to us at the Kabuki watching "Chef" -- they told us the Beignets were the best they had ever tasted outside of the Cafe du Monde in New Orleans.
beignets.author: Lisa W.
beignets.review:
I'm a huge fan of eating breakfast out -- like a little mini vacation!  I had heard about this place from several people, including a couple seated next to us at the Kabuki watching "Chef" -- they told us the Beignets were the best they had ever tasted outside of the Cafe du Monde in New Orleans.  

We got there around 9:30 on a Sunday and waited about 20 minutes, but when we had finished the wait looked more like and hour.  What a great place!  Lots of energy, really interesting crowd, and fun art on the wall.  The service is terrific -- I always love breakfast places where just as you take your last sip of coffee, they're magically at your table to refill.  

And the food! Of course we tried a Beignet and it was unbelievable --so light, sweet, and delicious.  I had what seems like a simple thing, but I'm always amazed how few restaurants get "two eggs over medium" right -- and they did -- cooked them perfectly!  Add chicken apple sausage and home fries to that and BAM!  The husband had a breakfast frittata which he loved and grits (his favorite), which he said were cooked exactly right -- another dish many places miss by a mile.  

I love this place -- it's taking its place on our favorite breakfast places list!

excerpts: Fresh beignets, homemade bread and dishes with a Louisiana twist.
The menu includes a funny message about grits in the margin that I'd hate to ruin for you, so you'll have to find it yourself when you go there.
beignets.author: Montserrat V.
beignets.review: Fresh beignets, homemade bread and dishes with a Louisiana twist. The menu includes a funny message about grits in the margin that I'd hate to ruin for you, so you'll have to find it yourself when you go there.

excerpts: Service was spotty, food was so-so, coffee was old, and beignets were doughy.
beignets.author: Ben D.
beignets.review:
Just for me, i was disappointed.

It seems like Just for You is resting on it's laurels. Ate there today, and nothing was as good as i remembered from a eighteen months ago. Service was spotty, food was so-so, coffee was old, and beignets were doughy. 

This used to be a great neighborhood find, but i guess too many people found it.

excerpts: Don't forget to get the BEIGNETS!
beignets.author: Raphaël M.
beignets.review: This place is a neighborhood institution. The food is great and the service is always friendly. If you're ever in the Dogpatch and are looking for a meal this is a great bet and is well worth the wait if there is one. I'm personally a big fan of Nery's chicken salad sandwich, and the french toast is my breakfast go-to. Don't forget to get the BEIGNETS!

excerpts: And the beignets are delicious!
beignets.author: Albert M.
beignets.review: Cozy little neighborhood breakfast spot. Will definitely come back. They make the simple dishes taste amazing. And the beignets are delicious!

excerpts: Ordered some beignets and they blew my mind!
SO GOOD with raspberry jam!
:P their food is also super on point.
beignets.author: Danielle B.
beignets.review:
Can I give this place a million stars??? Omg, it's legit one of my favorite places to eat in SF! I think I found this place on Yelp while my boyfriend and I were looking for breakfast spots.

Parking can be a total pain in the ass, not gunna lie. Circle a few times and you'll be fine.

Anyways, as we walked up, we noticed a bunch of people outside. We realized it was busy and would have to wait. Let me just tell you, IT'S WORTH THE WAIT! I think the longest I waited was MAYBE 30 minutes? But that was on a weekend during brunch sooooo...

Ordered some beignets and they blew my mind! SO GOOD with raspberry jam! :P their food is also super on point. Very delicious.

This place is a gem and you won't be disappointed!

excerpts: We got the huevos rancheros, Cheries special, cornbread, and beignets.
Beignets were my favorite and everything else was delicious.
beignets.author: Akshaya V.
beignets.review:
This is a great place to grab a good brunch in Dogpatch. The employees are very nice and the food is well priced for the portions. We got the huevos rancheros, Cheries special, cornbread, and beignets. Beignets were my favorite and everything else was delicious. 

Try to get the outdoor seating as it's great on a beautiful day!

excerpts: Their beignets are good, I've had better but theirs isn't bad at all.
Can't wait to return next time we are in town to try their other items.
beignets.author: L N.
beignets.review:
Such a great find for us. Thanks yelpers! This place has excellent customer service and when there's a wait you know the food is good. 

We had their poached salmon eggs Benedict special with potatoes. Yummy and the portion was huge. Also tried their fried oysters which was very flavorful. Their beignets are good, I've had better but theirs isn't bad at all. Can't wait to return next time we are in town to try their other items.

excerpts: Last but not least, beignets were mediocre, a good beignet should be good without  needing any toppings, but it tasted so much more wondrous with the side of jam and maple syrup.
beignets.author: Anna S.
beignets.review:
Three stars for A-okay. Came here because it looked super packed one weekend, so decided to come back on a weekday to see what all the excitement was about, no wait then, seems like a popo's go-to bfast stop. Got the two eggs over easy, bacon slices which were not crispy but thick solid slices, chose grits with cheese--can't go wrong with grits, and whole wheat Just For Me artisanal homebaked toast. It was good, wouldnt go buy and bring a loaf home or anything though (that is an option). Also tried the chili which came with cornbread, tasty, nothing to rave about, tastier with some hot sauce. French fries were mediocre, waiter recommended that over the home fries. Took a bite of the Buttermilk Fried Chicken Sandwich which the waiter recommended over the Po-Boy Sammies, claimed the chicken sammie has an interesting/different flavor, but IMO it tasted ordinary..did come with large slices of pickle though! Last but not least, beignets were mediocre, a good beignet should be good without  needing any toppings, but it tasted so much more wondrous with the side of jam and maple syrup. 

Service was fine, comparable to typical diner service. Lots of variety on the menu, definitely something for mostly everyone. Nothing tasted bad, it all tasted alright or good.

excerpts: , you'd think something like beignets would be out of the question.
False.
We got two orders of those light, fluffy, delicious and heavenly donuts for each person to have (3 in order) their own.
I can't wait, especially for those beignets!
beignets.author: Lisa I.
beignets.review:
Stopped in for brunch after a workout with some of my gym friends over at Arena Ready on 25th and Connecticut, so we definitely came hungry and ready.  There were 6 of us, and at around 1pm, the wait wasn't too bad for a big table to hold all of us.

I don't know about you, but there are certain days where I'll work out and then right after that think to myself, "you know what? I'm going to eat my face off. yeah."  Saturday was definitely one of those days.

Being that most of us try and eat healthy (Paleo!), you'd think something like beignets would be out of the question.  False. We got two orders of those light, fluffy, delicious and heavenly donuts for each person to have (3 in order) their own.  Absolutely incredible, and almost as good as Cafe Du Monde's version in NOLA.

After those came out, everyone's dishes came out, including my eggs and chorizon scramble with a side of grits and tortillas. And then a strange phenomenon happened...the entire table went dead silent.  3 of us had the chorizon and eggs, 2 had an omelette special, and 1 had an order the oatmeal pancakes.  Even if you're not a grits fan, get the grits.  Even if you're not a huge egg fan, get the chorizo and eggs. I promise you won't be disappointed.

Service was ok, they were able to split our check by individual (which is seriously so awesome!).  A side order of bacon got forgotten until the very end, and we had to ask for more water, more butter, and hot sauce throughout breakfast.  All in all though, not a bad situation.

This was probably my first time eating at a place around here, and I honestly loved it. Given where the gym is, we'll probably be back very soon.  I can't wait, especially for those beignets!

excerpts: Beignets arrived at the table quickly, were hot and steamy, and the other 3 said they were delicious.
beignets.author: Terrie G.
beignets.review:
4 of us went for brunch and we all loved it.  I got the eggs + catfish fillet, the hub got the oatmeal pancakes, Nick got the scramble and Miriam ordered the Benedict.  Wonderfully yummy yummy all away around.  

Since I can't eat wheat, I particularly favored the wheat-free toast option.  I wanted the fluffy biscuit, or the scone, or the cornbread (all of which looked FANTASTIC), but I held myself back.  

Beignets arrived at the table quickly, were hot and steamy, and the other 3 said they were delicious.  Tasted like a donut thy said.

The wait for a table was maybe 5 minutes.  Super fast. (Saturday around noon)

excerpts: The huge beignets, definitely the highlight of the meal.
beignets.author: Vince N.
beignets.review:
Awesome place. I love these independent food places that cater to it's neighborhood.

I would rather much eat here than any other chain places.

I had the dungeness crab cake sandwich..did I spell that right? My partner in crime got the huge hamburger. I think my meal was better hands down. 

The huge beignets, definitely the highlight of the meal.

The best I've had in California so far.

Well, if I'm in the neighborhood, I would come back for another crab sammy.

The waitress was great..very sweet and funky fresh.

excerpts: But I was feeling guilty about my order of 3 beignets and a side of cornbread.
The beignets were warm and yummy.
I'd come back just to have them (which is what I did today).
The cornbread was bland and feel apart with each bite.
If you are craving beignets call in a takeout order to skip the long lines here on the weekend!
beignets.author: Tiffany L.
beignets.review:
I've had lunch here before and ordered a chicken salad, admittedly a boring choice for a place like this. But I was feeling guilty about my order of 3 beignets and a side of cornbread. 

The salad was ok. Something I could have whipped up myself at home. The beignets were warm and yummy. I'd come back just to have them (which is what I did today). The cornbread was bland and feel apart with each bite. I had to douse it in butter and maple syrup. 

If you are craving beignets call in a takeout order to skip the long lines here on the weekend!

excerpts: Their Beignets are to die for!
Whenever I go to a new breakfast place, I always judge them by their Biscuits and Gravy.
OMG!
The flavor in the gravy, and the fact that the biscuits are home made, YES!!!!
Kids are welcome!
The servers are really nice!
I couldn't ask for anything better!
beignets.author: Kim V.
beignets.review:
Best breakfast in the area! Their Beignets are to die for!
Whenever I go to a new breakfast place, I always judge them by their Biscuits and Gravy. OMG! The flavor in the gravy, and the fact that the biscuits are home made, YES!!!!
Kids are welcome! The servers are really nice! I couldn't ask for anything better!

excerpts: My friend and I both ordered 4 beignets to start with!
They were so fluffy and warm when we got them.
I was kind of expecting to have something inside but
plain was still good.
For our main dish, we both ordered the regular egg benedicts over english muffins and a side of country potatoes.
Yum!!
It was very delicious.
The waitress was super nice and checked on us few times to see how we're doing.
The only reason why I am giving it a 4 star is because parking can be somewhat hard to find but nonetheless, I'd definitely would be back here since it's close to my house!
beignets.author: Monica W.
beignets.review: How did I never notice this place?! There's so many new restaurants near 3rd street and I'm excited to try them all! Anyways, my friend and I came here on a Saturday morning. We got here around 8:50am, close to 9. The wait wasn't too long luckily..about 5 min or less? We put our names down and there was a spot opening right away. My friend and I both ordered 4 beignets to start with! They were so fluffy and warm when we got them. I was kind of expecting to have something inside but plain was still good. For our main dish, we both ordered the regular egg benedicts over english muffins and a side of country potatoes. Yum!! It was very delicious. The waitress was super nice and checked on us few times to see how we're doing. The only reason why I am giving it a 4 star is because parking can be somewhat hard to find but nonetheless, I'd definitely would be back here since it's close to my house!

excerpts: Obviously, the beignets rock.
Powdered sugar donut-like things that are like little flakes that melt in your mouth.
Hand-kneaded by God.
I'm convinced the sugar is cocaine, but I'm not sure.
As far as breakfast goes, try the corn bread, chili, and egg scramble.
Sounds odd, but it's an unreal combination with some hot sauce to boot.
beignets.author: Sam A.
beignets.review:
I don't even know where to start this review. Honestly one of the best breakfasts I've ever had. I've been to a bunch of different places across the country, and this place takes the cake out of places I can remember.

Obviously, the beignets rock. Powdered sugar donut-like things that are like little flakes that melt in your mouth. Hand-kneaded by God. I'm convinced the sugar is cocaine, but I'm not sure. As far as breakfast goes, try the corn bread, chili, and egg scramble. Sounds odd, but it's an unreal combination with some hot sauce to boot. Trust me.

If you don't like, message me and I'll pay for your bill. I back this place up 100%. Definitely a must-try if you're in SF.

excerpts: My dish was nothing all too special, but we ordered beignets which were pretty bomb.
beignets.author: Chelsea P.
beignets.review:
I came here with a friend because the place we originally wanted to go to was closed lol. We walked in and we were immediately greeted and seated right next to another party (basically sharing a table), but I didn't mind. Everyone eating there was super friendly and it basically felt like a community dining table haha. The restaurants small and filled with a bunch of cool artwork that my friend and I made conversation on while waiting for our food to come out. I ordered the cowgirl with bacon and man...those buttermilk pancakes were heavy!! My dish was nothing all too special, but we ordered beignets which were pretty bomb. I'd say I left feeling satisfied enough walking out of here

(Also if the main bathroom is occupied, the one in the back is a tiny stall with a sink located right outside of it, kinda ehhh)

excerpts: Where else can you get beignets like this in San Francisco?
beignets.author: Abby S.
beignets.review:
Worth the wait on weekends for sure! Where else can you get beignets like this in San Francisco? So good!

Extra love for the mimosa pints, it's almost as good as the bottomless variety. The huge glass doesn't require a constant refill this way.

Eggs Benedict is perfect, just don't do a split plate unless you want a breakfast snack vs. a breakfast meal all to yourself. Won't make that mistake again :)

My only slight criticism is the grits, they are not something I would recommend. They were gummy and bland. Not creamy, buttery or rich like I've had elsewhere. Home fries are a much more detectible option.

Other than that, Just For You hits the spot on just about anyone's brunch palate.

excerpts: We had the beignets first!
3 for $5.45 --- we kinda underestimated it, because we thought it'll come small--
but their beignet size is quite big!
No regrets though
beignets.author: Emil J.
beignets.review:
I came here today for brunch and truly enjoyed it! The wait was not too bad- we only waited for maybe 5-7 mins. 

We had the beignets first! :) 3 for $5.45 --- we kinda underestimated it, because we thought it'll come small-- but their beignet size is quite big! No regrets though :) 

We enjoyed our food here --- look at the pictures! :) I would definitely come back!

excerpts: Also the beignets are a must have!
beignets.author: Courtney C.
beignets.review: The fried chicken sandwich is my go to! On white bread with extra well done fries and ranch. Love the service here- very friendly staff. Also the beignets are a must have!

excerpts: The beignets are delicious!!
They are huge and if you intend on eating after them then don't eat a lot!
beignets.author: Laura F.
beignets.review:
This little cafe was the bees neez!! The beignets are delicious!! They are huge and if you intend on eating after them then don't eat a lot! Lol 

This cafe is quaint, very friendly staff and a hip, trendy total SF vibe... Loved it!

excerpts: My friend recommended this place for beignets, so I decided to try it.
I ordered the beignets to-go, but also ended up with the greek scramble (without olives) with home fries & wheat toast.
The beignets were the best I've had in SF to date!
They taste great & the texture was what I remembered having in New Orleans.
I had to get got extra powdered sugar though cuz 1 of the 3 was sugared only on a corner.
And that same sad beignet with minimal sugar was simply a pillow.
A deliciously deceiving exterior with one huge air pocket interior.
& unfortunately I got full from the beignets and didn't get to try the home made wheat bread.
But it did look & smell great.
I'm going back for beignets, especially since its close to the house in a lighter traffic area.
May have to be seated & try a different breakfast next time.
beignets.author: M P.
beignets.review:
My friend recommended this place for beignets, so I decided to try it. I ordered the beignets to-go, but also ended up with the greek scramble (without olives) with home fries & wheat toast. 

The beignets were the best I've had in SF to date! They taste great & the texture was what I remembered having in New Orleans. I had to get got extra powdered sugar though cuz 1 of the 3 was sugared only on a corner. And that same sad beignet with minimal sugar was simply a pillow. A deliciously deceiving exterior with one huge air pocket interior.  :(  

The scramble was ok. It had olives which I asked them to omit. The taste was good, texture wasn't to my liking. For some reason I expected diced veggies, and crumbled feta, but there were large slices of onion & huge chunks of tomato & feta, scrambled with egg that I could barely tell was there. My 2 yr old nephew could have done that. 

The potatoes were off on taste & texture, (try the potatoes at Plow!) & unfortunately I got full from the beignets and didn't get to try the home made wheat bread. But it did look & smell great. Maybe their specialty is in the breads???

I'm going back for beignets, especially since its close to the house in a lighter traffic area. May have to be seated & try a different breakfast next time.

excerpts: Cute little cafe in Dogpatch that's known for their beignets..and oh my, I was NOT disappointed at all!!
It was light and delicious.
I would recommend putting the maple syrup on the side and dip the beignets in instead of pouring it on to keep it from getting soggy.
beignets.author: Sarah J.
beignets.review:
Cute little cafe in Dogpatch that's known for their beignets..and oh my, I was NOT disappointed at all!! It was light and delicious. I would recommend putting the maple syrup on the side and dip the beignets in instead of pouring it on to keep it from getting soggy.

About 10 minutes from SFO airport so we went there right after we landed this weekend and even though it was raining, that didn't stop us. There was no wait when we went so we got seated super fast.

Great food.
Friendly service.
Nice ambiance.
Street parking.

excerpts: Powdered puff of dough - BEIGNETS.
beignets.author: Hiromi N.
beignets.review:
My assessment: Brekkie on steroids.

Powdered puff of dough - BEIGNETS.

Eggs, eggs, eggs and some more eggs.

Frittata with a lotta ANDOUILLE SAUSAGE.

Hand me the SRIRACHA please.

Southern fixins with a hunka hunka slab of cornbread.

Cheezzzzy GRITS (nommers)

COFFEE - IV DRIP.

Plenty o'parking in the Dog-patch.

BTW did you know that Dog-patch = many dogs and outdoor seating?

SCORE!  Less than 10 minutes of waiting in line at 10AM.  WIN BIG!

excerpts: The beignets were $1.80 something a piece or 3 for $5.
They were served pretty quickly and were just served warm.
They were huge and  not so dense.
He thought he detected a little bit of liquor in the batter.
I like Brenda's French Soulfood's crawfish and apple beignets more
but JFY's plain beignets are less filling due to the lightness.
Their plain (only flavor) is also more enjoyable than Brenda's.
His egg was cooked well as the yolk oozed out.
The crabcake was a creole crabcake which had a nice little kick to it.
The hollandaise sauce was an after note and the potatoes lacked flavor as well.
I felt that there wasn't too much crab in his dish either (lot of filler in the crabcake0.
He felt that it's hard comparing it to Zazie because their bennies are so good.
I was a little taken back when I saw my frittata because I thought that frittatas are supposed to be pretty fluffy
(it's been awhile since I had one).
It was chocked full of salami, bell peppers, tomatoes and Swiss tho.
Potatoes were the same with mine though the hot sauce did help.
I love how they give you a choice of about 5 different brands.
Mine also came with my choice of toast
so I chose cinnamon raisin, gotta love that option.
Though I noticed a little bit of green on one of my pieces of toast.
I believe this was some avocado from the flat top.
I'm not allergic but
could you imagine if someone was & they didn't properly clean their flattop or something?
Both of our dishes were $12.95.
Even tho his had crab in it, was it worth it,
no?
I think we would have had a more satisfying brunch at Hard Knox for cheaper.
Hard Knox does over bacon and eggs for brunch but JFY does have an edge with being the only traditional breakfast place in the area.
Sad to say, I think the beignets were the highlight.
Our meal wasn't bad but it was nothing special.
There are other better options out there.
Our average meal here totally makes me miss Nini's in San Mateo!
Three at best.
beignets.author: Cat C.
beignets.review:
I've had Just For You on my radar for a little while.  Luckily for us we decided to go to Rickshaw Bagworks down the block spur of the moment Sunday afternoon.  I was getting kinda hungry but we didn't want Piccino again and we weren't in the mood for Hard Knox.  So we decided on Just For You and got to the cafe around 1:30.  Surprisingly there was no wait.

The lady taking our order didn't seem too chatty or suggestive, I think she's the cashier or something.  Our waitress checked in on us occasionally, but she like everyone else except for the attentive and friendly bus boy seemed reserved.  He ended up getting the crabby bennie and I got the special salami frittata.  We also chose to get a beignet each for us to start with.   

The beignets were $1.80 something a piece or 3 for $5.  They were served pretty quickly and were just served warm.  They were huge and  not so dense.  He thought he detected a little bit of liquor in the batter.  I like Brenda's French Soulfood's crawfish and apple beignets more but JFY's plain beignets are less filling due to the lightness.  Their plain (only flavor) is also more enjoyable than Brenda's.  His egg was cooked well as the yolk oozed out. The crabcake was a creole crabcake which had a nice little kick to it.  The hollandaise sauce was an after note and the potatoes lacked flavor as well.  I felt that there wasn't too much crab in his dish either (lot of filler in the crabcake0.  He felt that it's hard comparing it to Zazie because their bennies are so good.  I was a little taken back when I saw my frittata because I thought that frittatas are supposed to be pretty fluffy (it's been awhile since I had one).  It was chocked full of salami, bell peppers, tomatoes and Swiss tho.  Potatoes were the same with mine though the hot sauce did help.  I love how they give you a choice of about 5 different brands.  Mine also came with my choice of toast so I chose cinnamon raisin, gotta love that option.  Though I noticed a little bit of green on one of my pieces of toast.  I believe this was some avocado from the flat top.  I'm not allergic but could you imagine if someone was & they didn't properly clean their flattop or something?  Both of our dishes were $12.95.  Even tho his had crab in it, was it worth it, no?  I think we would have had a more satisfying brunch at Hard Knox for cheaper.  Hard Knox does over bacon and eggs for brunch but JFY does have an edge with being the only traditional breakfast place in the area.  Sad to say, I think the beignets were the highlight.  Our meal wasn't bad but it was nothing special.  There are other better options out there.  Our average meal here totally makes me miss Nini's in San Mateo!  Three at best.

excerpts: Get the beignets!!
You will be eating soft, powdered sugar pillows of goodness.
Everytime
I come here with the boy, it's our main objective brunch + an order or beignets!!
beignets.author: Stella J.
beignets.review:
Get the beignets!! You will be eating soft, powdered sugar pillows of goodness. Everytime I come here with the boy, it's our main objective brunch + an order or beignets!!

Brunch I can't complain about. But then again i tried the frittata and loved it. It has a good amount of cheese, eggs and veggies. And it's cooked to perfection. 

The boy always opts for the scramble or Benedict and he always seems to love his meals. its always perfectly cooked. The amount of food they give you is humongous. We can never finish our meals. 

Definitely coming back here again!

excerpts: Their beignets (covered in powdered sugar, fluffy and fresh) are what they're known and for good reason, too so do not miss out on those!
beignets.author: Esther A.
beignets.review:
Nothing fancy or innovative here. Just good, solid breakfast. A bit of a wait though as the cafe is small-ish. But like others have mentioned just head on over, grab some coffee across the street and relax until your party gets called. 

Their beignets (covered in powdered sugar, fluffy and fresh) are what they're known and for good reason, too so do not miss out on those!

Friendly servers to boot. No complaints here!

excerpts: : We had beignets,  churrizo burrito and the cowgirl brrakfast.
Beignets were so delish.
Fresh,  light and airy.
Pancakes were fluffy and perfectly cooked!
I had a bite of my hubby's burrito, it has a spicy kick (yum) and was so flavorful.
I had the Sunset mimosa,  ,(cranberry and fresh squeezed oj) very refreshing &came in a large glass
FYI absolutely so phone reception in the back part of the restaurant (not sure about the front)
beignets.author: Denise L.
beignets.review:
Hubby and I went Friday late morning,  no wait. :) in short- Great service(!) and yummy food. 

Details: We had beignets,  churrizo burrito and the cowgirl brrakfast. Beignets were so delish. Fresh,  light and airy. Pancakes were fluffy and perfectly cooked! I had a bite of my hubby's burrito, it has a spicy kick (yum) and was so flavorful. I had the Sunset mimosa,  ,(cranberry and fresh squeezed oj) very refreshing &came in a large glass :) FYI absolutely so phone reception in the back part of the restaurant (not sure about the front)

excerpts: Also got the beignets.
I LOVE THEIR BEIGNETS HERE.
I have tried beignets only one other time, and these beignets blew them out of the water.
Obviously I don't have much to compare to
but they were soo good...
beignets.author: Sandy Y.
beignets.review:
I absolutely loved this place! I have checked out a few other brunch places in SF and this is definitely one of my favorites! 

I ordered the crab bennie... if you love crab cakes and egg benedicts, definitely try out this one! it was so delicious! You can also customize what you want on the bottom of the benedict! It doesn't have to be the typical english muffin if you so prefer. The dish also comes with these soft potatoes that taste delicious alongside the benedict. The yolk of the benedicts oozed out as I cut through the benedict. Usually I like my yolk more solid (not pastel yellow but jewel-y yellow), but I still really enjoyed my dish! I usually have never finishes both egg benedicts.. but this was the first time I did. IT WAS THAT GOOOOD. or maybe they were smaller portions? NOPE, definitely the former because I was so full afterwards haha. Also got the beignets. I LOVE THEIR BEIGNETS HERE. I have tried beignets only one other time, and these beignets blew them out of the water. Obviously I don't have much to compare to but they were soo good... Each beignet is a square shape, large, fresh, warm, fluffy.. and topped with an ample amount of powdered sugar! 

The service here was really good as well! My server took her time to answer any questions I had about the dishes and was very helpful.

excerpts: Beignets too!
Wait is a bit of a grip on weekends but worth it.
beignets.author: Rex L.
beignets.review: Probably the best Huevos rancheros (with Hatch green chili sauce) in SF. Beignets too! Wait is a bit of a grip on weekends but worth it.

excerpts: Excellent beignets!!!!
crunchy and buttery around the periphery, light, airy, and yet still this wonderful chew quality on the inside... done right.

Dipped in 100% Vermont maple syrup from the countertop squeeze bottles, I learned how not to snort the powdered sugar by skimming with a tine all of it off, and then re-dipping little pedacitos of the beignet after wetting with the syrup....
Nice, super friendly Guatemalteco who helped serve and seat me actually gave me a little card coupon for free beignets next time I'm in (definitely going to take my family).
beignets.author: Jana C.
beignets.review:
Excellent beignets!!!! crunchy and buttery around the periphery, light, airy, and yet still this wonderful chew quality on the inside... done right. Dipped in 100% Vermont maple syrup from the countertop squeeze bottles, I learned how not to snort the powdered sugar by skimming with a tine all of it off, and then re-dipping little pedacitos of the beignet after wetting with the syrup....($1.65 ea. or purchase a plate of them)

That was how it went down the hatch, folks... 

SPLENDIDLY. Nice, super friendly Guatemalteco who helped serve and seat me actually gave me a little card coupon for free beignets next time I'm in (definitely going to take my family).

My $10 pork chops and over-medium eggs for lunch came accompanied with super duper on-steroid biscuits!!! (had to try and bag 'em, cuz had to save some room for that PeeWee Herman-sized Nawlin's nosh!!!!

What a ridiculously cozy place... down-home and lovely. Sat at the bar where I could watch the action from the non-stop working cook who turned all of the orders into ash, he was moving like lightning. So consistent, and yet so fast too, swigging Cokes in between orders.

Love it here.... what a great little place for lunch.

PS Lots of love put into their homemade breads for sale, including an ever-so-popular cinn raisin I spotted. One can see all of the loaves baking near the cutesie historic restroom! Loaves run about $5-6.

excerpts: Their beignets are a nice little addition any meal.
beignets.author: Jessica H.
beignets.review:
I really liked this place.  The first time we went, my husband and I decided we finally had to try it and waited for about an hour.  Now days, the weekend wait has definitely lengthened.  The wait outside can be awkward so we usually walk around the cool neighborhood and discuss how insane prices have become.  Our first time was really memorable.  We were seated at a communal table next to two hipsters couples discussing how they "have really gotten into scotch" and how "it is such an expensive hobby".  I miss those days.  Now, the tables are filled with techies and every conversation sounds like a job interview or pitch for a kickstarted.  

The oyster omelet is really good, but you might not want to try it when you are recovering from a serious hang over.  First time, my lesson was LEARNED.  It was still good though.  Their beignets are a nice little addition any meal.

excerpts: I love the beignets here.
They also have great breakfast.
When I was pregnant, I loved the French toast here
and I was full after with plenty left over.
This place is great.
But You can't being the whole family.
I suggest no more than 4 and you may have to wait.
But it's worth it.
Great food!
beignets.author: Helani H.
beignets.review: I love the beignets here. They also have great breakfast. When I was pregnant, I loved the French toast here and I was full after with plenty left over. This place is great. But You can't being the whole family. I suggest no more than 4 and you may have to wait. But it's worth it. Great food!

excerpts: We started off with the beignets that I read about review after review.
They were pretty good...soft, fluffy, fresh...covered with powdered sugar.
beignets.author: Jen W.
beignets.review:
Cute little cafe out in the growing area known as the dog patch...be prepared to wait as the list tends to get long.  The servers work quickly to get you in and out...we waited around 30 mins for a party of 3.  

Parking is great...street parking everywhere!  I love how they had a coffee pot out front for those of us shivering in the rain...but no cups!  I saw peeps just going inside and asking for some...good business gesture.  

We started off with the beignets that I read about review after review.  They were pretty good...soft, fluffy, fresh...covered with powdered sugar.  No complaints there!  

Our breakfast entrees weren't so special.  I ordered the red flannel hash...corned beef hash with beets, eggs, and your choice of bakery item.  They were out of scones and biscuits...so I chose cornbread.  Nothing was really super memorable...except the cornbread...which I'm still craving.  Yum!  

Wifey ordered the hang town fry...there were a few good sized oysters...but it was pretty mushy.  The cornbread was the highlight again...but sadly, the grits weren't so fantastic.  

BFF ordered turkey sausage patties with eggs and cornbread...she actually texted me today saying she wants the freakin cornbread again.  Haha.  Other than that? Hmm...meh.  

I get the hype...new neighborhood, homemade cooking...fast service...is it the best breakfast in the city?  Probably not.  But decent enough that I might possibly return again...as long as the wait is bearable.  

3 stars...solid.

excerpts: I would've ordered their infamous beignets if I were with friends.
Coffee comes with free refills but is only mediocre (thus minus 1 star)
BUT my hangtown fry was awesome.
beignets.author: Jackie C.
beignets.review:
Alright, I'll admit. I did in fact bus all the way from Outer Richmond to Dogpatch just so my Hangtown fry (scrambled eggs with bacon, onions, and FRIED OYSTERS) craving can be satisfied, after watching Bobby Flay make some on TV the day before. I couldn't believe I really did it but I'm glad Just For You Cafe didn't disappoint.

I waited for about 5-10mins because I was by myself, but expect to wait at least 20-30mins on weekends if your party is 2+. This place was buzzing with people when I arrived. The menu was quite extensive - pretty much whatever you want for breakfast. I would've ordered their infamous beignets if I were with friends. Coffee comes with free refills but is only mediocre (thus minus 1 star) BUT my hangtown fry was awesome. They let you choose whether you want your fried oysters on top of your eggs or folded in.

Perhaps what will make it 5-star for me would be: better bread, a little more flavor in my eggs and maybe let it be a tad undercooked (oysters were perfect), perhaps a bit of sweetness to the bacon, and of course better coffee. Coffee definitely needs to be improved.

Service was great.

excerpts: A server tended to us immediately after we were seated, so we ordered 3 beignets (3 for $4.75) to start and our beverages.
OMG, these New Orleans style beignets were soooooo good!
This place is famous for them!
Generously sprinkled with powdered sugar, hot, fluffy, airy, and so soft!
Loved the taste and the texture!!
Delicious food, filling, good portion sizes, extensive & cool menu, very friendly & professional servers, & of course, the BEST tasting beignets I've ever had!
beignets.author: Juliet Rachel C.
beignets.review:
Was in SF for a weekend and my friend recommended this place for brunch! A group of hungry patrons had already congregated outside upon our arrival and the wait for us would be 45 minutes. It was better than the 2 hour wait for Plow's up the street, though!

Time flew and our name was called. A server tended to us immediately after we were seated, so we ordered 3 beignets (3 for $4.75) to start and our beverages. OMG, these New Orleans style beignets were soooooo good! This place is famous for them! Generously sprinkled with powdered sugar, hot, fluffy, airy, and so soft! Loved the taste and the texture!! Great way to start our meal.

I ordered the Greg's Scramble ($9.95): 3 eggs scrambled with spinach, onions, garlic, and topped with parmesan cheese. You get a choice of mix ins, and I decided on mushrooms and zucchini! I asked for slices of avocado too, which cost an extra $2.50. My order came with grits & two slices of dry toast. Everything was great...no complaints at all!!

Delicious food, filling, good portion sizes, extensive & cool menu, very friendly & professional servers, & of course, the BEST tasting beignets I've ever had!

excerpts: Like most people, I think, I came to try their beignets.
We took them to for dessert after our picnic of sandwiches.
However, I couldn't resist and took a bite as soon as we got in the car.
They're huge!
beignets.author: Rose A.
beignets.review:
Like most people, I think, I came to try their beignets.  We took them to for dessert after our picnic of sandwiches.  However, I couldn't resist and took a bite as soon as we got in the car.  They're huge!  And pretty yummy!

The food smelled so good when we walked in to order that my husband wants to go back.  Can't wait to try their other stuff.

excerpts: We were offered free beignets to agree to sit outside, as the inside was packed, and it wasn't a very warm day.
The beignets were huge and delicious, and sitting in the sun warmed us up.
We got eggs benedict and biscuits and gravy.
Both dishes were very tasty, although the biscuits and gravy were a little too heavy for my boyfriend, so he got up to take a quick walk.
:P
beignets.author: Alysha V.
beignets.review: Very friendly staff, and a cute little outdoor waiting area. We were offered free beignets to agree to sit outside, as the inside was packed, and it wasn't a very warm day. The beignets were huge and delicious, and sitting in the sun warmed us up. We got eggs benedict and biscuits and gravy. Both dishes were very tasty, although the biscuits and gravy were a little too heavy for my boyfriend, so he got up to take a quick walk. :P

excerpts: And maybe, just maybe, I'll go BIG and get some of their famous beignets.
Nom nom nom.
beignets.author: Wendy N.
beignets.review:
I've recently discovered the Dogpatch area and so far have loved all the places I've been. My good friend lives in nearby Potrero Hill so we rolled out of bed on Sunday morning after late night Halloween partying and headed to the popular Just for You cafe. There were around 10 parties on the list before us but it took only 20 minutes to get seated. In the meantime, they kindly served up hot coffee in paper cups. There is a new "parklet" area to sit in outside... super cute. 

Everything on the menu sounded good but I opted for the Greg's Scramble (eggs and spinach and Parmesan cheese) with bacon - extremely yummy - with grits on the side. The grits were served plain (and as such were pretty bland) but they tasted fine to me. Also, the service was fabulous!

I definitely will be back to try other items on the menu such as the Hangtown Fry (Oysters, Bacon, Onions with eggs) and grapefruit mimosas served in pint jars. And maybe, just maybe, I'll go BIG and get some of their famous beignets. Nom nom nom.

excerpts: I didn't get a chance to try the beignets but heard they were awesome!
beignets.author: Teresa C.
beignets.review: Was in the Potrero/Dogpatch area for work and stopped by Just For You Cafe for lunch with a coworker! The staff was incredibly friendly and definitely made for a wonderful dining experience. I had the buttermilk fried chicken sandwich (pictured) and my coworker had the crab poboy. Both were excellent! I didn't get a chance to try the beignets but heard they were awesome!

excerpts: 4) Beignets.
beignets.author: Stephanie T.
beignets.review:
Five reasons to love Just For You (and to go out of your way to Dogpatch for it):

1) Grapefruit mimosa. I think this is my favorite mimosa, period. It uses fresh squeezed juice (ie there is still a stray seed or two at the bottom), the proportions are spot on, and it's freaking delicious. At $9 a glass it's not cheap but you do get a pint!

2) Huevos rancheros. It's not a Mexican restaurant but I think their "meat sauce" huevos are the best I've had in SF. 

3) House-made bread. Also includes gluten-free, very fresh, very delicious.

4) Beignets. Lots of people write about these, so I'll skip the description and say they will serve them to you while you wait!!!

5) Relatively short wait. It's tiny and popular but this restaurant is aggressive about keeping people moving  and while that is annoying for the brunch lingerers out there, it's great if you love great brunch and would rather eat quickly than wait forever.

excerpts: Ordered Beignets and the veggie frittata.
I would return for their Beignets.
beignets.author: Janet T.
beignets.review:
We came here early today when they opened,  to avoid the lines.

Ordered Beignets and the veggie frittata. Delish!

I, however, did not care for their coffee (and I'm a huge coffee lover). Our waitress wasn't very forthcoming when I asked what type of coffee they serve. Oh well....

I would return for their Beignets.

excerpts: The CEO highly recommended this place and its beignets and a quick Yelp preview confirmed this is usually the case.
So I walked in for a late lunch and got a bowl of clam chowder and a beignet.
The clam chowder came red, and I thought perhaps they had made a mistake and given me minestrone or tomato soup instead.
I didn't say anything though and proceeded to slurp away.
It really was clam chowder!
And it was absolutely delicious!
I like it better than traditional creamy clam chowder served on the coastline.
These beignets are huge, one was definitely enough for me as a dessert, which makes sense given they are over a buck each.
Like Jana S., I use my fork to push all of the powdered sugar onto the plate, then start eating a section at a time, folding the powdered sugar into each bite.
By the end I had actually consumed all of that powdered sugar...possibly not the best idea in the world but soooo good. =
P
beignets.author: Esther Y.
beignets.review:
Dropped in after a visit to Rickshaw Bagworks just down the block. The CEO highly recommended this place and its beignets and a quick Yelp preview confirmed this is usually the case. So I walked in for a late lunch and got a bowl of clam chowder and a beignet. The clam chowder came red, and I thought perhaps they had made a mistake and given me minestrone or tomato soup instead. I didn't say anything though and proceeded to slurp away. It really was clam chowder! And it was absolutely delicious! I like it better than traditional creamy clam chowder served on the coastline. Hearted.

As for the beignet, I think there are enough reviews about that, and I agree with the positive ones. These beignets are huge, one was definitely enough for me as a dessert, which makes sense given they are over a buck each. Like Jana S., I use my fork to push all of the powdered sugar onto the plate, then start eating a section at a time, folding the powdered sugar into each bite. By the end I had actually consumed all of that powdered sugar...possibly not the best idea in the world but soooo good. =P

excerpts: I was in the mood for some New Orleans style beignets and this place did not disappoint.
The staff is incredibly efficient and so friendly!
A man named Netti greeted us and made our entire breakfast experience perfect!
He gave us 3 free beignets right when we sat down.
We will definitely be returning soon.
beignets.author: Mary Claire D.
beignets.review: My husband and I absolutely love brunch. Especially in the city. Just for you cafe absolutely takes the cake! I was in the mood for some New Orleans style beignets and this place did not disappoint. The staff is incredibly efficient and so friendly! A man named Netti greeted us and made our entire breakfast experience perfect! He gave us 3 free beignets right when we sat down. We will definitely be returning soon.

excerpts: When R&B singer, songwriter Ne-Yo penned these words, I think he was either talking about the Beignets or the Hangtown Fry at
beignets.author: Michael L.
beignets.review:
It's all because of YOU."


When R&B singer, songwriter Ne-Yo penned these words, I think he was either talking about the Beignets or the Hangtown Fry at Just For You Cafe.

I believe where ever I am, it's important to try all the indigenous foods of the area.  But one indigenous dish I have never tried despite being born and raised in San Francisco is the Hangtown fry.  Here's my brunch:


Beignet:  comes out hot as Irina Shayk on the cover of Sports Illustrated.  Fresh, doughy, sweeten by the powdered sugar.  I got powdered sugar all on my hand.  And I don't care what you guys think, I licked it off!

Hangtown Fry:  What a enduring combination.. Like Cream Cheese and Lox on my bagel or Jada and Will Smith.  I can't help but love these combinations together.  Oysters, Bacon, Onions all mixed in with eggs.  The legend is that the Hangtown Fry was originated in Placerville and became popular here in the City.  Nothing less than genius.  

Gravy & Biscuits:  As Ernie McCraken said in the movie Kingpin:  "You're on a gravy train with biscuit wheels!'

Because of this Cafe I found a favorite dish in the Hangtown Fry.  Just For You Cafe,   I know it was "Just For Me".  But... "It's all because of YOU".

excerpts: I ordered a plate of 3 beignets ($5):
I've had beignets at maybe 10 restaurants, including Cafe du Monde in New Orleans, and these are the best by far, for 3 reasons:
1) they are super light and airy.
It's 90% air inside.
They are not dense/leaden.
2) super flavorful.
It's almost a glazed donut flavor.
3) great texture.
beignets.author: Scott F.
beignets.review:
I ordered a plate of 3 beignets ($5): http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/just-for-you-cafe-san-francisco?select=Snb667neu1i4hKMh4T_z0g#Snb667neu1i4hKMh4T_z0g

They are phenomenally good.  Worth a trip just for these.  I've had beignets at maybe 10 restaurants, including Cafe du Monde in New Orleans, and these are the best by far, for 3 reasons: 1) they are super light and airy.  It's 90% air inside.  They are not dense/leaden.  2) super flavorful.  It's almost a glazed donut flavor.  3) great texture.  It's a little bit like a popover in terms of perfect level of chewiness.

The cafe is New Orleans themed, and they have great chicory coffee.

excerpts: At one point in my life I was on a hunt for good beignets and out of all the places I've been to in the Bay Area, JFYC is hands down the best!
They serve them hot, pillowy, bathed in powdered sugar
and it's so good and surprisingly not too sweet.
Wait staff is inconsistent.
They were great the first few times we came and other times were really slow.
The place is small with funny little signs.
They have a bar area for single (party of 1) person dining in.
Expect the wait to be long but the beignets is worth it.
If you have a stroller leave it outside or in the car.
beignets.author: Ardielyn F.
beignets.review: Food here is good with a variety of good breakfast/brunch options and plus an awesome beignet makes this place a whole lot better. At one point in my life I was on a hunt for good beignets and out of all the places I've been to in the Bay Area, JFYC is hands down the best! They serve them hot, pillowy, bathed in powdered sugar and it's so good and surprisingly not too sweet. Wait staff is inconsistent. They were great the first few times we came and other times were really slow. The place is small with funny little signs. They have a bar area for single (party of 1) person dining in. Expect the wait to be long but the beignets is worth it. If you have a stroller leave it outside or in the car.

excerpts: 5 stars for their beignets, 3 stars for the rest of their breakfast food.
I've previously raved about the beignets
so I'll use this review to describe the rest of their breakfast items.
I ordered scrambled eggs and they were neither creamy nor fluffy.
It seems they were going for creamy but slightly overcooked the eggs so they were starting to go dry.
My grits were dry, clumpy, mushy with no grit texture, and underseasoned.
I was underwhelmed.
The biscuit was huge!
But it was halfway between a biscuit and a dinner roll.
I like my biscuits flakey or crumbly, and these biscuits, although impressively tall, were neither.
I think their recipe needs more butter.
But I'm personally just going to stick with their amazing beignets....
beignets.author: Beatrice W.
beignets.review:
5 stars for their beignets, 3 stars for the rest of their breakfast food.

I've previously raved about the beignets so I'll use this review to describe the rest of their breakfast items.  I ordered scrambled eggs and they were neither creamy nor fluffy.  It seems they were going for creamy but slightly overcooked the eggs so they were starting to go dry.  My grits were dry, clumpy, mushy with no grit texture, and underseasoned.  I was underwhelmed.  The biscuit was huge!  But it was halfway between a biscuit and a dinner roll.  I like my biscuits flakey or crumbly, and these biscuits, although impressively tall, were neither.  I think their recipe needs more butter. ;)

All that said, the service is great and Just For You is definitely a happening spot to get your brunch on.  But I'm personally just going to stick with their amazing beignets....

excerpts: Anyways, beignets were almost brunt & served to us.
There was nothing special about it...
a donut would've sufficed.
It was big and no flavor.
The breakfast options left me less in desire.
Upon my wait, I had to decided what to get and surely it was a tough decision.
Not because everything was good but because my ass is indecisive on this.
Dear god, don't get buttermilk pancakes
(they look delicious upon service but once you put it in your mouth it goes all downhill) way too much salt.
All the maple syrup in the jar ain't gonna help.
Needless to say, I did not enjoy my brunch.
Nothing soon out and those sausages were kinda salty.
beignets.author: Ann L.
beignets.review: It was just NOT for me cafe.... while our attempt at another brunch failed due to long wait times... we called to see if this had a long wait. 30 mins, sure that's wait-able. They offer free coffee but it was a roast that I did not like. I do like ritual coffee's latte but not this. Anyways, beignets were almost brunt & served to us. There was nothing special about it... a donut would've sufficed. It was big and no flavor. The breakfast options left me less in desire. Upon my wait, I had to decided what to get and surely it was a tough decision. Not because everything was good but because my ass is indecisive on this. Dear god, don't get buttermilk pancakes (they look delicious upon service but once you put it in your mouth it goes all downhill) way too much salt. All the maple syrup in the jar ain't gonna help. Needless to say, I did not enjoy my brunch. Nothing soon out and those sausages were kinda salty.

excerpts:
But while their beignets were quite tasty and affordable (albeit a tad heavy, so order sparingly), their entrees (I got the corned beef hash, while my friend got a scramble) were average at best, and overly salty at worst.

So, while I don't necessarily see myself coming back for brunch often, I definitely see myself coming back for the beignets!
beignets.author: Johnny W.
beignets.review:
I have a certain place in my heart for Southern food (if you knew how often I went to Hard Knox, well...), so needless to say, I was pretty excited to find out there was another place in Dogpatch that served up Southern food, and with a brunch menu to boot [ Photo: http://instagram.com/p/YYgrINQfr6/ ]!

But while their beignets were quite tasty and affordable (albeit a tad heavy, so order sparingly), their entrees (I got the corned beef hash, while my friend got a scramble) were average at best, and overly salty at worst.

So, while I don't necessarily see myself coming back for brunch often, I definitely see myself coming back for the beignets!

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - A cozy little restaurant, but with seating spaced out well enough that accessibility shouldn't be a huge problem for people.

Bathroom - Didn't check them out, so I can't comment.

excerpts: i chose the version with chicken apple sausage), and we shared an order of beignets.
the beignets were delish!
soft, fluffy, and coated in so much powdered sugar that any attempt to eat it cleanly resulted in a powdered sugar snowfall around the table.
greg's scramble was delicious as well, and I chose home fries and a huge hunk of cornbread as my sides.
beignets.author: Caitlin C.
beignets.review:
my three friends and i came here on new year's day, hungover and craving some damn good brunchage. for a party of four, we ended up waiting about 45 minutes. luckily, it was sunny outside and there are a few benches for waiting people to loiter around and sit on. note to the waiting people - do not sit on the stoop directly adjacent to the café, because you will get severely reprimanded by the tenants who live there, as i definitely did. it was a great start to my 2015! the workers are friendly and will serve you coffee as you're waiting. parking was relatively easy and not too much of a struggle.

i ordered the greg's scramble ($12, 3 eggs scrambled with spinach, onions, garlic, topped with parmesan cheese. i chose the version with chicken apple sausage), and we shared an order of beignets. the beignets were delish! soft, fluffy, and coated in so much powdered sugar that any attempt to eat it cleanly resulted in a powdered sugar snowfall around the table. greg's scramble was delicious as well, and I chose home fries and a huge hunk of cornbread as my sides. i couldn't finish the whole thing and ended up taking the rest to go, but it was so delicious that i ate it for dinner as well and still craved more!

it was a fun experience! i will for sure be coming back, with the same appetite and without the annoying hangover!

excerpts:
Pros:
- beignets were SO
FLUFFY omg

so good
- chili scramble = corn bread + soft eggs smothered in meaty chili
beignets.author: Jiann M.
beignets.review:
Pros:
- beignets were SO FLUFFY omg so good
- chili scramble = corn bread + soft eggs smothered in meaty chili THIS IS THE BEST
- mmm potatoes (not crispy, but soft and still delicious)
- quick weekday service

Cons:
- the backroom dining room is dimly lit and feels dirty
- difficult to find parking

Bottom line: delicious non-greasy diner style brunch. I can't stop thinking about the chili scramble and how soft those eggs were. I can't wait to return and show this place to everyone I know.

excerpts:
Just For You Café's freshly fried beignets are made "just for me". 

But the beignets are definitely to die for. 

Beignets: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/N6z0so39b9fzGi8UWzI1Ww?select=zUw1Dqb9hVasRjplfiD66A

I have been to New Orleans and have eaten the fresh beignets from the Bayou's finer café's/restaurants.
beignets.author: Matt G.
beignets.review:
Just For You Café's freshly fried beignets are made "just for me". 

Yes, just for Matt G!

Not for any of you!!

I've been to this café in the Dogpatch area a few times. And all the café's dishes are really good. But the beignets are definitely to die for. 

For $4.25, I get three fried puff pastries with powdered sugar topping. Maple syrup is also available and adds a bit of sweetness to the pastries.  

Beignets: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/N6z0so39b9fzGi8UWzI1Ww?select=zUw1Dqb9hVasRjplfiD66A

The owner is from the state of Louisiana and decided to bring the Creole fried pastry and many recipes to San Francisco. I have been to New Orleans and have eaten the fresh beignets from the Bayou's finer café's/restaurants. But I find this café's version is just as good as any New "YAR-LIN'S" café's.

I came on a weekday and it's not crowded at all. 

Weekends are definitely busy. 

Yelp-sticker posted on the window and definitely one of the hottest businesses!

My bill: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/N6z0so39b9fzGi8UWzI1Ww?select=p5gjwcISe7Hv-GpEjzyFRw

excerpts: You definitely have to come here to get the Beignets!!!
They are pretty large in size and well worth it!
Warm, Fluffy, and sweet!
beignets.author: Michelle H.
beignets.review:
You definitely have to come here to get the Beignets!!! They are pretty large in size and well worth it! Warm, Fluffy, and sweet! One per person is definitely satisfying if accompanied with another dish! 

The rest of the food is good, but not much different from any good brunch place! The house fries are well seasoned and crispy on the outside! 

They get really busy on Saturday mornings, but the service remains good! Although it may take a little bit of time to get the check/order taken, they make sure to constantly check up on you to see you are liking the food! This is a small place with a homey feel!

excerpts: Except they serve the same recipe for Nola's famous Beignets and Coffee.
Not impressed, don't go out of your way for bfast here unless you're having a craving for beignets and chickory coffee.
beignets.author: Jess C.
beignets.review:
Regular ol' traditional diner breakfast. Except they serve the same recipe for Nola's famous Beignets and Coffee. 

Not impressed, don't go out of your way for bfast here unless you're having a craving for beignets and chickory coffee.

excerpts: I really enjoyed the New Orleans theme - besides the beignets, I noticed they have Abita beer, and tons of hot sauces.
The atmosphere was great: busy, but not crazy - very relaxed.
beignets.author: Eileen D.
beignets.review:
My husband and I had a lovely brunch here! We got there around noon on a Sunday, and only had to wait about 10 minutes. To start, we each had a beignet, which were delicious (as expected). I had basic scrambled eggs, bacon, and fruit - the bacon was excellent. My husband had a more Cajun-inspired shrimp omelette special, which he loved. The Mexican dishes, especially the chilaquiles, looked very tasty.

I really enjoyed the New Orleans theme - besides the beignets, I noticed they have Abita beer, and tons of hot sauces. The atmosphere was great: busy, but not crazy - very relaxed. All of the wait staff seemed to be in a great mood, and they were super attentive - refilling my coffee cup multiple times :) 

We will definitely be back. Oh, and if you have kids, the restaurant is a little tight for a stroller, but they have some outdoor seating that seemed like it would be fine to pull up a stroller.

excerpts: FIVE stars the the AUTHENTIC beignets!
best I've had outside of Cafe du Monde in New Orleans.
PERFECT
I tell ya.
beignets.author: Amy W.
beignets.review:
FIVE stars the the AUTHENTIC beignets! best I've had outside of Cafe du Monde in New Orleans. PERFECT I tell ya. I could have eaten the order of 3 myself and left and been a happy happy girl.

3 stars for the rest of the meal. I had the cowgirl b'fast with sausage and cornmeal pancakes. On either side of our table people returned their eggs for being to underdone. Yes, our over easy eggs were also underdone, but I'm not sending back eggs unless they have glass in them, they are just eggs, eat them and shut the hell up.  

Service is quick and efficient.  Looks like there is often a line but somehow we missed it.

excerpts: The beignets were fluffy
but I didn't see anything special about it.
Biscuits looked fluffy and fresh but they were dry.
The gravy was average.
The grits didn't have much taste.
Maybe I have higher standards as a Texan.
But I can make better biscuits, gravy and grits myself.
I'd go back if I were in the area and wanted breakfast/brunch.
I wouldn't go out of my way to come back.
beignets.author: Vanessa T.
beignets.review: More like 2.5 stars. The service is great. Everyone is friendly. It tends to get busy. I've tried several dishes here. But nothing really stands out. The beignets were fluffy but I didn't see anything special about it. Biscuits looked fluffy and fresh but they were dry. The gravy was average. The grits didn't have much taste. Maybe I have higher standards as a Texan. But I can make better biscuits, gravy and grits myself. I'd go back if I were in the area and wanted breakfast/brunch. I wouldn't go out of my way to come back.

excerpts: The grits, biscuits, and beignets were also very, very good!
beignets.author: Ericha F.
beignets.review: A long wait to be seated but not to be served: just for you Café is a treasure. I will order the hang town fry which consists of egg whites--which I requested--Bacon, onions and oysters! Superb! The grits, biscuits, and beignets were also very, very good!

excerpts: Beloved airy and piping hot beignets.
beignets.author: Amy C.
beignets.review:
Why Just for You Cafe is Just For Me:

1) Sassy signage like, "We reserve the right to pour coffee on your cell phone."

2) Beloved airy and piping hot beignets. (Resign yourself to getting powdered sugar all over yourself and the table.)

3) A Breakfast Burrito filled with eggs, black beans, cheddar cheese, zucchini, mushrooms, and spinach. Don't forget the spicy New Mexico green chili sauce!

4) The Greg's Scramble with eggs, spinach, onions, garlic, parmesan cheese, and chicken-apple sausage.  Get your carb fix from the thick wedges of homemade cinnamon toast slathered in raspberry jam rather than the bland home fries.

5) Close proximity to after brunch treats from nearby Poco Dolce, Recchiuti's Little Nib, or Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous.

UH-OH.

excerpts: Started with the beignets,.. thin, fluffy, powdered sugar of fun!!
beignets.author: Chanel L.
beignets.review:
I arrived slightly before noon, so the line wasn't too long.  They also serve coffee out in front, which made the wait a little more bearable!  Started with the beignets,.. thin, fluffy, powdered sugar of fun!!  I think it tasted better than the ones I had in New Orleans! 

I shared the bisquit with meat gravy and the deep fried oysters on an omelet. Portions are huge and I was full off half of an order.  I even had a box of left overs for an afternoon snack. 

I will be back!

excerpts: Recommended: the beignets, the frittatas and the scrambles.
beignets.author: Jared S.
beignets.review:
An FYI to those dining alone: don't bother outside of off hours. They've recently changed their policy to only seat single diners at the counter and there are only 4 counter spots in the entire place (so be prepared to wait an hour). 

Food can be hit or miss but when it's good, it's good, and affordable. Recommended: the beignets, the frittatas and the scrambles.

excerpts: The beignets are pretty good, but overall it's just breakfast food.
As much as I appreciate it, overall, my thing with brunch is that I can make most of the stuff on my own.
My girlfriend got the veggie breakfast burrito
and it was sopping wet- as if they cooked the veg and didn't drain the liquid before putting it in the burrito, gross.
My chorizo and eggs were fine, nothing special.
The chorizo didn't have much spice to it
so I had to load it up with cholula.
Service was great though.
beignets.author: Samir K.
beignets.review: A long wait awaits you! But it's brunch in a trendy area in SF, so it comes with the territory. The beignets are pretty good, but overall it's just breakfast food. As much as I appreciate it, overall, my thing with brunch is that I can make most of the stuff on my own. My girlfriend got the veggie breakfast burrito and it was sopping wet- as if they cooked the veg and didn't drain the liquid before putting it in the burrito, gross. My chorizo and eggs were fine, nothing special. The chorizo didn't have much spice to it so I had to load it up with cholula. Service was great though.

excerpts: You have to have the beignets, served warm from the fryer with lots of powdery sugar on top - YUM!!
The service is friendly and attentive.
So happy we found this place - it's our new favorite SF breakfast spot!
beignets.author: emily v.
beignets.review: The breakfast here is delicious.  Had scrambled eggs, bacon, with home fries and the BEST buttery biscuits, served warm. Very good coffee (we had the dark roast). You have to have the beignets, served warm from the fryer with lots of powdery sugar on top - YUM!! The service is friendly and attentive. So happy we found this place - it's our new favorite SF breakfast spot!

excerpts: For dessert my sister and I shared 3 beignets.
If you don't know what a beignet is, it's a light,fluffy, New Orleans donut smothered in powdered sugar!
Add some syrup to the top of your beignet && OH-EM-GEE TO DIE FOR!!
The beignets prices are 1 Beignet = $1.75 or
**3 Beignets = $5
beignets.author: Hazel L.
beignets.review:
Just for you cafe is officially my new favorite breakfast/brunch spot ! 

I never heard of this place before until my sister took me here for Sunday brunch. We arrived at the location around 1PM (*WARNING* they close at 3PM Sundays)and there was a long line of people waiting outside of this little cafe, but  we waited from 20-25mins. So not that bad! 

For my meal I ordered Gregg's Scramble w/ Chicken-Apple Sausage, home fries, and wheat bread toast. To me, the portion size is definitely filling and worth it. Gregg's Scramble: $10.50 

For dessert my sister and I shared 3 beignets. If you don't know what a beignet is, it's a light,fluffy, New Orleans donut smothered in powdered sugar! Add some syrup to the top of your beignet && OH-EM-GEE TO DIE FOR!! The beignets prices are 1 Beignet = $1.75 or **3 Beignets = $5

The servers were so nice and very efficient making sure customers were doing okay and satisfied with our orders. All in all, I would definitely come back here for a delicious, fulfilling, breakfast/brunch meal!

excerpts: I've visited for brunch a couple of times and love getting their beignets.
They're not overly greasy.
Most recently I've ordered the crab benedict and avocado turkey scramble.
Both dishes were pretty flavorful.
Customer service doesn't disappoint.
If you decide to go for brunch, be prepared to wait an hour or so....if you go to brunch often you probably already know this is pretty standard in SF.
beignets.author: Christine D.
beignets.review: I've visited for brunch a couple of times and love getting their beignets. They're not overly greasy. Most recently I've ordered the crab benedict and avocado turkey scramble. Both dishes were pretty flavorful. Customer service doesn't disappoint. If you decide to go for brunch, be prepared to wait an hour or so....if you go to brunch often you probably already know this is pretty standard in SF.

excerpts: It's all about the beignets and cornmeal pancakes here!!
beignets.author: CeCe C.
beignets.review:
Friday at 10:30am, this place was still packed!! O_O Don't people have work or something? 

1. Beignet ($1.65): This is a must order!! It was big, but I was actually expecting it a lot BIGGER because everyone wrote that it was "HUGE"!!! haha So I was expecting a UFO flying saucer size :P I love adding the strawberry jam that's on the table to the beignet!!! Then it's like an awesome jelly filled donut!!! Yum!!! :D

2. Oatmeal Pancake: I could just barely finish my 1 stack. It was a bit uncooked? =\ I was intrigued. Never heard of an oatmeal pancake before. But I wasn't really crazy about it after consumption. The pancake taste wasn't there and almost too moist and mushy. bleh. I was almost sad that I didn't get the cornmeal pancakes :(

3. Cornmeal Pancake: LOVED!!!!! Luckily my friend offered me some of hers! Ahhhh It was soooo light and fluffy! Loved the cornmeal texture!!! Yummy yummy!

Julie K and I came here for breakfast last week before heading up to the North Bay! Because seating was limited inside, we were able to quickly get seats at the counter and right in front of the kitchen! Super cushiony seats! ^^ We ordered 1 beignet, 1 oatmeal pancake, and 1 cornmeal pancake. I was trying to read through the reviews the night before. No one really wrote anything about these oatmeal pancakes, and I guess I know why now. It's all about the beignets and cornmeal pancakes here!! :D

Next time I'm in the Dogpatch, I would love to try their crab cake eggs benedict on the weekends! Love their posters and signs on the walls! Hilarious!! Their website is cute too with links to their menu! By the way, I did notice a slight price difference between weekday breakfast and weekend brunch for the same items. Also they seem to serve better stuff on the weekends of course! Service was okay. But since it was busy our food took awhile. Our server, Holly, was super sweet though!! :)

excerpts: I was told that the beignets at this place were delicious, so I set off and got there at around 11 AM.
And of course I placed an order for 3 beignets.
Unfortunately, my breakfast was so fulfilling that I was only able to eat one beignet, but damn, it was good!
They aren't kidding with their sign outside that reads "Fluffy pillows of perfection"!
I ended up paying nearly $20 just for that Greg's scramble, beignets, and a coffee.
That's a bit ridiculous to me.
beignets.author: Arnold B.
beignets.review:
I came to Just for You... on a Thursday morning for some breakfast. I was told that the beignets at this place were delicious, so I set off and got there at around 11 AM. 

As I walked in, my initial impression was how clean and tidy the place was. I was told to sit anywhere and was immediately brought a menu. The service at this place is great, and my coffee was constantly being refilled. 

I ordered Greg's Scramble with chicken-apple sausage. It has spinach, onions, garlic, and parmesan cheese on top. I also got the home fries (crispy-ass potatoes) and a biscuit. It was yummy!  And of course I placed an order for 3 beignets. Unfortunately, my breakfast was so fulfilling that I was only able to eat one beignet, but damn, it was good!
