They aren't kidding with their sign outside that reads "Fluffy pillows of perfection"! These things really are fluffy perfection. 

Anyways, the only thing that bothered me was how expensive it was. I ended up paying nearly $20 just for that Greg's scramble, beignets, and a coffee. That's a bit ridiculous to me.

excerpts: I was in search of delicious beignets.
In the course of my research, I discovered Just For You on Yelp.
Naturally, we started with coffee and beignets, which were so light, airy, warm, sweet and delicious.
We moved on heartier fare from there:
I had the Eggs Blackstone and my daughter opted for poached eggs with white toast.
Eggs were poached easy and to perfection.
My husband had the biscuits and gravy.
I may have stolen a bite or two from his plate while he wasn't looking.
Those were good too.
A pint of Grapefruit Mimosa and my meal was compete.
I'm not eating for the rest of the day-
beignets.author: Jennifer L.
beignets.review:
I was in search of delicious beignets. In the course of my research, I discovered Just For You on Yelp.  After reading the reviews, I knew a 45 minute brunch road trip was going to happen. 

This Sunday was the day we chose. I went on a 4.5 mile run before we left so I could justify this meal.  It did not disappoint. 

Though I prepared my family that we were in for a wait, we got lucky with our timing, hit a seating lull and were seated within 5 minutes of arriving. 

Naturally, we started with coffee and beignets, which were so light, airy, warm, sweet and delicious.  We moved on heartier fare from there:  I had the Eggs Blackstone and my daughter opted for poached eggs with white toast.  Eggs were poached easy and to perfection. My husband had the biscuits and gravy.  I may have stolen a bite or two from his plate while he wasn't looking. Those were good too.  A pint of Grapefruit Mimosa and my meal was compete.  I'm not eating for the rest of the day- but it was so worth it. 

I'm planning on stopping by here early on my way to Giants day games next season. Is it baseball season yet?

excerpts: 5 stars for the beignets.
The corned beef hash is good too, but the potatoes are diced and not shredded.
My search continues for SF's best corned beef hash
beignets.author: Geordie E.
beignets.review: 5 stars for the beignets. The corned beef hash is good too, but the potatoes are diced and not shredded. My search continues for SF's best corned beef hash

excerpts: They are well-known for their beignets, which come as massive pieces of fried goodness.
The powdered sugar is a bit overdone
so be sure not the inhale, lest you want some type of confectionary pulmonic mishap.
I was disappointed that they weren't fluffy or filled with anything.
Brenda's is still the best place to go to for quality beignets.
beignets.author: Bailey Z.
beignets.review:
This is a nice little neighborhood breakfast dinner in the Dogpatch district. They are well-known for their beignets, which come as massive pieces of fried goodness. The powdered sugar is a bit overdone so be sure not the inhale, lest you want some type of confectionary pulmonic mishap. I was disappointed that they weren't fluffy or filled with anything. Brenda's is still the best place to go to for quality beignets. 

I can't say much for much of their other breakfast items, but just from the looks of it, the portion sizes are just massive. If whatever egg plate you ordered didn't fill you up, the big helping of homefries will.

excerpts: The beignets were SO good!
Best I have ever had.
One is enough for 2 people but if you really enjoy them, get two.
beignets.author: Victoria C.
beignets.review:
What a GREAT place for Sunday brunch.  I absolutely LOVE this place.  The whole staff was so friendly and accommodating.  It was pretty busy but they weren't phased by the chaos at all.

Great menu choices.  Especially loved the Mickey Mouse pancakes which they were nice enough to let me have.  The beignets were SO good!  Best I have ever had.  One is enough for 2 people but if you really enjoy them, get two.  They're pretty big.

This is my new favorite brunch place and I highly recommend you stop by this place on a Sunday.  Place gets pretty busy so be prepared to wait but the good thing is, people come in and out.

excerpts: As many other reviewers have stated, the beignets are worth getting.
I'm not sure I've ever actually eaten a beignet before?
But!
beignets.author: Becca S.
beignets.review:
I came here for breakfast right before driving back from San Francisco to Portland. 

As many other reviewers have stated, the beignets are worth getting. I'm not sure I've ever actually eaten a beignet before? But! I would best describe it as tasting like a funnel cake that is socially appropriate to eat with breakfast. 

I also had the two eggs with home fries, biscuits, and a Cajun crab cake. The biscuits were disappointing, but everything else was pretty good.

excerpts: The beignets were the strawberry on top!
Highly recommended if looking for a good breakfast stop and just an FYI get there early, tends to have a long wait line, but well worth the wait.
beignets.author: Francisco H.
beignets.review: Must I say, what a great experience I had here. The food was AMAZING! First time here and couldn't have had a more delicious breakfast. The beignets were the strawberry on top! Highly recommended if looking for a good breakfast stop and just an FYI get there early, tends to have a long wait line, but well worth the wait.

excerpts: I started my meal with a good bloody Mary, and the absolute best beignets I have ever had.
I highly recommend trying them.
Everyone liked them in my group.
Then I shared the blue cheese scramble, raisin toast, and grits with my wife.
The eggs were cooked perfect, but it was a bit watery because of all the great vegetables in the eggs.
Tasted great.
The grits were basic, and sufficient after adding butter and salt.
The Raisin toast was really good...
a nice touch was that the toast came with no butter, so it was crunchy and you could add as much as you like.
Go for the blue cheese scramble.
Yum.
My little one had pancakes, and called them 5 star.
Our friends had French toast, and eggs Benedict, also very good.
beignets.author: James M.
beignets.review:
Yummo!  Just for you cafe is a great place for breakfast!  

We visited at 9am on a Saturday, and we're able to get a seat immediately, but it was not the same for those arriving only a few minutes later...  They had to wait a while...  The wait would be worth it.

The cafe is small, with people packed in.  It was clean, and felt like home.  Rustic and shabby chic.

I started my meal with a good bloody Mary, and the absolute best beignets I have ever had. I highly recommend trying them.  Everyone liked them in my group.  Then I shared the blue cheese scramble, raisin toast, and grits with my wife.  The eggs were cooked perfect, but it was a bit watery because of all the great vegetables in the eggs.  Tasted great.  The grits were basic, and sufficient after adding butter and salt.  The Raisin toast was really good...  a nice touch was that the toast came with no butter, so it was crunchy and you could add as much as you like.  Go for the blue cheese scramble.  Yum.  My little one had pancakes, and called them 5 star.  Our friends had French toast, and eggs Benedict, also very good.  The coffee left a bit to be desired... skip it.

The staff were extremely friendly, attentive, and helpful.  They did a great job. I tipped well.

I will be back, and would recommend this place to anyone.  Yum!

excerpts: Oh, and don't forget the beignets!
beignets.author: Teese N.
beignets.review:
I love Just For You.

I live in the neighborhood and this is one of the better restaurants in the area. All of their food is great but my boyfriend and I especially love their Chili Scramble or Greg's Scramble.

Oh, and don't forget the beignets!

YUM.

excerpts: Make sure you do not go here and not order the beignets!!
beignets.author: Y N M A.
beignets.review: Perfect place to come for breakfast when you're in the town of San Francisco. You absolutely have to try the delicious fresh fluffy pillows of perfection. The powdered sugar and the fluff is amazing. Make sure you do not go here and not order the beignets!!

excerpts: On the bright side, the beignets are pretty damn good.
beignets.author: Jessica L.
beignets.review:
The people were super friendly and the food looked super amazing and tasty.

But it wasn't :( It was just bland. And a little overpriced. At least the aesthetics were nice!

On the bright side, the beignets are pretty damn good.

excerpts: Don't forget to get a thing of their beignets!
They have to be one of the best I've had!
beignets.author: Jeanette Y.
beignets.review:
Just for me? Aww. So sweet!

Okay, in all seriousness now. Just For You Cafe is definitely a small little gem in the Dogpatch. It's a small, cute little cafe that has quick, fast and amazing service tied together with amazing brunch! 

I was craving for a stereotypical brunch with poached eggs and hollandaise sauce so I went with the Eggs Blackstone which is poached eggs, bacon and tomato on toast and hollandaise sauce. It was oh so very good and satisfying! 

PS. Don't forget to get a thing of their beignets! They have to be one of the best I've had!

excerpts: Love the beignets.
Just DO NOT get french toast here
that's all.
It's a semi moist bread at best; it wasn't dipped in eggs/vanilla extract at all.
Disappointing- can be improved upon...
but this is a solid option for breakfast.
beignets.author: Boris L.
beignets.review: Good overall. Love the beignets. Just DO NOT get french toast here that's all. It's a semi moist bread at best; it wasn't dipped in eggs/vanilla extract at all. Disappointing- can be improved upon... but this is a solid option for breakfast.

excerpts: My friend and I assumed their famous beignets would be small
so we ordered 3 to split and they turned out to be huge.
beignets.author: Kim W.
beignets.review:
5+ food
5+ dog friendly

We stumbled upon this cafe as we were walking to Rickshaw bags.  What a terrific place to have a big filling breakfast! They have two tables outside so you can eat with your pups.  We were lucky to meet the owner who also happened to be a poodle owner. We thanked her profusely for having outdoor seating so we could eat with our dogs.

Portions are huge. I had the Greg's scramble with turkey sausage, potatoes AND a scone (which was freshly baked).   My friend and I assumed their famous beignets would be small so we ordered 3 to split and they turned out to be huge. Good thing our dogs were there to help out with leftovers.

We dined at 8:45am on a Friday morning so there was no waiting but I could see its popularity on the weekends.

Note that gluten free toast is an option!!! Yay for my hubby who is GF.

excerpts: Beignets are the bomb diggity.
I ate an entire order of three last time...
They're that good.
Not too much of the rum aftertaste like in other beignets.
The other food is kinda flavorless though.
Not enough seasoning
beignets.author: Malia B.
beignets.review: Beignets are the bomb diggity. I ate an entire order of three last time... They're that good. Not too much of the rum aftertaste like in other beignets. The other food is kinda flavorless though. Not enough seasoning

excerpts: The beignets were irresistible!
One of my colleagues ordered some for the table.
I broke my strict low carb diet, and would gladly do it again for these beignets.
beignets.author: Jack L.
beignets.review:
I came here for lunch on a rainy Friday and the place was packed.  Came with a group and am glad we had reservations!  

This is a nice little neighborhood cafe.  The furniture is a little old but clean, and the decorations vintage.  I like the ambience.  Food is good - I am told by regulars that there is a Louisiana native in the kitchen, so the cajun food is authentic.  

The beignets were irresistible!  One of my colleagues ordered some for the table.  I broke my strict low carb diet, and would gladly do it again for these beignets.

Parking can be difficult in this neighborhood, or maybe I am just unlucky.  I circled the block twice and ended up parking two blocks away.

excerpts: Love the beignets and rightfully so.
Light, fluffy and sugary...yum!
beignets.author: Shweta M.
beignets.review: Love the beignets and rightfully so. Light, fluffy and sugary...yum!

excerpts: The food is amazing, the vibe friendly and fun, and did I mention the beignets are to die for!
beignets.author: Noel M.
beignets.review:
This place is a San Francisco institution, and for good reason.  The food is amazing, the vibe friendly and fun, and did I mention the beignets are to die for!  

I have frequented Just for You for nearly 20 years, and it has always had that awesome neighborhood vibe.  Case in point: Last week a colleague of mine was traveling from Australia and accidentally left his passport at the cafe while having breakfast earlier in the day.  Unfortunately he didn't realize his passport was missing until the end of the day, after the cafe had closed.  His flight home to Australia was in just a few hours.  The awesome dudes at the Liquor Store next door helped track down the owner and she actually came down to the restaurant after hours to help him get his passport back just in time to make his flight.  

I am so happy to have been a patron for many years and now know that the people behind the cafe are genuinely kind and thoughtful people as well.  You won't be disappointed.

excerpts: Every time we eat there, we order beignets for the table, also an authentically prepared deliciousness!
And did I mention great dark roast coffee refilled happily, fresh fruit cups/bowls available, and yes they actually have righteous grits!
beignets.author: Calla F.
beignets.review:
My first meal, I had poached eggs (done to perfection) with hot link (DEELISH) and the best south Louisiana style French toast I have eaten outside of my own kitchen, since moving to this great city in 1996. Every time we eat there, we order beignets for the table, also an authentically prepared deliciousness! And did I mention great dark roast coffee refilled happily, fresh fruit cups/bowls available, and yes they actually have righteous grits! And great iced tea...the list actually goes on to include everything we've tried on the menu.

Our weekly Koffee Klatch first met here on a Tuesday morning about 2 years ago. The service started out fabulous and has kept right on being that way.  We are a bit difficult to serve well...we are a bunch of lesbians and our friends over 50 who never know how many of us will show up. (We nosh and chat all over town at a different breakfast-y diner-ish place every Tuesday-for nearly 5 years now!). And we always want separate checks. The first time, the waiter sat us down at a table then said he'd just keep the other closest empty til we knew how many would be here. Sweet man!  The owner stopped by for a chat - she's from my neck of the woods down in Louisiana, and although I have avoided "eating Southern" in San Francisco, that is exactly what I wanted to do, so I did. Now when I want authentic taste served with San Francisco sensibility, this is THE breakfast spot in the City. It was simply so good that the Koffee Klatch repeats meeting for breakfast here, on a Tuesday, once every quarter or so! And now they know us, they get us right into the best spot for us so we can add folks as they arrive.

excerpts: Of course, you must, must order the beignets.
I don't care if you're on a diet.
Order them, eat them, and love them.
Everything else on the menu is good.
I got some sort of scramble, and Sara went with over-easy eggs.
All done perfectly.
But none of that matters, just get the beignets and the rest of your day will be better.
beignets.author: Jonah H.
beignets.review:
This place is great for brunch. I went for the 3rd or 4th time last weekend. Of course, you must, must order the beignets. I don't care if you're on a diet. Order them, eat them, and love them. Everything else on the menu is good. I got some sort of scramble, and Sara went with over-easy eggs. All done perfectly. The coffee is also good.

But none of that matters, just get the beignets and the rest of your day will be better.

excerpts: The beignets are to die for...fluffy but crispy and warm!
We were there on New Years for breakfast, our wait was no more than 10 minutes.
It's a quaint little cafe with a relaxed atmosphere.
Food tasted great, the oysters my husband had were SUPER DELICIOUS!
My butternut scramble was very tasty.
Then there was the grapefruit Mimosas
... yum again!
We'd make the trip again, especially for the oysters.... they were cooked to perfection and made a lasting impression on our taste buds!
Thanks for the great experience and wonderful food!
beignets.author: Cindy S.
beignets.review: Great service! Loved sitting at the bar watching the show in the kitchen. These guys have it down. The beignets are to die for...fluffy but crispy and warm! We were there on New Years for breakfast, our wait was no more than 10 minutes. It's a quaint little cafe with a relaxed atmosphere.  Food tasted great, the oysters my husband had were SUPER DELICIOUS! My butternut scramble was very tasty. Then there was the grapefruit Mimosas... yum again! We'd make the trip again, especially for the oysters.... they were cooked to perfection and made a lasting impression on our taste buds! Thanks for the great experience and wonderful food!

excerpts: For dessert we had the beignets-OMG as good as the ones in NOLA!
To die for!!
Staff was friendly and food was yummy.
We can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu.
beignets.author: Lee J.
beignets.review:
4.5 Stars!
We came here for the first time for breakfast on Sunday. It was about a 40 minute wait, but so worth it. We both had the specials: Frittata  with mushrooms, bell peppers, asparagus and eggplant (chose the grits and biscuits as sides). Corned beef benedict, had so much homemade corned beef on a huge piece of toast (with home fries as side). For dessert we had the beignets-OMG as good as the ones in NOLA! To die for!!
Staff was friendly and food was yummy. We can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu.

excerpts: When food writers describe beignets as being "pillows," I'm pretty sure they were describing the ones here at
Just For You.
I would gladly sleep on these things (and then gobble them all up!).
For one, they're HUGE - about 4"x3
" (THAT'S why they're $1.65 each) - and deep fried to a plushy perfection, with a piping hot, chewy interior and an crispy exterior.
Also, be prepared to look like a crack addict after eating these, they're covered in powdered sugar.
Beignets and coffee?
Just for ME??
Life doesn't get much better than this.
beignets.author: Clarice W.
beignets.review:
When food writers describe beignets as being "pillows," I'm pretty sure they were describing the ones here at Just For You. I would gladly sleep on these things (and then gobble them all up!). For one, they're HUGE - about 4"x3" (THAT'S why they're $1.65 each) - and deep fried to a plushy perfection, with a piping hot, chewy interior and an crispy exterior. Also, be prepared to look like a crack addict after eating these, they're covered in powdered sugar. Ohh yeah.

For fellow coffee lovers like me, another great thing about Just For You is the free coffee outside while you wait (just remember to get your cup by the counter when you pay)!

Beignets and coffee? Just for ME?? Life doesn't get much better than this.

excerpts: However, I think there is still value and love the beignets... just can't justify a long wait.
Perhaps worth it for weekday breakfast no line?
beignets.author: Melody T.
beignets.review: Hadn't been in years because we weren't willing to do the wait on weekends. Usually there's a rather large crowd waiting outside. The food is good for the most part - good scramble and home fries. The biscuits were unimpressive - sort of like the pillsbury ones with no texture whatsoever.. too doughy. The coffee was also horrible and the service insanely slow. However, I think there is still value and love the beignets... just can't justify a long wait. Perhaps worth it for weekday breakfast no line?

excerpts: The best beignets in the city, IMHO.
beignets.author: Solitaire M.
beignets.review:
Lots of options for a wide spectrum of people's lifestyles and health issues.

You can do a light, yet flavorful meal

or you can do an indulgent, savory/sweet meal.

The best beignets in the city, IMHO. 

Original choices, sometimes servers are really stellar, sometimes they're basic. There is a wait if you go at the typical brunch hours.

excerpts: Their signature beignets didn't really do much for me though.
beignets.author: Alice W.
beignets.review:
Make sure to get the biscuits as the bread option that comes with the brunch plates. They're more like rolls than typical biscuits, but oh so buttery and delicious. The sausage at this place seem to be made on premise instead of the run of the mill Tootsie Roll variety. Their signature beignets didn't really do much for me though.

The atmosphere is laid back and the wait isn't too bad.

excerpts: We got beignets to start and they were fresh-made and still warm.
So delicious with the (heavy) dusty of powdered sugar.
Loved the fresh OJ and the scrambles, etc.
The only thing I wasn't too thrilled about was the chocolate chip scone.
beignets.author: Rowena L.
beignets.review:
Great breakfast spot with delicious menu options. We got beignets to start and they were fresh-made and still warm. So delicious with the (heavy) dusty of powdered sugar. Loved the fresh OJ and the scrambles, etc. The only thing I wasn't too thrilled about was the chocolate chip scone. It was more of a chocolate chip bread than scone. 

Service was nice and efficient, though they seemed a bit short-staffed at times.

excerpts: so far i've only tried the beignets..
they are B average.
Next is the main dishes .
beignets.author: Dorian M.
beignets.review: so far i've only tried the beignets.. they are B average. Next is the main dishes .

excerpts: while we waited for our food, we noshed on some beignets topped with beautiful snowy powdered sugar.
The coffee is decent too.
Servers are always friendly and get you your check quick without making you feel like they are rushing you out.
A big plus is the parklet outside which makes for a nice place to wait.
Pro tip-
dont forget to sign the list clipboarded on the side of the door!
Come on, that would be a SF-Rookie mistake.
beignets.author: Anita H.
beignets.review: This is my bf and my go-to spot for some good solid breakfast. We only go on off-peak times, like late weekday brunch; weekends it's lines out the door. I ordered the Cowgirl (2 eggs, sausage, 2 pancakes) eggs scrambled and subbed link sausage for andouille sausage, added a side of grits. while we waited for our food, we noshed on some beignets topped with beautiful snowy powdered sugar. The coffee is decent too. Servers are always friendly and get you your check quick without making you feel like they are rushing you out. A big plus is the parklet outside which makes for a nice place to wait. Pro tip- dont forget to sign the list clipboarded on the side of the door! Come on, that would be a SF-Rookie mistake.

excerpts: We were waiting for a table nearby, and u saw the sign do beignets and couldn't resist.
beignets.author: Marilyn T.
beignets.review:
There's nothing wrong with a little pre brunch beignet, right ?  We were waiting for a table nearby, and u saw the sign do beignets and couldn't resist.  They're only $1.85 each, 3 for $5.

The beignet was freshly fried, topped with powered sugar, fluffy and light, not too dense, pretty awesome ;) it was a bit salty, topped with just the right amount of powdered sugar, awesome with raspberry preserves.

As for the menu, they have your standard breakfast fare, and you can customize your own breakfast burrito.  Bonus: giant mimosas.

The wait isn't too bad even though it's a small place - just out your name on the clipboard on the wall outside.  They have a cute patio area you can sit on while you wait, too.

excerpts: Beignets are just like those in New Orleans!!!
beignets.author: Vanessa B.
beignets.review: Amazing food, cute decor, and really awesome and attentive staff!!!! A must go to and worth the wait!!!! Beignets are just like those in New Orleans!!!

excerpts:
;)

Beignets, beignets, and more beignets pleeease!
Ehhh, who cares when they got piping hot beignets!
The beignets are nice and dough-like which is how I like 'em.
beignets.author: S Y.
beignets.review:
"Juuuust For Meeeee..." Who remembers that commercial? ;)

Beignets, beignets, and more beignets pleeease! Or is it I just haven't tried anything else from here? Ehhh, who cares when they got piping hot beignets! The beignets are nice and dough-like which is how I like 'em. 

Keep in mind that Just For You isn't "just for you" after 3pm... sucks for me cause I crave them around dinner time!

excerpts: The beignets seem to be VERY popular here, but we didn't get them.
beignets.author: Amanda G.
beignets.review:
We had wanted to check this place out for awhile, and finally made it there for a late breakfast on Monday.. 

My guy had a breakfast burrito, which was good, but nothing extraordinary. He ordered potatoes on the side, but never got them, although they were on the bill. (As soon as we pointed this out, it was corrected.) 

The beignets seem to be VERY popular here, but we didn't get them. We did try the cornbread, which was probably the best thing we had here. 

I had to send my bacon back to be made crispier, and my poached eggs weren't runny. Even worse,my pancakes were raw in the middle. I sent those back too. When they finally came back they were pretty good. 
We shared one buttermilk and one cornmeal pancake, the cornmeal was the winner of the two. 

I was a little annoyed that one of the servers said i wanted my pancakes well done, and that was why they were taking so long...No, i didn't want them well done, just not raw.... 

As we were leaving, there was a line out the door, so obviously, this is a popular place. 
Some of the food was tasty, but it's not worthy of a return trip for me.

excerpts: Anyways, one of the servers noticed that and gave us free beignets after our meal.
beignets.author: Shawn G.
beignets.review: Very good food and even better customer service. I ordered Cherie's home fry special and it was good, but too many red bell peppers for my liking. Anyways, one of the servers noticed that and gave us free beignets after our meal.

excerpts: Beignets to soak up the alcoholic remnants in our bellies, a Hangtown fry (fried oyster omelet), Benedict special, or something with the hatch green-chile sauce usually follows.
beignets.author: Grant L.
beignets.review:
It is not a weekend in San Francisco unless I am eating at Just For You at least twice.  On my days off, I usually start here.  I go with eggs and a turkey sausage patty (sweet and savory) with homemade wheat toast and I sit outside.  I bring a notebook and plan my day, talk with the warm staff, and drink in the day's potential.

On Saturdays or Sundays, I round up my hungover friends and we grab a big table inside.  Beignets to soak up the alcoholic remnants in our bellies, a Hangtown fry (fried oyster omelet), Benedict special, or something with the hatch green-chile sauce usually follows.  Then after about 6-10 cups of coffee we are ready to tackle the day, or return to the couch either way we're happy.

Just For You now opens for dinner and I have eaten there once.  The food was decent the price was high for the flavor.  But, I understand.  Just For You is breaking into a foodie neighborhood and growing pains are expected.  The Dogpatch boasts some proud restaurants.  I was chatting with one of the staff and they told that they are currently searching for a new executive chef to take them to the next level.  

5 stars. This place is a San Francisco staple and an ambitious kitchen.

excerpts: it could be the consistency of their food, the friendliness of their staff, the proximity to where i live, and even the eclectic-ness of their decor, but i find myself craving their omelettes, potatoes, cornbread, scones, beignets, and pancakes come sunday morning.
they've never once failed me.
do yourself a favor and check out this truly neighborhood gem.
beignets.author: Melissa Y.
beignets.review: my bf and i come here at least twice a month, if not more often. sure, there's a TON of breakfast options in san francisco, but there's something about just for you that i'm drawn to week after week. it could be the consistency of their food, the friendliness of their staff, the proximity to where i live, and even the eclectic-ness of their decor, but i find myself craving their omelettes, potatoes, cornbread, scones, beignets, and pancakes come sunday morning. they've never once failed me. do yourself a favor and check out this truly neighborhood gem.

excerpts:
Dishes selected:

French Toast
Beignets
Cornbread
Biscuits and Raspberry Jam

While I have no idea how a menu touting "New Orleans and Mexican specialties, California classics" came about at Dogpatch darling Just For You Café, the hours and location couldn't be beat given my Monday conference agenda and with breads all baked in house while meats and produce are largely local and mostly organic the restaurant seemed worthy of an early morning walk up to Portrero Hill.
beignets.author: Michael U.
beignets.review:
Dishes selected:

French Toast
Beignets
Cornbread
Biscuits and Raspberry Jam

While I have no idea how a menu touting "New Orleans and Mexican specialties, California classics" came about at Dogpatch darling Just For You Café, the hours and location couldn't be beat given my Monday conference agenda and with breads all baked in house while meats and produce are largely local and mostly organic the restaurant seemed worthy of an early morning walk up to Portrero Hill.  Finding the restaurant expectedly small, kitschy, and without a doubt the sort of place where 'regulars' make up the majority of the clientele I was quickly greeted like an old time friend upon entry and placing my order without much delay it would be perhaps five minutes later that I was treated to a pillowy beignet lighter, larger, and far less greasy than I'd experienced since my visit to New Orleans - a good start to be sure.  Focusing more on sweets than savories, what followed the beignet would prove equally impressive with the French toast golden and soft, the cornbread a sweet block warm from the oven, and the biscuits raised high with rich buttermilk notes and a light yeasty linger than paired beautifully with the house made raspberry jam - the whole meal with tax and tip ringing in at $17.50 and worth every penny.

excerpts: Reasons to go here: beignets.
Need I say more?
beignets.author: Sam Z.
beignets.review:
Reasons to go here: beignets. Need I say more?
Chicory coffee (I like it, not everyone does). 

The egg dishes, etc. are huge and consistently good. Not amazing, but consistently good. This is the kind of place that has biscuits and gravy, if you're in the mood for clogging up your arteries. 

There's usually a wait if you go on the weekend. Having said that, they are good with groups, and it has a very homey atmosphere.

excerpts: I also had a cup of their house coffee and fresh beignets dusted with powdered sugar.
I truly enjoyed everything I ordered, and I don't even like chicory coffee, but there's was palatable.
The service was very friendly and accommodating.
beignets.author: Christine R.
beignets.review:
I really lucked out and came when business was just right, and not terribly busy!  It was my first time here, and I ordered mexican chorizo with eggs along with a side of their home fried potatoes.  I also had a cup of their house coffee and fresh beignets dusted with powdered sugar.  I truly enjoyed everything I ordered, and I don't even like chicory coffee, but there's was palatable.  The service was very friendly and accommodating.  I truly enjoyed their Louisiana-style comfort food, and I certainly would go back again....

I truly love down-home local feel this place has.  You can tell the owner is very happy and the wait staff certainly makes us feel right at home.  Thank you for my great experience and I can't wait to go back again...

excerpts: We order the Beignets and
oh my god!
Def try it :) we ordered some to go too!
The Egg Benedict was good.
I had a combo of oatmeal and buckwheat pancakes.
I liked the oatmeal one more.
Also the Bleu Scramble was tasty as well :) above all, their customer service is amazing!
beignets.author: Elmira Z.
beignets.review: We order the Beignets and oh my god! Def try it :) we ordered some to go too! The Egg Benedict was good. I had a combo of oatmeal and buckwheat pancakes. I liked the oatmeal one more. Also the Bleu Scramble was tasty as well :) above all, their customer service is amazing!

excerpts: The winner were the beignets.
They came out super fresh and piping hot from the kitchen.
As I bit into my first beignet, a sweet whiff of steam hit me in the face.
I savored every bite of the beignet, holding it close to my face each time, and repeatedly rolled it around in the powdered sugar which had fallen.
The dough was light and fluffy, much better than the beignets at Brenda's (which I had eaten recently).
The beignets saved what would have been just an average/ok brunch.
beignets.author: Jeanne L.
beignets.review:
I ordered the Chorizo Con Huevos, which was disappointing, because of the paucity of chorizo. It was like scrambled eggs with speckles of chorizos, instead of big chunks like I expected. I did like how they offered me a choice of corn vs flour tortilla. The home fries were not french fries like I assumed based on the name, but fried potatoes, soft on the inside, slightly crispy on the outside.

I also tried the Eggs Benedict with steak. The hollandaise sauce was heavy. Overall, the dish was very rich with the steak. I only ate about half of this dish. It was too heavy for me.

The winner were the beignets. They came out super fresh and piping hot from the kitchen. As I bit into my first beignet, a sweet whiff of steam hit me in the face. I savored every bite of the beignet, holding it close to my face each time, and repeatedly rolled it around in the powdered sugar which had fallen. The dough was light and fluffy, much better than the beignets at Brenda's (which I had eaten recently). The beignets saved what would have been just an average/ok brunch.

excerpts: After everything we wanted to try their Beignets.
Called the server over..started saying "And we also wanted to try the....
he goes "Beignets?
Okay, an order of 3
okay?
It'll be right out!
AND it wasn't in that obnoxious know-it-all way
, it was pretty cool.
Beignets were sooooo goooood with the powdered sugar!
Mmmmm Beignet............
(now think Homer Simpson again with a donut)
:P
beignets.author: Athena L.
beignets.review:
I'm still drooling about the Hangtown Fry uhhhhhhggg.........(think Homer Simpson.......but prettier).

Got the potatoes and biscuits with it.. Both were tasty and.. it's actually a lot of food. I could not finish the entire thing by myself.

The bf got Greg's Scramble with Chicken Apple Sausage. I don't think that was even close to the deliciousness of what I had. It looked bland and...actually a lot less food than my Hangtown Fry. But still, it wasn't tooo bad.

After everything we wanted to try their Beignets. Called the server over..started saying "And we also wanted to try the...." he goes "Beignets? Okay, an order of 3 okay? It'll be right out!" AND it wasn't in that obnoxious know-it-all way, it was pretty cool. Apparently a lot of people order that here.

Beignets were sooooo goooood with the powdered sugar! Mmmmm Beignet............(now think Homer Simpson again with a donut) :P

excerpts: Next time, I'm trying their famous beignets!
beignets.author: Jen L.
beignets.review:
Thick slices of dense, chewy homebaked bread take their already yummy eggs benedict up a notch. I actually got the eggs blackstone: poached eggs with Hollandaise sauce, roasted tomatoes, and crispy bacon. I'd never heard of this combo before, but it tasted divine. It goes without saying that they poach their eggs perfectly: well-done whites and saucy yolks, perfect for mopping with the bread.

The servers are very attentive, the atmosphere quirky with vintage signage, and the neighborhood has plenty of parking. Great spot for comfort food brunch in the city. Next time, I'm trying their famous beignets!

excerpts: And whatever you do, don't skip the beignets.
Sitting at the counter is a fun experience, too.
Definitely plan on going back.
beignets.author: Patrick F.
beignets.review: Had a delicious roasted veggie omelette with eggplant marinara, opted for the fruit cup on the side rather than home fries and was even pleased with the fruit. And whatever you do, don't skip the beignets. Sitting at the counter is a fun experience, too. Definitely plan on going back.

excerpts: but Just For You Cafe make the best beignets in the city!
This, severely rained on with powder-sugar, pillow shaped pastry is soft and fluffy on the inside and has a thin crusty bite on the outside.
Great flavor, great texture and tastes simply blissful with their raspberry jam!
If we had ordered just the beignets and nothing else then it would be a 5 star rating, however we ordered a couple of their other breakfasts and found it to be just so-so.

On top of the beignets, we had their: 
-Fritata of the decade w/ a side of grits: nothing out of the world
but it wasn't bad either.
My 2nd favorite after the beignets, love love the Cinnamon after taste.
Glad to know there's a place in the city to go to when one if craving for beignets!
beignets.author: Jenny K.
beignets.review:
I'm not hyping this up for anyone but Just For You Cafe make the best beignets in the city! This, severely rained on with powder-sugar, pillow shaped pastry is soft and fluffy on the inside and has a thin crusty bite on the outside. Great flavor, great texture and tastes simply blissful with their raspberry jam! If we had ordered just the beignets and nothing else then it would be a 5 star rating, however we ordered a couple of their other breakfasts and found it to be just so-so. 

On top of the beignets, we had their: 
-Fritata of the decade w/ a side of grits: nothing out of the world but it wasn't bad either. 
-2 eggs w/ crab cakes and a side of home fries: their crab cake wasn't too bad but we've had better. 
-French Toast: My 2nd favorite after the beignets, love love the Cinnamon after taste.

Glad to know there's a place in the city to go to when one if craving for beignets!

excerpts:
Even when busy the staff is very accommodating

Beignets, very well done too...
beignets.author: Ed S.
beignets.review:
Been here a few times now. I have never been disappointed! Breakfast burritos covered in their green chili are amazing! Home fries are as good as it gets. Their special omelets are always well crafted and tasty. What tops their food is their friendly service. Even when busy the staff is very accommodating

Beignets, very well done too...Sadly NO ONE can ever come close to Cafe Du Monde in NOLA, but Just For You has very good ones! Takes me back to my trips to the big easy. 

Highly recommended breakfast spot!

excerpts:
Food: huge portions, yummy southern options, beignets, grits, sausage, everything your little southern heart longs for

Tips:
beignets.author: Betty C.
beignets.review:
Ambiance: charming southern hospitality, a mix between a diner and an antique shop it's got vintage signs and slogans all over the wall as well as a diner counter in the back.

Food: huge portions, yummy southern options, beignets, grits, sausage, everything your little southern heart longs for

Tips: 
*expect a wait for weekend brunch, put your name on the list outside
*line moves relatively fast
*staff is super friendly
*free coffee while you wait
*expect a food coma, it's good but the food is heavy!

excerpts: The English muffin, buttery biscuits and Beignets are off the hook.
They make home made bread, good for a small groups.
The mimosas are great as well cures any hang over!!!
beignets.author: Mony K.
beignets.review: The English muffin, buttery biscuits and Beignets are off the hook. They make home made bread, good for a small groups. The mimosas are great as well cures any hang over!!!

excerpts: The beignets deserve their French name.
They are real beignets and they are super good
beignets.author: Cricri B.
beignets.review: I had the 3 eggs with spinach onion and chorizo and it was excellent. The beignets deserve their French name. They are real beignets and they are super good

excerpts: I love their beignets and corn bread!
It's so tasty.
It's a cosy neighborhoody place.
Recommend.
beignets.author: Ting C.
beignets.review: I love their beignets and corn bread! It's so tasty. It's a cosy neighborhoody place. Recommend.

excerpts: My high school French teacher always said, "Make beignets, not war!"
I always wanted to try a beignet, and whether it was truly authentic or not, it was mad tasty here during my first and second visits.
(If you don't like too much sugar, you can ask for it on the side.)
beignets.author: Judy L.
beignets.review:
My high school French teacher always said, "Make beignets, not war!" I always wanted to try a beignet, and whether it was truly authentic or not, it was mad tasty here during my first and second visits. (If you don't like too much sugar, you can ask for it on the side.)
(I also recently learned from someone who grew up in France that my French teacher's saying is not an authentic French phrase.)

Other Pros:
-Love the fun, colorful, cozy environment 
-Waitress was attentive but not pushy
-Personal preference: like how they serve water without ice
-Breakfast potatoes are perfect - slightly crispy yet soft inside; also has great balance of salt and pepper (could see how some would think they are tad too salty though)
-Bacon is a thicker cut. Though not as crispy as other restaurants', I like how the combo of the less crispy bacon and thick cut make the bacon THEIR unique bacon.
-Great place to people watch
-Only a few blocks away from Rickshaw Bagworks which is a neat place to buy eco-friendly, personalized grocery bags, laptop bags, etc.  

Cons: 
-Was slightly disappointed the hangtown fry didn't have more oysters. Guess I'll have to shuck my own next time. 
-If you can't handle slightly sarcastic, witty signs, this ain't the place for you. 
-If you're looking for a romantic, bougie brunch place, I would not recommend this for a date like such.

excerpts: On my next visit, I'll try the beignets :)
beignets.author: Mariela D.
beignets.review:
This cute little cafe offers more than meets the eye. Everything this cafe serves is organic and produced locally. And their bread is freshly made in-house.

The owner is originally from New Orleans, so their menu has a few dishes normally found only in the Big Easy. Their daily specials rotate and if you're lucky, you might just get to try their muffalettas. I haven't had one since I went to New Orleans in 2004. 

Everything on the menu looked delicious, but I decided on the Greg Scramble: eggs, jack, spinach, onions and chicken apple sausage, with parmesan sprinkled on top and a side of home fries. WOW! Everything tasted so fresh. 

My husband had the Cowgirl which is a combo platter with two buttermilk pancakes, eggs and sausage. He asked if they could add bananas on top of the pancakes and they impressed us by mixing fresh banana IN the batter! It was so good. 

Life moves a bit more slowly in here. Their famous sign: "We reserve the right to pour coffee on your cell phone" is a declaration that this cafe is a place to sit, relax and enjoy your food. And that's a concept that we tend to forget with our busy lives, smartphones and laptops. 

On my next visit, I'll try the beignets :)

excerpts: As advertised, their beignets are awesome.
You really only need one to share among a few friends.
beignets.author: Winny F.
beignets.review:
This is one of my favorite brunch places in the city. Why? Food is great, the staff are incredible, and there is parking everywhere! 

We went there with 5 people and were seated within 15 minutes, which is pretty amazing for a top rated Brunch Place in San Francisco. The staff there have a good sense of humor and really step up to take care of you. They aren't just sales people, they care about their customers and discourage against waste. 

As advertised, their beignets are awesome. You really only need one to share among a few friends. They are piping hot when they come out, and they recommend you have it after your meal. 

I had the corn beef hash and it was great. They have pretty good portion control, and will always offer to wrap your food up. 

One more thing. i love that they have a sign that says 'They reserve the right to pour coffee on your cell phone". That's right! Cell phones belong in your pocket/purse during a meal!

excerpts:
There is always a line on the weekends and there is a reason...

Beignets
Biscuits and Gravy

Everything else on the menu is solid!
beignets.author: Jon H.
beignets.review:
There is always a line on the weekends and there is a reason...

Beignets
Biscuits and Gravy

Everything else on the menu is solid!  Just remember to order the bacon crispy

excerpts: Came here with great recommendations from Julie K and Kevin N on the beignets.
Yes, for beignets, I am willing to track and explore the next sweetness.
The beignets were quite delicious.
I do wish they serve specialty coffee or French press ones because I truly believe coffee is like wine, it enhances the taste of breakfast.
beignets.author: T L.
beignets.review:
(See pics)

Came here with great recommendations from Julie K and Kevin N on the beignets. Yes, for beignets, I am willing to track and explore the next sweetness.

Came here a couple times. A cafe with a hint of diner. The eggs benedict was good. The beignets were quite delicious. I do wish they serve specialty coffee or French press ones because I truly believe coffee is like wine, it enhances the taste of breakfast.

excerpts: The beignets are amazing -- i go for the omelet or the scramble; pass on the toast but an extra helping of the fruit.
beignets.author: G R.
beignets.review:
Great breakfast spot in the dog-patch.  Been here a couple of time, and the joint fits the hood; its low key, no fuss, friendly staff and southern style food make this an ideal spot.

The beignets are amazing -- i go for the omelet or the scramble; pass on the toast but an extra helping of the fruit.  You mug of coffee is kept full and the table is yours.

I don't like coming on the weekends, too long of a line -- mid week is the best.  Schedule a breakfast meeting and go here.

excerpts: meh, it was okay, still trying to adapt to American breakfast preferences/choices & stay healthy at the same time) and also ordered some beignets to go (WHICH WERE
SO GOOD!!!
better than English jam filled donuts).

There was a long wait on a Sunday late morning (11 am ish) but we were still seated and served pretty quickly, the place was very busy and loud but that is to be expected from such a popular brunch restaurant.
Good food, good service, very affordable.
Would definitely go back
but order pancakes this time!
beignets.author: Anya P.
beignets.review:
Boyfriend had chilli scramble and devoured it, I had the greek scramble (meh, it was okay, still trying to adapt to American breakfast preferences/choices & stay healthy at the same time) and also ordered some beignets to go (WHICH WERE SO GOOD!!! better than English jam filled donuts). There was a long wait on a Sunday late morning (11 am ish) but we were still seated and served pretty quickly, the place was very busy and loud but that is to be expected from such a popular brunch restaurant. Good food, good service, very affordable.
Would definitely go back but order pancakes this time!

excerpts: I had the lobster bene and the beignets!
All amazing!
beignets.author: Kaitlin T.
beignets.review:
Great service, amazing food. We were lucky and were seated with 5 people after waiting 10 minutes on a Sunday brunch! I would recommend this place over and over again and I will be returning. 

I had the lobster bene and the beignets! All amazing!

excerpts: You'll get a great breakfast for two for $25, and if you want to indulge and get mimosas, side of pancakes, beignets, the works - you'll still have trouble getting your bill above $40.
beignets.author: Adam F.
beignets.review:
Anyone who lives in Potrero Hill has seen the crazy lines on 18th St. outside of Plow.  What the people waiting don't understand is that there is a much better place just down the street in Dogpatch at Just For You. And, without the long line and crazy wait.

Just For You is the kind of restaurant where, when you ask for something special or a customization like substituting chicken apple sausage for pork sausage in a scramble, they write it down, repeat it to make sure they got it right, and come out to check with you again if there's any issue. At Plow, they'll roll their eyes and begrudgingly make the change because they think their breakfast is just SO awesome - but at Just For You they understand that breakfast is all about what I want, and how I want it cooked.

Here's some more reasons why I love just for you:
- They bake their own bread and their cinnamon raisin is the bomb
- They also make their own sausage, and the chicken apple sausage is top notch
- Pint mimosas made with fresh grapefruit or orange juice - much more satisfying than a wimpy flute
- Their cornmeal pancakes - get them
- Even their homefries are awesome, not too fried and the right amount of potato

The last thing I'll say is about price.  Just For You is so affordable.  You'll get a great breakfast for two for $25, and if you want to indulge and get mimosas, side of pancakes, beignets, the works - you'll still have trouble getting your bill above $40.

excerpts: The beignets... don't leave without trying the beignets.
beignets.author: Lizette C.
beignets.review:
The beignets... don't leave without trying the beignets.

The host is always so funny and welcoming, I love him

The food is great - best place to have brunch. On weekends the wait might be longer than usual, but definitely worth it!

excerpts: I love their beignets.
They are my favorite place to grab this fluffy pastry.
5 stars for beignets.
beignets.author: Hazel N.
beignets.review:
I love their beignets. They are my favorite place to grab this fluffy pastry. It is did not contain too much bread; it had the right amount. 

My boyfriend ordered the po boy. It was lacking in the shrimp, and was pretty ordinary; however, this is our spot for dessert. 

5 stars for beignets.

excerpts: I've been informed that I'm sadly mistaken and those are indeed true beignets.
If you decide to eat here you can judge for yourself.
They're deep fried tasty donuts either way.
Just remember avoid the huevos like the plague!!!
beignets.author: Ritu K.
beignets.review: I've been informed that I'm sadly mistaken and those are indeed true beignets. If you decide to eat here you can judge for yourself. They're deep fried tasty donuts either way. Just remember avoid the huevos like the plague!!!

excerpts: Yum, beignets.
Some of the best I've had outside of New Orleans.
Solid breakfast burrito as well.
And friendly staff!
beignets.author: Nisha R.
beignets.review: Yum, beignets. Some of the best I've had outside of New Orleans. Solid breakfast burrito as well. And friendly staff!

excerpts: The beignets I saw in person looked bigger than the pictures.
I'd like to try one of those.
The eggs were done almost perfectly and the French toast was a bit too raw for my taste.
Still very good meal plan on coming back to try those beignets.
beignets.author: Gilad P.
beignets.review: This place is quite crowded and somewhat noisy. The service is good. I love the decor its really funny. The beignets I saw in person looked bigger than the pictures. I'd like to try one of those. The eggs were done almost perfectly and the French toast was a bit too raw for my taste. Still very good meal plan on coming back to try those beignets.

excerpts: What else but the beignets, the Filipino Longanisa  sausage, and the atmosphere.. dog patch heaven.
beignets.author: Jay K.
beignets.review:
Once again, long overdue.  This spot was in my backyard for many years, and I continue to drag my half-awake belly and brain to this main event (wife in tow).  

What else but the beignets, the Filipino Longanisa  sausage, and the atmosphere.. dog patch heaven. HOWL.  

http://blog.junbelen.com/2011/11/16/l-is-for-longganisa-filipino-style-sausage/

I've never been disappointed here, bring the family too... but plan ahead for the wait, strategy is everything!

excerpts: I would have loved to tried their beignets, but I was stuffed.
The location is great, and parking is not too terrible, but there are a handful of other breakfast joints in SF I rather go to.
beignets.author: Marilyn W.
beignets.review:
Neglected writing yelp reviews for over a year! Not good... but I'm back!

I was just at this place last Sunday, and I have to say it was just okay. I swear, San Franciscans all go gaga over Sunday brunch which is why there was a wait. But not too bad, about 20-30 mins. Cute little cafe with friendly servers. They have a lot of different breakfast selections, and I loved the various side options they offer with your entree. I opted for the crab cake benedict, except I got it on an English muffin instead of their house made toast. And I got grits on the side just to be daring and try it for the first time. The benedict was not bad, but it was just a little heavy. As for the grits, I was not a fan of them at all, but at least I gave them a try! I would have loved to tried their beignets, but I was stuffed. The location is great, and parking is not too terrible, but there are a handful of other breakfast joints in SF I rather go to.

excerpts: This was also helpful since I noticed a big sign about their beignets, it is a must try, a great thing to share for the table.
I had the blue cheese scramble, which was a little strong on the blue cheese for me, but I could also see how people who love blue cheese would prefer that.
The standout item were the biscuits, perfect balance of fluffy and flakey.
beignets.author: Mayur A.
beignets.review:
Came in here after failing at 3 other locations on a Sunday morning breakfast search...I'm glad I did. It has a kind of diner / cafe feel...which is very relaxed and welcoming. We had to put our name down and wait about 15 mins....always a good sign. This was also helpful since I noticed a big sign about their beignets, it is a must try, a great thing to share for the table. I had the blue cheese scramble, which was a little strong on the blue cheese for me, but I could also see how people who love blue cheese would prefer that. The standout item were the biscuits, perfect balance of fluffy and flakey. The others in my party just got a simple 2 eggs breakfast, but they came with grits, which seemed fun.

Overall, I recommend this place for a chill, hearty, farm-fresh kind of breakfast.

excerpts: We were so happily surprised to see beignets on the menu!
(so hard to find good beignets in california!)
This place has a really good atmosphere.
There are really quirky and interesting posters and pieces and pictures covering the walls.
They even have very sarcastic little posters in the window.
Overall it was just a fun interesting place with great food and a cool vibe.
Beyond satisfied!
beignets.author: Kailin D.
beignets.review: Me and my friend were on a mini vacay to San Fran and just happened upon this place one morning. It couldn't have been more perfect! We were so happily surprised to see beignets on the menu! (so hard to find good beignets in california!) This place has a really good atmosphere. There are really quirky and interesting posters and pieces and pictures covering the walls. They even have very sarcastic little posters in the window. Overall it was just a fun interesting place with great food and a cool vibe. Beyond satisfied!

excerpts: oysters po' boy, along with decent beignets) in a location near my work.
Since this is San Francisco, the $15 price tag for lunch was not too expensive.
beignets.author: DV P.
beignets.review: Hip place to grab a quick meal. Fast, friendly service comes with excellent food (I had the mixed fried shrimp and fried oysters po' boy, along with decent beignets) in a location near my work. Since this is San Francisco, the $15 price tag for lunch was not too expensive.

excerpts: Ordered the beignets and they were the best out of everything we got but again, not the best I've had.
beignets.author: Monica W.
beignets.review:
Came here at 11 am on a weekend and the wait for a party of 2 was about 15 minutes. Not bad for weekend brunch in the city. I had high hopes for this place given all the good reviews but the food was just ok. I ordered the greg's scramble with grits and cornbread. The cornbread was dry and the grits were bland. I guess I'm just used to eating grits with cheese and very well seasoned. The scramble was average, could definitely get the same quality elsewhere. Ordered the beignets and they were the best out of everything we got but again, not the best I've had. 

Probably won't be coming back given all the other delicious brunch spots SF has to offer. Three stars because I'm biased towards breakfast foods. Any restaurant that serves eggs, pancakes, and french toast automatically gets three stars from me.

excerpts: We also got the beignets, and truth be told, I've had beignets in New Orleans (1st time) and
these are no where near Cafe du Monde caliber, not that they claim to be.
But I have a very high bar set.
These beignets had a fermented taste to them, which me and my friends didn't enjoy.
beignets.author: Kimberly S.
beignets.review: Came here twice, both occasions they were pretty busy. Menu is witty. First time I had 6 people in my group and  a baby. They were accommodating and really nice. They served us promptly and didn't push us to finish faster. It was a catching up occasion so we were very happy. The prices are reasonable and the portions are huge! I never finish my food, always have to bring it home. 2nd time it was a group of 4 and same great service. We also got the beignets, and truth be told, I've had beignets in New Orleans (1st time) and these are no where near Cafe du Monde caliber, not that they claim to be. But I have a very high bar set. These beignets had a fermented taste to them, which me and my friends didn't enjoy.

excerpts: The star of the show here is (as everyone else has mentioned): their beignets.
I just came back from New Orleans, where I had amazing beignets from Cafe du Monde and Morning Call, so hopefully that gives me some credibility when I say this:
Just For You Cafe's beignets are even better than the ones in New Orleans.
Yeah yeah, gasp all you want
-- it is what it is.
beignets.author: Roy C.
beignets.review:
Just For You Cafe is one of my favorite overall breakfast/brunch places in SF. The service is excellent, the atmosphere has a grassroots neighborhood vibe, it's not pretentious whatsoever, and most importantly, the food is excellent. 

My one and only complaint (and it's actually a pretty big complaint): the coffee here is horrible. The house coffee I had here was so burnt that there are moments when I felt like I was tasting Korean Shin Ramen MSG packets. I know it's weird and I thought I was going crazy for a second, but the taste just really reminded me of something MSG-related. Regardless, it was disgusting. But perhaps I just had a bad burnt batch -- so I'm not going to ding them too much on it.

The star of the show here is (as everyone else has mentioned): their beignets. I just came back from New Orleans, where I had amazing beignets from Cafe du Monde and Morning Call, so hopefully that gives me some credibility when I say this: Just For You Cafe's beignets are even better than the ones in New Orleans. Yeah yeah, gasp all you want -- it is what it is. If only I had some decent coffee to drink with it.

Corned Beef Hash was excellent; Crab cakes were delicious. Everything just tasted like good old fashioned homestyle breakfast cooking. I was bit disappointed with the biscuits (they weren't fluffy enough), but the gravy was addicting.

The owner came around with a big smile and warm greetings. Always a plus when you have a neighborhood joint like this. Also, with the long waits, they provide coffee outside for those who are waiting. Little things like this just really hit home for me (even though the coffee was horrible, but it's the thought that counts).

All in all, Just For You Cafe is a wonderful breakfast/brunch restaurant that blends together incredible food with a intimate, genuine vibe. 

If it weren't for the coffee, this place would get a resounding 5 stars from me.

excerpts: This review are for the Beignets.
beignets.author: Arlito C. L.
beignets.review:
This review are for the Beignets. 

They are the best in town. A must get if you're in the area. Woot!

excerpts: The beignets are delicious.
beignets.author: Jonathan B.
beignets.review:
I don't know where to start with this place. Hands down my favorite spot to get breakfast in the city. 

The heuvos rancheros with the Santa Fe green sauce is out of this world!!  I normally get it with scrambled egg, and they serve it all directly on the tortilla. (I can't be bovvered)  

Great chicory coffee. The beignets are delicious. The burritos are massive, and everything is just GOOD. 

The service is A+ too.

excerpts: I was mucho excited to try this spot with its mean looking beignets and quirky signage.
The beignets lived up to the hype.

They really know how I like it, hot hot hot... and fluffy.. and a little crispy on one side.. and powdery.. and they melt in your mouth/not in your hands and mmm just g dbbl o d good, and they made em just for me.
I don't know if I'll go back, to have to wait through the crowds, but if I do I'm hoarding all the beignets to myself.
beignets.author: Angela W.
beignets.review:
I love brunch like the next fierce gay couple walking down Castro on Sunday morning after hitting the gym.. so trust me I was mucho excited to try this spot with its mean looking beignets and quirky signage.

I got the eggs (over medium) with Creole crab cake with home fries and cornbread. It only comes with one crab cake a little chauncey I'd say, a little cheesy, very mehhh but I ate it anyways cause you can't hate on crabs unless they're in your pants. Home fries were disappointing-they were charred on the outside but still hard on the inside and bland. You get your choice of side from a whole buttload of things like white, wheat, cinnamon raisin, biscuit, cornbread, scone, english muffins ohh my!! I got the cornbread.. and i got a big HUGE chunk of it!! It was okay, just plain cornbread nothing special.

The beignets lived up to the hype. They really know how I like it, hot hot hot... and fluffy.. and a little crispy on one side.. and powdery.. and they melt in your mouth/not in your hands and mmm just g dbbl o d good, and they made em just for me. Thanks!

I don't know if I'll go back, to have to wait through the crowds, but if I do I'm hoarding all the beignets to myself.

excerpts: Scrumptious beignets that come out hot!
They def are giving Brenda's a run for their money here.
beignets.author: Erin C.
beignets.review:
Solid Yummy Brunch/Breakfast.

"Just" is right in my neighborhood and consistently good every single time. Sometimes there is a bit of a wait on a Saturday or Sunday morning/noon (up to 20-25 mins) but usually it's pretty painless for a party of two.

I always get the Frittata of the Decade or Greg's Scramble. Comes with buttery warm cornbread and your choice of grits or homefries or fruit. 

Scrumptious beignets that come out hot! They def are giving Brenda's a run for their money here. Suggestion: different flavors.

For you? Yes.

excerpts: The beignets.
Wow.
Love.
Love.
Def worth a stop in... if only for the beignets and a cup of coffee.
beignets.author: Sabrina B.
beignets.review:
In town and finally had a chance to take a friends recc. and check this place out. I went for the Gregs scramble plus bacon and it was a winner. 

Location was cozy and the back room was relaxed and not too crowded. Low volume so chatting was easy.

The beignets. Wow. Love. Love. Love. 

Not what I had in mind for breakfast but DAMN was it a nice treat! 

The menu is hilarious - ex: "Grits.... just like you had in prison." haha. Awesome.

Def worth a stop in... if only for the beignets and a cup of coffee.

excerpts: Absolute favs are the beignets and hang town fry - scrambled eggs, oysters and bacon with home fries and scone.
Yum!
Servers are very nice with lots of positive energy.
beignets.author: Pechay P.
beignets.review: We are regulars. Absolute favs are the beignets and hang town fry - scrambled eggs, oysters and bacon with home fries and scone. Yum! Servers are very nice with lots of positive energy.

excerpts: We got the Greg Scramble, French Toast, Chili Scramble and a set of 3 beignets.
The Greg Scramble was ok.
We got it with chicken apple sausage and corn bread.
The corn bread was DELISH - served hot and fresh.
The scramble was alright -
I felt like I've had better.
I wasn't so fond of the parmesan cheese on top,
but oh well.
And the rest of it was not blow-your-mind status.
The French Toast was thick and yummy - also typical and yummy, but not to die for.
The Chili Scramble was probably the best dish we had.
The chili and eggs were laid on top of homemade cornbread.
It was hot and yummy and full of flavor.
We couldn't finish all of it.
Lastly, I realize each place has their own version of how they make their beignets.
This place made HUGE beignets, each the size of my palm.
It's super doughy inside, making me wonder if it's supposed to be like that, or just undercooked.
beignets.author: Sharon G.
beignets.review:
This was our first time here after seeing the reviews from other Yelpers. We went on MLK day, expecting a long wait because of the holiday but were pleasantly surprised by the short wait. We had 3 other groups ahead of us, but things seemed to be moving along fairly swiftly. Our party of 3 was seated after about 15-20 minutes of waiting. 

We got the Greg Scramble, French Toast, Chili Scramble and a set of 3 beignets. The Greg Scramble was ok. We got it with chicken apple sausage and corn bread. The corn bread was DELISH - served hot and fresh. The scramble was alright - I felt like I've had better. I wasn't so fond of the parmesan cheese on top, but oh well. And the rest of it was not blow-your-mind status. The French Toast was thick and yummy - also typical and yummy, but not to die for. The Chili Scramble was probably the best dish we had. The chili and eggs were laid on top of homemade cornbread. It was hot and yummy and full of flavor. We couldn't finish all of it. Lastly, I realize each place has their own version of how they make their beignets. This place made HUGE beignets, each the size of my palm. It's super doughy inside, making me wonder if it's supposed to be like that, or just undercooked. Either way, I think we could've all shared one and that would've been plenty. 

Overall, I think this place would be ok to come back to and I'm glad I checked it out, but I would not rush back anytime soon.

excerpts: Beignets to be reckoned with.
beignets.author: Annie D.
beignets.review:
Beignets to be reckoned with. And they are less than $2 each, so you HAVE to order one with your meal, don't you?

I ordered the special omelet yesterday, which came stocked with crab cake, green and red peppers and hollandaise. It was a pretty rich, monster breakfast, which is exactly what I wanted because my stomach was fiercely growling. Still, I could only eat about 2/3 of the omelet before giving up (of course, I first looted all of the crab cake from inside the last 1/3 too). I ordered home fries as my side, and they could've been browned a bit more, but the flavor was excellent and the manager let me know in a PM on Yelp that if you ask for well-done, they'll be perfectly browned!

The menu slants a bit Southern with corn cakes and catfish, but also things like Filipino sausage, eggs benedict and breakfast burritos. Most brunch entrees come with a side of bread (even wheat-free is available) and the OJ and grapefruit juice are both fresh-squeezed. As far as drinks, it's beer, wine or champagne... and that means a mimosa is possible. This is a great thing.

It is a very small cafe, so expect to wait on the weekends and it's probably best to call ahead for a group larger than six people. We waited about 30-45 minutes. Don't fret though---put your name on the sign-up sheet and then run down to Piccolino, where you can grab a pick-me-up while you hang out and wait with bated breath for your name to be called. 

There were just two places for improvement here... 
-the coffee: the servers kept our cups full, but the coffee itself was not great.
-the credit card policy: they can only take three credit cards per check right now. The manager let me know that they are updating their system soon and it'll allow for smoother payment with split checks.

excerpts: The New Orleans style beignets were hot, soft and delicious.
I was a little disappointed
they didn't make variety of flavors but these babies were satisfying pair with coffee.
beignets.author: Ha S.
beignets.review:
The New Orleans style beignets were hot, soft and delicious. I was a little disappointed  they didn't make variety of flavors but these babies were satisfying pair with coffee. Waiter said that's how it's done in New Orleans. 

I also ordered the po-boy fried shrimp sandwich. I love fried food and the fried shrimp was perfect, lightly crusted texture with the bite of the soft bread, fresh tomato, lettuce and pickles. I was surprised by generous amount of huge shrimp on the sandwich. I can't wait to come back to try the brunch menu.

excerpts: Delicious beignets.
HUGE mimosas (pint glass!).
Eggs benedict over crab cakes.
beignets.author: Allison B.
beignets.review:
Delicious beignets.  HUGE mimosas (pint glass!).  Eggs benedict over crab cakes.  All around solid brunching experience.

Expect a long wait, but located in a cute enough neighborhood to do a little time-killing-exploration.  Thumbs up!

excerpts: Beignets that are fluffy, light,  and airy.
You could probably find a place similar to this minus the beignets in your own neighborhood.
beignets.author: Christopher M.
beignets.review:
This place is very interesting.  When you walk inside you get a taste of two different worlds.  It looks like a small diner you'd expect to see in a small fishing town infused with a lot of funky/awesome posters/wall decor that you'd expect to see at a place on Haight.  Always busy.  Always. Prepare for a wait each time you go unless you go early.  Wait isn't usually too long, 20-30 mins on avg. in my experience.

Food is good.  Nice portion sizes, price point isn't bad. Staff is always a delight despite the hectic, borderline chaotic environment that sometimes pops up.  Very attentive and the food comes out fast.  You can't ask for more. Beignets that are fluffy, light,  and airy.  Sugary fried goodness. 

It's worth a stop/trip if you're compiling an ultimate breakfast/brunch list for san francisco. It is in the Dogpatch and parking there is just woof. You could probably find a place similar to this minus the beignets in your own neighborhood.

excerpts: This place has great beignets, I tried them for my first time here, they are like fluffy pillows of goodness.
I thoroughly enjoyed my chorizo burrito as well.
Very fast and friendly service.
beignets.author: Sally Y.
beignets.review: This place has great beignets, I tried them for my first time here, they are like fluffy pillows of goodness.I thoroughly enjoyed my chorizo burrito as well. Very fast and friendly service.

excerpts: Fantastic grapefruit mimosas and beignets.
beignets.author: Jennifer P.
beignets.review: Strange name. Fantastic grapefruit mimosas and beignets.

excerpts: The beignets and scone were delicious, as always.
beignets.author: Anna B.
beignets.review: I tried this place again for brunch with a friend, and my experience was even better than last time. The service was friendly, and the special I ordered was great. The beignets and scone were delicious, as always.

excerpts:
- 
The beignets (fluffy, powdered sugar-y, fried yumminess!)
The scones
The frittatas
The french toast
beignets.author: Gowri R.
beignets.review:
Excellent neighborhood brunch place!  

Love - 
The beignets (fluffy, powdered sugar-y, fried yumminess!)
The scones
The frittatas
The french toast
The hot chocolate

It's small so expect a wait.  If you're ok with sharing a table you might be able to get seated faster.

excerpts: Beignets are a must.
beignets.author: Jaime O.
beignets.review: Great place for brunch. Very friendly, no-nonsense service, cool atmosphere, hip crowd, and pretty good food. Try the huge mimosas. Beignets are a must.

excerpts: Pancakes looked great, definitely the oatmeal one and the beignets will have to be back in my belly again soon.
beignets.author: Anthony S.
beignets.review:
This place was great.

Came here for an early Sunday brunch, walked in at 8:30a.m and sat at a table right away.

Cool little atmosphere with posters and pictures all over the wall "homey kinda" feel to it all.

I ordered ... went with ..

Benignets - Sooo good , warm , fluffy , flavorful and just perfect to pair with a nice cup of endless coffee. Covered in powered sugar .. mmmM

Corn beef Hash - They make the corn beef in house which paired with there homemade wheat bread, two eggs over easy and potatoes makes for a great filling breakfast ... 

I will be back ... Pancakes looked great, definitely the oatmeal one and the beignets will have to be back in my belly again soon.

excerpts: Try ordering beignets for appetizer and check out the nice art while you wait.
beignets.author: Don J.
beignets.review:
Went here for the first time with friends for Brunch on a Saturday early afternoon. Cute little place in the Dogpatch. There were some people outside waiting and a sign up sheet. I was surprised how quickly the line moved and we were seated. Very nice straight forward service, always around to keep your drinks full. Seems to be something for everyone on the menu. Lots of scrambles etc... Gluten free bread? Yup they have it. Try ordering beignets for appetizer and check out the nice art while you wait. 

There were so many things on the menu that I wanted to try, so I will have to go back for more!

excerpts: Five stars for the beignets!
WOOHOO!
Big pillowy goodness.
So fresh, out of the fryer, dusted with powdered sugar and what can you ask more?
beignets.author: Rika P.
beignets.review:
Five stars for the beignets! WOOHOO! Big pillowy goodness. So fresh, out of the fryer, dusted with powdered sugar and what can you ask more? Even Cafe Du Monde in New Orleans can't do anything to kill it!

Other things in the menu seems fine as they are. Brunch stuff - Benedicts, scrambles, pancakes, waffles, etc. Not too bad either. Service is okay - they tend to get really busy in the weekend so sometimes you lack affection there sitting on the table.

excerpts:
- Beignets: big! sweet, good with the raspberry jam, love the powered sugar on top
- Special Scramble: tomatoes, mushrooms, Swiss = delicious.

all my favorite ingredients for eggs
- Grits: plain, thick, still good
- Buttermilk Pancakes: just okay, fluffy, tastes like anywhere else
beignets.author: Linda C.
beignets.review:
Great homestyle food, friendly, attentive service, in a warm fun atmosphere. Not that bad of a wait for a Saturday. They have a few tables outside. The decor adds a lot of fun personality to the place with all the interesting posters.

- Beignets: big! sweet, good with the raspberry jam, love the powered sugar on top
- Special Scramble: tomatoes, mushrooms, Swiss = delicious. all my favorite ingredients for eggs
- Grits: plain, thick, still good
- Buttermilk Pancakes: just okay, fluffy, tastes like anywhere else

excerpts: This is where you go when you want to sit in a corner and lick the left over powdered sugar off your fingers because the beignets are that good.
This is where you go when you don't want to choose between pancakes or eggs (because you can have both) where you want chilli on your cornbread...and grits on your plate.
You can even get fresh squeezed juice.
beignets.author: Kierstan G.
beignets.review:
I started this review with four stars...because well its hard to have five stars...but you know what, its a five star kind of place... Now its no five star place, if you know what i mean...but 5 star yelp...defina-surely...

I decided to go here with a friend.  It was brunch time and now that I live in the city the dog patch is actually not that far! This is not where you go when you are trying to keep your figure and you are concerned with calories.  This is where you go when you are hung over, hungry as hell, and you just want to eat...this is not where you go when you are concerned with the whose who of SF seeing you, seeing or being seen, dressing up or being trendy.  This is where you go when you want to sit in a corner and lick the left over powdered sugar off your fingers because the beignets are that good.  This is where you go when you don't want to choose between pancakes or eggs (because you can have both) where you want chilli on your cornbread...and grits on your plate.  You can even get fresh squeezed juice.  And the food is great.  

Parking is street, but not bad at all.  They could have a little more outdoor seating, but the waiter said that is coming very soon because they just got the permit approved to expand.  Just for you is right...there was about eight things on that menu that could have been just for me and I will take up the challenge to try them all.

excerpts: Maybe it was the beignets that was screaming out my name..or perhaps it was the breakfast burritos with Chili con Carne..
beignets.author: Mimi T.
beignets.review:
Sunday am Brunch with my pals T&D..I checked out some menus online..and we decided to try Just for You--
Maybe it was the beignets that was screaming out my name..or perhaps it was the breakfast burritos with Chili con Carne..

On our way to Dogpatch..our friends Mateo and Mila called...and we invited them to join...

We pulled up to the joint..and put our name down for a table of 5...There wasn't much waiting room inside so we had to wait out in the cold...it was a good thing it wasn't too long of a wait....and the pint size grapefruit mimosa totally made up for it!

My tummy was happy with both the beignet and the breakfast burrito...everyone else seemed to enjoy their food as well...

Nice little neighborhood joint...now on my go to list...

excerpts: yes, it makes your beignets, grits, and pancakes even MORE amazing....
beignets.author: Mike V.
beignets.review:
ORDER THE REAL MAPLE SYRUP.
