After many trips to Montreal this year, and feeding my addiction with all the "real" maple syrup I've smuggled back, I've decided that I will actually springing for their "real" maple syrup every time (yes, it's on the menu....yes, it's like a shot glass....yes, it makes your beignets, grits, and pancakes even MORE amazing....yes, it's like $3, unless you get the Canadian discount) 

Just do it. Trust me. (or do what my brother does and bring his own "real" maple syrup container to restaurants....just don't sit on it by accident)

excerpts: Green chili (way better than green chili kitchen's), beignets and the scrambles were delicious.
beignets.author: Aimee O.
beignets.review: Great spot! Low wait time, took the order quickly and the food came out fast and hot! Green chili (way better than green chili kitchen's), beignets and the scrambles were delicious.

excerpts: The beignets are wonderful!
Biscuits and corn bread were also good.
We had Greg's scramble with spinach and chicken-apple sausage and corned beef hash.
Both were very good breakfast fare.
beignets.author: Brad B.
beignets.review:
Great diner fare with a bit of flare. On Sunday, we had a short wait (15 min) for a table at 9:00 am.  The interior also has a diner feel, which small tables in a relatively long and narrow space.  The walls are lined wtih interesting pop art/vintage posters (e.g., a Michael Jackson image).   Server was really pleasant and helpful.

As mentioned elsewhere, the highlight of the restaurant is the pastry menu.  The beignets are wonderful!  Biscuits and corn bread were also good.  We had Greg's scramble with spinach and chicken-apple sausage and corned beef hash.  Both were very good breakfast fare.

excerpts: skip the pancakes and go right for the beignets!
My bf loved his crab cakes too, they had a great flavor.
really enjoyed some time at the little tables outside in the sun.
busy place.
left full and happy.
corn bread on point!
next time I will have to try a biscuit, mmm.
beignets.author: Coco J.
beignets.review: skip the pancakes and go right for the beignets! My bf loved his crab cakes too, they had a great flavor.  really enjoyed some time at the little tables outside in the sun. busy place.  left full and happy. corn bread on point! next time I will have to try a biscuit, mmm.

excerpts: They beignets were good, not great.
The coffee was terrible.
I had the smoked salmon eggs benedict special.
Their grits is pretty good, a somewhat redeeming feature.
But that's because I'm a grits girl.
beignets.author: Elsie N.
beignets.review:
A bit of a wait because the place is rather small.

The servers became more attentive and friendlier when they present the check after not providing that great of service.

The food was ok.  Nothing to write home about.  They beignets were good, not great.  The coffee was terrible.  I had the smoked salmon eggs benedict special.  Their grits is pretty good, a somewhat redeeming feature.  But that's because I'm a grits girl.

excerpts: (thanks Greg where ever you are), the pancakes are fluffy, and the beignets are way larger than the ones I remember in New Orleans.
My kids enjoyed their various egg platters, and we loved how they cooked the bacon.
Service is very good, with the servers rushing around for orders, pouring refills and making sure to compost properly.
They are kind enough not to rush you in and out even when there's a large crowd outside.
Special kudos for that!
Weekend brunch should always be this way - good food, opportunity to relax and people watch or read a paper, and just be part of a friendly atmosphere.
Looking forward to many more meals at this place.
beignets.author: Maria S.
beignets.review: I learned early that if a lot of people are willing to wait a long time for a table, there must be something good about it.  Just For You Cafe is one of those places.  I've gone a few times now and each time I ate a good, old fashioned breakfast.  Their scrambles are delicious (thanks Greg where ever you are), the pancakes are fluffy, and the beignets are way larger than the ones I remember in New Orleans.  My kids enjoyed their various egg platters, and we loved how they cooked the bacon.  Service is very good, with the servers rushing around for orders, pouring refills and making sure to compost properly.  They are kind enough not to rush you in and out even when there's a large crowd outside.  Special kudos for that!  Weekend brunch should always be this way - good food, opportunity to relax and people watch or read a paper, and just be part of a friendly atmosphere. Looking forward to many more meals at this place.

excerpts: , the three beignets are so tempting!
but self-control is an amazing thing.
and you will leave the restaurant feeling pleasantly full without waddling around like you're about to give birth to your food baby.
beignets.author: Moraia W.
beignets.review:
get the chili scramble! WITH CORNBREAD! you will not regret it. heaping piles of chili on top of perfectly cooked scrambled eggs and amazingly gooey cheddar cheese...i mean COME ON. the chili had a nice kick to it which worked so well with the cornbread. the homefries are nicely seasoned and came out piping hot, but next time i think i'd try them extra crispy.

the beignet, i mean what can i say that hasn't already been said about that piece of culinary genius. SO GOOD. if you're there with just another friend, i recommend splitting one...and not three. i know i know, the three beignets are so tempting! but self-control is an amazing thing. and you will leave the restaurant feeling pleasantly full without waddling around like you're about to give birth to your food baby.

excerpts: Also the beignets are crackin.
I recommend ordereing them.
beignets.author: Cedric F.
beignets.review:
I was surprised to find this place in the dogpatch area.  Great place to grab breakfast, brunch, or lunch after those long hard nights of partying.  Expect it to be pretty busy on weekends, even at 2pm.

The food here is awesome.  I had the crab omlette and home fries which was off the chain.  Also the beignets are crackin.  I recommend ordereing them.

excerpts: And let's not forget the beignets...
DELICIOUS!
Hot, soft in the middle.
Oh my, it was really good.
I also love that their mimosas are in a big pint glass!
It was my dream.
beignets.author: Caroline L.
beignets.review:
Of all people to suggest a place to go, it was my dad. For his first time suggesting a place: great job! It was also Father's Day, so what a perfect place for brunch. This place is located in Dogpatch, a neighborhood I've never been to, but apparently it's hip and happening and has a lot of good food places, this being one of them. It's also a popular place, since there were people waiting outside and names on a long list. But, there was coffee and sunshine to keep the crowd from storming the place. 

I honestly didn't know what to get when I got there... you can only have breakfast enough times before you realize you're ordering the same thing all the time. I was torn between going simple with just bacon and eggs and then going with something like eggs benedict. I finally decided on the cowboy, which is just eggs, bacon, and french toast. Oh my god... the french toast was absolutely divine. The bread slices were huge (it was only two slices), and it was so nice and custardy in the middle. And hot! Topped with powdered sugar and syrup, it was probably the best kind of french toast I've had all year. I also got a side of one pancake because I wanted to do my pancake test (if they have good pancakes, then they have good everything). They totally passed! It was big and hot, and perfect. 

And let's not forget the beignets... DELICIOUS! Hot, soft in the middle. Oh my, it was really good. I also love that their mimosas are in a big pint glass! It was my dream. I decided to live my dream that day. 

If anything, I would like to make this place a regular place for brunch. After seeing their menu, it was pretty clear that this place is awesome. I'm excited to try other things... I was also pleasantly surprised to see Longanisa (Filipino sausage) on the menu.

excerpts: Beignets.
That should be enough of a reason to come here.
If it is not, then the rest of the San Fransico inspired menu should have at least one thing to fill you up.
Their daily specials are inspired.
Parking is their only problem.
beignets.author: Theodore M.
beignets.review: Beignets.  That should be enough of a reason to come here.  If it is not, then the rest of the San Fransico inspired menu should have at least one thing to fill you up.  Their daily specials are inspired.  Parking is their only problem.

excerpts: The best thing on their menu are the beignets!!!
There is always a wait during the weekends but the food and beignets are so good
I'm willing to wait an hour.
This isn't the most quaint spot for breakfast but the service is always good and the food is consistently awesome!
The only annoying part is looking for parking
so if you come on the weekend try to come early.
beignets.author: Maria T.
beignets.review: The best thing on their menu are the beignets!!! There is always a wait during the weekends but the food and beignets are so good I'm willing to wait an hour.  This isn't the most quaint spot for breakfast but the service is always good and the food is consistently awesome!  The only annoying part is looking for parking so if you come on the weekend try to come early.

excerpts: The beignets are warm and sugary.
The hometown fry is the best outside of El Dorado county.
beignets.author: Anne Marie M.
beignets.review:
I loooooove just for you! It's one of the few places I will make a special trip over the bridge for.

While there's always been a little wait when I've been here, it's never been more than 30 minutes. Service is super friendly and attentive. I took my boyfriend here for his 30th birthday and the staff was incredibly sweet and  even gave him a birthday beignet!! 

The food has a twist on breakfast classics. The beignets are warm and sugary. The hometown fry is the best outside of El Dorado county. I've had multiple omlettes from here and each one has been uniquely delicious.

Nom nom nom. Love just for you!!

excerpts: The beignets were good, but nothing to rave about.
beignets.author: Shannon C.
beignets.review:
I'm not a hundred percent sure on how to rate this restaurant as I have many mixed feelings about it.

Service: 2 star: Water never refilled. Brought me a strawberry scone instead of the chocolate chip one I ordered.

Food: I had their special fritta, and it was overdone and rubbery. The potatoes were dry and there was no saving them with any amount of ketchup or hot sauce. I'm also vegetarian and I got a piece of bacon in my potatoes. Let me say that I asked if they were vegetarian before ordering them. Not my day. I also ordered their scone of the day which was chocolate chip. I never got to try this. My sister ordered the biscuits and gravy which she said was delicious.  My husband had the Blackstone Egg Benedict. He said it was okay, but missing some seasoning. His potatoes were also dry. The beignets were good, but nothing to rave about. 

Incident: When the scone came, I took a little bite. I started to realize something was off. Turns out they had brought me a strawberry sconce instead. I'm highly allergic to strawberries. I never mentioned this since the scone was supposed to be chocolate chip. Management came to talk to me and they took my name and number. We got the bill and there was no adjustment for this incident. The manager said she sent over a chocolate chip scone, but we never got it. After talking to the manager she couldn't take the scone off, she finally took the part of my meal of. She did call to check on me later that day, but you could tell it was just to cover themselves. The main issue I had with this incident was the lack of compassion and how it was glossed over by the staff.

excerpts: They have beignets!
beignets.author: Mihir M.
beignets.review: A nice menu with several vegetarian items, including some eggless. Good service. They have beignets!

excerpts: Beignets - wonderful.
beignets.author: Yma Y.
beignets.review:
Long wait - pack your patience and you will be rewarded.

Coffee - good. 
Beignets - wonderful.
Servers - super.

I had the Eggs Blackstone. Eggs were poached perfectly and the hollandaise seemed to be homemade, not from a mix or delivered via Sysco or something. I mean I got more and dipped my home fries in it. YUM.



Unique restau, will absolutely get back. Next time I will try the biscuits and gravy. Looked good too!

excerpts: Beignets were great, scramble was fantastic, service was wonderful.
We loved it.
Nice to go somewhere in SF and find parking easily and feel like we were eating among locals, not among a bunch of tourists from Kansas City.
beignets.author: Will S.
beignets.review: Great off the beaten path NON tourist trap brunch spot.  Neighborhood is definitely a bit run down, but this was a great find.  Beignets were great, scramble was fantastic, service was wonderful.  We loved it.  Nice to go somewhere in SF and find parking easily and feel like we were eating among locals, not among a bunch of tourists from Kansas City.

excerpts: We first got the beignets, first reaction, OMG.
They're HUGE!!!
(Don't say it, I know what you're thinking)
Anyways, it's this 4"x4" fluffy sweetness.
So great to start your brunch with.
I then got the greg's omelette with chorizo and home fries.
Oh man, this was so delicious with chorizo, onions, spinach in fluffy egg heaven.
Also, if you get the english muffin, you should definitely get the gravy to go with it.
beignets.author: Stephanie Y.
beignets.review:
Such a bustling place for brunch. Even though it may be a long wait, you don't have to wait long for your food!! We first got the beignets, first reaction, OMG. They're HUGE!!! (Don't say it, I know what you're thinking) Anyways, it's this 4"x4" fluffy sweetness. So great to start your brunch with. I then got the greg's omelette with chorizo and home fries. Oh man, this was so delicious with chorizo, onions, spinach in fluffy egg heaven. Also, if you get the english muffin, you should definitely get the gravy to go with it. Hope you're full after all that!

Oh, it's also cool, you can get a cup inside and fill up your cup with hot coffee while waiting outside.

excerpts: i had beignets, grits and a veggie omelet, with a house turkey sausage patty.
I was happy..
And was happy the previous 4-5+times.
I will go there again, and again, and again...
beignets.author: Kevin H.
beignets.review: Met a friend there, Had breakfast. Ya, it gets busy on Saturdays, but thats a good thing. If it wasn't good, it wouldn't be busy.I love the place. I've been there multiple times, and was a bit of an ass in a previous review. i had beignets, grits and a veggie omelet, with a house turkey sausage patty. I was happy..And was happy the previous 4-5+times. I will go there again, and again, and again...

excerpts:
Give their chorizos a spin -- they are really good. 
- To die for beignets.
So so good.

- Friendly service. 
- Great prices.
$4 for three large beignets.
beignets.author: Min L.
beignets.review:
Excellent in every way. 

- Good coffee while we wait. (there are always cute dogs outside too)
- Delicious huevos rancheros with green chili and chorizos. Give their chorizos a spin -- they are really good. 
- To die for beignets. So so good. 
- Friendly service. 
- Great prices. $4 for three large beignets.

Would take the caltrain up just to get brunch here!

excerpts: Beignets that are fluffy and covered in a blanket of powdered sugar.
Longaniza sausage?!
I am part-filipina and trust me this is as good as it gets.
They may not make it the way my dad makes it back home, but hey they at least have it on the menu.
beignets.author: Cherlyn M.
beignets.review:
Ughhh....I love when things are just for me.  Customized dresses. Customized Make-up palettes. I mean I could go on...and on...and on.  

Just For You Cafe was seriously made just for me.  I don't mean to sound narcissistic but seriously! I think they went into my mind and made sure that they served everything that I love for breakfast! Beignets that are fluffy and covered in a blanket of powdered sugar.  Longaniza sausage?!  I am part-filipina and trust me this is as good as it gets.  They may not make it the way my dad makes it back home, but hey they at least have it on the menu.  This combo is my remedy to curing those crazy hang overs I suffer from on Sundays after going out with my friends on Saturday.  

I love the coffee they have for patrons waiting to be seated inside their cozy restaurant - to me that's great customer service from the start.  The staff here is uber friendly and are quick to get whatever you need once you are seated.  

Definitely make the trip out to the Dogpatch for this to amazing breakfast spot to find the meal combo that is just for you ;)

excerpts: b. Beignets are mouth watering..
steamy hot that melts in your mouth
beignets.author: Kimberly H.
beignets.review:
Oh Lord, how I love this place. I have been going there almost every weekend for a year and I still can't get enough. The specials keep me from getting tired of the usual things on the menu. 

But, although I love this place and have given it 5 stars I will be honest about the bad parts. I was a hotel and restaurant major so I do see where some of the negative reviews are coming from.

BAD
1. Wait staff could use a few more sessions of training, if they even got any
            a. Service can be slow
            b. They can be rude

2. Location can be good or bad depending on your circumstances. I live in Pacific Heights so it is pretty far to travel just for breakfast, however I have a car and can always find close parking right on third street so it makes it very convenient if I have errands to run that day where I need my car.

***I have never had any problems with my food so I cannot comment on why people have said they can be inconsistent

GOOD
1. Food is amazing
        a. It is unique or hard to find New Orleans food
        b. Beignets are mouth watering..steamy hot that melts in your mouth
        c. Crab cake is sinful, perfect amount of spices and herbs
        d. Homemade turkey sausage patty was my addiction for months 
        e. Biscuits are sooo good, homemade and steamy hot

2. It is not pretentious (I wear sweats most of the time I go there) Customers are very friendly too.

3. Coffee is quite different than the typical coffee that I've had. I know someone who knows the owner of the restaurant and they say that she gets the coffee from New Orleans.

4. There is a decent wait and a list that you have to put your name on, and yes I know waiting sucks but it is a good sign if there is a wait because that means the food is worth waiting for by locals plus they give you free coffee outside...unlike Mama's on Washington Square.

Basically, whenever my family comes out to visit me I always take them there and I will be going there until they either close or I move. And while I do think the service sucks at times, it does kind of go with the personality of the restaurant...not pretentious.

excerpts: We ordered the Beignets to go just because we were way too full from our meal.
The Beignets are light, fluffy New Orleans-style donuts, smothered in powdered sugar.
They were only $5 for 3 of them.
What a deal!
Since we got them to-go, it looked deflated in the to-go box.
Nonetheless, they were still quite delicious!
The beignets taste a bit sweet, yet soft and airy on the inside.
I actually prefer the beignets here than at Brenda's.
Overall, service was good that day and we were easily able to find parking within the next block.
beignets.author: Philana C.
beignets.review: I came here with my friend on a rainy Saturday early afternoon. Because of the rain, we only waited about 15 minutes for our table. :) I had the Hangtown Fry which consisted of 3 eggs scrambled with bacon, oysters, and onions. It was served with home fries and cornbread. Super delicious. There were quite a few big oysters in the scramble. If I had to compare, I prefer the Hangtown Fry at Brenda's just a bit more. The home fries are basically fried potatoes. They were not too crispy on the outside, yet they were well seasoned. We ordered the Beignets to go just because we were way too full from our meal. The Beignets are light, fluffy New Orleans-style donuts, smothered in powdered sugar. They were only $5 for 3 of them. What a deal! Since we got them to-go, it looked deflated in the to-go box. Nonetheless, they were still quite delicious! The beignets taste a bit sweet, yet soft and airy on the inside. I actually prefer the beignets here than at Brenda's. Overall, service was good that day and we were easily able to find parking within the next block.

excerpts: The beignets take us back to new orleans and we always get a plate to share each time we go.
The wait is never too long on the weekends and there is outdoor seating for those of you with dogs.
beignets.author: R C.
beignets.review: My husband and I have been here a couple of times and the food has never disappointed us.  Great flavors, well cooked and a cozy atmosphere.  The beignets take us back to new orleans and we always get a plate to share each time we go.  The wait is never too long on the weekends and there is outdoor seating for those of you with dogs.

excerpts: The beignets are awesomely fluffy, except I got too excited on the first bite and inhaled hella powdered sugar
oO
beignets.author: Calvin W.
beignets.review:
Quaint little lunch/brunch spot with good food, friendly servers, and ample street parking.

**The beignets are awesomely fluffy, except I got too excited on the first bite and inhaled hella powdered sugar oO

excerpts: I'm only rounding up because the beignets deserve 5 stars on their own!!
I am S-O-L-D on their beignets!
Don't wear black...you'll get powdered sugar all over you!
beignets.author: Ly T.
beignets.review:
This place is small and the wait can be long. Breakfast was solid but nothing special. Parking is easy in this area. I'm only rounding up because the beignets deserve 5 stars on their own!!

It's really good!! One alone is pretty big, enough to share for two. For that size, I was afraid it was going to be overfried and hard. But o contrare! It was crispy on the outside and surprisingly super fluffy once you bite into it.

I am S-O-L-D on their beignets! Don't wear black...you'll get powdered sugar all over you!

excerpts: Don't miss the baked goods - pies and beignets to die for.
beignets.author: Katy M.
beignets.review:
JFY never disappoints.  Sort of a cooler, hipper-without-trying version of Toast in Noe (but with delicious food).  Feels like a diner, but with some great Southwestern specialties (and the best green chile sauce I've had outside New Mexico - awesome green chile cheeseburger!), delicious fish tacos, and a few other unexpected offerings.  Don't miss the baked goods - pies and beignets to die for.  

Lunches get busy so arrive just around noon if you don't like to wait.  I can imagine weekend brunches are pretty crowded as well.   A must when in the Potrero/Dogpatch area.

excerpts: All their breakfasts are delicious, and the beignets are to die for!!
Don't forget to save some room for them :)
beignets.author: Ganesha B.
beignets.review: Such a great brunch spot. I'm usually pretty lucky about not having to wait too long during busy hours in the morning/ early afternoon on the weekends. Just sign up on the list once you get there and enjoy some sun (since its pretty much always sunny in that part of the city). All their breakfasts are delicious, and the beignets are to die for!! Don't forget to save some room for them :)

excerpts: Great beignets and benedicts in the Dog Patch.
the area is a little secluded so you can avoid the massive crowds and long line and dig into delicious food.
Outdoor seating is great on a nice day.
Very solid restaurant with delicious, homestyle food.
beignets.author: Ed L.
beignets.review: Great beignets and benedicts in the Dog Patch. the area is a little secluded so you can avoid the massive crowds and long line and dig into delicious food. Outdoor seating is great on a nice day. Very solid restaurant with delicious, homestyle food.

excerpts: Best crabcakes and beignets this side of the Mississippi!
And try the longaniza, Filipino sausages with eggs.
Yum!!!
beignets.author: Jaime A.
beignets.review: Best crabcakes and beignets this side of the Mississippi!  And try the longaniza, Filipino sausages with eggs.  Yum!!!

excerpts:
3.5

Fun and quirky little cafe in the Dogpatch area that serves up some delicious beignets, those powdery pillows of sweetness.
beignets.author: Pauline L.
beignets.review:
3.5

Fun and quirky little cafe in the Dogpatch area that serves up some delicious beignets, those powdery pillows of sweetness.  I was craving a coffee and something sweet so those really hit the spot.  I was a bit disappointed that for a place that serves up a lengthy breakfast menu that their coffee selection is really just brewed coffee.  Service is really friendly and the place is cozy and eclectic with their mix of sports, movie posters, and vintage world posters.  It's the sort of place you stop by on a lazy weekend for a simple brunch or a beignet fix.  Be sure to read through their snarky menu for a good laugh.

excerpts: Situation: Beignets.
Oatmeal pancakes.
The beignets are good, massive and topped with quite a bit of powdered sugar (which came into play later).
They are a house specialty and worth the splurge.
beignets.author: Jason B.
beignets.review:
Situation: Beignets. Oatmeal pancakes. House turkey sausage.

Assessment: All looked delicious.

Problem. There was just one of me.

Solution: Mix and match thanks to Just For You's extensive side selection.

The beignets are good, massive and topped with quite a bit of powdered sugar (which came into play later). They are a house specialty and worth the splurge. (plus it helps you can get just one, more than that would be dangerous).

House turkey sausage can be skipped. I've had better from the grocery store.

Oatmeal pancakes should not be skipped. They are outstanding. A moist and flavorful yet light batter that tastes even better when using some of the leftover powdered sugar from above.

And if you are digging lunch, the veggie burger is nothing memorable, but the wheat bread it comes on is (all their bread is house made).

Helpful tip: Dining solo is not advice because 1) you need someone to help you sample everything and 2) the wait for a counter spot is longer than twos and fours waiting for a table.

Fortunately there is free coffee while you countdown to those pancakes.

excerpts: Best beignets!
Far better than Brenda's French Soul Food, and worth the three-mile walk from Polk Street.
Eggs Benedict are served on choice of English muffin or whole-wheat bread, but the Hollandaise sauce could use a touch of lemon juice.
Friendly and solicitous servers.
Great place for an afternoon breakfast.
beignets.author: Mamie B.
beignets.review: Best beignets!  Far better than Brenda's French Soul Food, and worth the three-mile walk from Polk Street.   Eggs Benedict are served on choice of English muffin or whole-wheat bread, but the Hollandaise sauce could use a touch of lemon juice.   Friendly and solicitous servers.  Great place for an afternoon breakfast.

excerpts: Starting with the beignets.
I must say that they were excellent.
beignets.author: Hilda Z.
beignets.review:
JFYC, is a place serves breakfast my way. Good portions, great tasting and not too complicated. 

Starting with the beignets. I must say that they were excellent. My friend discovered the raspberry jam they had on the table, and I will admit that I spread a little raspberry lovin' on mine and turned them into an even more sinful experience.

I ordered the eggs benedict (over ham) with grits. Hot damn they were good! The eggs weren't covered in a bland sauce, oh no. The hollandaise tasted amazing....had a little zing!

I tasted a chunk of thier cornbread, and it too was divine (and they throw in a substantial piece of cornbread, if you order one).

This place seems to be busy so come prepared for waiting (especially for parties larger than 2). And inside the restaurant, it is loud. Almost a little too loud for me =(

excerpts: We started with the beignets...
Too much powdered sugar for my taste, but
I shook some of it off and enjoyed a bite of the warm doughy pillowy goodness, but were these funnel cake cousins worth the one hour wait?
beignets.author: Lori K.
beignets.review:
On New Year's Day we went here for brunch. I wasn't surprised that we had to wait for over an hour for a table. The waitress we had wasn't overly friendly or service oriented which I know would annoy most other yelpers, but I didn't really mind because I hate the in your face style of some servers who constantly check in. The place was very busy and I could tell the staff was frazzled but doing their best to keep their cool and keep the place running.

We started with the beignets...Too much powdered sugar for my taste, but I shook some of it off and enjoyed a bite of the warm doughy pillowy goodness, but were these funnel cake cousins worth the one hour wait? Ehhh, not really.

I ordered an egg white omelet loaded with fresh spinach and other vegetables. I loved that they had various types of hot sauce. I enjoyed my breakfast, but couldn't help but feel I could have gotten the same meal anywhere in the City.

Don't go out of you way for this joint... It wasn't worth the journey or the wait.

excerpts: The beignets are pure happiness in my tummy!
A MUST try.
Best beignets I've had in the America's hands down!
Note the 5 Star Rating is 100% related to the beignets.
The rest of the menu is good but banal and would most likely warrant a three star rating.
beignets.author: Caroll M.
beignets.review:
The beignets are pure happiness in my tummy! A MUST try. Best beignets I've had in the America's hands down! (And I've tried my fair share of them!)

Note the 5 Star Rating is 100% related to the beignets. The rest of the menu is good but banal and would most likely warrant a three star rating.

excerpts:
I loved it with the with the seasonable raspberry jam but chickened out of asking for the recipe

- Beignets: 3 for $4-5, delicious and amazing portions

- Biscuits & Sausage
beignets.author: Frances N.
beignets.review:
Stopped here for brunch on my way to the 22nd street Caltrain station. Parking was super easy and the wait for 3 wasn't too bad. They had free coffee outside which was nice on a chilly SF morning.

:: Food ::
(in order of which I liked best)

- Oatmeal Pancakes: DELICIOUS, melted in your mouth. I loved it with the with the seasonable raspberry jam but chickened out of asking for the recipe

- Beignets: 3 for $4-5, delicious and amazing portions

- Biscuits & Sausage Gravy w/ eggs: $9 the biscuits were fluffy, a bit dry but good

excerpts: We found the raved about beignets to be ok, not the best thing since sliced bread...there are better places to get beignets in the city.
beignets.author: Alex C.
beignets.review:
Nice little Dogpatch neighborhood cafe for breakfast/brunch. We found the raved about beignets to be ok, not the best thing since sliced bread...there are better places to get beignets in the city. 

For bfast, I had a really good omelet special: turkey, red peppers, mushrooms, spinach and Swiss cheese - one of the best combos I've had in a while. A big plus for the cafe having longanisa (Filipino sausage) - don't find that in your average place...my wife had to add that to her order. We heard another customer rave about the French toast but my wife found them to be a little bland.

Overall, good place to grab brunch...although get here early since I hear it gets crowded on the weekends. We got here at 9:30am on Presidents' Day (a Monday) and had to wait 10 min. When we left, it was prob closer to 20 min. Also, parking can be a hassle in the area.

excerpts: Beignets are good, large portions and somewhat reasonable prices
beignets.author: A C.
beignets.review:
Came all the way from soma, lol to have their breakfast :)
Beignets are good, large portions and somewhat reasonable prices

excerpts: And if you're extra lucky they might bring out some hot beignets, on the house.
Score.
beignets.author: Leah H.
beignets.review:
If you are forced out of bed at an ungodly hour, come get some crab benedict. They open at 8am--even on New Years Day.

And if you're extra lucky they might bring out some hot beignets, on the house. Score.

excerpts: I would come here again for the beignets!
Yum.
But that is where the food ordering would stop for me.
This little breakfast spot is so fun and the artwork inside is amazing.
It also helps that the staff is super sweet and efficient.
For a vegetarian breakfast, there weren't many options.
The homefries with cheese and grilled vegetables I ordered was pretty tasteless.
beignets.author: Vanessa L.
beignets.review: I would come here again for the beignets! Yum. But that is where the food ordering would stop for me.  This little breakfast spot is so fun and the artwork inside is amazing.  It also helps that the staff is super sweet and efficient.  For a vegetarian breakfast, there weren't many options.  The homefries with cheese and grilled vegetables I ordered was pretty tasteless.

excerpts: You have to order the beignets and the coffee is not the usual dirty water diner version, it actually has taste.
I'm looking at the menu to refresh my memory and see they have Po Boys.
I have to try that next time.
Time to hop into the jalopy.
beignets.author: Rich M.
beignets.review: I've been here twice and its far far from home. Well, the other side of town. Great place and original. I had the "hangtown fry" (oysters and eggs made famous during the gold rush)  my first time there and it was great. You have to order the beignets and the coffee is not the usual dirty water diner version, it actually has taste. I'm looking at the menu to refresh my memory and see they have Po Boys. I have to try that next time. Time to hop into the jalopy.

excerpts: Aside from the testosterone element in the kitchen, in case you weren't aware, I LOVE BEIGNETS.
And when I say LOVE beignets, I really mean, "will-fly-to-Cafe-
du-Monde-on-a-whim-for-some-beignets" kind of LOVE.
And, with no pending trips to the Big Easy anytime soon, these beignets will suit me just fine.
beignets.author: Olma M.
beignets.review:
OK, if I try to be really objective about this place, I can only justify a three star rating.  This would be based on mediocre service, "pretty good" and generously portioned dishes, and the cash or check only thing usually doesn't work well for me.

However... my recent experience convinced me to add that fourth star.  Actually, after today's experience I would've given five stars if not for the aforementioned reasons.

Today, I realized something about myself.  As I sat at the counter, facing the exposed kitchen area, I saw three men working the stove, toasters, and prep counters.  All men.  On the wall beside the entry to the kitchen, was a sign: "Danger Men Cooking."  Cute.  

Then I realized - wow, I really dig men in the kitchen!  Seriously.  I didn't realize how comfortable I was knowing a man was in the kitchen.  ALL my life, I've been spoiled with men cooking for me.  My father, my brother-in-law, my brother, ex-fiance.  My fondest childhood memories are of my father cooking up huge breakfasts on the weekends.  To this day, he is known for his breakfast feasts.  My hips are now paying the price.

Who knew that men in the kitchen would be such a "security blanket" for me!?  At any rate, there was something so comforting for me to see/feel this today at JFY.  

Aside from the testosterone element in the kitchen, in case you weren't aware, I LOVE BEIGNETS.  And when I say LOVE beignets, I really mean, "will-fly-to-Cafe-du-Monde-on-a-whim-for-some-beignets" kind of LOVE.  And, with no pending trips to the Big Easy anytime soon, these beignets will suit me just fine. Lovely texture, perfectly sized, not too greasy, not too dough-y.  

Other than that, service is kinda spotty - not consistent.  Plus, I don't really like having to ask for more water and coffee, esp. when I'm at the counter facing you.  I appreciate the very cool vintage decor and the convenience of an ATM in the neighboring liquor store.  My other favorite here: the cornmeal pancakes.  Reasonable prices and I appreciate the menu selections - not too overwhelming, but great variety for breakfast/brunch/lunch.  Nice, hearty diner which every decent neighborhood needs.

This is the perfect place for hangover grub - well, I haven't been hungover in a looong time, but from what I remember... wait, I actually can't remember.  You'll just have to take my word for it!

excerpts: Once seated, we couldn't resist ordering the beignets which turned out to be a great idea.
How can you go wrong with fried dough topped with powdered sugar?
All egg dishes come with home fries or grits, and your choice of home baked white, whole wheat, or cinnamon-raisin toast, biscuits, cornbread or scone.
I had the Greg's Scramble (eggs and spinach and Parmesan cheese) with ground beef - very flavorsome and served with outstanding home fries.
A return trip to
Just For
You is a must!
beignets.author: Miriam W.
beignets.review:
After becoming used to the hour-long waits at places like Mama's on Washington Square and Dottie's True Blue Cafe, the wait at Just For You is easily palatable. Once seated, we couldn't resist ordering the beignets which turned out to be a great idea. How can you go wrong with fried dough topped with powdered sugar? All egg dishes come with home fries or grits, and your choice of home baked white, whole wheat, or cinnamon-raisin toast, biscuits, cornbread or scone. 

I had the Greg's Scramble (eggs and spinach and Parmesan cheese) with ground beef - very flavorsome and served with outstanding home fries. 

A return trip to Just For You is a must!

excerpts: You'll definitely need to try the Beignets, these fluffy overly dusted with powdered sugar are some yummy goodness.
beignets.author: ERICA G.
beignets.review:
In the mood for some home style cooking, then this is one of the places to visit in SF.  You'll definitely need to try the Beignets, these fluffy overly dusted with powdered sugar are some yummy goodness.    

The food isn't amazing, but it's good and the prices aren't too bad,  However, the OJ is a bit over  priced at $4.75/glass, it better be supersized.  I tried the cornbeef hash, which was lacking a bit of flavor, sprinkled a little salt, much better.  My partner in crime, chomped on the Two Eggs Any Style w/ Longanisa (Filipino sausage, hard to find)...being part Filipino, I'm a sucker and will give you an extra star for that!  

The place is small which I'm ok with, if you're from SF or have lived in SF for a while, you know to expect small restaurants, so I really can't complain about that.  The server was ok, but the delivery of our food was quick.  

Overall, not bad, but not sure why the wait or 4-stars.  I may need to go back and try something different.  But with brunch running later than most SF spots, quick service and decent food, you can't go wrong, especially a Beignet!

excerpts: The exception was the Beignets and the La Monde Chicory coffee.
Big portions.
beignets.author: Carol M.
beignets.review: Stood in line for a long time for a pretty good but not fantastic breakfast.  The exception was the Beignets and the La Monde Chicory coffee.   Big portions.

excerpts: We had the creole crab cake and eggs, beignets, and hang time omelette.
All delicious and great service!
Definitely going back and recommending to others!
beignets.author: Dre H.
beignets.review: We had the creole crab cake and eggs, beignets, and hang time omelette. All delicious and great service! Definitely going back and recommending to others!

excerpts: Tried the delicious beignets that my friend had been raving about.
I've had a few other dishes like a veggie scramble
beignets.author: Yvonne Q.
beignets.review:
Food is good. Service is ok. As with most places you've got your good servers, and then the servers that check up on you 15-20 minutes after you've been sitting there or just simply are not very attentive to your needs. I've had my share of both at this place.

That said, the food is good and worth the price. Tried the delicious beignets that my friend had been raving about. I've had a few other dishes like a veggie scramble and I left satisfied and  a sandwich.

It definitely deserves the popularity it has accrued.

excerpts: The beignets are little soft pillows of happiness.
It is everything good in the world.
beignets.author: Hetal S.
beignets.review: The beignets are little soft pillows of happiness. It is everything good in the world.

excerpts: The daily specials are always fantastic and you've got to try the beignets and the mimosa's, which are 95% booze and served in a pint glass.
Great servers too and a low key atmosphere.
A favorite in the Dogpatch.
beignets.author: Jeff C.
beignets.review: The beauty of Just for You is that everything is focused on the quality of the ingredients. The daily specials are always fantastic and you've got to try the beignets and the mimosa's, which are 95% booze and served in a pint glass. Great servers too and a low key atmosphere. A favorite in the Dogpatch.

excerpts: I haven't tried their beignets which everyone is raving about, so perhaps my rating will increase to 4 stars after I try that.
beignets.author: トモ T.
beignets.review: A good breakfast/brunch place with good food, but there are many other places that offer a better brunch.  As an example, Aperto, which is nearby, had much more to offer.  Therefore, I didn't understand the wait.  Some of the positives:  free coffee while you wait, good home fries, plenty of parking, and good service.  I had their "Greg's Scramble" which was pretty good, but a little too much half cooked onions.  I haven't tried their beignets which everyone is raving about, so perhaps my rating will increase to 4 stars after I try that.

excerpts: , I find a great breakfast place with these terrific beignets which I stuff with raspberry jam that's on the table and all of a sudden
I'm a (happy) hot mess, snowing my powdered sugar all over my zucchini and mushroom scramble.
I'm addicted to this place
and I've gotta stop cold turkey.
They don't serve turkey
'cause it's breakfast/lunch
, I managed to get 2 beignets, a 3 egg scramble, a giant piece of corn bread with warm butter and grits
and I'm counting down the hours till I can do it again.
beignets.author: Jessica K.
beignets.review:
Anonymous woman, let's call her Carol: Thanks for calling Jenny Craig, this is Carol. How can I help you?

Me: Um, hi Carol, I have a problem.

Carol: Well, I'm sorry to hear that. What exactly is it?

Me: I'm addicted to food. Mainly breakfast foods. 

Carol: Well, again I'm sorry to hear you have a problem. That's what we're here for-to help.

Me: Great. 'cause I want to go back to eating really awesome breakfast food but I'm afraid if I eat it everyday, I'll take it for granted and that can't happen. If you guys put me on some diet plan, I'll get thin again and then I can go back to eating my at my favorite breakfast place.

Carol: Well, that's not exactly what we're here for...

Me: I know, I know, but here me out. my waistline is expanding and just went I'm starting to go on a diet, I find a great breakfast place with these terrific beignets which I stuff with raspberry jam that's on the table and all of a sudden I'm a (happy) hot mess, snowing my powdered sugar all over my zucchini and mushroom scramble. I'm addicted to this place and I've gotta stop cold turkey. They don't serve turkey 'cause it's breakfast/lunch but they've got a badass line of daily specials which I bet could involve turkey one day.

Carol: Ummmm...

Me: I know, speechless right? They're usually super busy but I got in for a late brunch on a Sunday and they were so terrific, I managed to get 2 beignets, a 3 egg scramble, a giant piece of corn bread with warm butter and grits and I'm counting down the hours till I can do it again. I have a serious problem.

Carol: ...

Me: You wanna come with me tomorrow? You'll see what the problem is and you can correctly assess the situation then. I'm telling you, this place is addictive but the parking situation isn't bad at all so I'll pick you up. 

Carol: ...I um, huh?

It's okay. You'll like it. How could you not?

excerpts:
I'm a total dick about any restaurant offering southern specialties like grits or beignets (being from the south, and all that).  

Beignets were unexpectedly huge, but still fluffy and delicious, and the grits were completely unmolested and yummy.
beignets.author: Mark B.
beignets.review:
My friends an I spent about an hour waiting outside in 44 degree rain.

We loved it.

Great food, all the way 'round... and great service to boot.  I'm a total dick about any restaurant offering southern specialties like grits or beignets (being from the south, and all that).  

Beignets were unexpectedly huge, but still fluffy and delicious, and the grits were completely unmolested and yummy.  

If you aren't from the south, here's what goes with your grits: butter, salt, pepper... and perhaps mixing that together with your eggs.  Period.  It's a freakin' starch to be treated like potatoes.  No syrup.  No sugar.  It's not cream-of-friggin'-wheat.  If I sit next to you and you mix something sweet with your grits, expect to get a boot to your head, Yankee.

JFY doesn't mix in cheese or anything else with their grits.  Congrats.  It's not polenta... it's grits.  They get it :-)

Totally worth the wait, even in the rain. One of the best brunches I've had in SF to date,  Oh, did I mention the $8 mimosa pint?

excerpts: Like everyone else has suggested.. BEIGNETS!
They make it to order.
It comes out fresh, crispy on the outside, heavily snowed with power sugar, airy on the inside with a touch of buttery yumness.

thumbs up: beignets, po boys, the people,
thumbs down: it can get busy
beignets.author: Lauren Y.
beignets.review:
Like everyone else has suggested.. BEIGNETS! They make it to order. It comes out fresh, crispy on the outside, heavily snowed with power sugar, airy on the inside with a touch of buttery yumness. mmm!

I ordered the Fried Oyster Po' Boy cause a review said it was scrumptious.. and it is... especially during Oyster season. 

Everything is fresh.. the bread, lettuce, tomato, seafood. Waiters and waitresses are friendly and welcoming.

thumbs up: beignets, po boys, the people,
thumbs down: it can get busy

excerpts: The table to my left had the beignets and a hamburger, both which got rave reviews as well.
Can't wait to quench my appetite here again.
beignets.author: Jennifer L.
beignets.review: Right after traveling through a sea of industrial buildings, there lies a cute and hip restaurant.  My driver had told me that the fish tacos were amazing, and they sure looked good, but I couldn't resist the special.  Spicy chicken fried chicken with sausage gravy, mashed potatoes and a side salad.  Amazing.  The table to my left had the beignets and a hamburger, both which got rave reviews as well.  Can't wait to quench my appetite here again.

excerpts: Beignets, beignets, beignets!
Fresh homemade bread and pretty much fresh everything.
Staff is excellent.
Will definitely not disappoint!
beignets.author: Ty H.
beignets.review: Beignets, beignets, beignets! Fresh homemade bread and pretty much fresh everything. Staff is excellent. Will definitely not disappoint!

excerpts: We saw the menu and yelp reviews and were sold by the beignets.
The beignets were very tasty and much bigger than the ones you get at Cafe Du Monde.
beignets.author: Caroline L.
beignets.review:
We came here because our out-of-town friend wanted to eat eggs. I said every brunch spot will most likely be packed and we'll have to wait an hour. Especially since it was warm out. I also wanted to try a new spot. We saw the menu and yelp reviews and were sold by the beignets. 

We waited a long time. Not quite sure how long, but it felt like 45 minutes. I guess the trick is to put your name down and stroll over to the DogPatch Saloon for a drink and come back. We saw several people doing this, although one group totally lost their spot when their name was called and they were nowhere to be found. I don't get why this place draws groups of 5-8 but it took forever for us to get seated. It normally is not a big deal, but our friend had to catch a flight. 

The menu has options galore. Every imaginable breakfast/brunch item is on here. That made it hard for me to choose. The beignets were very tasty and much bigger than the ones you get at Cafe Du Monde. I give them 5 stars for these.

The rest of my food was not so great. It was partly my fault for rushing and ordering their veggie hash omelette. The filling was sweet potato, bell peppers, swiss cheese and onions. I also ordered their biscuits. The portion is so big here. Eating sweet potato and then regular home fried potatoes and biscuits were a carb overload. There was just way too much sweet potato and not enough of the other vegetables. It was a big pile of sweet potato. 

I definitely want to come back and try other items on the menu, but will definitely steer clear away from this veggie hash. Totally not what I expected.

excerpts: My friend mentioned beignets and everything else in life just didn't matter anymore.
We ordered the 3/$4.
I hadn't had beignets since I went to New Orleans a few years ago.
I asked the waitress if she recommended the homemade turkey sausage patty or the chicken apple
Anyway, she brought out 2 beignets covered in powered sugar.
They looked like pillows of powdery goodness - I wanted to lay my head down on them.
Then our waitress comes back a couple minutes later and says, "You ordered 3 beignets?
Well, I didn't know that you could order them individually?!
I liked the atmosphere and will go back for beignets.
Oh yes.
The 4-star rating is for their beignets.
Food I would give like 2 stars.
beignets.author: Ming-Jou C.
beignets.review:
Just for You was just so cute. My friend mentioned beignets and everything else in life just didn't matter anymore. We ordered the 3/$4. I hadn't had beignets since I went to New Orleans a few years ago. I asked the waitress if she recommended the homemade turkey sausage patty or the chicken apple and she said she didn't eat meat. 

Rather than go into a whole discussion about whether or not she didn't eat it for religious, health or PETA reasons, I left well enough alone. But I still wonder how you can serve something you've never eaten. What if it tastes like crap? Can you still hand someone crap? I guess so.

Anyway, she brought out 2 beignets covered in powered sugar. They looked like pillows of powdery goodness - I wanted to lay my head down on them. Then our waitress comes back a couple minutes later and says, "You ordered 3 beignets?" Well, I didn't know that you could order them individually?! It's 3/$4! Sheesh.

They were great and I really just didn't care about the rest of my breakfast after that. I wanted to order about a dozen more to go, but knew that they probably wouldn't be good unless they were blazing hot. I ended up getting the turkey apple sausage, which was a bit on the dry side, but flavorful. My eggs were eggs, cornbread was whatever, and I'm not a fan of homefries, but they were decent. I liked the atmosphere and will go back for beignets. Oh yes. The 4-star rating is for their beignets. Food I would give like 2 stars. So maybe I should average to 3? 

NOTE: They're not Chinese, but it's CASH ONLY!

excerpts: They've got awesome breakfast food like grits, omelets, grits, pancakes, grits, beignets, grits, etc...
Oh, and I definitely recommend the grits.
beignets.author: Ivan L.
beignets.review:
Really fantastic food with funky retro ambiance.  

I like this place!  The walls are covered in 60's psychedelia posters advertising local music.  It's really fun to check out what's hanging.

The food is pretty phenomenal.  They've got awesome breakfast food like grits, omelets, grits, pancakes, grits, beignets, grits, etc...  Oh, and I definitely recommend the grits.

excerpts: The Beignets (about $4) are donuts with a layer of powdered sugar.
I was a bit disappointed that they came out AFTER our actual food had, but that didn't stop us from eating them.
They were great.
Soft and moist and obviously very very sweet.
beignets.author: Mariko F.
beignets.review:
After a work mate and fellow yelper pointed this place out to me, I just had to go. He said that it was so good that he went a few times a month!

I wasn't the least bit disappointed. After getting there a bit on the late side (around 11:30am on a Saturday) we were surprised to find that we could get a table for 4 in about 10 minutes! And the place isn't big. Sure, it's not as small as you would think at first glance, as there are a few extra tables in the back that you can't see from the outside, but it's still not big. Nonetheless, I was surprised to get a table so fast because there was  small crowd gathered outside, waiting to try out Just For You. 

Eventhough the (probably new) hostess had very little idea what she was doing, we found our table and the waiter came by quickly and took our drink orders. It was crowded we were still about to place our orders in about 7min, and our food was out in about 20min after sitting down. 

I had Greg's Scramble with Chorizo (about $9). It was amazing. If you haven't been here before, seriously, start with this. You don't have to get it with Chorizo as there are tons of options, ranging from spinach and mushroom to all sorts of meats. It was fantastic. Oh wait, I said that already. It doesn't matter. It's was brilliant. Other people wanted by food. 

Skip the grits and go with the home fries. Ok, maybe I'm a bit bias as I don't really like grits, but the home fries are fantastic. 

The Beignets (about $4) are donuts with a layer of powdered sugar. I was a bit disappointed that they came out AFTER our actual food had, but that didn't stop us from eating them. They were great. Soft and moist and obviously very very sweet. I would ask to make sure that they come before because they would definitely relax your palette a bit before your real food.  

All in all, Just For You is fantastic and I can't wait to go again!

Note that they accept CASH ONLY.

excerpts: Beignets, Beignets, Beignets.
Light, Crispy and COVERED with powdered sugar...
A great start to a yummy brunch!
Came here with some good friends and we definitely had some awesome conversation starters about this place.
For instance, the posters around the walls were awesome!
Check out the poster of the pink Power Ranger.
Her name was Kim (thanks, Kimmie for the quick trip back into time!).
Anyhoo, yes, the beignets were great.
The mimosas were served in a pint glass to the brim and the coffee stayed warm and refilled.
beignets.author: Jennifer L.
beignets.review:
Beignets, Beignets, Beignets.  Light, Crispy and COVERED with powdered sugar...A great start to a yummy brunch!  Came here with some good friends and we definitely had some awesome conversation starters about this place.  For instance, the posters around the walls were awesome!  Check out the poster of the pink Power Ranger.  Her name was Kim (thanks, Kimmie for the quick trip back into time!).  Best of all was the poster announcing the Alcatraz reunion (Sad that I missed that one!).   

Anyhoo, yes, the beignets were great.  The mimosas were served in a pint glass to the brim and the coffee stayed warm and refilled.  To top it all off, service was friendly, even in the midst of all the hustle and bustle during a Sunday brunch rush (say that 5 times in a row!). 

I had the Frittata of the Decade.  Wow...flavors were bursting!  Zucchini, mushrooms, onions, garlic, cheese...I would've liked the eggs a bit more fluffy, but nonetheless, it was good.  The side of grits was good too: add some butter, salt and pepper.  Oh, and throw in some pieces of Chicken Apple Sausage (or bacon for that matter) and you're golden!

The chili scramble was massive.  The cornbread was moist (mm...moist...) and thick...A good hearty meal!  

Just For You Cafe is not for bird-eaters...it's quite a heavy brunch, so prepare beforehand and wear your best stretchy pants!

excerpts: Ordinarily I LOVE their beignets
but I'm guessing since they were so busy (and possibly understaffed, I only saw two people in the kitchen) they were not paying attention to how long they were cooking.
I definitely know they were not cooked long enough or the oil was way too hot - raw in the middle!!!
No Bueno, definitely not okay, hence the bump down to three stars.
However, they were very understanding, comped us the cost of the beignets, and made us a few more fresh ones (more cooked through but still obviously yeasty in the middle).
I'll still come back, but probably during my usual time, when they're not busy.
Make sure you rip one of the beignets open and check to make sure it's not raw if you come here for them!
beignets.author: Rhea S.
beignets.review: I've been here a few times, usually during an off hour when they're not too busy - and during those times, the food is absolutely wonderful. Totally defines 'comfort food'. However, today I came in and they were a little more busy - the main entree I bought was okay, but the bigness, not so much. Ordinarily I LOVE their beignets but I'm guessing since they were so busy (and possibly understaffed, I only saw two people in the kitchen) they were not paying attention to how long they were cooking. I definitely know they were not cooked long enough or the oil was way too hot - raw in the middle!!! No Bueno, definitely not okay, hence the bump down to three stars. However, they were very understanding, comped us the cost of the beignets, and made us a few more fresh ones (more cooked through but still obviously yeasty in the middle). I'll still come back, but probably during my usual time, when they're not busy. Make sure you rip one of the beignets open and check to make sure it's not raw if you come here for them!

excerpts: The beignets were huge...compared to the ones I've had before in NOLA...but they lived up to the hype.
They have some outdoor sitting and it seemed pretty easy to park around that area.
Would definitely recommend it.
beignets.author: George M.
beignets.review: quirky menu, but everything was delicious. The beignets were huge...compared to the ones I've had before in NOLA...but they lived up to the hype. They have some outdoor sitting and it seemed pretty easy to park around that area. Would definitely recommend it.

excerpts: 5 stars all for one thing: BEIGNETS!
Just go to this place for the beignets!
They are sooo delicious!
You can order three in an order or just one (but I dont see why anyone would just order one), and I seriously can eat all three by myself, in less than 5 minutes!
They are that good!
So go!
Go to
Just For
You Cafe and order the beignets.
And think of me, yours truly, while you are indulging in heaven on earth.
beignets.author: Cheryl S.
beignets.review:
5 stars all for one thing: BEIGNETS!

Just go to this place for the beignets! They are sooo delicious! You can order three in an order or just one (but I dont see why anyone would just order one), and I seriously can eat all three by myself, in less than 5 minutes! They are that good! So go! Go to Just For You Cafe and order the beignets. And think of me, yours truly, while you are indulging in heaven on earth.

excerpts: And, of course, we ordered beignets for the table.
Our beignets didn't come out until after our brunch entrees (we had to remind the busboy) which was a bummer since we were hoping to dig into those before our entrees arrived.
With both appetizer and entree at the table, it was tough to decide which food item should get cold.
For the most part, it was the beignets - Sandy H. prodded us into eating as many beignets as we could before they got cold.
Too late.
The couple of bites of hot beignet that I had were good, but they weren't the delicious, melt-in-your-mouth ones that I remember from New Orleans.
But, alas, this is San Francisco, not New Orleans.
beignets.author: Wendy L.
beignets.review:
My friends and I are brunch people; we like brunch and, for a while, we kept going back to our favorite stand-bys.  No longer, we are on the hunt for new brunch spots...

Just For You came up as a top pick, so even though it was a bit out of the way for us, we got there very early to beat the crowd (and boy was there a crowd as we were leaving).  The place is pretty small - probably seating 20-25 people max.  We didn't have to wait too long (even after having our name called without the entire party being there - we were next on the list), but we got there at around 10:45 (practically breakfast time).  

I was STARVING by the time we sat down, and I made a beeline for the savory menu items.  There were a few specials (an eggs bene and a few other items), but the Mexican menu items - breakfast burrito and huevos rancheros - called to me.  I couldn't decide, so the waiter suggested I get the huevos rancheros because the spicy red meat sauce was delicious.  And, of course, we ordered beignets for the table.

Our beignets didn't come out until after our brunch entrees (we had to remind the busboy) which was a bummer since we were hoping to dig into those before our entrees arrived.  With both appetizer and entree at the table, it was tough to decide which food item should get cold.  For the most part, it was the beignets - Sandy H. prodded us into eating as many beignets as we could before they got cold.  Too late.  :(  The couple of bites of hot beignet that I had were good, but they weren't the delicious, melt-in-your-mouth ones that I remember from New Orleans.  But, alas, this is San Francisco, not New Orleans.  I enjoyed my huevos rancheros - can't say I'm a huevos rancheros expert but the spicy red meat sauce was very tasty.  

We got an unfortunate table in the back of the restaurant between the kitchen and the front of the restaurant and right next to a loud ice machine and soda refrigerator.  Not ideal, but not a real ding in my book - but if you're picky about that kind of stuff, you may want to let them know.

If this place was around the corner from me, I'd probably be a regular because despite the mediocre to average service, the food was solid and the prices were reasonable (brunch with coffee came to ~$12 including tax and tip).

excerpts: The beignets were piping hot, and the closest thing to eating a loaf of donut-bread as you'll get to experience in this lifetime.
beignets.author: daniel v.
beignets.review:
I went here for the first time with two other (hungover) people on a busy Saturday morning.  We must have arrived during a lull in the morning rush, as we only had to wait about 5 minutes before we were seated.

Our waiter was dressed in an outfit that I would imagine a Court Jester might wear, but he was super nice and prompt.  I don't generally have impressively high standards for food, but when our dishes arrived, the breakfast was nothing short of amazing.  The beignets were piping hot, and the closest thing to eating a loaf of donut-bread as you'll get to experience in this lifetime.

excerpts: From their coffee to their beignets, everything was good.
beignets.author: Patrick S.
beignets.review: Favorite brunch place in the Dogpatch.  From their coffee to their beignets, everything was good.

excerpts: We also had grits, HOMEMADE cinnamon raisin toast (of which I got a loaf to go), biscuits, and we had no room for the Beignets unfortunately...
beignets.author: Joshua K.
beignets.review:
Mexican food in San Francisco?  Outside of Mission district?  Impossible you say?  I found a Chorizo breakfast burrito worthy of adding to any "best of" list for Mx food.  I am so glad we went there today.  I have been missing San Diego's scene for a couple weeks now, and I've been forced to cook my own stuff-- which is delicious, but takes a lot of work.  Who's got the time to be awesome in the kitchen when kids are hitting each other and jumping off the counters?

Just me sometimes.  But, I am always in the mood to find the satisfaction only a burrito can often provide.  I had no idea I'd find it at this artsy looking place in a quiet neighborhood so close to 3rd st.  Gladness.  Tastiness!  More awesomeness.  

The burrito looked actually small when she first gave it to me, but at first bite I knew it would be a challenge to finish it, and I almost lost the game.  But, it was so good I would have been sad to leave it on the plate.  Luckily everything went so swimmingly well together, that I enjoyed every last morsel while I suffered the pangs of over filling my stomach.  

Taste:  Chorizo was nice and flavorful, not too spicy, not too greazy.  Went very well with the fluffy scrambled eggs, salty black beans, jalapeño salsa, lots of real cheddar cheese, and a just-under cooked tortilla (sometimes that works well.)  Good flavors all around melded together to be a whopping bonanza of balance and each bite led me into deeper territory within my own appetite, I was actually scared to go there.  We made it out alive.  

Decor:  Top notch kitsch and rock stardom.  All kinds of colors added to the snarkiness of the quotes all over the place and theme of the artwork.  

Environment: Nice natural light entered through the bay windows, so bright that some ladies who looked like real housewives of New Mexico kept their sunglasses on the whole time.  The staff were all very nice and knowledge filled.  Low levels on the music, but I could feel the bass in my face.  

Food:  Yum.  We also had grits, HOMEMADE cinnamon raisin toast (of which I got a loaf to go), biscuits, and we had no room for the Beignets unfortunately...

All in all:  more than five stars.  I will be back.  No dinner though, yet...

excerpts: My friends, on the other hand, really enjoyed their breakfast choices... and I did like the beignets!
beignets.author: Gretchen S.
beignets.review:
I really wanted to like this place.  I really did.

However, searching for a vegetarian brunch, I chose to go with the veggie burrito.  I thought it would come with all the standard burrito items - beans, cheese, rice, etc. + the veggies listed on the menu.  That was just not the case - it came with a ton of sour cream and not much else.  Honestly terrible food.

My friends, on the other hand, really enjoyed their breakfast choices... and I did like the beignets!  

Should I give it another shot?  Or is it just not for me?

excerpts: Therefore, I was undoubtedly excited to come here especially since I've been jonesin' for some beignets!
Obviously, we started off with the beignets which were of course smothered with powdered sugar, but were also swimming in a pool of butter, which I did not like so much,.
I know not exciting, but remember we had some beignets
so I was a little full.
Also, at our table was the tofu scramble which look amazing.
My grits were pretty basic, but very creamy.
And as for my biscuit it was very fluffy, but not crispy enough for me, think it should have been in the oven a little longer.
Overall, I liked this place
not loved it
but I am definitely willing to come back to try other thing on the menu like the fritatta or breakfast
burrito because I saw other people eating that it looked delicious!
beignets.author: Molly M.
beignets.review:
I'm determined to try every soul food/comfort food joint in the City and Just For You is a place that's been on my list for awhile.  Therefore, I was undoubtedly excited to come here especially since I've been jonesin' for some beignets!  Obviously, we started off with the beignets which were of course smothered with powdered sugar, but were also swimming in a pool of butter, which I did not like so much,.  However, they were still yummy, but its kinda hard to f%*k up something fried.

Before going on about the food I want to comment on the vibe, very cool, laid back, local feel.  It kinda felt like I was somewhere in new Orleans, perhaps Magazine street.  The service was efficient enough, not great but OK.  One of the girls working there never smiled which made me a little uneasy.,

Moving on, I got the grits with biscuit and fruit.  I know not exciting, but remember we had some beignets so I was a little full.  Also, at our table was the tofu scramble which look amazing.  My grits were pretty basic, but very creamy.  And as for my biscuit it was very fluffy, but not crispy enough for me, think it should have been in the oven a little longer.  Overall, I liked this place not loved it but I am definitely willing to come back to try other thing on the menu like the fritatta or breakfast burrito because I saw other people eating that it looked delicious!

excerpts: Beignets!
They are so good here
that when I went to New Orleans, I was a little disappointed.
Seriously...
Cafe du Monde does NOT compare.
I recommend egg dishes, biscuits, obviously beignets, the chicken apple sausage, and pancakes.
I am a huge brunch fan
and I'd come here all the time if I lived closer.
Sometimes there's a little bit of a wait, but I recommend waiting, and that's coming from a very impatient person.
Do yourself a favor and come here immediately.
beignets.author: Julia D.
beignets.review:
Beignets!  They are so good here that when I went to New Orleans, I was a little disappointed.  Seriously...Cafe du Monde does NOT compare.  They are light and fluffy and covered in piles of powdered sugar--sort of messy.

The staff here is on their game, and they had a Scoutmob coupon for 50% off, which was excellent.  I recommend egg dishes, biscuits, obviously beignets, the chicken apple sausage, and pancakes.  I am a huge brunch fan and I'd come here all the time if I lived closer.  Sometimes there's a little bit of a wait, but I recommend waiting, and that's coming from a very impatient person.  Do yourself a favor and come here immediately.

excerpts: The beignets here are worth the wait.
beignets.author: Athena S.
beignets.review:
AH - Just for you?  No! JUST FOR ME!!

The beignets here are worth the wait.

Then again, so are the pancakes - 

And the veggie omelets - 

Oh, and the BOMB Crab omletes!!!

So, Please, I implore: don't go here.  I tend to think I don't need any more people ahead of me in line next time the beignet craving kicks in.  :)

excerpts: I like their cowgirl, cowboy, egg benedicts, beignets.
Their coffee is okay but not to die for.
I bring people here and none ever had anything bad to say.
Five stars.
beignets.author: Kelly M.
beignets.review: My favorite spot for brunch.  Like anywhere else in the city there's always a bit of a wait but they serve you coffee while you're waiting and the line moves pretty fast.  This place and the crowd don't feel pretentious.  It has that diner feel with excellent food.  They come in decent portions and are served fast.  The wait staff is always helpful.  I like their cowgirl, cowboy, egg benedicts, beignets.  Their coffee is okay but not to die for.  I bring people here and none ever had anything bad to say.  Five stars.

excerpts: I love me some beignets...
I hadn't had one in a WHILE and was pleasantly surprised by this little gem on the menu.
We decided to split an order of three, yummy yummy.
I loved the light fluffiness.
I even ate the whole thing!
Yes, they're huge...
beignets.author: Isabella O.
beignets.review:
Oohhh... this is the place to BE when a hangover strikes.  Hello rainy Sunday morning filled with a headache and nausea!  My friends and I decided to stay in bed until later in the afternoon... around 2PM, a little late for breakfast? Yes.  The place was jam packed, but the wait wasn't too bad - around 15 minutes.

The foods:

Beignet: Oohhhhh wassup! I love me some beignets... I hadn't had one in a WHILE and was pleasantly surprised by this little gem on the menu.  We decided to split an order of three, yummy yummy.  I loved the light fluffiness. I even ate the whole thing! Yes, they're huge... don't you judge me.

Greg's Scramble with chicken apple sausage: Mm Mm... I got this with the home fries.  This was hearty.  I liked how sweet the sausage was, especially with the cheese on top.  I would definitely get this again, maybe even with a different meat option.  OH! I got it with a biscuit... strike that, this ish comes with 2 biscuits!  These were definitely AMAZE, especially with the preserves on the table...

Overall:  Hell yeah, whenever I'm in the Dogpatch (and the previous night was ROUGH) I'll be here in the afternoon having my breakfast and wearing my sunglasses.

excerpts: We tried the beignets which would have been spectacular if it were a little less greasy.
The eggs Benedict was...
Ok...
Where ever I go
I try the eggs Benedict because it reminds me of home with my family, this one didn't quite bring me home.
It was served on bread instead of English muffins, which would have been a great twist on the eggs Benedict if there were something great about the bread.
My son had pancakes which he enjoyed.
He's four.
I felt bad for the server because he was running around like crazy.
It adds a different feel to your experience when your watching someone run through the service.
We didn't get a chance to ask for more napkins, (again, we were eating with a four year old.
Napkins are essential.) or another roll up.
I don't see myself coming here again.
beignets.author: Joann V.
beignets.review: The location is in a cute neighborhood, a mix between industrial and residential. It has a rustic feel and a strong art interior. The food was ok. We tried the beignets which would have been spectacular if it were a little less greasy. The eggs Benedict was... Ok... Where ever I go I try the eggs Benedict because it reminds me of home with my family, this one didn't quite bring me home. It was served on bread instead of English muffins, which would have been a great twist on the eggs Benedict if there were something great about the bread. My son had pancakes which he enjoyed. He's four. I felt bad for the server because he was running around like crazy. It adds a different feel to your experience when your watching someone run through the service. We didn't get a chance to ask for more napkins, (again, we were eating with a four year old. Napkins are essential.) or another roll up. I don't see myself coming here again.

excerpts: I got the chili and scrambled eggs, and the GF goes for the huevos rancheros, and since this place claims to be "the best beignets in the city", we ordered 2 for desert (or is it dessert?)
Finally, after feeling like we're going to explode, we remembered our beignets... should left some room, but then again, Im'a trooper!
So we got our beignets, super fresh and moist from the kitchen!
There was plenty of powdered sugar, so additional toppings are purely gratuitous...
so I added a bit of maple syrup... and
then... AWESOME!
After that, I was done...
beignets.author: Jo R.
beignets.review:
Alright... knockin' off the dust on my keyboard and brain, I thought I should do a couple of reviews! I been eatin' here and there, and one of the most recent joints was Good For Your Cafe, and I DID NOT leave unsatisfied! 

Me and the GF wanted some breakfast and wanted to try to hit up a new place, so a friend / fellow foodie suggested this cafe, said it was "hella good". We found it pretty easily and with parking right in front (it was 730am, so naturally we were the early birds, no lines, no wait, smooth service). So we get in, sit down, and READ the menu, while at the same time wiping off the drool that would fall onto the menu. The menu is extensive and very appetizing to read. After a few minutes of, "what do you think?", "I dunno...?", and "this or that?", we finally made our decisions. 

I got the chili and scrambled eggs, and the GF goes for the huevos rancheros, and since this place claims to be "the best beignets in the city", we ordered 2 for desert (or is it dessert?) Both dishes were plentiful, no need to eat more than your share, lest you plan to roll out in a wheelchair. 

So I get my dish and dig in... awesome! The chili is beefy with the right amount of tang and a little spice. Underneath the chili was chopped onion, and then the scrambled egg, which was seasoned just right, and with perfect fluff. Then there was the cheese melted all over, which was good enough to make the dish dee-lish (I mean who doesn't love cheese, right?). However, what really brought the dish together and put on another level to set it apart from all other scrambled egg dishes, was the homemade cornbread lying underneath this savory concoction! The cornbread was fresh, fluffy, and sweet, which worked as the perfect companion with the tangy and subtle spice of the chili. The entire dish reacts wonderfully together, and if left me full and ready for a nap (I normally don't wake up this early). 

The GF's plate, the huevos rancheros was also well done. The sauce that went with the eggs had just the right spice, no need for Tabasco with that sauce! However, the tortilla didn't really do much for the plate, and of course you need a tortilla for a plate like this if you plan on calling it "huevos rancheros", but then again I am being bias in my assessment. What can I say, I grew up on homemade huevos rancheros by a Latina mother. Either way, both dishes were great. 

Finally, after feeling like we're going to explode, we remembered our beignets... should left some room, but then again, Im'a trooper! So we got our beignets, super fresh and moist from the kitchen! There was plenty of powdered sugar, so additional toppings are purely gratuitous... so I added a bit of maple syrup... and then... AWESOME! After that, I was done... D-U-N-N! 

So, as you can see, I was blown away by the food. Now a quick word on the environs of the joint. The place is decorated with a homely feel. The walls were colored in light beige. And there were also framed posters from what appeared to be the owner's favorite movies. They had one of Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid, and another one of Clint Eastwood's western movies, and other assorted prints.  However, like most breakfast/brunch joints in the city, they're small, so no reservations, just long lines.  So if you want to be able to get in and relax and enjoy individual service, get in EARLY!!!!

excerpts: Excellent beignets.
They are hot, light and fluffy, unlike at Brenda's where they're actually quite hard.
(Sorry Brenda, I still love you guys.)
Their free, fresh, home-made strawberry jam at every table also goes well with the beignets.
Everything else, however, is just mediocre.
(Actually, my poached eggs were below mediocre since they were both overcooked.)
On the bright side, huge portions.
beignets.author: Jonas T.
beignets.review: Excellent beignets. They are hot, light and fluffy, unlike at Brenda's where they're actually quite hard. (Sorry Brenda, I still love you guys.) Their free, fresh, home-made strawberry jam at every table also goes well with the beignets. Everything else, however, is just mediocre. (Actually, my poached eggs were below mediocre since they were both overcooked.) On the bright side, huge portions.

excerpts: The beignets smelled of stale oil and were a little dry.
The eggs were underdone, oily, and again smelt of stale oil.
