The chicken apple sausage was burnt, tasted a little odd, and
after encountering a big piece of bone/gristle I gave up.
The home fries were undercooked (the potato was still hard) and again the nasty stale oil smell and taste.
beignets.author: Paul F.
beignets.review:
Reading down all the raving reviews here I wonder whether I was just here on an off day or something.

Firstly, the service was great, and the environment is fun. But, the food was really poor. The beignets smelled of stale oil and were a little dry. The eggs were underdone, oily, and again smelt of stale oil. The chicken apple sausage was burnt, tasted a little odd, and after encountering a big piece of bone/gristle I gave up. The home fries were undercooked (the potato was still hard) and again the nasty stale oil smell and taste. Finally the toast was really, really, dry, as if it had been sitting around for hours and just retoasted.

I really want to give this place another try, because it does have a lot of things right, but I'd need the memory of the very poor food to fade first.

excerpts: The beignets, smoked salmon omelet, Eggs benedict over crab cakes were delicious.
Had my first taste of grits with butter and they were good too.
beignets.author: AndyBoy V.
beignets.review: The beignets, smoked salmon omelet, Eggs benedict over crab cakes were delicious. Had my first taste of grits with butter and they were good too.

excerpts: Homemade breads and the beignets...
oh my those beignets.
beignets.author: Darin A.
beignets.review:
This place defines brunch. If you're an SF brunch person, then you already know this place. Homemade breads and the beignets...oh my those beignets.

Come on over, put your name on the clipboard, grab a cup of joe and enjoy the neighborhood. See you on the weekend.

excerpts: The service is excellent, the beignets are what they're known for, and the decor makes you feel oh so happy inside.
beignets.author: Kerry Z.
beignets.review:
This place is the cutest little dine-in cafe in the Dogpatch. The service is excellent, the beignets are what they're known for, and the decor makes you feel oh so happy inside. 

Oh and the coffee being free is a HUGE +

excerpts: I recommend the beignets, mimosas and convincing the person you are dining with to order two other dishes and share them family style.
Its even better, when you can convince them to order two things that YOU really want i.e. buttermilk pancakes and eggs bennie, a side of crispy bacon, beignets (3) and mimosas.
Oh and don't be afraid to substitute your fruit for home fries.
beignets.author: JC D.
beignets.review: This is my "go to" spot for brunch, as both the food and service are consistently better than average . . . at least this has been the case for me on all visits. I recommend the beignets, mimosas and convincing the person you are dining with to order two other dishes and share them family style. Its even better, when you can convince them to order two things that YOU really want i.e. buttermilk pancakes and eggs bennie, a side of crispy bacon, beignets (3) and mimosas. Oh and don't be afraid to substitute your fruit for home fries. :)

excerpts:
Solid 4-star brunch joint in the dogpatch

pros: 
relatively short wait for brunch in the city, 20mins at 12:30pm, 
great fresh baked goods - BEIGNETS (must have), toast, etc,
overall - $45 for two people including coffee, plates, beignets, tax and tip
beignets.author: Noah P.
beignets.review:
Solid 4-star brunch joint in the dogpatch

pros: 
relatively short wait for brunch in the city, 20mins at 12:30pm, 
great fresh baked goods - BEIGNETS (must have), toast, etc, 
decent prices dishes range from $9-$11 and are filling, 
Great home fries, usually these are over-deep fried but well done here with just one crispy side almost like a half hashbrown

cons: none really, place is busy so servers aren't the most attentive. 

overall - $45 for two people including coffee, plates, beignets, tax and tip

excerpts: We ordered the famed beignets, however when they came out, one was not entirely cooked so they just picked up the entire batch threw it away and along came another plate.
beignets.author: Angel L.
beignets.review:
Great breakfast/brunch place.
Show up a little earlier and you won't have much of a wait.

The servers are nice enough, more no nonsense when it gets busy.
Not your typical white shirt khaki pants staff. Fun decor.

We ordered the famed beignets, however when they came out, one was not entirely cooked so they just picked up the entire batch threw it away and along came another plate. I was sad to see the good ones tossed out =(

My group ordered a variety of dishes.
The Eggs Blackstone stood out, and everything else was fine.

The bread for their toast was dense and hearty.
Potatoes...ok, not much on the flavor end.

Solid breakfast place and a definite bonus was the easy street parking.

excerpts: Everyone else is right: the beignets are really good -- light, airy, and sweet.
I also had an egg scramble with chicken, pesto, and cheese, as well as a side of potatoes.
The portion size was good and the potatoes were tasty.
(Some place's potatoes are plain.)
The staff was very friendly and accommodating.
beignets.author: Paul L.
beignets.review: Everyone else is right: the beignets are really good -- light, airy, and sweet. I also had an egg scramble with chicken, pesto, and cheese, as well as a side of potatoes. The portion size was good and the potatoes were tasty. (Some place's potatoes are plain.) The staff was very friendly and accommodating.

excerpts: A friend & I shared the mini-donut-esque things..beignets.
BOMB.
And I had a poached egg with grits (sidenote:
"like the kind you ate in prison" - as soon as I saw that description, I knew it was my kind of place) and cornbread.
No complaints, though it was kinda a carb/sweet overload but that was my bad.
My friend got a chili scramble or something and it had cornbread in it.
Never seen that before.
He ate all of it despite being hungover
so I'm guessing it was pretty good.
Would definitely come back here, if just for the beignets.
beignets.author: Lilian W.
beignets.review:
How did I basically live at the Mission Bay Avalon for 2yrs and not know this existed?!

A friend & I shared the mini-donut-esque things..beignets. BOMB. And I had a poached egg with grits (sidenote: "like the kind you ate in prison" - as soon as I saw that description, I knew it was my kind of place) and cornbread. No complaints, though it was kinda a carb/sweet overload but that was my bad. My friend got a chili scramble or something and it had cornbread in it. Never seen that before. He ate all of it despite being hungover so I'm guessing it was pretty good. Would definitely come back here, if just for the beignets. 

Our waiter was honest with his recommendations and overall the service was dec. The place is a little dinky so not really somewhere you go for the ambiance.

excerpts: I loved the beignets.
beignets.author: Brianna C.
beignets.review:
Great brunch after a rowdy night.  

Fun, funky vibe.  Coffee comes fast.  Mounds of delicious food.  I loved the beignets.  

Be prepared to wait.

excerpts: The beignets are heavenly.
beignets.author: Akta A.
beignets.review:
Great place for a weekend brunch. I wanted eggs benedict without the meat. So they replaced the meat with thinly sliced mushrooms and spinach. It was just perfect. 

The beignets are heavenly. Definitely try that. 

The potaoes are okay.

excerpts:
Beignets = best in SF
Grits = yum
Coffee = strong and free flowing
beignets.author: Joseph M.
beignets.review:
When it comes to breakfast there are So many options in the city and this is by far my favorite.
Gregs scramble = add zucchini, mushrooms and chicken apple sausage and go home happy
Beignets = best in SF
Grits = yum
Coffee = strong and free flowing

They also have steak, catfish and a list of other tasty treats.
Kid friendly and outdoor seating.

excerpts: I always order their beignets.
They also have very solid burgers, best ones in the area.
Parking can be a bit tough at times.
beignets.author: Stacey L.
beignets.review:
Solid bruch place.  I've actually been here on multiple occasions, but for some reason I always have problems searching  it though the Yelp! search engine or on Yelp! mobile.  It wasn't until recently that I was on their website that I realised there was a link on their main page.  

I was here this past Thursday for a late lunch, which turned into a brunch since I ordered the chorizo and eggs.  I always order their beignets.  They also have very solid burgers, best ones in the area. Parking can be a bit tough at times.

excerpts: You must try the beignets here!
The service is great!
The staff is fast and friendly.
There often people outside waiting
but people get seated surprising fast (compared to other places I've been to).
The food is delicious and affordable.
Parking is never a problem if you are willing to walk for about two blocks.
beignets.author: K L.
beignets.review: I love, love, love this place even though I've only been here twice.  You must try the beignets here!  The service is great!  The staff is fast and friendly.  There often people outside waiting but people get seated surprising fast (compared to other places I've been to).  The food is delicious and affordable.  Parking is never a problem if you are willing to walk for about two blocks.

excerpts: This is just your friendly "we're trying be southern because we have beignets, biscuits and cornmeal pancakes, but we are really just hipsters with overpriced mediocre food.
The beignets were decent the second time around - the first time I bit into one it was completely raw in the middle.
Luckily the service was good
so they didn't get upset when I asked them to get us new ones.
As for the cornmeal pancakes - they were just that - cornmeal pancakes.
Nothing special.
I think the highlight of the meal was the biscuits.
beignets.author: Stephanie P.
beignets.review:
So yelp gives this place four stars. I give it barely two. 

This is just your friendly "we're trying be southern because we have beignets, biscuits and cornmeal pancakes, but we are really just hipsters with overpriced mediocre food." The beignets were decent the second time around - the first time I bit into one it was completely raw in the middle. Luckily the service was good so they didn't get upset when I asked them to get us new ones. As for the cornmeal pancakes - they were just that - cornmeal pancakes. Nothing special. I think the highlight of the meal was the biscuits. Very moist, fluffy, buttery and delicious.

Would I come back here if I was being held hostage? Sure. Not for any other reason. But I do think the 2 star rating says it all - Meh, I've experienced better.

excerpts: BEIGNETS - Out of this world good.
Pefect balance of salty/sweet and it is so chewy.
The powder sugar makes it light yet
A bit over priced if you ask me but come here to share the beignets.
There's usually a wait
but staff is very efficient to you updated on the wait.
beignets.author: Maggie C.
beignets.review:
BEIGNETS - Out of this world good. Pefect balance of salty/sweet and it is so chewy. The powder sugar makes it light yet it is a sweet treat!!

The rest of the breakfast stuff is just OK. A bit over priced if you ask me but come here to share the beignets. There's usually a wait but staff is very efficient to you updated on the wait.

excerpts: Beignets are good if you want something sweet.
And the Chili Scramble is hella bomb!
Haven't had a bad meal there.
I go there several times a month.
A great place in a up and coming neighborhood.
beignets.author: Ian P.
beignets.review: "Early bird special" (which ends at 830am) is a pretty good deal, especially for the city.  Beignets are good if you want something sweet. And the Chili Scramble is hella bomb!  Haven't had a bad meal there. I go there several times a month.  A great place in a up and coming neighborhood.

excerpts:
Try the beignets
2.

Avoid the far right back corner area
3.
beignets.author: H H.
beignets.review:
Not bad, not great

Notes

1. Try the beignets
2. Avoid the far right back corner area
3. Usually plenty of street parking nearby!

Food was pretty good for brunch, with typical brunch cafe items, at relatively reasonable prices. Service wasn't terrible, but also not particularly great. The place was busy, we get that, but it's not that hard to be slightly more present beside a table. All in all, not bad, not great, but still recommended as an alternative stop.

excerpts: The beignets here are fried dough that are super good.
So good
I don't want to order anything else.
beignets.author: Alicia C.
beignets.review:
I love breakfast food. I would like to have breakfast food at all meals - but alas, sometimes I have to eat like the grown up that my age tells me I am. Just for You is breakfast heaven.

My eating partner and I were in Boston recently and there was a stand with a guy selling fried dough. So we got in the line to try. It was super gross - we threw it away. The beignets here are fried dough that are super good. So good I don't want to order anything else. But I do.

I've had the cowgirl and just the eggs with some bacon - enough for two meals!

BIG PLUS: When I order green tea, they will give me soy milk if I ask. You have no idea how many places look at me like I just asked them to kill their mother when I ask for soy milk.

Attentive waiters and delicious breakfast food!

excerpts: Had their beignets and crab cake with eggs.
Both were delicious!
I'm always looking for a brunch place that isn't boring and like all the other brunch places in SF and this is it!
The staff is friendly and efficient, I'll definitely be returning!
beignets.author: Margit H.
beignets.review: Love this place! Went recently on a Saturday and got seated right away. Had their beignets and crab cake with eggs. Both were delicious! I'm always looking for a brunch place that isn't boring and like all the other brunch places in SF and this is it! The staff is friendly and efficient, I'll definitely be returning!

excerpts: We also had the beignets (which are kinda like french donuts), which as other yelpers have already said, are awesome!
Service was good too!
beignets.author: Jeff Y.
beignets.review:
I went here for the first time with a few friends and I was all set to order the chili scramble when my friend spotted someone eating a plate of what looked like pure awesomeness. She kindly asked him what he was eating, and he responded that it's not on the menu, but was recommended by the wait-staff. The Christmas!

The Christmas is a bunch of corn bread with two of their sauces poured over it - a red sauce (meat or vegetarian options), and a green sauce, then topped with an over easy egg! It may not sound like much, but both of these sauces included vegetables good stuff in them too, and the whole thing packed a lot of flavor (and spice!). The whole thing was nice and filling. I suggest you try it out!

We also had the beignets (which are kinda like french donuts), which as other yelpers have already said, are awesome! Service was good too!

excerpts: This was the first time I had beignets, beware of flying powder sugar with a rowdy laughing table of six.
These New Orleans donuts were very tasty, but were also much larger than I had expected!
beignets.author: Anthony B.
beignets.review:
The scrumptious prosciutto scrambler special, truly made me feel as if it was just for me.  This was the first time I had beignets, beware of flying powder sugar with a rowdy laughing table of six.  These New Orleans donuts were very tasty, but were also much larger than I had expected!  One serving of three can easily fill the brunch donut appetite of two.

If I like this place so much, why only four stars?

I can go to the post office and buy a .39 cent stamp with my VISA debit card, but can't charge the $16 for a tasty breakfast!  It's one thing when a small business puts up their little "$10 minimum for credit cards" but our tab was over $70!  Begin accepting VISA/MasterCard, begin getting a 5 star review from me.

excerpts: I have yet to try the famous beignets
beignets.author: Bridget A.
beignets.review:
Historically I have not been a regular brunch eater.  Brunch was something that was for special occasions or when friends came from out of town.  This has all changed over the past year with my monthly SF visits and their proximity to Just For You Cafe. 

The food is great.  Whether you are looking for breakfast (served all day), a sandwich or burger you can't go wrong.  They do make their own bread (which is also for sale); I am partial to the cinnamon/raison.  Hint: You can request "thick slices" for extra bread goodness.  Plate portions are well sized so there is no fear that you will leave hungry.  I have yet to try the famous beignets but those are next on my to-eat list. 

With food this good, do expect a wait to be seated on the weekend.  It is also not uncommon to find the place bustling during the weekday mornings as well.  If there is a wait, put your name on the list that hangs by the front door.  Historically, I have not had to wait longer than 20 minutes. 

The one downside to the restaurant I would say is the service; it doesn't always live up to expectations.  I have certainly had worse but I have also had much better.  Your order will be taken quickly (know what you want and be ready when the server arrives) but it's not unusual to not see the server again for a long while.  On my last visit, I sat at the counter and my iced tea glass sat empty for about 15 minutes even though the cafe was not overly busy.  Not a huge deal but disappointing. And definitely not going to affect me from returning!

excerpts: so he ordered both for us and of course the Beignets.
beignets.author: Malou C.
beignets.review:
Okay so this is the 2nd breakfast that I had with TB this week.

I suggested Tselogs but he said hed take me here instead.

I missed the Longgonisa on the Menu last time I was here, so I told TB I want to order this instead, I saw the crabcakes too...TB knows....so he ordered both for us and of course the Beignets.

Servers are great, food is great and its nice having breakfast with TB again.

excerpts: BEIGNETS!!!
The first time, we only got their beignets to go because we were meeting up friends for lunch, and were starving, so we made a pit spot.
BEIGNETS!!!
beignets.author: Lisa L.
beignets.review:
BEIGNETS!!! 

Okay. The end. 

Victoria C. and I have been here twice now. The first time, we only got their beignets to go because we were meeting up friends for lunch, and were starving, so we made a pit spot.  This time, we were ready for the line.  

The breakfast will put you in a coma. It is SO good... and you get a good amount of food... and the signage/decorations on the wall are simply amazing. A mix between hipster and local. Love it. 

Stay away from their biscuits if you can, they give you two and it is 1.5 too many, they are heavy.  All breakfast items look amazing, but we had the scramble (Greg's?).  Arrive early to avoid the crowds, or come after 1:30pm, after your hangover has subsided. 

BEIGNETS!!!

excerpts: It is Southern inspired with their beignets, filled with tons of powered sugar.
I've been to The Cafe' Du Mond in New Orleans.
beignets.author: Michelle M.
beignets.review:
Good place to eat.  It is Southern inspired with their beignets, filled with tons of powered sugar.  I've been to The Cafe' Du Mond in New Orleans.  The Southern doughnets here were pretty good.

Over all I was not super inpressed with the meal and the prices, but I loved the people.  You really go here for the atmosphere and the cool people.

excerpts: This place has a huge brunch/lunch menu, and though they have some cajun/creole food (beignets and po'boys), the majority of the food on offer is standard American fare.
The highlight of the menu has to be the beignets, and I would go so far to say it is the sole reason to eat here.
For $4 you get 3 huge beignets dusted in sugar which will inevitably find it's way all over your clothes.
Well worth the sacrifice though.
beignets.author: Jean K.
beignets.review:
This place has a huge brunch/lunch menu, and though they have some cajun/creole food (beignets and po'boys), the majority of the food on offer is standard American fare.

I tried the shrimp po'boy and though good, was not impressed.   The whole thing didn't meld together.  They picked bread that was too chewy on the inside (instead of light and fluffy) and not crisp enough on the outside. Shrimp was good but there were only 6 pieces in the sandwich (for almost $10 I expect it to be stuffed with shrimp not layed out individually where I can easily count how many).

I also tried the fish and chips.  The fries were good and so was the fish, but the fish batter was soggy and kept falling off.  For me the key to fish and chips is the batter so a big thumbs down here.  Especially since no vinegar was available at the table.   The tarter sauce was pretty nice though - had lots of pickle relish in it.  And the portions were huge - 3 fish fillets.  I couldn't finish.

The highlight of the menu has to be the beignets, and I would go so far to say it is the sole reason to eat here.  For $4 you get 3 huge beignets dusted in sugar which will inevitably find it's way all over your clothes.  Well worth the sacrifice though.

excerpts: One star is for beignets and mimosas, but that's about the only paositives this place has.
We had some family in town visiting and thought we'd take them to a place with a neighborhood feel to it.
Boy were we wrong.
The service was lacking to say the least, particular the guy with suspenders and piercings who was blatantly rude to us.
He literally told my girlfriend to  "go fight it out yourself" with another party that was waiting for a table.
They  randomly brought the check to us while all three of us were still halfway through our dishes.
Only after they brought the check did waiters start coming by the table every two minutes asking whether "everything was alright".
Clearly, they were trying to get us to leave the table since they had others waiting for it.
I used to work in a restaurant that was usually quite busy
so I get how this works, but it was completely out of line they way these folks went about this.
Did I mention that my girlfriend's frittata had raw egg whites oozing out of it?
I had the eggs and chorizo and its nothing to write home about.
Do not recommend this place.
beignets.author: Rick C.
beignets.review:
One star is for beignets and mimosas, but that's about the only paositives this place has. We had some family in town visiting and thought we'd take them to a place with a neighborhood feel to it. 
Boy were we wrong. The service was lacking to say the least, particular the guy with suspenders and piercings who was blatantly rude to us. He literally told my girlfriend to  "go fight it out yourself" with another party that was waiting for a table. They  randomly brought the check to us while all three of us were still halfway through our dishes. Only after they brought the check did waiters start coming by the table every two minutes asking whether "everything was alright". Clearly, they were trying to get us to leave the table since they had others waiting for it.  I used to work in a restaurant that was usually quite busy so I get how this works, but it was completely out of line they way these folks went about this. Did I mention that my girlfriend's frittata had raw egg whites oozing out of it?  I had the eggs and chorizo and its nothing to write home about. Do not recommend this place.

excerpts: The Beignets work, as well as they can without the clay-ey Mississippi water
(M I crookedletter crookedletter I crookedletter crookedletter
I humpback humpback I).
beignets.author: Glen M.
beignets.review:
There seem to be some haters of this place. Stay away if you are.

I'm from New Orleans. The Beignets work, as well as they can without the clay-ey Mississippi water (M I crookedletter crookedletter I crookedletter crookedletter I humpback humpback I). So there.

Coffee is pure dinery luxury. Deelish. And free refills.

$5.25 for 2 eggs, 2 toast, 2 bacon and coffee, and it's 2 blocks from Caltrain. Take your hipster bike down to 22nd st, park it, have a decent breakfast, then train on down to Apple or Oracle or Yahoo.

And, just every now and then, have the hangtown fry.

The place is fab-tizzle. Worth the trip. You'll be back.

excerpts: Have the beignets and chicory coffee, or a pint sized mimosa (fresh grapefruit/Cypress Mimosa is the best), or delicious fresh juices (some organic) are another great option.

Things not to miss: Chilaquiles and Corned Beef (both are specials, so get 'em when you have any opportunity), New Mexico Green Chile sauce (made with Hatch chiles and taste like the real deal according to my friends from New Mexico.
beignets.author: Alyce K.
beignets.review: Not only is the food amazing (the owner is a chef, and demands only the best ingredients), but the service is friendly and attentive. Even when there is a line, they do a great job of keeping things moving and trying to minimize your wait time. Also, the cooks are super fast, so even if they are busy, the wait for food is never excessive. Have the beignets and chicory coffee, or a pint sized mimosa (fresh grapefruit/Cypress Mimosa is the best), or delicious fresh juices (some organic) are another great option. Things not to miss: Chilaquiles and Corned Beef (both are specials, so get 'em when you have any opportunity), New Mexico Green Chile sauce (made with Hatch chiles and taste like the real deal according to my friends from New Mexico. It can be SUPER hot depending on the batch of chiles, so taste with caution if you are sensitive.), Reuben Sandwich on Rye or Huevos Rancheros. Some more of my favorites are the Oatmeal Pancakes (wheat free!) Cobb Salad and the house burger, which I get on Gluten-Free toast (keep in mind this is not a "gluten-free" facility, so cross-contamination is always a possibility). Not super-expensive like everywhere else in SF these days and they have a great vibe and comfortable atmosphere--so don't bring your attitude, and tip generously! They appreciate their regulars!

excerpts:
We had several things:
Beignets--this was the item most reminiscent of LA (not the city.)
Though they were a little doughy and not as light as some, they were good (Fat and Sugar!)
beignets.author: Simon D.
beignets.review:
Great food, worth the wait!
Loads of kitch here-posters and signs talking about having a good attitude; the staff does! Seems to be trying for a Southern/Louisiana theme-I am not well enough versed to say they pull it off, but the food was great so not really a concern.
The line was long though we did not get there until 1:30 and they would not seat a partial group (2 were there early). We understood this once we saw how small it was inside and they were full right up until closing.
We had several things:
Beignets--this was the item most reminiscent of LA (not the city.) Though they were a little doughy and not as light as some, they were good (Fat and Sugar!) :)
Biscuits and Gravy
BLT with Home Fries
The biscuits were great-not sheet goods, but actual individuals and tasty! The milk gravy slightly sweet (as it should be) with good tasting sausage.
They knew what I meant when I asked for my BLT bacon to be limp (and it was). The homemade bread was toasted on one side (inside) and really nice crumb.
Our friends had:
Special-Italian Omelet
Pancakes, eggs, bacon and corn (cake-it has sugar in it) bread 
This was our first venture into the Dog Patch and we enjoyed ourselves. This is another solid lunch/brunch place that we would visit again.

excerpts: we got the hangtown fry to share and an order of beignets.
My friend and i was stuffed.
The order of beignet comes with 3 beignets covered in sugary goodness!!!
beignets.author: JY L.
beignets.review:
came here for some good hangover food.  yes it was a good choice.  we got the hangtown fry to share and an order of beignets.  My friend and i was stuffed.  The order of beignet comes with 3 beignets covered in sugary goodness!!! not to mention they were huge!! 

The hangtown fry was delicious.  i love the bacon they add to the scramble eggs.  It definitely took care of my NYE hangover.

excerpts: The beignets, corn beef hash special, and heuvos rancheros are delicious.
Great service, great food, funny signs.
beignets.author: Tina K.
beignets.review: Love this place! The beignets, corn beef hash special, and heuvos rancheros are delicious. Great service, great food, funny signs.

excerpts: Their beignets are my FAVORITE!
Light, airy, yeasty, and dressed to the nines in powdered sugar!
I top it with jam
and I'm set!
It's also close to the ballpark so you can totally hit up this spot for breakfast and then walk, MUNI, or bike to the ballpark for a day game.
beignets.author: Ava J.
beignets.review: I love JFY! I love that their fare is hearty and well-priced, and the quality is about what I would expect of a diner/cafe, but maybe kicked up a notch. Their beignets are my FAVORITE! Light, airy, yeasty, and dressed to the nines in powdered sugar! I top it with jam and I'm set! It's also close to the ballpark so you can totally hit up this spot for breakfast and then walk, MUNI, or bike to the ballpark for a day game.

excerpts: Beignets *and*  a breakfast dish that could have been named after me?
One bite of the Crabby Bennie
and I was hooked.
Homemade bread to die for, beignets, and crab options made it well worth the trek to Dogpatch.
Do it, but go early, and you won't be disappointed.
beignets.author: Jenn G.
beignets.review:
Beignets *and*  a breakfast dish that could have been named after me? One bite of the Crabby Bennie and I was hooked.  It was worth it, even if my brother insisted on calling me that the rest of the weekend.

We'd heard it's very popular, so we showed up at the ungodly hour of 8 am on a Saturday morning and got a table right away.  I tried not to snicker too much as we left, walking past the huge crowd of folks waiting.  It was difficult.

Homemade bread to die for, beignets, and crab options made it well worth the trek to Dogpatch.  Do it, but go early, and you won't be disappointed.

excerpts: BEIGNETS!
This Southern-style brunch joint has a guaranteed looooooong wait on the weekends, but it's worth it for the beignets and cornbread alone.
Seriously - the tagline 'fresh, fluffy pillows of perfection' aint lying!
A breakfast feast of eggs, chicken apple sausage, home fries, cornbread....and beignets....will definitely set you up for the day, and wont break the bank!
beignets.author: Melanie B.
beignets.review:
Brunch brunch brunch! Nom nom nom! A visit to Just For You cafe in the Dogpatch neighbourhood on Sunday morning set me up for the perfect day. What more could you want, apart from a) amazing bluebottle coffee (from nearby bluebottle cafe) whilst you wait for your table, b) great company, c) lovely weather? Oh, that's right....BEIGNETS!

This Southern-style brunch joint has a guaranteed looooooong wait on the weekends, but it's worth it for the beignets and cornbread alone. Seriously - the tagline 'fresh, fluffy pillows of perfection' aint lying! Admittedly, not the most healthy start to the day, but oh so delicious.

A breakfast feast of eggs, chicken apple sausage, home fries, cornbread....and beignets....will definitely set you up for the day, and wont break the bank!

excerpts: So I was craving beignets and I heard that these beignets are as good as Cafe Du Monde.
So I ventured out with my friend to see if this is true!
I've never been here before but
my fellow Yelpers say it's a great place to eat.
So naturally I'm incline to believe this is true-
and WOW !!!
YES it is!!!!
The food is so yummy and just plain wholesome.
I had the Greg's Scramble with egg whites mixed with organic veggies and
nicely paired with their homemade toast!
Who could ask for anything more?
And the "poinsettia " was deliciously refreshing!
A cran-raspberry juice with champagne!
No better way to enjoy a " little something " in the afternoon.
Our server "Kat" was incredibly nice and welcoming!
So why?
A 4 star-rating?
Because the first server that first seated us  seemed bothered and disinterested and luckily she disappeared!
And "Kat" who truly deserves a 5 star-rating totally made up for our first negative impression.
Funny enough, I never got a chance to taste those beignets.
Completely unaware that they close shop
early around 3pm
and we were there
way pass 3pm.
By the time I ordered the beignets, Kat informed us that the kitchen was closed!
Seeing that I was bummed out, Kat  handed us a coupon for "free beignets on the house"!!!!!!
Awesome Service and scrumptious food.
A great reason to come back!!!!
beignets.author: Elizabeth C.
beignets.review: So I was craving beignets and I heard that these beignets are as good as Cafe Du Monde.  So I ventured out with my friend to see if this is true!  I've never been here before but my fellow Yelpers say it's a great place to eat.  So naturally I'm incline to believe this is true-  and WOW !!! YES it is!!!! The food is so yummy and just plain wholesome.  I had the Greg's Scramble with egg whites mixed with organic veggies and nicely paired with their homemade toast!  Who could ask for anything more?   And the "poinsettia " was deliciously refreshing! A cran-raspberry juice with champagne! No better way to enjoy a " little something " in the afternoon.  Our server "Kat" was incredibly nice and welcoming!  So why? A 4 star-rating? Because the first server that first seated us  seemed bothered and disinterested and luckily she disappeared! And "Kat" who truly deserves a 5 star-rating totally made up for our first negative impression.   Funny enough, I never got a chance to taste those beignets.  Completely unaware that they close shop early around 3pm and we were there way pass 3pm.  By the time I ordered the beignets, Kat informed us that the kitchen was closed!  Seeing that I was bummed out, Kat  handed us a coupon for "free beignets on the house"!!!!!! Awesome Service and scrumptious food.  A great reason to come back!!!!

excerpts: The Huevos Rancheros with green sauce is my go to, and the beignets are actually really good.

Unlike those flat pieces of oil bread that they try to pass off as beignets at Brenda's, Just for You's beignets are closer to what beignets are supposed to be - light, powdered-sugar coated pillows of doughy goodness.
beignets.author: Kevin L.
beignets.review:
My new favorite brunch place. 

The Huevos Rancheros with green sauce is my go to, and the beignets are actually really good. Unlike those flat pieces of oil bread that they try to pass off as beignets at Brenda's, Just for You's beignets are closer to what beignets are supposed to be - light, powdered-sugar coated pillows of doughy goodness. Scrumptious.

Long wait here so be ready to listen to your stomach growl for a while.

excerpts: Then of course I got a small bite off of Aaron's Beignets, so yummy!
Who can pass up light fluffy donuts w/ powdered sugar on top?
If you can't eat it there then take it to go.
beignets.author: Nana R.
beignets.review:
I have been trying to get in here several times but always saw a line out the door on Sundays for brunch and got discouraged. BUT this time I woke up early (9 AM) and called in to ask them the wait time. They don't take reservations but by calling in they can estimate the wait time for you. And since I live down the street, why not go here for a Sunday brunch. 

I love their menu (also there is a link to their website so peruse it before you show up so you know what to get once you sit down). Once you show up if there is a wait outside write your name down on the clipboard, grab a complimentary cup of coffee off the cart outside the front door and get comfy while you wait. 

I didn't know they have a bar but since I am going here alone it was perfect. I got sat right next to this handsome cute guy named Aaron and we started up a conversation until we got our food. [shout out to Aaron: Thanks for making my first time here so much fun!!!!!] The atmosphere is really comfy and homey so don't be afraid to talk to the person sitting next to you or the table over. Very friendly and patient staff who will take care of you, what more can you ask for? 

The food is fabulous!!!! I ordered the Cowboy which is nothing more than a French Toast breakfast w/ two eggs over-easy and three bacon strips. Crispy thick bacon, so yummy!!! Then of course I got a small bite off of Aaron's Beignets, so yummy! Who can pass up light fluffy donuts w/ powdered sugar on top? If you can't eat it there then take it to go. And a cup of coffee to wash it down, endless cup of coffee, something I need in the morning to wake me up. 

This is a place you go to to enjoy good food, good conversation, and to relax on a Sunday morning. No rush so take your time. You might find street parking a bit difficult but I live down the street and riding the T-line isn't so bad. I'll definitely make this my Sunday brunch place, as long as I can avoid game days because that will pack the place up. 

Enjoy!!!!

excerpts: Their beignets are seriously to die for; a perfect treat that melts in your mouth.
Their pint-sized mimosas have me hooked on this place.
beignets.author: Jaime L.
beignets.review:
Their beignets are seriously to die for; a perfect treat that melts in your mouth.  Their pint-sized mimosas have me hooked on this place.  Well, their amazing dishes aren't so bad either. :-)

This is my favorite place to go on the weekends for some afternoon breakfast/brunch eats.  I need to make it out to their happy hour where I think I've heard their pint-sized mimosas are half off!  Oh boy, I sure hope its true.  

On weekends, this place is PACKED! Expect a wait, but it sure is worth it.  When you get there, there is a list posted next to the door outside.  Jot your name down and write how many are in your party to get on the list.  I don't think I've ever had to wait more than 20 minutes, which may seem long, but it really is worth it when you have time.

Can't wait to go here this weekend!

excerpts: Beignets are so yummy, I even ordered some to go.
5 stars breakfast & lunch place for sure :0
) they also serve beers & mimosas
beignets.author: Stella R.
beignets.review: Just for You Cafe is now my favorite breakfast place! Everything is delicious ! Beignets are so yummy, I even ordered some to go.   5 stars breakfast & lunch place for sure :0) they also serve beers & mimosas

excerpts: Not sure if I'll ever make it back to the Dog Patch for breakfast, but if I do I'll be trying the beignets fo sho.
beignets.author: Corey V.
beignets.review:
I don't wait in line.  I just can't.  I did this past Sunday though and I'm glad because Just for You Cafe has a very good breakfast menu.  I can really sum this review up with, "I love their Biscuits!"  I enjoyed the grilled catfish even though I think of it as the one fish that needs to be fried as much as possible. 
Not sure if I'll ever make it back to the Dog Patch for breakfast, but if I do I'll be trying the beignets fo sho.

excerpts: Beignets are tight, american breakfast is supah tight, huevos and many of the other egg dishes are also way tight.
beignets.author: Richard A.
beignets.review:
I've been eating breakfast at JFY coming on 15 years now.   This place has maintained a great quality of food, tasty, fresh and served hot through my entire tenure.  Even after moving locations from Portrero to Dogpatch, almost without a hiccup.  

Beignets are tight, american breakfast is supah tight, huevos and many of the other egg dishes are also way tight.

Some people gripe about the vibe, mainly because Arienne takes NO MESS.   That means turn your damn phone off and enjoy the company and your meal.

JFY FTW!!!

excerpts: so I ordered just one of their famous beignets, and hubby had the corned beef hash.
The beignet is exactly as advertised - light, fluffy, pillowy doughy goodness!
I wasn't quite expecting it to be as large as it was, but it was delicious down to the last bite.
The hash was also very good, as was the fresh carrot-apple juice.
I found that the sweetness of the apples balances the root-y taste/texture of the carrots very well.

They were also very accommodating, as we had two friends who wanted to join us after we had already ordered, and they made sure to move us to a table of four - while still seating the people who had been waiting in line.
beignets.author: Ji K.
beignets.review:
Stumbled upon this cafe while wandering around Dogpatch, and stopped in for a quick bite to eat. There was a line, but the wait was fairly short and our server came right away to take our drink orders once we were seated. He was friendly and gave recommendations on the specials. I wasn't terribly hungry so I ordered just one of their famous beignets, and hubby had the corned beef hash. The beignet is exactly as advertised - light, fluffy, pillowy doughy goodness! I wasn't quite expecting it to be as large as it was, but it was delicious down to the last bite. The hash was also very good, as was the fresh carrot-apple juice. I found that the sweetness of the apples balances the root-y taste/texture of the carrots very well. 
They were also very accommodating, as we had two friends who wanted to join us after we had already ordered, and they made sure to move us to a table of four - while still seating the people who had been waiting in line.

excerpts: Beignets were yummy but not the best I've had.
Cute place.
Good breakfast.
Solid.
beignets.author: Kelly S.
beignets.review: Good. Beignets were yummy but not the best I've had. Cute place. Good breakfast. Solid.

excerpts: Friendly staff, strong coffee, fluffy beignets, excellent, diverse menu for meat-eaters and vegetarians alike!!
Easy to park, cool decor, fun place to bring out-of-towners!

A few downsides:  tends to be a wait in the morning (although coffee is available), tables are a bit crowded for parties larger than two, tofu scrambles are a little greasy (but still super yummy), sausages are not fresh (but other meats are excellent), and at very back table sometimes the onions from the kitchen are enough to make one cry.
I bring up the downsides only as small areas for improvement.
Overall, this place is an eclectic gem and worth the wait!
beignets.author: Sandra H.
beignets.review:
Great neighborhood spot!  Friendly staff, strong coffee, fluffy beignets, excellent, diverse menu for meat-eaters and vegetarians alike!!  Easy to park, cool decor, fun place to bring out-of-towners!
A few downsides:  tends to be a wait in the morning (although coffee is available), tables are a bit crowded for parties larger than two, tofu scrambles are a little greasy (but still super yummy), sausages are not fresh (but other meats are excellent), and at very back table sometimes the onions from the kitchen are enough to make one cry.
I bring up the downsides only as small areas for improvement.  Overall, this place is an eclectic gem and worth the wait!

excerpts: The beignets, yes, were awesome.
HUGE, and awesome with powdered sugar kissing my nose on a warm Saturday morning.
Sweet, hot and light these marvelous beignets were.
beignets.author: Tracy L.
beignets.review:
NOMSSSSSS!!!!!!!!

This place is SOOO good!  The beignets, yes, were awesome.  HUGE, and awesome with powdered sugar kissing my nose on a warm Saturday morning.  Sweet, hot and light these marvelous beignets were.  Great with the jam jelly in a jar at the counters... jelly donut, anyone?

I had the Eggs (something).  Their variation of Eggs Bennie anyways (3 ways), but mine had bacon and tomato (one of my favorite combos).

I had the Eggs Bennie on homemade bread (that's right).  Thick white toast (although now I know they do cinnamon raisin bread, I shall have it on that next time to satisfy the sweet savory cravings of my tongue (which I suppose implies I will be there again. :))

Anyways, the hollaindaise was awesome, thick, and perfecto- wonder if they use lime?  Savory enough, not too heavy, nice acid.  Good balance.  They poach their eggs really well too.

Down home damn good goodness.  Umm... what else.

Oh, grits were okay. Nothing exciting.  Like boring oatmeal in a bowl with cheese on top.  You can get that or the homefries and I recommend going with the homefries- red potatoes, skin on, pan fried and perhaps roasted.  Delish.

OOH. They have hangtown fry.  I want. I want.

xxoo

excerpts: I suggest the breakfast burrito and the beignets (YOU MUST TRY THE BEIGNETS!).
beignets.author: Melinda B.
beignets.review:
This place is right around the corner from my house and I am a regular. The food is so amazing with huge portions. I suggest the breakfast burrito and the beignets (YOU MUST TRY THE BEIGNETS!).

The price is equivalent to the quality and amount of food you get. The service is pretty good. Not amazing but they are definitely friendly. I suggest trying this place on a weekday if possible because there is always a long wait on the weekends.

excerpts: I loooove their beignets!
So fluffy and powdery!
That was my favorite part of my lunch.
We shared a shrimp/oyster poboy which was ok.
I hardly tasted the oysters.
I'd definitely go again for the beignets tho!
beignets.author: Christy A.
beignets.review: I loooove their beignets! So fluffy and powdery! That was my favorite part of my lunch.  We shared a shrimp/oyster poboy which was ok.  I hardly tasted the oysters.  I'd definitely go again for the beignets tho!

excerpts: We kicked things off with 3 beignets between us.
These are NOT munchkin sized.
More like softball-sized.
Extremely hot, fresh and deliriously delicious.
I highly recommend slathering on the raspberry jam even if I couldn't quite convince my companion to do the same.
beignets.author: Drew M.
beignets.review:
Worth the hype! We had been scouring yelp looking to find THE hottest breakfast spot in the Bay area to kick-start our vacation and we did not leave disappointed. 

The outside and interior are nothing to get excited about but it is quite quaint and cozy inside. But most importantly it smelled and looked fantastic. Be forewarned my friends....cell phones are NOT welcomed here! 

We kicked things off with 3 beignets between us. These are NOT munchkin sized. More like softball-sized. Extremely hot, fresh and deliriously delicious. I highly recommend slathering on the raspberry jam even if I couldn't quite convince my companion to do the same. (She is a bit crazysexycool) 

I went with the Cowgirl breakfast (what an emasculating name for a manly meal) including buckwheat pancakes. The late, great Buckwheat himself would have declared them O'Tay! Pancakes fantastic, eggs good but the bacon....oh the bacon is to die for. 

She had the Fritatta of the decade and loved it. Said it tasted like a delicious pizza. The bacon was so good that my lovely companion, a self-professed vegetarian, had 3 slices and easily could have knocked out 10 tasty pieces!!! As a side note, ALL bacon in Cali is delicious. What do they do to their little piggies out here??? 

When the food arrived it was so much and overwhelming we were certain there was no way in hell we could eat it all. But we were wrong, it was soon devoured. She even had to remove her leather jacket to dig in further and cool off her warm, happy belly. 

Kudos to the cooks and the very hip and efficient waitress. But what's with the cash only policy??? It's 2009 buy a credit card machine you crazy hippies! 

Two enthusiastic thumbs up from the two deliciously decadent divas.

excerpts: Try the beignets!
beignets.author: Chi T.
beignets.review:
I have been going to Just for you Cafe about once a month for two years.

Pros

1. Always fresh, especially the fruits
2. Eggs are done CORRECTLY
3. Great Service is the norm
4. Try their home made cornbread
5. Try the beignets!

Cons

1. On the weekends expect to wait
2. Portions seem to be getting smaller over time
3. Can be difficult to find parking on weekends

excerpts: -I love the beignets!

Now it makes me wonder how awesome the New Orlean's beignets are...

-Great service!
Our lady server gave my friends and I  free beignets because she felt that our order took too long.
beignets.author: Jennifer H.
beignets.review:
A tiny place with full of surprises ^_^

-They have a butt load of pictures on the wall (which I love) and random Christmas lights hanging from the kitchen area. 

-I love the beignets! Now it makes me wonder how awesome the New Orlean's beignets are...

-Great service! Our lady server gave my friends and I  free beignets because she felt that our order took too long. (I didn't even have to ask!) 

 I'm gonna go there again. 


NOM NOM NOM CERTIFIED!

excerpts: Of course we also ordered beignets.
These were quite tasty, light and fluffy with nice flavor.
and I'd definitely go back for those beignets
, I'm just not sure when I'll be up in the city again for breakfast/brunch.
beignets.author: Raul N.
beignets.review:
While up in the city for the day, we stopped here for brunch before heading over to the Park. Now I'm not generally a fan of breakfast/brunch--I'd be fine with a latte for breakfast--but I was pleasantly surprised by my brunch here. 

I ordered one of the scrambles--Greg's, I think?--and it was actually pretty tasty. (And that's saying a lot since I'm not usually a fan of eggs.) The scrambled eggs were mixed with garlic, onions, spinach and chicken-apple sausage. The flavors all blended nicely; my only complaint was the spinach, which wasn't sufficiently cooked or fresh for the dish--it was served in a weird in-between state. Of course we also ordered beignets. These were quite tasty, light and fluffy with nice flavor. Could probably have survived on a single one, but my friend and I split an order (3 per order) because why not?!?!

As expected, there was a wait when we arrived, but despite warnings from fellow Yelpers, it wasn't too bad. Once we were seated, service was pretty fast, which was surprising given a full house on a Saturday morning.

Overall, not bad and I'd definitely go back for those beignets, I'm just not sure when I'll be up in the city again for breakfast/brunch.

excerpts: If you go, I recommend getting the hot chocolate and, by all means, make sure you order the beignets (deep fried crack).
beignets.author: Rory O.
beignets.review:
I've had several meals at this cafe with none of them being anything less than delicious. This is just good, home-cooked style food. 

I recently ordered the patty melt and thoroughly enjoyed it. Loved having the thousand island dressing on the side so I could put as much (or as little) as I wanted on there. I thought the onions could have been fried a little more, but that's a personal preference. The burger patty was cooked to perfection.

Parking in this Dogpatch neighborhood is like trying to win the lottery, but the food and the service at this eatery is worth it.

Great for breakfast and lunches and they now offer dinners on certain nights of the week. Awesome!

If you go, I recommend getting the hot chocolate and, by all means, make sure you order the beignets (deep fried crack).

excerpts: Shared the crab cakes, corn pancakes, and beignets with a friend.
All delicious.
Wash it down with the unlimited but not very strong coffee.
It's a great place to go before or after biking so you can work off the big meal.
There's a wait on weekends but things turn over pretty quickly.
beignets.author: Ryan C.
beignets.review: Great setting, giant portions. Shared the crab cakes, corn pancakes, and beignets with a friend. All delicious. Wash it down with the unlimited but not very strong coffee. It's a great place to go before or after biking so you can work off the big meal. There's a wait on weekends but things turn over pretty quickly.

excerpts: Or try the "cowgirl" special along with their beignets.
Yum!
beignets.author: Juliet W.
beignets.review:
I love a place where one can have options of grits, biscuits, cornbread or  potatoes! Yey! 

The 2 eggs with catfish is always a good choice with grits and cornbread! Or try the "cowgirl" special along with their beignets. Yum!

excerpts: We also saw on Yelp that a lot of folks liked the beignets
The beignets were what you'd expect - donuty taste and lots of powdered sugar.
beignets.author: Christine P.
beignets.review:
-Update- 

I've returned several times since and am still a fan. I tried the BLT (I wanted some A but they ran out of avocados that morning) and the crab cakes and while Oralia's makes an infinitely better sandwich, what can you expect from a breakfast joint? The crab cakes were pretty good! I think I make them better but that takes some time so for a quick crab cake fix without traveling too far from home, Just For You may just cut it.

-End Update-

I woke up craving buttermilk pancakes. Normally, I'll make 'em myself using my handy-dandy griddle but I didn't have any buttermilk. Who knew there was a great brunch place so close by to where I live?! 

The Boyfriend and I drove over, found a nice parking spot a few feet from the front door and after examining the menu outside, walked in to the register. I ordered a Cowgirl (two pancakes, two eggs any style, two sausage links or two bacon strips) and the Boyfriend wanted a Greg Scramble with chorizo. We also saw on Yelp that a lot of folks liked the beignets so we got some too. 

Yes, our eyes were bigger than our stomachs. I was astonished when a guy came out to us carrying three to-go boxes. The stack was almost up to my knees. The wait for a table wasn't too bad for a Saturday brunch place (I'd say it would have been about 15-30 minutes) and they have a small table set up outside with free coffee. We waited about 10 minutes for our to-go order. 

I was quite pleased with my pancakes. They were big and fluffy and the syrup wasn't any Aunt-Jemima-like-imitation. The sausage and eggs weren't anything to write home about but were passable. The Boyfriend's chorizo scramble was tasty - lots of Parmesan and chorizo and the home fries were nice and mealy. The beignets were what you'd expect - donuty taste and lots of powdered sugar. 

All in all, I'm quite happy with Just For You. As the Boyfriend said, four stars for being solid brunch food. We're planning on going back soon to try other things and maybe they'll wow us into five.

excerpts: Its good to know that I have a place where I can get beignets, po boys, and muffaletta sandwiches whenever I want.
beignets.author: Corinne R.
beignets.review:
Being a new patron of the Dogpatch, I have now been to Just for You Cafe twice. I immediately loved the atmosphere, and the signage where they threaten to pour coffee on your cell phone. Any place promoting face to face conversation is an A+ in my book. They display an awesome collection of screen printed concert posters and the atmosphere is laid back but attentive. As another reviewer put it there is really nothing pretentious about it, which is refreshing coming from the Mission.

They are one of the original purveyors of the slow food movement and their menu is New Orleans themed. Its good to know that I have a place where I can get beignets, po boys, and muffaletta sandwiches whenever I want. There is a good selection of vegetarian items, but you can also order a delicious reuben and surprisingly not walk out feeling like you have a brick in your stomach. The quality and freshness of ingredients is apparent throughout. Love this place and will certainly be back.

excerpts: We did have the beignets, which were very good.
Perhaps it was just a one-off bad experience, but I don't think I will be going back to try it again.
beignets.author: Shirley B.
beignets.review: Pretty disappointed with my experience here given the great reviews.  We waited about a half hour to get our table (pretty standard), but service went downhill from there.  To our server's credit, he was quick to take our order and bring our food, but he only brought 1 water for 2 people and I had to ask for a straw several times before he brought it.  When we got our food, both our orders were wrong and our waiter had to take them back.  Our orders came out again very quickly, but almost too quickly because my eggs were very undercooked.  I have never returned a dish twice and felt strange about it, so I ate it as is, but was very underwhelmed overall.  We did have the beignets, which were very good.  Perhaps it was just a one-off bad experience, but I don't think I will be going back to try it again.

excerpts: Beignets!
They are so good!
How good?
We are talking Barack Obama at the 2004 DNC convention good--they leave with you the same feeling of possibility and bliss.
Beignets and jam.
The food is great too but lets face it--you only eat the food so you can put your food aside to make room for the beignets.
Now if we could only get our politicians to be as fulfilling as these beignets.
beignets.author: George J.
beignets.review:
Beignets! They are so good! How good? We are talking Barack Obama at the 2004 DNC convention good--they leave with you the same feeling of possibility and bliss. And they wont let you down like BO has. 

Make sure you ask your waiter for jam. Beignets and jam. Just saying those words brighten my afternoon. 

The food is great too but lets face it--you only eat the food so you can put your food aside to make room for the beignets. 

Now if we could only get our politicians to be as fulfilling as these beignets.

excerpts: Beignets like everyone else says is a must.
Go ahead and order them right when you sit down so you can munch on them while you are deciding what to eat.
Oh, and get the pint of mimosa.
Its not all you can drink like some other places, but, dang a pint is enough for a sunday morning.
beignets.author: Roy L.
beignets.review:
I used to go to park chow for breakfast, but now its "Just for you cafe". Beignets like everyone else says is a must. Go ahead and order them right when you sit down so you can munch on them while you are deciding what to eat. Oh, and get the pint of mimosa. Its not all you can drink like some other places, but, dang a pint is enough for a sunday morning. I gotta work on Monday. 

So far everything Ive had on the menu has been great and brings me back. Ive been trying the specials. I see people getting breakfast burritos and stuff. iono...

Be prepared for a wait on the weekends. Its not a big place, but there is free coffee while you wait.

excerpts: Try the crab cake and the beignets.
beignets.author: Addrianna R.
beignets.review:
I was fooled by the gritty exterior.  It is actually bright, clean and comfy with the most comfortable diner bar stools these cheeks have ever sunk into.  They have a good natured attitude: bathroom sign reads "We're not asking you to be Michael Jordan, just to put your trash in the basket"; at the bar "we reserve the right to pour coffee ... on your cell phone."; outside "we love your baby, not your stroller", etc. 

Pint size mimosas!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Gluten free bread!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

The food is so tasty, fresh and creative and delivered to you by truly hip, laid back individuals.  Great place to meet locals and ole' dogpatch timers. Medium/Large size portions.

Try the crab cake and the beignets.

excerpts: The beignets are delicious!
The come covered in powdered sugar
beignets.author: Aryn Y.
beignets.review:
Love this place! The beignets are delicious! The come covered in powdered sugar and I always enjoy them with the jam and honey they have on the table, yummy!

I've tried the Eggs Blackstone and the Greg's Scramble with chicken apple sausage. Eggs Blackstone was good, big portions, although my poached eggs were overcooked :( Not a huge fan of the home fries (potatoes) or the biscuits (dry and crumbly), but the food is solid. The scramble had onions, garlic, spinach, parmesan and sausage... it was fantastic! And their grits are delish - but its pretty hard to mess up grits. I'll be back for sure!

They also have mimosas, large ones at that. Had one my first visit... not memorable, but a mimosa isnt really supposed to be, is it?? :)

excerpts: the spotlight went for the beignets (they felt light, not greasy at all and with just the right amount of sweetness), the oatmeal pancakes (it is amazing how they were able to make brown bland health food taste

so good even before you soak it with other random flavor enhancing condiments), the bacon (I asked extra crispy, to the point that it just sits up and can be eaten like a Popsicle but not too thin and
beignets.author: Bea L.
beignets.review:
we biked all the way from upper haight to this place to try their brunch. It was the week before Christmas and it was a fairwell thing for for my roommates, we were circling around all their favorite places before they left San Fran.
I loved the place. it is pretty small and the line big but they really move people around fast. They had coffee outside for those waiting and random seating spots.
We had tons of food (it was a party of 5 and we randomly took the server suggestions for food) the spotlight went for the beignets (they felt light, not greasy at all and with just the right amount of sweetness), the oatmeal pancakes (it is amazing how they were able to make brown bland health food taste so good even before you soak it with other random flavor enhancing condiments), the bacon (I asked extra crispy, to the point that it just sits up and can be eaten like a Popsicle but not too thin and they got it just right).

If you have a fun group of friends and don't mind the wait just give this place a try, I really appreciate when they take your requests seriously and bring exactly what you asked for.

excerpts: I always go for the beignets.
beignets.author: Jon R.
beignets.review: Went for brekky yesterday (a Tuesday). The service literally could not have been better!!! What a happy place. It's a piece of the South plonked fair square into Dogpatch. Just delightful. I always go for the beignets.

excerpts: Otherwise, if you're patient and in need of a filling breakfast, and want some fresh-baked whole wheat bread, or have a hankering for beignets, this is the place for you.
beignets.author: Jill K.
beignets.review:
I live around the corner from this place, so maybe the novelty of Just For You wore off a long time ago for me. Or maybe $10 for a diner breakfast is just a bit steep, and although it's been a long time since I had to wait for a table here (when I do go, it's before 9:30 in order to beat the crowds) I don't think the brunch is worth a 20 minute wait.

If you're forced to wait, you might as well consider the breakfast around the corner at Serpentine.

Otherwise, if you're patient and in need of a filling breakfast, and want some fresh-baked whole wheat bread, or have a hankering for beignets, this is the place for you.

excerpts: We shared some amazing beignets to start and everyone loved their breakfast plates.
Service was excellent.
Also they have some kind of frequent meal program where if you purchase 10 or so meals, you get one free!!!
beignets.author: Anne Y.
beignets.review:
Love love love this place. We came at a popular brunch time and had to wait about 35 minutes which worked out ok because there is a Blue Bottle Coffee store right down the block to hold you over. 

The restaurant interior is very retro and homey. We shared some amazing beignets to start and everyone loved their breakfast plates. Service was excellent. Also they have some kind of frequent meal program where if you purchase 10 or so meals, you get one free!!! It was about an average price for brunch in the city.

Go. It's worth the wait.

excerpts: The beignets were tasty, but they were reminiscent of Chinese fried donuts vs. actual beignets from Cafe du Monde.
I have yet to find a beignet that tastes similar to the Cafe du Monde ones.
I was pretty disappointed for a 2 person, $30 brunch.
beignets.author: Steph W.
beignets.review: 2.5 Stars.  I had particularly high expectations for this cafe.  The servers are very friendly, but the food is so-so.  I ordered the Crabby Benny which is a benedict with a crab cake on top.  It was reminiscent of a Trader Joe's crab patty on toast, which does not cost 12.75.  The biscuits and gravy were average.  The gravy was a bit too sweet, and you could barely taste the sausage.  The beignets were tasty, but they were reminiscent of Chinese fried donuts vs. actual beignets from Cafe du Monde.  I have yet to find a beignet that tastes similar to the Cafe du Monde ones.  I was pretty disappointed for a 2 person, $30 brunch.

excerpts: didnt get to try the beignets, but i have heard they are fabulous.
beignets.author: Christian C.
beignets.review:
nice little breakfast place in the dog patch.

i had the the green chili huevos rancheros which was both plentiful and spicy.  they werent kidding when they said "yowza" next to it on the menu.  My eggs were cooked perfectly.  sauce had a nice tomatillo flavor.   I also ordered potatoes on the side which were a little too greasy for me.  tasted a little like burnt bacon grease.  other than that, they had good flavor.  

coffee was decent.  service was good and the price was right.  get there before 10 on a sunday if you want to beat the rush....we got there just in time.

didnt get to try the beignets, but i have heard they are fabulous.

excerpts: Beignets with extra powder sugar....
That's all I have to say~~
beignets.author: Ann L.
beignets.review: Beignets with extra powder sugar....That's all I have to say~~

excerpts: Mistake: not ordering the beignets...need to go back and try!
beignets.author: Elaine S.
beignets.review:
Very SOLID (southern themed) breakfast food. Came on a Saturday around 8am and 5 of the tables were already occupied...by the time we left, the place was pretty much full!

If you like choices this place is Just For You! haha, get it?

I ordered egg whites with whole wheat toast (homemade, was thick and good), potatoes & bacon. Everything was excellent although the bacon could have been a little more crispy. Definitely will be back if I am in the neighborhood.

Mistake: not ordering the beignets...need to go back and try!

excerpts: I'm curious to try the beignets next time and hope to make Just
For You a more regular breakfast spot!
beignets.author: Paul S.
beignets.review: Happy to be the 1,000th review for this place! Went there for the first time today with my wife and some out of town friends. Maybe it was less busy because of the Pride Parade, but we were seated quickly and though cozy, our table was a good fit for four. I got the corned beef hash with two perfectly poached eggs and some hearty slices of homemade rye. The hash was great - not too dry as is often my issue with in-house recipes. It had a nice mix of peppers and onions but no potatoes which I know some people like but I was OK without. The rye was thicker than the store bought stuff and only needed a touch of butter to complement the hash and softly poached eggs. Coffee was what I expected and the service was fast,  friendly, and unintrusive - precisely what it ought to be! Everyone at our table was happy with their food which made me happy since I chose the place. I'm curious to try the beignets next time and hope to make Just For You a more regular breakfast spot!

excerpts: People come for their American/Southern/Mexican insipired meals, and especially for their beignets, which are heavenly on a chilly SF morning.
beignets.author: Liz S.
beignets.review:
Fold up your strollers and silence your cell phones, because as the signs plainly say, there's no room for them here.  Then come right in to this cozy little restaurant and enjoy a homecooked meal served with a smile.

Just For You has long been a breakfast and brunch staple for many, as you can see from the line out the door every weekend.  People come for their American/Southern/Mexican insipired meals, and especially for their beignets, which are heavenly on a chilly SF morning.  They also make great grits, which are a personal favorite of mine.

But what most Weekend Warriors forget is that there are other days and other meals to be enjoyed at Just For You.  I stopped in recently for lunch and had a delicious pastrami sandwich with some of the best cole slaw I have had in a very long time.  It was nice to be in there without the frantic rush of the weekend crowds, and to not have hungry faces peering in the window wondering when your table was going to be free.  I could even hear the classical guitar music playing on the speakers - so nice.

Another thing that I learned was that they have loaves of their homemade bread for sale.  I bought a loaf of the dense, hearty whole wheat bread which sliced up nicely for morning toast the next day.  It made me think back to stories of an era gone by of kids being sent to the local bar to pick up a pail of beer for the family's dinner.

In today's world of fewer and fewer comforts, a fairly priced, comforting meal can go a long way.  Pair that with friendly service and a comfortable space, and it's easy to see why Just For You remains a favorite spot in our city.

excerpts: We then had the perfectly fried beignets and coffee for dessert -- YUM.
beignets.author: Sid D.
beignets.review:
This is my new breakfast joint!  Thank you, LaShanda G., for your wise recommendation.  

I had the grits + grilled catfish and fried eggs for breakfast.  Friends had the "frittata of the decade" and chilaquiles.  Everything was well-prepared and infused with Southern soul.  Best grits I ever had...I added some butter, salt, pepper, and hot sauce, and I was already over the moon.  We then had the perfectly fried beignets and coffee for dessert -- YUM.

excerpts: BEIGNETS were just as good as the ones I had at CAFE DE MONDE in New Orleans a few months back.
I don't like sweet things
but I love these.
Lots of fresh fruit was available too!
we had no wait and also found free parking outside ( now that was a 1st)
beignets.author: Christina M.
beignets.review:
love it love it love! Our waiter was awesome they were closing at 3pm and we got there at 2:30pm no rush! 
had herbal tea with honey and lemon,Gregs Scramble yummy! BEIGNETS were just as good as the ones I had at CAFE DE MONDE in New Orleans a few months back. I don't like sweet things but I love these. Lots of fresh fruit was available too! we had no wait and also found free parking outside ( now that was a 1st)

excerpts: Eat the beignets warm.
They serve it first (is that typical?), so I took a bite of it and well what can I say it's a pillow of thin dough deep fried and covered in powdered sugar...
beignets.author: Ray R.
beignets.review:
Eat the beignets warm. They serve it first (is that typical?), so I took a bite of it and well what can I say it's a pillow of thin dough deep fried and covered in powdered sugar... it was freakin' delicious! 

After I finished the eggs and the creole crab cake, all very good, I finished the beignet. Not as great after it lost it's warmness, but still a nice sweet after breakfast treat. 

It's nice inside too. It's set up like an old 50's type diner, and the paint and decor give it a very country feel.

excerpts: They have something for everyone on their very large menu, but don't miss the fresh beignets!
They're also one of those places that has a coffee stand for those waiting outside.
I need to get back here for some breakfast!
beignets.author: Kaitlyn L.
beignets.review: I've had a good experience every time I've gone. They have something for everyone on their very large menu, but don't miss the fresh beignets! They're also one of those places that has a coffee stand for those waiting outside. I need to get back here for some breakfast!

excerpts: Loved the beignets.
beignets.author: Lu E.
beignets.review:
Tasty. A bit of a wait but worth it.

I had the chilaquiles with soy chorizo and they were yummy and flavorful with just enough kick and the dish still had a good amount of crunch. Good texture...

My mom had the longanisa and eggs. Always fun when one of your choices can be Filipino sausage. It was good as well.

Loved the beignets. 3 for $4.75, you can't go wrong!

I'll definitely be back!

excerpts: their coffee was a bit dissapointing, kind of watered down ): but their Beignets made up for it!
overall i think i found a new favorite B-FAST joint.
food was overall great, i can't say about the rest of the menu but their BRUNCH is great!
the only thing is that, Parking is kind of a pain in the rear.
beignets.author: Eva H.
beignets.review:
Service: 3.5/5
Food: 4/5
Wait: 4.5/5
Price: $
Presentation of food: 3.5/5
Presentation of restaurant: 3.5/5
Overall: 4/5

i had the two eggs + Louisiana Hot Sausage w/ their CINNAMON RAISIN TOAST (: i was surprised to see they have something so unique a Cinnamon Raisin Toast (btw was yummy)!! like childhood in my mouth once again. their coffee was a bit dissapointing, kind of watered down ): but their Beignets made up for it! overall i think i found a new favorite B-FAST joint. food was overall great, i can't say about the rest of the menu but their BRUNCH is great! the only thing is that, Parking is kind of a pain in the rear.

excerpts: We also ordered their beignets to start.
So yummy!!
They were large, fluffy, and covered with powdered sugar.
We got to deck them out further with maple syrup and jam.
OMFG.
After much indecisiveness, I decided on their omelette of the day: sun dried tomatoes, broccoli, chicken apple sausage, onions, cheese and home fries.
Delicious.

I could tell my friends were totally impressed with their dishes as well, because as soon as the food arrived, and the forks were inserted into our mouths, complete silence followed...and we're a pretty chatty crew, so that's saying a lot.
The restaurant in general is also super cute and quirky.
I hope I don't read a review where anyone is complaining about the wait for this place, because it's worth EVERY second.
We all left feeling totally full, and super loopy.
I'm not sure if that's because we went out the night
prior, the mimosas were super strong, the white stuff on the beignets wasn't really "powdered sugar", or if the food was really just THAT good...but whatever the reason, totally happy.
beignets.author: Sonya D.
beignets.review:
First of all I just want to say how happy I am being that I got to try two 5 star brunch places in one weekend. Um YES PLEASE!! I love you SF.

Anyways, we walked up put our names on the wait list and literally waited for about an hour. But luckily there was a convenience store next door, so I was able to rehydrate with a massive coconut water. For those that drink coffee, there was free coffee in front.  We finally got a table and quickly ordered two of their signature GIANT mimosas. I honestly couldn't even finish it. I mean it looked orange, but I couldn't tell if there was even any OJ in it. lol. We also ordered their beignets to start. So yummy!! They were large, fluffy, and covered with powdered sugar. We got to deck them out further with maple syrup and jam. OMFG. After much indecisiveness, I decided on their omelette of the day: sun dried tomatoes, broccoli, chicken apple sausage, onions, cheese and home fries. Delicious. I could tell my friends were totally impressed with their dishes as well, because as soon as the food arrived, and the forks were inserted into our mouths, complete silence followed...and we're a pretty chatty crew, so that's saying a lot. The restaurant in general is also super cute and quirky. I hope I don't read a review where anyone is complaining about the wait for this place, because it's worth EVERY second.  We all left feeling totally full, and super loopy. I'm not sure if that's because we went out the night prior, the mimosas were super strong, the white stuff on the beignets wasn't really "powdered sugar", or if the food was really just THAT good...but whatever the reason, totally happy.

Note: Make sure to try the Filipino sausage. I'd never tried it before, and it literally rocked my world for the short duration of time that it was in my mouth.

excerpts: but the Beignets are fan-friggin-tastic.
Seriously, these are the best Beignets in the city.
beignets.author: Erik N.
beignets.review:
I completely love this place.  And I'm sure it's been said before on Yelp. but the Beignets are fan-friggin-tastic.  Seriously, these are the best Beignets in the city.  Brenda's don't hold a candle.  

As for the service... SUPER CUTE!  And that in more ways than one: rude-cute (my favorite), friendly-cute, talkative-cute, busy-cute, and yes, sexy-cute.

Plus they give you coffee for the wait.  This does not suck.

excerpts: Plus Beignets!
If I lived near this place I would gain 10 pounds because I would eat hear al the time, so luckily I don't.
beignets.author: amanda v.
beignets.review:
Pint sized Mimosas at 1pm on a monday!  That pretty much stole my heart.
Everything you've been missing in a San Francisco eatery you will find it here at Just For You.  Amazingly nice/good/professional service.  Everything on the big menu is delicious.  They make all their own Breads, everything has a real old fashioned feel.   Plus Beignets!   If I lived near this place I would gain 10 pounds because I would eat hear al the time, so luckily I don't.

they're big fans of new orleans, and the beignets were up to par.

beignets.review:
phenomenal beignets & coffee. recommended it to my parents on a recent trip, and they flipped. they're big fans of new orleans, and the beignets were up to par. I've never had a bad experience!!! 

GO. GO. GO. GO.

n they dont even specify if its from vermont
