excerpts: The beignets are yummy and fresh.
The portions are always more than enough.
The home made raspberry jam is yummo along with the rustic organic bread.
Theres plenty of parking and the feel of the place
is cozy.
I will go back again.
beignets.author: Katherine T.
beignets.review: Love this place for the area that it's in.  The beignets are yummy and fresh.  The portions are always more than enough.  The home made raspberry jam is yummo along with the rustic organic bread.  Theres plenty of parking and the feel of the place is cozy.  I will go back again.

excerpts: We started out with an order of beignets considering
it was mardi gras time and we were really missing those french donuts.
They were hands down the best beignets we've had outside of Louisiana.
Yuuummmm.
We all ordered the breakfast burrito with slight variations.
All three of us thoroughly enjoyed our burritos and breakfast potatoes.
We also ordered a side of the biscuits and thought they were great.
I am looking forward to our next outing, at JFYC.
Hopefully it won't be raining and we'll be able to enjoy it with our pup (they have two tables outside).
P.S. we have decided to use them to cater an upcoming event that we are hosting.
I'll update my review and let y'all know how that goes.
beignets.author: Kelsey K.
beignets.review: Ok, we just relocated to SF from Louisiana last May, so we know genuine southern cooking. Just For You Cafe has got it figured out!!!! We went in here for brunch and waited a good 35 minutes for a table inside. It was TOTALLY worth the wait. They move people in and out of there so fast, and the servers, busers, and hostess are all smiling and pleasant despite the chaotic atmosphere (it's only chaotic because it is so busy because it is that good). We started out with an order of beignets considering it was mardi gras time and we were really missing those french donuts. They were hands down the best beignets we've had outside of Louisiana. Yuuummmm. We all ordered the breakfast burrito with slight variations. All three of us thoroughly enjoyed our burritos and breakfast potatoes. We also ordered a side of the biscuits and thought they were great. I am looking forward to our next outing, at JFYC. Hopefully it won't be raining and we'll be able to enjoy it with our pup (they have two tables outside). P.S. we have decided to use them to cater an upcoming event that we are hosting. I'll update my review and let y'all know how that goes.

excerpts: I am so in-love with the BEIGNETS (light, fluffy New Orleans-style donuts, smothered in powder sugar)!
I was expecting it to be bite-size and surprised to see it so big...
like cute little pillows.
It was very yummy and paired well with my tall serving of mimosa, which gave me a good buzz at 2pm.
The menu is great (the design was simple, yet it was fun to look at), and there are tons of different kinds of food I would have never expected to see including Longanisa (Filipino sausage).
I'll be back here again soon -- if anything I will come back for some BEIGNETS!
beignets.author: Celeste M.
beignets.review:
After partying until 4am last night (this morning), my good friend, Kitty, let me and one of our other friend crash at her apartment in Mission Bay right by the ballpark.  We decided to have brunch together at San Francisco's Dogpatch (even though I was nervous about seeing tons of dogs), so the alarm was set for 11am, but we did not leave until about 12:15pm.  We took the T-Line and in to time we arrived at Just For You.  The wait did not seem long so we wrote our name down for 3 on a yellow pad by the door.  We walked around the the block to see what else was around and when we got back, we were seated after a few minutes.  

Celeste: "Hey, why did they skip us?"
Si-Eun: "They are only party of 2, harder to seat party of 3"
Kitty: "I think we're next"
Celeste: "Yeah, looks like it from the list"
Kitty: "Wait a minute... is that lady trying to steal our table inside?"
Celeste: "Hmmm... I think so, what is she thinking?"
Si-Eun: "She's probably asking the staff member if she and her family can have our table..."

The staff member walks out followed by the lady trying to steal OUR table.  He looks at the list and says that there was a party before them (that was us) and could not seat them inside.  She looked at us and gave me a dirty look, but I smiled at her before going inside.  Just because she had a baby in a stroller, she thought he can cut in line... no f'ing way, she's not special.  Okay, moving on...

I am so in-love with the BEIGNETS (light, fluffy New Orleans-style donuts, smothered in powder sugar)!  I was expecting it to be bite-size and surprised to see it so big... like cute little pillows.  It was very yummy and paired well with my tall serving of mimosa, which gave me a good buzz at 2pm.  The menu is great (the design was simple, yet it was fun to look at), and there are tons of different kinds of food I would have never expected to see including Longanisa (Filipino sausage).  I had two-eggs (over-medium, though they made it over-easy) with home fries, cornbread, and turkey-apple sausage. 

Good food, great service, not a single dog in sight, okay crowd, easily accessible by public transportation... I'll be back here again soon -- if anything I will come back for some BEIGNETS!

This was written on the menu -- it's hilarious (just like some of the other posters about cell phones and stuff):
"What's grits? It's that pasty white stuff... like you had in prison."

excerpts: Sometimes the beignets looked fluffy like pillows, like they do at Brenda's, but sometimes they were darker flater crisps closer to east coast fried dough.
beignets.author: Raccoon S.
beignets.review:
dogpatch 1/21/12

Just for you has been just near me since I moved to the dogpatch a little more than a year ago. I am moving away soon and really wanted pancakes so figured I'd come full circle and return to the diner I ate at a bunch of times when I first came out here.

First off, my how times have changed. Waiting lists to sit at the counter, dogs and crowds, babies and coffee, all hovering on the street outside, the neighborhood has really come onto the radar.

My breakfast was simple: Corn meal pancakes, a 1 pint mimosa, bacon, and coffee.

Let me just start by saying that the meal was incredible. Somehow it wasn't but somehow it was, the pancakes kept whispering to me.. love us... love us....

I sat at the counter after a long and chilly wait that was sort of my fault. I went next door to reno's to get cash and missed my name being called I guess. But when they came out and called another party, then another, then another till I was still the last guy standing there and my name still at the top of the list I began to wonder. Then when they escorted out a guy who had walked in alone, told him to put his name on the list, and then sat HIM, I asked the person if they had had an opeing for me, and pointed at my name. He looked at the list, seemed surprised to see my sad and lonely name, not scratched out in a sea of black ink and found me a seat. Mostly my fault but it was cold as hell and they were full, but not totally slammed. Something I would hope they checked on once or twice.

I had time to look at the menu while waiting outside and knew what I wanted to order. The aformentioned pancakes, coffee, bacon and mimosa. My order was taken quickly, my food popped up in the window even faster, they were very busy but very on it.

I have to say though that from stopping in a few times their food seems to have a lot of variation to it depending on who was in the kitchen. Sometimes the beignets looked fluffy like pillows, like they do at Brenda's, but sometimes they were darker flater crisps closer to east coast fried dough. I don't know what was going on any of those days, but today everything looked great.

The coffee was coffee, endless and warm and mixed by me with too much sugar and cream to say much about it. I liked it. It was the energizing hot elixer i needed to help me power through a very late brunchfest.

The bacon came out looking ironed and crisp and thick, I like something a little more greasy and hot, but it was good. Wafers of salty delight, especially when soaked in some syrup, they did have a tendency to crackle and sometimes melt away. Almost like crackers. It was also a large serving, long, wide, thick pieces, 4 or 5 of them. None of that shrimpy little tails nonsense.

The mimosa was LARGE and fresh and priced at A.Q. which apparently is eight bucks. It was cool and refreshing, mixed well enough that there were bubbles and the elegant touch of sparkling white wine, but it still kept the bulk and satisfaction of fresh juice. A thick wholeness to a drink spotted with light bubbles. It was refreshing and a stark contrast to my coffee(as it should be), it cleansed. 

Finally to the pancakes. They were also unassuming, some thick disk laid in front of me soaked in syrup that was rapidly disappearing. I liked that. Like a sponge the cakes fused with all the syrup I could throw at them. The amazing part was that the tops and bottoms stayed crisp. Like thin wafers, each toasted edge crackled as I cut and bit them, exposing the many celled walls within.

The insides were like a corn muffin, but so much more. They crumbled dryly, but dont be fooled. Once I had a bite in my mouth there was nothing dry about it at all, steamy and hot it became a sweet soft filling taste of joy, soaked in honied syrups. All at once they were crisp and light, moist and dense, delicious and wonderful. I scraped my plate clean.

All in all I had a surprisingly great experience and a wonderful meal, everything was unassuming and then wonderfully complex. Which brings me to the one off note, my breakfast after tax and tip was about $25. I spent that much at another place recently but also got eggs and home-fries. Hell, I spent that AT Just for you, and got more. The menu in the window showed prices lower than the ones inside. While I don't feel it wasn't worth it, I do feel that given their location and presentation and the fact that it was still pancakes, bacon and coffee poured out of a vat, or pulled off of a pile and served on plain bulk flatware that it could be a little lighter on the wallet.

excerpts: I usually can, and the beignets looked amazing, but my mom wasn't feelin the donuts, so it just gives me more motivation to head back at a later date.
The place is small.
The wait exists, and its cash only, but there are so many more things on that menu that I want to try.
Ill definitely be back.
After all, brunch is my favorite meal of the day.
beignets.author: Lauren F.
beignets.review:
So, apparently this place is not just for me.  I thought id be able to show up, with mom in tow, to a brunch joint id never been to before, and we would be the only ones there...cuz after all, it's just for me.  Nope.  Everyone else thought the same thing.   It was good though, we showed up, put our names on the list, and got a nice table outside that was indeed just for us.

It's too bad that this place is all the way in the dog patch, and required quite a trek to get there, because it could easily become one of my new regular brunch spots.  Deliciousness and large portions make Lauren a happy gal.  Its also one of those brunch places that is only open till 3:00 so they do what they do and they do it well.  I recommend this place too, because I ran into Mr. Yelp himself with his family and friend, and if Nish eats here...I should too.  :)

My mom and I split the Greg's special.  It's an omelet with spinach, goat cheese, garlic and onions, and split between the two of us it was a perfectly light brunch.  We opted to stay healthy and get fruit instead of home fries, but the fruit salad was fresh and full of variety.  I probably could have eaten more.  I usually can, and the beignets looked amazing, but my mom wasn't feelin the donuts, so it just gives me more motivation to head back at a later date.  The place is small.  The wait exists, and its cash only, but there are so many more things on that menu that I want to try.  Ill definitely be back.  After all, brunch is my favorite meal of the day.

excerpts: It's in my favorite historic district (please see profile photos for 1892 artistic rendering of Dogpatch, k thx), they have beignets with which you really can't go wrong, they've got a cute sassy little design thing going on, and the staff are friendly and awesome.
beignets.author: Megan W.
beignets.review:
This is basically just Boogaloos or Saint Francis Fountain but I can bring my dad there without fools giving us the up and down. Yes that's right, bitch, he is rocking shorts in the middle of winter and a fishing hat. What. You think your tapered pants look any less ridiculous? Fuck it, we're going back to outer Third. 

I digress. Just For You: I love it. It's in my favorite historic district (please see profile photos for 1892 artistic rendering of Dogpatch, k thx), they have beignets with which you really can't go wrong, they've got a cute sassy little design thing going on, and the staff are friendly and awesome. 

Sometimes they're out of cups for the complimentary coffee but (a) you can't complain because it's free, and (b) take a walk while you wait, you lazy fuck. It will do wonders for your vascular system.

excerpts: I don't have a very big sweet tooth but the beignets were really good and completely worth the sugar intake.
beignets.author: Drue C.
beignets.review:
In the spirit of exploring both sides of an issue I took Ed M.s advice and decided to try two of his favorite breakfast spots to truly see if SF has better breakfast joints than SD. This was one of them. I am still weighing in on this theory, but thank Ed for pointing me in the direction of this fantastic place.

There was a pretty long wait so we opted to share a table with some strangers so we could be seated more quickly. We ended up having a lovely breakfast, great conversation about food with the couple who we were seated with and a laundry list of new places to try. 

I don't have a very big sweet tooth but the beignets were really good and completely worth the sugar intake. In fact all of the food was very good.....and they serve grits, I love grits. 

Our impromptu breakfast companions ordered decaf coffee, while I, having just had a super delicious latte from Piccino, opted out. I am glad I did...their coffee was so bad they sent it back. 

Overall a great little breakfast place, reasonably priced, and though they don't take credit they do take checks....who takes checks anymore? Service was so so and they did that thing I cant stand and asked if I needed change. Just bring me the GD change and stop being presumptuous already (clearly this is a pet peeve of mine). For this they lost one star.

excerpts: To start, I see they serve beignets and am reminded of New Orleans when I get them.
So I get the order of 3 knowing I will take home those I don't finish.
It is topped with lots of powdered sugar.
beignets.author: Janet H.
beignets.review:
I recently went into Just For You Cafe for brunch in the Dogpatch area.  This area has changed quite a bit with the "T" Muni Metro line and the building construction.

To start, I see they serve beignets and am reminded of New Orleans when I get them.  So I get the order of 3 knowing I will take home those I don't finish.  It is topped with lots of powdered sugar.  It's delicious and I'm loving it!

For my breakfast, I get the veggie version of Greg's Scramble, which includes spinach onion, garlic, mushrooms and zucchini all top w/ Parmesan cheese.   With it I also order biscuits and grits.  While my scramble was delicious, my biscuits were on the doughy side and my grits were similar to Cream of Wheat making my sides only ok.

The service is down-to-earth friendly and relaxed.  With great customer service I will return.  Thanks Just For You Cafe!

excerpts: Order the beignets....ya just gotta.
order the beignets.
beignets.author: Jay H.
beignets.review:
If you ever feel like ditching the first half of a work day to eat a cozy breakfast you must do it here. 

Even on a Thursday morning there is no where to park but fortunately they aren't as busy either!  No line....just walk in and park your lazy I- don't-want-to-work-today ass down at a table.  

Order the beignets....ya just gotta.  

It can lean on the California healthy side.  Seriously....breakfast burritos with black beans?  It's a mexi-crime really to do that to burritos. 

Coffee is strong and always getting refilled....I love that. I don't' even have to ask they just keep pouring it in.

Corn Beef Hash is pretty bomb ass.....it does have a three months supply of your daily recommended salt intake in it though. 

Don't go on the weekend unless you are willing to wait...and aren't too starving when you get there. 

Oh and in case you forgot already...

order the beignets.

excerpts: Some days the beignets are great, some days they are AWFUL.
beignets.author: Sara D.
beignets.review:
Inconsistent. 

Some days the service is fine, some days it sucks.
Some days the food is good, some days it sucks.
Some days the wait is out the door, some days it isn't.
Some days the beignets are great, some days they are AWFUL.
Some days the biscuits and gravy are good, some days they aren't


They are always a bit pricy.
They are consistent on that.

excerpts: beignets made after you order them!
doused in powdered sugar just like in Nawlins'!
better if you eat them fresh out of the fryer, but if you have to get them to go, tell them NOT to sugar them and have the powdered sugar on the side.
good eating!
beignets.author: Jeff W.
beignets.review:
beignets made after you order them! doused in powdered sugar just like in Nawlins'! better if you eat them fresh out of the fryer, but if you have to get them to go, tell them NOT to sugar them and have the powdered sugar on the side. 
good eating!

excerpts: Beignets are fantastic and highly recommended each and every time you come here.
They have a creole slant on some of the items here like po'boys and stuff
beignets.author: Morgan H.
beignets.review:
All the way out in the dogpatch is one of my all time favorite brunch spots in SF. Its not nice or trendy. Doesn't have a crazy menu with blood orange mimosas and all that but what it does so it make a damn good breakfast.  

Beignets are fantastic and highly recommended each and every time you come here.  They have a creole slant on some of the items here like po'boys and stuff but I have yet to actually try it. 

And yes, like all brunch spots on the weekend -- the wait sucks.

excerpts: We started with the beignets.
WOW!
Large doughy, air-filled pillows covered with lots of yummy powdered sugar.
Melts in your mouth.
They aren't exactly like the traditional tasting beignets in New Orleans, but close enough for me.
beignets.author: Kimberly S.
beignets.review:
Great cozy breakfast/lunch spot hidden away in the Dogpatch!

My co-workers and I came to this spot for lunch. It was after 1pm and the place was still busy! So I glanced at the menu posted on their window. Before getting here, I thought I wanted a bowl of soup to soothe me on this cold afternoon. However, after checking out their menu, I quickly changed my mind. I don't know if it was because I was starving, but just about everything on the menu from the pancakes, huevos rancheros to the po-boy's sounded so much more comforting! 

We started with the beignets. WOW! Large doughy, air-filled pillows covered with lots of yummy powdered sugar. Melts in your mouth. They aren't exactly like the traditional tasting beignets in New Orleans, but close enough for me.

I ended up getting two eggs with a grilled pork chop, grits, and homemade cornbread. That meal did it's job - my hunger was fulfilled and my soul was soothed. The cornbread was a little dry for me, but nothing that a little bit of jelly couldn't fix. The pork chop had just the right amount of seasoning and went well with my eggs. 

Other dishes on the table included the breakfast burrito (HUGE burrito filled with eggs, beans, and your choice of fillings), bowl of yogurt with fresh fruit and granola (this too, looked awesomingly delicious) and their pasta of the day, which was linguine with lots of veggies in a light sauce. Everyone was happy and satisfied with their choices. 

Young, hip, and friendly staff!

NOTE: Cash or check only. Yes, you can write a check for your food, odd as it sounds (My co-worker actually did so that day).

excerpts: Today, I ordered the beignets 'to go'.
You get three good size, puffy, powder sugary, pillows of French donuts in one order.
Maybe I should have eaten it there.
Upon getting home in 15 minutes, the beignets were tasty but not quite as puffy.
beignets.author: Nanette L.
beignets.review:
It's NOLA by the bay which is actually in the Dogpatch area of San Francisco.  This funky little hip joint serves hearty Cajun/Mexican style breakfast and other specialties.  Upon entering, you'll notice the neatly framed psychedelic and colorful posters hung over the wainscot walls. A huge Blue Marlin is hung over the arch way to the kitchen.  At 2:30pm in the afternoon, they were half full and still serving breakfast.  Today, I ordered the beignets 'to go'.  You get three good size, puffy, powder sugary, pillows of French donuts in one order.  Maybe I should have eaten it there.  Upon getting home in 15 minutes, the beignets were tasty but not quite as puffy. 

I love their gentle reminders displayed on the wall:

"For your dining pleasure and the enjoyment of those around you, we ask that you observe the following: No sitting at an uncleared table. Please sign the list and wait to be called. No yackin' away on your cell phone. Turn off that annoying little ringer and talk to the person next to you for a change. No credit cards. It's our little way of lowering the national debt. And most important: No whining. Thank you!"

This is a no cell phone zone.  Don't let them catch your phone ringing or as the sign says, "We reserve the right to pour hot coffee over your cell".

I see that they serve Po-boy sandwiches here.  I will definitely have to come back to try these.

excerpts: We've ordered beignets twice - raw in the middle (and we saw another table send an order of them back for this).
Hubby got eggs benedict - hollandaise was the consistency of water.
I ordered poached eggs - yolks were barley warm, and the eggs were served in a cup that had about an inch of water in it.
Bacon was so undercooked that it wouldn't keep
it's shape at all when picked up -
it slumped, dejectedly, as if it was embarassed to call itself bacon.
beignets.author: Shannon H.
beignets.review:
I want to love this place...I do.  As an early riser and resident of Potrero Hill, a convenient breakfast place is right up my alley.  We've given this place a few chances, and I hate to say it, but we're done.

The food isn't good, primarily because most of it is cooked incorrectly.  We've ordered beignets twice - raw in the middle (and we saw another table send an order of them back for this).  Hubby got eggs benedict - hollandaise was the consistency of water.  I ordered poached eggs - yolks were barley warm, and the eggs were served in a cup that had about an inch of water in it.  Bacon was so undercooked that it wouldn't keep it's shape at all when picked up - it slumped, dejectedly, as if it was embarassed to call itself bacon.  And the coffee isn't good, and is served lukewarm.

I think this place would be GREAT if they got a couple new line cooks.  The wait staff are great - fast and efficient; the place is cute; and it's hard to find a decent breakfast (NOT BRUNCH) in this city.  But the food is simply not worth the $ - ten dollars for a plate of eggs, etc. and coffee is sort of expensive for breakfast, and you'd expect to get a great meal.  Sadly, here you won't.

excerpts: Beignets?!!
YES!
The beignets here live up to the hype.
Light and pillowy, could see the air escape as I cut into it.
Chewy and tasty.
At first I thought we would not be able to finish all three, but just mere seconds later I was wondering if we should order more to go.
Not too sweet at all.
Since we planned on getting the beignets, I had to rethink my original plan of getting the Cowboy breakfast.
Carbs, you know.
So, I got the 2 eggs with sausage, biscuit and home fries.
I really did not want the home fries or grits, but considering I ate half a watermelon in the morning did not want the fruit substitute ($1.75).
The  eggs and sausage were fine, though I would probably pick bacon next time.
The best thing on the plate were the biscuits!
Oh my goodness, light and flaky.
After a little garnish of butter and jam, they were incredible.
So much for limiting the carbs, but it was worth it.
Breakfast was about $25 for 2 people (including beignets).
A return visit for sure.
beignets.author: Mashi M.
beignets.review:
Bayonets? Bengay? Beignets?!! YES! The beignets here live up to the hype. Light and pillowy, could see the air escape as I cut into it. Chewy and tasty. At first I thought we would not be able to finish all three, but just mere seconds later I was wondering if we should order more to go. Not too sweet at all. YUM! 

Breakfast was also good. Since we planned on getting the beignets, I had to rethink my original plan of getting the Cowboy breakfast. Carbs, you know. So, I got the 2 eggs with sausage, biscuit and home fries. I really did not want the home fries or grits, but considering I ate half a watermelon in the morning did not want the fruit substitute ($1.75).  The  eggs and sausage were fine, though I would probably pick bacon next time. The best thing on the plate were the biscuits! Oh my goodness, light and flaky. After a little garnish of butter and jam, they were incredible.  So much for limiting the carbs, but it was worth it. Breakfast was about $25 for 2 people (including beignets). A return visit for sure.

excerpts: Beignets are a slightly denser, chewier version of NOLA's
but they are huge!
One per person is plenty especially if you plan on ordering a regular meal.
I would suggest passing on the egg scramble with chicken applewood sausage as you will bite into a substantial amount of grizzle from the sausage - yuck.
Home fries are really dry and have a cardboard taste.
Stick with the beignets, they warrant the 3 stars.
beignets.author: K W.
beignets.review: Beignets are a slightly denser, chewier version of NOLA's but they are huge!  One per person is plenty especially if you plan on ordering a regular meal.  I would suggest passing on the egg scramble with chicken applewood sausage as you will bite into a substantial amount of grizzle from the sausage - yuck.  Home fries are really dry and have a cardboard taste. Stick with the beignets, they warrant the 3 stars.

excerpts: The best beignets I've ever eaten.
Beignet's aren't the healthiest treat
beignets.author: Janet T.
beignets.review:
Our friends are regulars here and introduced us when we were visiting two weekends ago. I was in the mood for beignet's and they knew of a place in the dogpatch neighborhood and brunch was never the same after this day. Just for you reminds me of this cute little cafe in Seattle that my bf and I would frequent. 

We came in around 1pm and didn't have to wait for a table. It appeared we missed the breakfast/brunch crowd and were seriously lucky since we all were starving. I ended up with the Fried Egg Sandwich with bacon - and it was delicious!! The spicy mayo is really quite amazing, and the more tabasco sauce you add, the better it tastes - so I made mine super spicy!

The bf ordered the corned beef hash which was made fresh and not canned! It came with a side of potatoes and two slices of toast but was smokey & a little brackish. We ordered and shared three beignet's and sadly it wasn't enough for 4 hungry foodies. JFYC is known for these delicious soft chewy dough with dulcet powdered sugar - it was ahhhhmazing! The best beignets I've ever eaten. Beignet's aren't the healthiest treat but we didn't seem to care and decided to order another set to share.

I'd have to agree with the other yelpers on here....these are probably the best beignet's I've ever had and I'll definitely stop by the next time I'm in the city!

excerpts: The beignets - yes, they're that good.
You'll eat one and won't feel like the rest of breakfast but of course since you've been waiting awhile, you'll have ordered more to make it worth it.
Be careful of the powdered sugar...
my friend inhaled down the wrong pipe, he coughed, and it sprayed everywhere.
He and the counter looked like they were in a flour factory or like they were getting ready for a mime performance.
beignets.author: Vanessa H.
beignets.review: The beignets - yes, they're that good. You'll eat one and won't feel like the rest of breakfast but of course since you've been waiting awhile, you'll have ordered more to make it worth it.  Be careful of the powdered sugar...my friend inhaled down the wrong pipe, he coughed, and it sprayed everywhere.  He and the counter looked like they were in a flour factory or like they were getting ready for a mime performance.

excerpts: The beignets are deliciously yummy and very messy!
There is a nice variety of food to choose from, and everything I've had has been very tasty.
I recommend this place.
beignets.author: Landy G.
beignets.review: If been to Just For You Cafe about 3 times now and have enjoyed it each time.  The beignets are deliciously yummy and very messy!  There is a nice variety of food to choose from, and everything I've had has been very tasty.  I recommend this place.

excerpts: We all shared the beignets (OG style, if you go here and don't order these SHAME ON YOU, they're worth the extra 10 min on the treadmill!)
eggs
Benedict special, Louisiana sausage, and unfortunately I can't remember the other dishes that were ordered
(it was pretty early in the morning for us
and I was nursing a slightly fuzzy head from the previous nite's festivities...
beignets.author: Nenette Y.
beignets.review:
The boyfriend and I made the trek out here (we lives in Hayes Valley) because we were meeting another couple with a 1 year old baby, so we wanted somewhere with minimal fuss, plenty of parking and lots of YUMMY food for good prices- Just For You delivered on everything. 

It's a medium size space without too much going on for decorations, fast/friendly service, and a really delicious breakfast... 

We all shared the beignets (OG style, if you go here and don't order these SHAME ON YOU, they're worth the extra 10 min on the treadmill!) eggs Benedict special, Louisiana sausage, and unfortunately I can't remember the other dishes that were ordered (it was pretty early in the morning for us and I was nursing a slightly fuzzy head from the previous nite's festivities... HICCUP). 

Try getting there early, by the time we left the wait looked obnoxious. 

Highly recommended and will be back!

excerpts: I totally had a hankering for beignets.
I was psyched they offered the yeasted variety, but completely bummed to find them so incredibly greasy and even boring.
Yes, I know that beignets are fried, and bound to be greasy, but these were extreme.
beignets.author: Casey D.
beignets.review:
Really bummed out. I totally had a hankering for beignets. I was psyched they offered the yeasted variety, but completely bummed to find them so incredibly greasy and even boring. Yes, I know that beignets are fried, and bound to be greasy, but these were extreme.

I ordered scrambled eggs with chicken apple sausage, grits and biscuits. The eggs tasted diluted and bland. The biscuits were the packaged, frozen variety that had been thrown into a microwave and the chicken apple sausage was just eh. The grits were as to be expected. I've had better, but these were nothing to complain about. 

My companion had a scramble that included artichoke hearts, and was overwhelmed my the intense pickling flavor. He got a side of very bland potatoes and a piece of sweet, but decent cornbread. 

In other words, this Sunday's brunch was hugely disappointing.

excerpts: As a person who does not have a major sweet tooth, I must recommend this place on their beignets alone.
beignets.author: G Z.
beignets.review:
Update 5/13:

 Service is still killer but I have a question for the cooks at JFY:
Why is you Sausage gravy sweet? That's just wrong, y'all...

As a person who does not have a major sweet tooth, I must recommend this place on their beignets alone.

They are the BZOMBB. and really, where else but in SF can you enjoy your loving southern breakfast while jamming out to Miami freestyle tunes from the 80s?

excerpts: As many have said epic beignets (popped my cherry).
The spicy salsa on my hash plate was equally dericious too.
Very popular but worth the wait
beignets.author: Gordon E.
beignets.review: As many have said epic beignets (popped my cherry). The spicy salsa on my hash plate was equally dericious too. Very popular but worth the wait

excerpts: The beignets are very good and very messy.
beignets.author: Matt Y.
beignets.review:
The beignets are very good and very messy.  Get at least one plate to share with everyone.

Coming from New Mexico, I've this love for good green chile (with an 'e' not an 'i') and Just For You has pulled through.  I ignored the fact that is was microwaved, because you really can't get New Mexico chile goodness all over your home fries anywhere else.

The owner here sometimes is really, really mean.  She tends to bark at her staff for not making patrons leave fast enough.  If you want to spend a long relaxing brunch chatting it up, you'll probably want to go somewhere else.

excerpts: I love the beignets here.
They are HUGE and come in an order of 3.
beignets.author: Trinh T.
beignets.review:
Yipppppeeeeeee! No wait, for once! It seems that the trick here is to come at 1 PM on Labor Day Weekend... :) Otherwise, Just For You Cafe has been packed every time I've gone. The ambiance is cheerful, cozy  and casual. Perfect for a breakfast spot. Tons of colorful artwork on the walls and a blue marlin hanging by the counter, right above the entrance to the kitchen. I love the beignets here. They are HUGE and come in an order of 3. Have tried the huevos rancheros, cornbeef hash and carnitas omelette (my fav so far). 

Located in the Dogpatch district, the area has character and is usually sunny and warm. More outside seating would make Just For You even better than it already is.

excerpts: The only thing worth the 20 minute wait were the beignets.
The food was so-so at best.
The menu descriptions sounded much better than what we actually got.
It stumps me why this place is so popular.
It "could" be the food that brings people to this place
cause it can't be the service
- I've gotten better service at Taco Bell.
Ok... maybe it wasn't THAT bad
Proly would have given 5 stars if we only had the beignets and coffee.
Too bad we ordered food.
beignets.author: AT V.
beignets.review:
The only thing worth the 20 minute wait were the beignets.  The food was so-so at best.  The menu descriptions sounded much better than what we actually got.  It stumps me why this place is so popular. It "could" be the food that brings people to this place cause it can't be the service - I've gotten better service at Taco Bell.  Ok... maybe it wasn't THAT bad but you get the idea.  

I ordered the bfast burrito with "chorizo" and added house fries for $2.25.  First of all... really?  $2.25 for 8 potato wedges?  I know times are hard these days but seriously?  Second of all, the "chorizo" was not what I expected.  It was more like cut up Italian sausage which is NOT the same thing as Mexican chorizo.  My friend's omelet was strange - it was basically scrambled egg over grilled veggies.  Hmmm... not exactly my idea of an omelet.

Proly would have given 5 stars if we only had the beignets and coffee.  Too bad we ordered food.

excerpts: Not to mention the Beignets, of course.
That being said, the breakfast is substantial and tasty.
As a Southerner living in SF, it's nice to find a spot that serve a good down home breakfast, even if it is a bit pricier then it is back in Dixie.
It's worth it, and you'll probably be pretty good until dinner if you come here for Brunch.
I'm a fan.
beignets.author: Sean H.
beignets.review: If you want a big, legit, tasty, and hangover curing breakfast, this is your place.  A no nonsense old school diner with tonnnnns of breakfast fixing.  Not to mention the Beignets, of course.  That being said, the breakfast is substantial and tasty.  As a Southerner living in SF, it's nice to find a spot that serve a good down home breakfast, even if it is a bit pricier then it is back in Dixie.  It's worth it, and you'll probably be pretty good until dinner if you come here for Brunch.  I'm a fan.

excerpts: but the beignets are still my favorite, with raspberry jam....
yum!

I usually stop by Just For You on a week day morning when I'm "home sick" or have an off week day where I don't have to work because you can get the buy one get one half off coupons on the back of the 16th St Safeway receipts or SF Weekly, but they are only good Mon-Fri.
Weekends are usually way too busy with lines out the door, so I tend to stay away.
I agree service is not that friendly and besides the beignets there's nothing that I LOVE about Just for You, but it's within walking distance of my house.
beignets.author: Sarah M.
beignets.review:
Decent sausage and biscuits...but the beignets are still my favorite, with raspberry jam....yum!
I usually stop by Just For You on a week day morning when I'm "home sick" or have an off week day where I don't have to work because you can get the buy one get one half off coupons on the back of the 16th St Safeway receipts or SF Weekly, but they are only good Mon-Fri.  Weekends are usually way too busy with lines out the door, so I tend to stay away.
I agree service is not that friendly and besides the beignets there's nothing that I LOVE about Just for You, but it's within walking distance of my house.

excerpts: The beignets are awesome, and it's hard to find a good beignet this far away from Nawlins.
beignets.author: Tempe M.
beignets.review:
My brother swears this place has the best breakfast burrito he has ever had in his entire life.  The beignets are awesome, and it's hard to find a good beignet this far away from Nawlins.

In fact, I was going to give this place 4 stars but then I realized that I had the best omelet ever there.  Blue cheese and red bell peppers.  Who knew it would be SO delicious!  Also the corned beef hash and eggs are supposed to be really good.  Cute atmosphere, good service.  The location is a bit weird and is always hard for me to find being from the E.B.  But if you can get there, you should!!

excerpts: Get an order of beignets for outside.
They go well with the free coffee usually provided.
beignets.author: Tom H.
beignets.review:
I'd previously written (3/07) that the cooking staff had quit.  I'm happy to report that they're back (7/07) and cooking up a storm.  Thank god.  You don't want to mess with something that works this well.

Hint for those on the waiting list: Get an order of beignets for outside.  They go well with the free coffee usually provided.

excerpts: but i do highly recommend the beignets.
it was my first time having it
and if i go back that is something i would definitely order
beignets.author: Annie L.
beignets.review:
not really one of my favorite brunch spots...

i ordered an egg scramble with chicken sausage and it was topped with Parmesan cheese (that part was gross)...it was bland but i think the parm cheese made the dish that much worse

but i do highly recommend the beignets. it was my first time having it and if i go back that is something i would definitely order

excerpts: Here's your tip of the day--as soon as you sit down (or maybe while you are walking towards your seat) order beignets to go with your coffee.
You don't want to wait for these fried, hot, tasty, and covered with powdered sugar pastries!

Now with your beignets and coffee you can carefully review the menu and specials and maybe end up with crunchy cornmeal pancakes with fresh eggs and a nice chicken apple sausage, or maybe huevos rancheros in a very very tasty sauce...
oh, and spring for the real maple syrup!!!
beignets.author: Kirk F.
beignets.review:
This is my favorite breakfast place when I am anywhere near Potrero or the ballpark at the right time.  It's great.

Here's your tip of the day--as soon as you sit down (or maybe while you are walking towards your seat) order beignets to go with your coffee.  You don't want to wait for these fried, hot, tasty, and covered with powdered sugar pastries!   Now with your beignets and coffee you can carefully review the menu and specials and maybe end up with crunchy cornmeal pancakes with fresh eggs and a nice chicken apple sausage, or maybe huevos rancheros in a very very tasty sauce...oh, and spring for the real maple syrup!!!

excerpts: but if you can let it go then the food is pretty good and the Beignets are to DIE FOR!
beignets.author: Sheree A.
beignets.review: Service sucks... if you like being talked down to then go here but if you can let it go then the food is pretty good and the Beignets are to DIE FOR!

excerpts: The beignets are sure to be the death of me- sort of a cross between Indian fry bread and Krispy Kreme.
Don't wear a dark shirt, as the powdered sugar will give the impression for the rest of the day that you STILL haven't kicked your nasty habit.
Just two blocks from my new house, I stumbled in on a hungover morning to discover the real reason I moved to this neighborhood.
The Benedict was very flavorful, but I wish they hadn't used toast.
The pancakes were amazing, though, and the eggs, spuds, and oatmeal all best of the best.
beignets.author: Stephen H.
beignets.review: The beignets are sure to be the death of me- sort of a cross between Indian fry bread and Krispy Kreme. Don't wear a dark shirt, as the powdered sugar will give the impression for the rest of the day that you STILL haven't kicked your nasty habit. Just two blocks from my new house, I stumbled in on a hungover morning to discover the real reason I moved to this neighborhood. The Benedict was very flavorful, but I wish they hadn't used toast. The pancakes were amazing, though, and the eggs, spuds, and oatmeal all best of the best.

excerpts: The beignets are always a treat - be careful not to accidentally inhale the sugar powder topping.
You almost can't go wrong at this place
there's so much good food here.
Expect a lineup to get in.
While waiting you can always check out the Hell's Angel's club house nearby ...
beignets.author: Ed P.
beignets.review:
Best breakfast in San Francisco.
What a bold statement but there it is - I've searched high and low for the best breakfast in the city and this place turned out to be the winner.  I usually order the Eggs Blackstone, a great hangover cure: AWESOME bacon (not the Fisher Price crap bacon served at other places), 2 poached eggs and tomato on toast with hollandaise sauce.  Their Hangtown Fry didn't work as advertised, I still had a hangover after but left with a full stomach (it was great).  The beignets are always a treat - be careful not to accidentally inhale the sugar powder topping.  You almost can't go wrong at this place there's so much good food here.
Expect a lineup to get in.  While waiting you can always check out the Hell's Angel's club house nearby ...

excerpts: And the beignets were terrific!
Crisply fried, soft and warm inside, dusted with powdered sugar...
beignets.author: Zoe H.
beignets.review:
Yummy yummy.

Been here three times now. All three times, my food was delicious, the service was friendly and quick, the atmosphere was cozy and charming, the place was clean.... and really... I can't think of anything to complain about.

Let's see... what have I eaten there?

Asparagus sandwich -- ohmigod, how cool is that? HUGE pieces of perfectly-cooked stalks of asparagus, highlighting this very interesting and delicious sandwich. (Did I mention the homemade bread?) I give them extra points for the creativity factor here.

Fabulous breakfast... eggs nicely done, and that wonderful homemade bread toast...

I had the soup of the day once... I think it was creamy asparagus. (I apparently have a "thing" for asparagus.) The soup was delicious. And came with wonderful homemade bread.

Yes... I also have a "thing" for homemade bread.

And the beignets were terrific! Crisply fried, soft and warm inside, dusted with powdered sugar... just delicious.

There are a few tables out front on the sidewalk, but I've eaten indoors when I've gone there -- and they keep the door wide open, so it's got nice circulating air. 

Nope -- can't think of a thing to complain about. Parking isn't ideal... I've had to walk a few blocks to get there... but you know -- it's worth it. I've never had to wait for a table once I got there.

Five stars!!!

excerpts: Other than, I think they serve the best, most authentic beignets I've ever had outside of Cafe du Monde in the Quarter in NOLA.
I'm a Mississippi man, so I know southern food.
They handle it.
And for those of you who say you don't like grits because they are flavorless??
Of course they are, until you put in some salt, pepper, a couple pats of butter, some hot sauce
and I say go big and crumble up your bacon in it too.
I've had people literally stare at me as I go through my grit preparation ritual.
It's A
M A Z
I N G!!
Best to arrive prior to 10am tho to minimize the wait.
beignets.author: Shawn D.
beignets.review: I don't really know what can be said that hasn't been said already.  Other than, I think they serve the best, most authentic beignets I've ever had outside of Cafe du Monde in the Quarter in NOLA.  I'm a Mississippi man, so I know southern food.  They handle it.  And for those of you who say you don't like grits because they are flavorless??? Of course they are, until you put in some salt, pepper, a couple pats of butter, some hot sauce and I say go big and crumble up your bacon in it too.  I've had people literally stare at me as I go through my grit preparation ritual.  It's A M A Z I N G!!   Best to arrive prior to 10am tho to minimize the wait.

excerpts: The people sitting at the tables want to enjoy their food without imagining their beignets tasting like your skid-marked jeans.
Speaking of beignets, I had to try them since everyone's been raving about them.
I was shocked to see how massive they were.
They put so much powdered sugar on them that it looked like they're rolling around in a swarm of cocaine.
We dumped a whole bunch off the beignets and made about 10 lines with powdered sugar for fun.
Wishful thinking I guess.
I had the Crabby Bennie which was a sight for hungry eyes.
The portion was enormous but I was starving and ate the whole thing, even though it was just alright tasting.
beignets.author: Jen Y.
beignets.review:
Just a note- If you happen to be sitting in one of the backless seats at the counter, please make sure you wear underwear. The people sitting at the tables want to enjoy their food without imagining their beignets tasting like your skid-marked jeans. Thank you.

Speaking of beignets, I had to try them since everyone's been raving about them. I was shocked to see how massive they were. They put so much powdered sugar on them that it looked like they're rolling around in a swarm of cocaine. We dumped a whole bunch off the beignets and made about 10 lines with powdered sugar for fun. Wishful thinking I guess. I had the Crabby Bennie which was a sight for hungry eyes. The portion was enormous but I was starving and ate the whole thing, even though it was just alright tasting. However, the OJ was the bomb.

Our waitress was kind of a debbie downer. No smile and it seemed like she didn't want to be there. She got irritated one time and said, "Cell phones aren't allowed in here." Sorry homegirl, we didn't know. But the annoying chick next to us was on her phone BEFORE we even got there and didn't hang up until 15 mins before we left but our waitress didn't say anything to her. Hmph. 

They are cash or check only. There is an ATM at the liquor store next door but the machine charges a $2.25 fee. The place is full of hipsters with staring problems and older folks who love to eat and eat.

On the plus side parking was easy, no wait for tables, and everything was huge and came fast. "That's what she said." Sorry, had to say it! :)

excerpts: Beignets are a must!!
My tummy is most happy!
beignets.author: David C.
beignets.review: This joint rocks!!  Good way to start my weekend with Frittata that has cherry tomatoes, asparagus and pesto!! YUM!! Also the cornbread rocks!! They do such a good job with the cornbread (moist and savory) that I have to take it home to have it for a snack!!  Beignets are a must!!  My tummy is most happy!

excerpts: i got an order of beignets
- they were the real deal holyfield beignets.
light, fluffy, and dusted with powdered sugar.
beignets.author: Ray R.
beignets.review:
we were determined to start the year off with a bang so we wanted to go somewhere we haven't been to on new years morning.  we were thinking of going to sausalito and finding a little breakfast spot but yelp came to the rescue once again and suggested just for you cafe which happened to be open on new years morning.

we got lucky with parking as someone was leaving as soon as we got there but we could see the crowd from a block away.  luckily my cousins got there ahead of us so they were able to sign us up for a spot.  we waited about an hour but we were prepared to wait after reading all the great yelp reviews about this place.  and it totally didn't dissappoint!!

i got an order of beignets - they were the real deal holyfield beignets.  light, fluffy, and dusted with powdered sugar.  scrumptious!

i also got the hangtown fry which if you've never had it, it's the ultimate breakfast and some.  eggs, spinach, bacon, onions all rolled into one and get this not 1, not 2, but 3 deep fried oysters mixed in as well.  served with home potatoes.  i've had this dish at other places, but they pale in comparison to Just For You Cafe's version.

I had a little of my cohorts' breakfastsesss and they were all good.  can't wait to come back here!

excerpts: The beignets are a terrific way to start off breakfast with just one or three to share with friends.
beignets.author: Erik J.
beignets.review:
Just for You Cafe is a really great "local's place".  Newcomers are welcome of course. :)  The only thing on the menu I'm not a fan of are the omlettes.  It's like an egg blanket with steamed insides (you know.. when they use too much egg? )  So -1 star for that.  Everything else that I've had has been yummy.  The scrambles, breakfast burritos and the home made salsas are really special.  The beignets are a terrific way to start off breakfast with just one or three to share with friends.  

The place gets busy past about 11am so expect a wait, but it usually goes pretty fast (they're FAST with their orders).  Coffee is decent and the home made breads (they're all home made I think except for the muffins and bagels) are thick and yummy.  Try the raisin bread, I recommend it.  Sometimes service can slow down a bit when they get busy, but hey... it's a local's place.. and it's inexpensive.  But bring cash, they don't take cards.  oh and the mimosa's are served in big cups.. god bless.. :-)

excerpts:
I really like Just For You, and it has a lot to do with Beignets. 

While it goes without saying I'm a big fan of the beignets (if you don't know, all the more reason to go), I go to have a normal breakfast/brunch in a place that reminds me that quiet corners of the city still exist.
beignets.author: Razoo D.
beignets.review:
I really like Just For You, and it has a lot to do with Beignets. 

We've been here a few times, and have started to bring friends when we go just to share the love. 

The food is just like from the home kitchen, and the service is friendly and unassuming. Just like the Dogpatch to have a nice place like this. 

While it goes without saying I'm a big fan of the beignets (if you don't know, all the more reason to go), I go to have a normal breakfast/brunch in a place that reminds me that quiet corners of the city still exist. 

I recommend Just For You for your visiting (out of town) friends, for relatives, for brunches with old college/HS buddies, and for regular treat-yourself breakfast outings. 

Five stars because it's perfect for an all-around brekky joint with good food and good character.

excerpts: The beignets arrived amply dusted with powdered sugar and were delicious when hot.
beignets.author: michelle s.
beignets.review:
3.75 stars

So with 210 reviews, Just For You really isn't an unknown spot.  However,  traveling to the Dogpatch, you wonder who would make the trip out here.  A beignet craving was my reason to jump out of bed early and travel out of my 'hood.

The beignets arrived amply dusted with powdered sugar and were delicious when hot.  They were crunchy and chewy but had a tartness to them which was a bit strange, still good though.

Squid ordered the chili over scrambled eggs atop homemade cornbread...perfect for a hangover.  I had the eggs and flat, rectangular crabcake which was Old Bay-all-the-way tasty.  I think that they should up the crab content and lessen the breadcrumbs since it left me craving for more crab.   

The service that day was attentive and fast.  Thank goodness that we motivated early bc at 9:30 the Brunchers started forming outside.  Overall, I liked Just For You.  Wish that it were closer to home but it's more special just where it is.

excerpts: We ordered the pillow-sized beignets and I had the pile of homefries with veggies and eggs.

When I ordered the homefry dish, I was worried that it was going to be a giant pile of potatoes with weird stale veggies on the side, but I was served a pleasing minimum amount of potatoes to the ratio of fresh stir-fry that was placed on top.
I was full, but not in a terrible "I just ate a lot of potatoes" kind of way.
One "complaint" would have to be insane amount of powdered sugar on the beignets.
beignets.author: Ross G.
beignets.review:
I was pleased to learn this wasn't one of those "cool on the outside, not tasty on the inside" place. First, they knew I was shy when requesting a pre-seated coffee cup outside, and tailored their sign accordingly, almost insisting I ask for a paper cup. We ordered the pillow-sized beignets and I had the pile of homefries with veggies and eggs. When I ordered the homefry dish, I was worried that it was going to be a giant pile of potatoes with weird stale veggies on the side, but I was served a pleasing minimum amount of potatoes to the ratio of fresh stir-fry that was placed on top. I was full, but not in a terrible "I just ate a lot of potatoes" kind of way. And the melted cheese really glued everything together tastefully.

One "complaint" would have to be insane amount of powdered sugar on the beignets.

excerpts: Oh, did I mentioned the beignets?
We were supposed to be at Jazz Fest but
a plane mishap left here instead.
So this was our Cafe Du Monde proxy.
It was a plate of 3 for $4 and I wanted one and a half.
The other couple said they wanted one
but fortunately they didn't care for it
so I got 1.70 beignets.
Pretty good at first
beignets.author: Russell Q.
beignets.review:
Had brunch after a 20 minute wait in the blazing SF May heat.  In fact it was one of the hotter days in SF.  Since we were eating so late, I toned it down and split a cajun omelet and salad.  Oh, did I mentioned the beignets?  We were supposed to be at Jazz Fest but a plane mishap left here instead.  So this was our Cafe Du Monde proxy.  It was a plate of 3 for $4 and I wanted one and a half.  The other couple said they wanted one but fortunately they didn't care for it so I got 1.70 beignets.  Pretty good at first but later it tasted a bit burnt, which I didn't know was possible.

Anyways the salad was good with a zingly dressing.  But the omelet just wasn't that inspired.  All the right ingredients but so so.  Fortunately the bread came to the rescue.  The bread?  Yes!
Captain HomeMade White Bread!  It had a hearty texture and a wonderful sweet wheat flavor.  The best white bread I can recall having.  

Service was friendly but a bit ad hoc.  You just had to flag them down.

excerpts: Those beignets are HUGE!!!
It's the size of a POP TART... maybe even slightly bigger?
And topped with TONS of snowy powdered sugar goodness in which most ended up on the pair of skating pants I was wearing.
(Not to worry!
beignets.author: Joanna R.
beignets.review:
It must be a sign that I *had* to come here today!  It MUST be!!!

So I'm driving down 280 from San Francisco and I ran into rush hour traffic.  I got off at Mariposa just so I can take a quickie shortcut down 3rd St. to get to the next exit @ Cesar Chavez.  (Yeah, THAT crowded!!!)  As I was driving down, I remember a soul food restaurant and remember it being near 22nd St.  So at 22nd St. I made a right turn and started looking around.  The Beignet sign at "Just For You" cafe flashed before me and I thought this was the soul good place.  (This is Sign #1!  And It wasn't the soul food place I was looking for -- that place was just past 22nd St. on 3rd St.  That said...)  I never tried a beignet before but I had heard all the drooling stories from Yelp reviews (I don't know if it's this place or another place...) 5 minutes later, I found parking right across the street from this place!!!  (Sign #2!)

When I was sitting at my table, I had mentioned that I was told I had to try a beignet.  The waitress asked "Do you want one or 3?"  I realize now that I probably SHOULD have asked how big those things are instead of just ordering 3!  Those beignets are HUGE!!!  It's the size of a POP TART... maybe even slightly bigger?  And topped with TONS of snowy powdered sugar goodness in which most ended up on the pair of skating pants I was wearing.  (Not to worry!  It was going straight to the laundry afterwards...)

I also came at Happy Hour... and for $2, I got myself 2 "crispy tacos".   It looked like tacquitos but crispy shell and topped with good homemade salsa!!!  YUM YUM!!!

Next time I want to break my diet though, I'm headin' for the Hangtown Fry!!!  ;)

excerpts: My basic breakfast of scrambled eggs, grits & toast was very great, and the beignets satisfied my sweet tooth for the whole day!
beignets.author: brittany z.
beignets.review:
I went to Just For You last week for the first time and it was delicious.  Weekday morning at 9:00 seems the perfect time to go - not empty, but no wait either.  My basic breakfast of scrambled eggs, grits & toast was very great, and the beignets satisfied my sweet tooth for the whole day!

Even though this place is a diner, it's very clean and the food is fresh and good - no greasy spoon here.  However, it's still a diner offering plain coffee, whole milk, and real eggs (yolk and all).  So don't think about ordering a latte (like my husband did) or egg whites only.

excerpts: Their beignets made it on my top nine tastes of the year list.
These suckers come to the table piping hot and huge.
HUGE.
My boyfriend and I ordered 2 plates of beignets (3 for $4.50) and home fries (avoid) and only made it through half the beignets.

They are covered in powdered sugar, are much bigger than the New Orleans version -- almost to the point that you wonder if there's a filling, and you'll feel kind of sick that you ate so many doughnuts, but
west of Caf du Monde, it's the best you'll find.
beignets.author: Kathleen M.
beignets.review: Their beignets made it on my top nine tastes of the year list. These suckers come to the table piping hot and huge. HUGE. My boyfriend and I ordered 2 plates of beignets (3 for $4.50) and home fries (avoid) and only made it through half the beignets. They are covered in powdered sugar, are much bigger than the New Orleans version -- almost to the point that you wonder if there's a filling, and you'll feel kind of sick that you ate so many doughnuts, but west of Caf du Monde, it's the best you'll find.

excerpts: My friend and I ordered beignets as an appetizer, 3 for $4.
They were just like the beignets I had in New Orleans, but slightly chewier and covered with way more powdered sugar.
What a delicious way to start your meal!
Then I ordered two scrambled eggs with a ham steak, cornbread and grits.
The scrambled eggs were fine, and the ham steak was a bit overcooked and a bit too salty.
The cornbread was very fresh and still warm, although it was a bit too salty as well.
beignets.author: Yan G.
beignets.review:
***4.5 stars, rounded down.***

If you've been reading my reviews, you already know that I love breakfast food and I love Southern food.  Now, imagine there were a place that served Southern breakfast food!  Why, I say, I'd eat there every day!

Just For You is that kind of place.  Located in the Dogpatch district of San Francisco, steps away from Hard Knox Cafe, Just For You is a Southern diner with a San Francisco flair.  Decorations on the walls say it all: 2007 LSU Championship banner and a giant plastic marlin share the space with cool old movie posters and street festival announcements.  Does anyone else think that it's deliciously appropriate that Just For You is located on 22nd Street between Third Street and *Tennessee* St?  

"Wish that I was on ol' rocky top,
Down in the Tennessee hills.
Ain't no smoggy smoke on rocky top,
Ain't no telephone bills."

But I digress.

It's the kind of a place where you show up before 9 am or wait in line for 30 min to an hour.  (while you wait outside, you can help yourself to some coffee, but it hardly helps).  It's the kind of a place where an older couple at the table next to you will strike a conversation with you and your dining companion.  It's the kind of place where the signs on the door say "we love your baby, not your stroller" and "we reserve the right to pour coffee on your cell phone."  I am not even kidding.

My friend and I ordered beignets as an appetizer, 3 for $4.  They were just like the beignets I had in New Orleans, but slightly chewier and covered with way more powdered sugar.  What a delicious way to start your meal!  Then I ordered two scrambled eggs with a ham steak, cornbread and grits.  The scrambled eggs were fine, and the ham steak was a bit overcooked and a bit too salty.  The cornbread was very fresh and still warm, although it was a bit too salty as well.  We also shared the buttermilk pancakes, which had a fluffy, yet doughy texture.

But none of that mattered much.  What I was looking forward to were the grits.  I LOVE grits.  Allow me to quote Just For You menu here: "What's Grits?  It's that pasty white stuff . . . like you had in prison."  Just For You grits were a bit bland for my taste, but with the right amount of salt and pepper, and, perhaps, even butter, I was able to perfect the chef's creation.

It's no Waffle House--nothing is--but Just For You is as close to a great Southern diner as it gets.  I struggled with the rating, because this place is a true 4.5-star establishment.  Yep, it's a bit more than "Yay!  I am a fan," but it's not quite "Woo-hoo!  As good as it gets."  

I can't wait to come back here for breakfast.  Parking is relatively easy to find, and the service is pretty friendly.

excerpts: The beignets are good, but really, how can anything fried and dusted with sugar be icky-tasting?
I'm not a fan of their crabcakes or the egg scramble.
The french toast is alright, as are the pancakes... sometimes they'll have a decent special, but for a really dependably tasty brunch, I'd say go elsewhere...
OK, I had to update this to 3 stars because the mimosas are served in a PINT GLASS, for the same price as a teeny tiny one you'd get anywhere else.
beignets.author: Jacqui M.
beignets.review:
I live right by this place, but I don't go often (after trying it out many times). The beignets are good, but really, how can anything fried and dusted with sugar be icky-tasting? I'm not a fan of their crabcakes or the egg scramble. The french toast is alright, as are the pancakes... sometimes they'll have a decent special, but for a really dependably tasty brunch, I'd say go elsewhere...

OK, I had to update this to 3 stars because the mimosas are served in a PINT GLASS, for the same price as a teeny tiny one you'd get anywhere else.

excerpts: We also ordered beignets which the cafe describes as "Fresh, Fluffy Pillows of Perfection."
The beignets were soooo good, that my mom wanted to order more for later.
They look like mini pillows dusted with powdered sugar.
The additional star is for their really taste beignets.
We were too full from our meals that my mom didn't bother order an additional serving of beignets to take home.
By the end of the meal, all of us didn't want to see any more food.
It was time for a nap.
beignets.author: Michelle N.
beignets.review:
I came here on Memorial Day thinking that I could order the Crab Cake Po-Boy because it was a Monday.  I was disappointed to discover that because it was a holiday the only menu being offered was the weekend brunch menu (which does NOT include the Po-Boy).  So, my alternate choice was the Crabby Bennie....it's a Creole crab cake on poached egg over toast with hollandaise sauce.  I was given two choices...English muffin or their homemade bread which was pretty much a sourdough bread.  I'm a fan of sourdough so I couldn't pass up that option.   My dish also came with home fries.  I love a really good biscuit too so I ordered a side of that.

My mom ordered the special frittata (which was basically a vegetable omelette with some cheese) with grits and cornbread.

We also ordered beignets which the cafe describes as "Fresh, Fluffy Pillows of Perfection."

The beignets were soooo good, that my mom wanted to order more for later.  They look like mini pillows dusted with powdered sugar.  The taste reminded me of funnel cake that I used to get as a kid at amusement parks.  

My Crabby Bennie was drenched in hollandaise sauce.  I should have requested the sauce on the side.  My dish was just so-so.  Super heavy because of the sauce, the thick slices of homemade bread, and the huge amount of home fries.  I couldn't finish my plate.  I only took one bite of the side of biscuits I got.  One bite was enough because it was really dry.

I took a bite out of my mom's cornbread.  It was meh.  The cornbread at Momo's is by far the best I've had here in SF...so I end up using my cornbread experience at Momo's as my benchmark.

My friend ordered the catfish filet.  I didn't taste that dish because I just felt it was a little too early in the morning to eat heavily breaded fish.

Service wasn't great...quite slow.  Yes, they were busy but there were a few people to wait on the customers. I would give them 3 stars for service.  The additional star is for their really taste beignets.  We were too full from our meals that my mom didn't bother order an additional serving of beignets to take home.  By the end of the meal, all of us didn't want to see any more food.  It was time for a nap.

excerpts: Service is quick, there's lots of add-on options for breakfast plates and they serve the biggest beignets and mimosas that I've ever seen.
It's cash only, parking is easy but there's almost always a wait.
A nice  neighborhood spot if you're in the area.
beignets.author: Kimmie N.
beignets.review:
Cozy brunch spot with the best bar stools in the world.  I would have given them five stars if there were bar hooks for purses, but alas I had to drop my bag on the floor. Service is quick, there's lots of add-on options for breakfast plates and they serve the biggest beignets and mimosas that I've ever seen.  
It's cash only, parking is easy but there's almost always a wait.  A nice  neighborhood spot if you're in the area.

excerpts: This place has the best beignets on the planet!
Bar none!
Go in late night for piping hot beignets and there's no wait like in the mornings!
beignets.author: Chrys K.
beignets.review: This place has the best beignets on the planet! Bar none! Go in late night for piping hot beignets and there's no wait like in the mornings!

excerpts: Also, you MUST get the beignets!!!
They are warm, doughy, and covered in powdered sugar.
You can even put a little extra syrup on them.
beignets.author: Jennifer C.
beignets.review:
I can feel the Dogpatch locals leering at me now...I'm sorry guys, but there is no way you're keeping this place a secret!!!  So far, this is my favorite brunch place in San Francisco. Apparently this place is a creole restaurant and you can totally see that peek through in their brunch fair. The best thing I've had there is the Bleu Scramble. I promise you won't be disappointed. 

Also, you MUST get the beignets!!! They are warm, doughy, and covered in powdered sugar. You can even put a little extra syrup on them. It's awesome because it rolls right off of the powdered sugar like little worms :) 

Plus, they have a coffee dispenser outside to keep all the waiting hungry people at bay....Yum!!!!!!

excerpts: Known for their beignets and snarky signs - we ordered 3 of them & the standard breakfasts - eggs, scramble & cinnamon raisin toasts.
Never having a beignets before, I am a fan.
The outside was crisp and moist inside.
The powdered sugar on top was literally icing on the cake.
I sampled a piece with their syrup and it was just so much better alone.
Very cute vibe, great service & wonderful menu.
Definitely worth the visit and the calories.
beignets.author: Mimi S.
beignets.review: SF was good to me & my belly.  On our way out we stopped by this cafe Monday around 10:30 - 11am with no line.  Located in the Dog Patch area, the place was artsy, small and you felt lucky to have found parking. Known for their beignets and snarky signs - we ordered 3 of them & the standard breakfasts - eggs, scramble & cinnamon raisin toasts. Never having a beignets before, I am a fan. The outside was crisp and moist inside. The powdered sugar on top was literally icing on the cake. I sampled a piece with their syrup and it was just so much better alone.  Very cute vibe, great service & wonderful menu. Definitely worth the visit and the calories.

excerpts: I'll definitely go back for the beignets.
Update: been back many times since initial review, no complaints, other than I wish it were closer to my neighborhood.
beignets.author: Pam D.
beignets.review:
Had a Zipcar for the day so I drove over to Just For You at 8:30 on a Saturday morning and got a table right away (but people were waiting by the time we left at 9:30). This was our first time and the staff was pleasant and attentive (I'm pretty sure we were waited on by the owner who is said to be cranky in other reviews but she was okay) and the food was good. I had Greg's Scramble with bacon since everything's better with bacon. Very tasty  sauteed with onions and spinach. The old man had buckwheat pancakes and sausage. Tasted both, both good. My biscuit was good but not great and the grits would have been better with cheese but that's just me. I'll definitely go back for the beignets.

Update: been back many times since initial review, no complaints, other than I wish it were closer to my neighborhood.

excerpts: The beignets were warm & tasty and served Cafe du
Monde style.
However, Brenda's beignets are still #1 in my book.
beignets.author: Tiffany M.
beignets.review:
aw shucks.

I wasn't really impressed w/ this cafe. I was hoping it'd knock my socks off since I had been meaning to go for quite some time, but it was just average. 

The beignets were warm & tasty and served Cafe du Monde style. However, Brenda's beignets are still #1 in my book. I ordered their Chili Scramble w/ a side of grits w/ the scramble's flavors uninteresting and the grits bland as ever.

Service was as friendly as it gets, so I'm disappointed that their brunch didn't measure up.

excerpts: Eggs, toast, beignets, coffee, all just hit the spot.
beignets.author: Melinda K.
beignets.review:
Hooray for Mabel's Just For You! And, you know what, it really IS just for you. You. You right there. You're thinking of going for breakfast? Go to Mabel's Just For You. 

The menu is funny, the waitrons are sweet, the line is never terribly long, you can easily find parking, it's conveniently located right by CalTrain for your peninsula pals, and it's right by the T line, 48, and 22 for your Muni riders. 

The food, you ask? Eggs, toast, beignets, coffee, all just hit the spot. 

One time, though, I got the oyster omelette thing, which was guaranteed to cure a hangover, and, well, it really didn't.

excerpts: The Beignets are Amazing and a must have in San Francisco.
All the dishes I have tried there are very good.
Parking is a nightmare and it can be a bit of a wait
but, can I hold that against them def.
not especially the latter!
beignets.author: Mike R.
beignets.review: Very good food and the prices are reasonable. The Beignets are Amazing and a must have in San Francisco. All the dishes I have tried there are very good. Parking is a nightmare and it can be a bit of a wait but, can I hold that against them def. not especially the latter!

excerpts: The beignets are always good when I have had them and I used to eat there an embarrassing amount.
:) Also, $5 mimosas in a pint glass?
beignets.author: Neely M.
beignets.review:
I took a star away cuz the wait is so long but this place is tiny and people love it so what should I expect?

I have never had a bad meal from here - from eggs and chorizo to a burger. They bake their own bread - get the cornbread, it's awesome. Their coffee is delish. The beignets are always good when I have had them and I used to eat there an embarrassing amount. :) Also, $5 mimosas in a pint glass? Excellent.

The servers bust ass and are nice, too! Parking ain't sooo bad in this hood. And, the liquor store next door is friendly and will give you cash back when you get done eating and realize you spent all your money at the bar last night. I could have sworn I had a $20 left!

excerpts: But we split the beignets, which were 3 for $4.
WOW!!!!
These beignets were warm, delicious, sweet, fluffy... we couldn't finish the last one
so I boxed it up and took it home.
And the price?
A total bargain!!!
beignets.author: ting b.
beignets.review:
This place would be a 4-star cafe if it weren't for their dinner service (which I think they started rather recently).

I came here twice, once for brunch and once for dinner. It was like night and day... the brunch is amazing, though there is a long wait, they hustle people in and out pretty fast, plus they have free hot, delicious coffee outside with cream and sugar for waiting patrons. 

I got a chili scramble which was sufficiently savory and tasty, but it did not stand out in any way over other chili scrambles I've had. I also ordered a hot chocolate with soy milk, which was pretty disappointing (read: Nestle instant hot chocolate :(  )

My friend got some sort of omelette, I forget what kind. But we split the beignets, which were 3 for $4. WOW!!!! These beignets were warm, delicious, sweet, fluffy... we couldn't finish the last one so I boxed it up and took it home. And the price? A total bargain!!! I give their brunch 4 stars.

Unfortunately, their dinner service gets 2 stars. The menu is way vast, they need to trim it down. I came with the same friend I went to brunch with and we split clam chowder (which was served tepid and underseasoned), pork chops with veggies (the veggies came straight out of a frozen bag and the pork required a chainsaw to cut apart and chew), and tilapia fish with pico de gallo (basically they drenched a tired old frozen piece of fish with tabasco sauce). The total damage came out to $45. BAAAAADDD.

I would warn you about the dinner service, I think this place has the potential to rise up to the occasion and clean up their act for dinner, since they are able to put out a great brunch service, but they really need to focus on a few simple, delicious dishes they are good at and cut out the dozens of other items they have on the dinner menu that they clearly aren't capable of making. Also there was nobody inside the restaurant when we had dinner, which is an indication of just how bad the dinner service is.

excerpts: We started off with the beignets which had some powdered sugar sprinkled over it.
It had an interesting chewy consistency and was a somewhat sour dough.
Next time we'll order the beignets then just share a dish.
beignets.author: Cindy B.
beignets.review: We arrived around 9:15am and were able to get a seat right away.  We started off with the beignets which had some powdered sugar sprinkled over it.  It had an interesting chewy consistency and was a somewhat sour dough.  I ordered the Creole crab cake with sides of grits and biscuits.  My friend ordered Greg's scramble.  Both dishes were very yummy though we had a ton of leftovers.  Next time we'll order the beignets then just share a dish.

excerpts: This place is a favorite for brunch...waiting for a table is the usual routine but worth it because of the beignets...order them just when your seated...they are sprinkled with powdered sugar just the right touch to these warm melt in your mouth  treat with your first gulp of coffee...
Of course I am a fan of their cornmeal cakes, but if I am doing the beignets, I will opt for one of the scrambles...
beignets.author: Scooter G.
beignets.review:
This place is a favorite for brunch...waiting for a table is the usual routine but worth it because of the beignets...order them just when your seated...they are sprinkled with powdered sugar just the right touch to these warm melt in your mouth  treat with your first gulp of coffee...

Of course I am a fan of their cornmeal cakes, but if I am doing the beignets, I will opt for one of the scrambles... I have to say you can't go wrong with the food...

There are days that the service is great and when they are really busy it can be tough getting served...But I am willing to spend my time their for a good meal.

excerpts: Neither, it turns out, are Just For You's beignets.
beignets.author: robin s.
beignets.review:
In any other city, Just For You would be a serious brunch contender. They've got the style and atmosphere down. But... style and atmosphere are not delicious with a cup of strong coffee.

Neither, it turns out, are Just For You's beignets.

There is just some element of deliciousness missing here.

But listen: It's still good. And a fine choice if you're in the neighborhood. Guzzle some coffee, scarf an omelette. Skip the donuts. Go for a walk.

excerpts: They serve fluffy beignets sprinkled with confection sugar hot off the oven!
beignets.author: Joyce S.
beignets.review:
I love Just for You. It's a quick 5 minute walk from my SF apartment, so that's an added bonus for me. And for those who have to drive, there's plenty of parking in the Dog Patch!

I passed by JFY for months before checking it out. I'd see crowds of people standing outside the joint while walking my dog in the neighborhood. Finally decided to go for brunch one Saturday morning, and I was pleasantly surprised to find the food yummy with a southern feel to it.

Whether you order their granola with fruit and yogurt or their chili scramble over cornbread, you won't leave with an unsatisfied stomach. An added bonus? They serve fluffy beignets sprinkled with confection sugar hot off the oven!
