Tip: On weekends, get there before 11am if you want to avoid waiting for a table for over 15 minutes. If you come later, expect to wait a long, long time. And because seating's pretty limited, I'd recommend just going here for 2some meals, NOT large groups. Also, they don't take credit card so bring CASH.

excerpts: Their beignets are to die for!
I've tried the beignet flight at Brenda's French Soul food and it is NOT as good compared to Just for You Cafe.
Just for You's plain powder sugar beignets beats Brench's chocolate stuffed, crawfish stuff, apple stuffed beignets any day!
But 5 stars on the beignets for sure!
beignets.author: Kim D.
beignets.review:
Their beignets are to die for! I've tried the beignet flight at Brenda's French Soul food and it is NOT as good compared to Just for You Cafe. Just for You's plain powder sugar beignets beats Brench's chocolate stuffed, crawfish stuff, apple stuffed beignets any day! 

I ate other brunch food there too--its so so. But 5 stars on the beignets for sure!

excerpts: I sauntered into Just For You (did they ditch the "Mabel's" part?) and were immediately swept off our feet by the sweet smell of beignets (http://www.justforyoucafe.com/_img/menu/beignets-weekend.gif) coming from the kitchen and the calming sounds of Pinback (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pinback) coming from the speakers.
We then promptly threw down the perfect triple beverage order (water, coffee, mimosa) and proceeded to have one the most wonderfully indulgent brunches ever.
beignets.author: Kevin D.
beignets.review:
So, this place has been rockin' a solid #2 on my best Bay Area brunch list (actual Yelp list coming soon), but after a particularly awesome experience there a couple weeks ago, it just might be the new #1.

It went like this... after a night of heavy boozing, my companion and I sauntered into Just For You (did they ditch the "Mabel's" part?) and were immediately swept off our feet by the sweet smell of beignets (http://www.justforyoucafe.com/_img/menu/beignets-weekend.gif) coming from the kitchen and the calming sounds of Pinback (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pinback) coming from the speakers.  We then promptly threw down the perfect triple beverage order (water, coffee, mimosa) and proceeded to have one the most wonderfully indulgent brunches ever.  I mean, I'm pretty sure we ordered three sides of bacon.

These guys have one of the best brunch menus I've ever seen.  From the hangover scramble (see below) to the grilled catfish, everything is solid, and their specials (homemade corned beef hash!) rock almost as hard as the classic Bottom of the Hill show posters adorning the walls.

excerpts: Like the beignets and the cornmeal pancakes.
beignets.author: Jun B.
beignets.review:
I love Just For You. 

I love that they have longanisa (Filipino sausage) on their brunch menu.  And it was tasty, too!  I love that their cornbread is sweet but not overly sweet. I love that they have outdoor tables, which are perfect when dining with your pooch.  I love that you can help yourself with coffee outside while waiting for your table.  And I love that it's so close to our loft in the Dogpatch.

We will be back for more.  Like the beignets and the cornmeal pancakes.

excerpts: I did have the beignets -- OMG!!!
I ordered 3 and when I first tried it it looked so overwhelming..
it was huge.
Come to find out, it was just airy, but it was very tasteful.
beignets.author: R M.
beignets.review:
I enjoyed the eclectic ambience.  Wait staff was friendly

I did have the beignets -- OMG!!!  I ordered 3 and when I first tried it it looked so overwhelming.. it was huge.  Come to find out, it was just airy, but it was very tasteful.  they tend to overdue it with the powder sugar, but you can always dust it off.

I've only gone during the week for breakfast so I was never faced with waiting in line, but I can totally see how rowded it can get.

Breakfast menu is also great.  You can find a couple in the Guardian newspaper for 1/2 off second breakfast :-)

excerpts: Excellent beignets...really, really, really yummy.
Save the airfare to New Orleans; you have a Cafe du Monde right here in Dogpatch.
Other than that the food was good and the service was solid.
beignets.author: G-Rex R.
beignets.review:
Excellent beignets...really, really, really yummy.  Save the airfare to New Orleans; you have a Cafe du Monde right here in Dogpatch.  Other than that the food was good and the service was solid.   No complaints.  

Clearly though the owner has lots to complain about.  I felt that Sister Mary Angelica had written all the signs instructing people what to do, what not to do, whether a stroller was OK, whether you could talk on your cell phone, how long you should wash your hands, etc.  OK, I get it.  Its your place and thus its your rules.  But hey, its my money and I'll eat where I feel welcome.

excerpts: You need to start out by trying the beignets.
They are really soft.
Next, move on to something savory.
There are a lot of good options; my friend and I went with the Greg's scramble with chicken apple sausage (dish was frequently mentioned in Yelp reviews).
The portions are fairly generous and pretty inexpensive.
I definitely will be going back (today was my first time), but I will likely try a different entree next time.
beignets.author: Rami R.
beignets.review: Great brunch place. Good environment: full and lively, but not too loud. The service was also pretty quick. You need to start out by trying the beignets. They are really soft. Next, move on to something savory. There are a lot of good options; my friend and I went with the Greg's scramble with chicken apple sausage (dish was frequently mentioned in Yelp reviews). The portions are fairly generous and pretty inexpensive. I definitely will be going back (today was my first time), but I will likely try a different entree next time.

excerpts: The beignets are a must.
beignets.author: Katalin G.
beignets.review: One of my favourite place to eat in SF. Simple, cosy, quirky with delicious, delicious food for a great price. The ingredients are carefully sourced from the best suppliers. The guys who run the place are obviously in love with what they do - and you will love the result. The beignets are a must. :)

excerpts: My first experience with beignets was fantastic, but the eggs and toast that was my "real" breakfast was delicious and fresh too.
A nice quiet area of SF where parking is easy too.
beignets.author: Anne R.
beignets.review: Yum! My first experience with beignets was fantastic, but the eggs and toast that was my "real" breakfast was delicious and fresh too. A nice quiet area of SF where parking is easy too.

excerpts: We started with their famous beignets and smothered them with homemade raspberry jam -- C'est Magnific!!
beignets.author: Katie C.
beignets.review:
The wait??  Mmmm... Longgggg.  However, they make up for it with the free drip coffee outside.

The food??  Deeee-lish!  We started with their famous beignets and smothered them with homemade raspberry jam -- C'est Magnific!!  The grits were grrrrreat, the coffee was fresh, and the breakfast choices are a'plentiful.

This is a great spot for brunch on a cold Sunday [or any cold day that ends in "Y"].  It's a bit out there in Dog Patch-landia, but make the trip [and thank me later].

excerpts: Beignets!
BIG ONES!!
DANG
beignets.author: Kellie P.
beignets.review:
Beignets! BIG ONES!!! DANG THEY ARE GOOD!!!

The staff was nothing short of  rad. Awesome service, and lots of smiles. I can tell they actually like being there ;) This one gal said it was her birthday and she was still there at work! How cute.

I was lucky to be sitting across from my cute man outside of this great cafe on a beautiful sunny day (today).

Good Coffee (I am a cafe junkie, this is a must!!!), Nice fun decor, and THEY HAVE PO'BOYS!! If you don't know what a Po'boy is... Well... I'm sorry.
I got the Huevos Rancheros, it was HUGE and Yummy. A bit too much cheese for me, but a cheese lovers delight.

Anyway, big thumbs up, I am getting an Oyster Po'Boy for sho in the near future!

excerpts: The food was ok, and the beignets were overrated.
You can't just fry dough and put some sugar on it and call it a day.
beignets.author: Shal J.
beignets.review:
Venturing outside of my neighborhood for brunch is not proving to be worth the gasoline... I was excited to try this place, but it was just ok for me (I am seriously channeling American Idol - "it was just ok for me, dawg"). 

The food was ok, and the beignets were overrated. You can't just fry dough and put some sugar on it and call it a day. I mean, you could, and it would probably taste decent (let's face it), but it's not necessarily a beignet.

Maybe brunch places are really specific to their neighborhoods and therefore they satisfy people who can walk there. But for me, this was another place that wasn't worth getting in the car.

excerpts: My friends got some beignets and eggs benedict, and I got biscuits and gravy.
Everything was awesome, and reasonably priced.
It tasted way better than Boogaloos.
Will definitely be back.
beignets.author: Beth D.
beignets.review: I had a great brunch here on Sunday. If you're going to be quick I recommend going about a half hour / 45 minutes before they close and you won't have to wait. My friends got some beignets and eggs benedict, and I got biscuits and gravy. Everything was awesome, and reasonably priced. It tasted way better than Boogaloos. Will definitely be back.

excerpts: Your beignets are simply brilliant and the hangtown fry is tAsty!!
beignets.author: Sandrita R.
beignets.review:
I miss you Just for you. I know you're just for me b/c you thought to serve mouth-watering  New Mexico green chile for which I will eternally be a fan. I used to belly up to the counter at your old location too and you've never let me down since. Your beignets are simply brilliant and the hangtown fry is tAsty!!
3.5

excerpts: The menu is quite nice as it appears you can order breakfast at anytime, but, being lunch, I ordered a Veggie Reuben and a beignet (I had to, I love beignets).
My companion had grilled cheese and a salad which she enjoyed.
The Reuben was beautiful and almost as hot as our waitress (you know the one :) ).
The veggies were wonderfully cooked and the Reuben sauce was perfectly proportioned and seasoned.
Really quite nice.
The best part was that the rye bread (made in-house) was perfectly toasted--
I love it when the center is crunchy and moist while the crust is crunchy and chewy.
Wow!
The beignets are awful.
Almost rancid.
Tasted totally store-bought mix to me.
Too salty, consistency not good at all and too much powdered sugar (a thick layer of Gu that actually turned bitter.
How is that possible?)
it could have been that the oil was either too new or too old, I guess, or is it just that they have no love for the beignets?
Just using, abusing perhaps, them as a marketing tool.
beignets.author: Roop D.
beignets.review:
This spot reminds me a bit of the NYC-- something about the interior and the street. A diverse crowd of Dotconners and artist-types were already eating (do these people ever work?). 

Upon entering, the wonderful smell of baking yeasty type treats granted me a peak back into my youth-- my dad (a rocket scientist) is an amazing baker; this fact has certainly put a little tonnage upon me (should a 6'3" vegetarian go 220, it is a fit-220), but it has also allowed me to really appreciate the sweet things.

The menu is quite nice as it appears you can order breakfast at anytime, but, being lunch, I ordered a Veggie Reuben and a beignet (I had to, I love beignets). My companion had grilled cheese and a salad which she enjoyed. It looked delicious.

The Reuben was beautiful and almost as hot as our waitress (you know the one :) ). The veggies were wonderfully cooked and the Reuben sauce was perfectly proportioned and seasoned. Really quite nice. The best part was that the rye bread (made in-house) was perfectly toasted-- I love it when the center is crunchy and moist while the crust is crunchy and chewy. Wow!
Great lemonade and appears to be 'endless'.

I was really feeling 5 stars here (8 stars for the waitress)-- I know, I know. Rest assured that I am just looking at the menu and not ordering.

Then I took a bite of beignet. How do I say this without sounding unclear?
The beignets are awful. Almost rancid.
Tasted totally store-bought mix to me. Too salty, consistency not good at all and too much powdered sugar (a thick layer of Gu that actually turned bitter. How is that possible?) and not enough of that deep-fried magic. 

It could have been a bad day for the fry cook it could have been that the oil was either too new or too old, I guess, or is it just that they have no love for the beignets? Just using, abusing perhaps, them as a marketing tool. Dough can be temperamental and insolent if ignored or taken lightly, and when scorned all the sugar in the world will not make it delicious again.

I think out this way you get soppapillas, but if you really, really want a beignet this ain't the place (The Farmer's Market in LA has a nice beignet.)

excerpts: The only real draw here is the beignets, which are great.
Everything else is standard diner breakfast, nothing special about anything here.
Except their prices (ex. sliced avocado is $2.25...
uh, freals?)
So not worth it.
They also lost a star for being difficult...
they'll
only accept one credit card per check.
So if you go with four peeps and everyone has plastic, one person gets stuck with the bill or you're all running for an atm.
I mean, yes, it's annoying to split a check onto four cards, and no, we didn't try to do that, but it irked me they "couldn't" take two cards.
Everyone knows damn well it's
*wouldn't* not couldn't.
beignets.author: Emily T.
beignets.review: Regular old breakfast dressed up in brunchy prices is a turn off.  The only real draw here is the beignets, which are great.  Everything else is standard diner breakfast, nothing special about anything here.  Except their prices (ex. sliced avocado is $2.25...uh, freals?)  So not worth it.  They also lost a star for being difficult...they'll only accept one credit card per check.  So if you go with four peeps and everyone has plastic, one person gets stuck with the bill or you're all running for an atm.  I mean, yes, it's annoying to split a check onto four cards, and no, we didn't try to do that, but it irked me they "couldn't" take two cards.  Everyone knows damn well it's *wouldn't* not couldn't.

excerpts: and I couldn't believe the size of their beignets..
they were like comfy pillows!
I'm glad they offer full plate and single portions to order...
beignets.author: Pauline L.
beignets.review:
When the menu itself starts sassing you back, you know you entered a good place.  We got seated right away and I couldn't believe the size of their beignets..they were like comfy pillows! I'm glad they offer full plate and single portions to order...I swear I can't eat that much T__T.

I love the Greg's Scramble with chicken apple sausage...I think anything with apples in it is gold!
My cousins got the Frittatas of the Decade and Greg's Scramble with mushrooms.
Can I get a holla from my soul food brutha! The portions were good and the atmosphere was homey.

Getting here was an adventure, why didn't anyone tell me that mapquest is run by a she-demon? Going there from Potrero Hill was hell! We got lost in the park, swarmed all over curvy lanes...I could have just went there by 3rd Street instead!

Parking is non-metered areas for 2 hours...we got lucky and got in right away, but I heard lines are aplenty and only bring cash...mama don't take that plastic crap.

excerpts: Nothing to come back for except the beignets.
beignets.author: Heiko P.
beignets.review: A hip spot, but the food was just OK. Nothing to come back for except the beignets.

excerpts: Like everyone else said it's the beignets.
Get it and enjoy.
The rest of the menu is average.
beignets.author: Laurence H.
beignets.review: Like everyone else said it's the beignets.  Get it and enjoy.  The rest of the menu is average.

excerpts: They have the best beignets!
They were light, crispy and smothered in powdered sugar.
I laughed at the amount they put on there, but found myself using my beignet as a sponge trying to mop up every last bit of it.
I also had the chili scramble.
Whoever came up with this is a total genius!
Chili on top of scrambled eggs on top of corn bread.
*drool*
beignets.author: Adelina W.
beignets.review: It's a cute cozy place with excellent service. They come by frequently to refill your coffee. They have the best beignets! They were light, crispy and smothered in powdered sugar. I laughed at the amount they put on there, but found myself using my beignet as a sponge trying to mop up every last bit of it. I also had the chili scramble. Whoever came up with this is a total genius! Chili on top of scrambled eggs on top of corn bread. *drool*

excerpts: and you've got to try the beignets if you go.
it'll make you feel all warm inside and put an even bigger smile on your face as you leave.
beignets.author: Art O.
beignets.review:
there's always a wait here but it's well worth it. some favorites are the biscuits with gravy and eggs with longanisa (filipino sausage). i hadn't had longanisa since i was a kid (it was sweet, spicy, and fatty like i remembered) and i was so stoked to find it here that i called my pops to tell him about it. one of these days i'll find out how it got on this menu, of all places...

oh yeah, and you've got to try the beignets if you go. it'll make you feel all warm inside and put an even bigger smile on your face as you leave.

excerpts: and I've got to say that I was so excited to find beignets!
These things were huge, and tasty, but not like cafe du monde.
I would die for those.
I gained 6lbs eating those on my last trip to NOLA.
beignets.author: Carol C.
beignets.review:
I stumbled by this place in the middle of house-hunting and I've got to say that I was so excited to find beignets!  These things were huge, and tasty, but not like cafe du monde.  I would die for those.  I gained 6lbs eating those on my last trip to NOLA.  mmmm

Anyway, the breakfast sandwich was excellent.  I will definitely have to go back.  I was there later in the day and didn't see any screaming ladies.  The staff was friendly and it seemed like a great neighborhood restaurant.

excerpts: We also shared a plate of beignets.
Mmmm....the corned beef hash was freshly made with large/small chunks of corned beef, potatoes, red peppers, and onions.
The biscuits were freshly baked and were very good too.
The beignets were to die for, you must try them if you come here.
Share a plate of three with friends or order individually.
beignets.author: Kenny J.
beignets.review:
I wish I could have brunch everyday, but I would probably gain 50lbs. lol!!

I went here for brunch with a few friends and we had to wait a bit for a table for five. Easy parking though. Well worth the wait.

Service was pretty good, my coffee cup was kept full, although the first time we did have to ask. Milk on the table also needed a refill. I had the corned beef hash special with biscuits and eggs over easy. We also shared a plate of beignets. Mmmm....the corned beef hash was freshly made with large/small chunks of corned beef, potatoes, red peppers, and onions. The biscuits were freshly baked and were very good too. The beignets were to die for, you must try them if you come here. Share a plate of three with friends or order individually. We actually got a plate of four.

You'll need some beta for the bathroom situation. So there's a restroom sign and the door actually doesn't have a handle. But, there's also another bathroom further back and to the left around the corner. There's no sign to label it because it's probably for the staff, but they don't seem to mind if you use it. Although, they may not actually tell you it's there when they see you waiting in front of the other bathroom.

excerpts: Good food, good service.. and the beignets were pretty good too.
Try the french toast though.
That's why I'll come back.
Oh ya, turn off your cell phone..
it's the rule here, as it should be MOST places.
beignets.author: John R.
beignets.review:
Good food, good service.. and the beignets were pretty good too. Try the french toast though. That's why I'll come back.
Oh ya, turn off your cell phone.. it's the rule here, as it should be MOST places.

excerpts: Holy shit, the beignets!
Even after having a big breakfast which left me completely full, I had to order them.
And, although they were to-go, we pretty much scarfed half of it all up by the time we got to our car after leaving the restaurant!
So very yummy!
Aside from the beignets, I had the Greg's Scramble with bacon.
The eggs were scrambled soft, just the way I like it, without me having to ask for it.
We also had an order of their clam chowder.
Overall, pretty good place to have breakfast -- but really, their beignets...
oh man!
beignets.author: Crys L.
beignets.review:
Holy shit, the beignets!  Even after having a big breakfast which left me completely full, I had to order them.  And, although they were to-go, we pretty much scarfed half of it all up by the time we got to our car after leaving the restaurant!  So very yummy!  It comes out hot, fresh, crispy, yet soft and pillowy, not to mention with a large amount of powder sugary goodness!

Aside from the beignets, I had the Greg's Scramble with bacon.  The eggs were scrambled soft, just the way I like it, without me having to ask for it.  We also had an order of their clam chowder.  I've never had clam chowder with a chile in it, but it added a surprisingly nice kick to it.

The service was alright; pretty laid back -- the girls that were working there the day I dined here didn't seem too friendly (they hardly ever smiled), but they did their job and my coffee/water was filled when needed.  Also, I don't know if it had anything to do with sitting by the window/door, but we had to occasionally swat away the flies that kept trying to steal our food, how dare they!

Overall, pretty good place to have breakfast -- but really, their beignets... oh man!

excerpts: I might come here for another weekday breakfast to give the beignets a try!
beignets.author: Shannon R.
beignets.review:
Cute place! Wish it was in the Mission, but hey, then it probably would lose some of its appeal! 

I saw their coupon on the back of my Safeway receipt, and decided to check it out. They make their own bread, and it's very hearty! I had the crabcake sandwich and my boyfriend had the catfish fillet with eggs and grits...the main thing that stood out to us, though, me was the super friendly service. Both of the guys manning the place were so nice and down to earth. 

I might come here for another weekday breakfast to give the beignets a try!

excerpts: , they have longanisa, offer beignets, and their mimosas are served in pint glasses!!
If it was in my 'hood, I'll be there all the time buying beignets by the dozen.
beignets.author: Ezduzit S.
beignets.review:
What an appropriate name.  Their menu suits me perfectly:  you have the option for grits instead of homefries, they have longanisa, offer beignets, and their mimosas are served in pint glasses!!

The staff are super cool and the parking easy breezy.  The only problem was that its located at the far end of the city from me. If it was in my 'hood, I'll be there all the time buying beignets by the dozen.

excerpts:
But I had lunch here last week and was frankly a bit disappointed by the main course and the reverberant noise level  (the Beignets, did NOT disappoint and were everything the reviewers have promised).

The coleslaw was very good (not too creamy); the ice tea smooth and not bitter, the Beignets were reason enough to come here---but the main act, the sandwich, just didn't soar.  
And I was saddened.
The Beignets I got to go, however, redeemed 99% of the experience.
beignets.author: Roger W.
beignets.review:
Uh oh.  I might be a dissenter here, because everyone else wants to give 4+ stars.
But I had lunch here last week and was frankly a bit disappointed by the main course and the reverberant noise level  (the Beignets, did NOT disappoint and were everything the reviewers have promised).

First the noise: I watched servers and the manager YELL at each other to get simple orders done and at least two phone orders failed because the person on the register couldn't hear the speaker.  They have Anechoic foam blocks (the funny little pyramids) on the ceiling----but they need A LOT MORE given the noise level the flat, hard surfaces in this place generate.  Even the staff thinks so--although they might not say it to your face.

I had the Crab Cake Po'Boy sandwich with a side of coleslaw and ice tea.  OK, I have my expectations; the crab cakes should taste mostly of crab, not filling; the roll should be good, but not too thick; the mayo should add something, perhaps by being really fresh or by having something a little spicy in it.  But the Crab cake tasked a bit too much of filling, the roll sort of detracted---and the mayo just didn't do it for me.  The coleslaw was very good (not too creamy); the ice tea smooth and not bitter, the Beignets were reason enough to come here---but the main act, the sandwich, just didn't soar.  And I was saddened.
The Beignets I got to go, however, redeemed 99% of the experience.

I'll go back and give it another shot; maybe the catfish Po'Boy is the way to go.

excerpts: I was really looking forward to it because I heard the beignets are bangin' and I've read the rave reviews about the place.
We ordered mimosas--theirs come in a pint glass (the more, the merrier), beignets (of course!), and we all picked different breakfast dishes.
There was a lot to choose from the menu...being Filipino, I even got excited to see "longganisa" (Fiipino breakfast sausage) on the menu.
I was tempted to order it, but since it was my birthday, I should try something different.
I ordered the Eggs Benedict Special (instead of ham, it was roast beef) from the Specials of the Day.
The beignets were good, but not good enough to constantly crave for, and sadly, I didn't enjoy my Eggs Benedict Special.
beignets.author: Barbra C.
beignets.review:
As one of my many birthday celebrations this month, my friends took me out to brunch last Sunday here. I was really looking forward to it because I heard the beignets are bangin' and I've read the rave reviews about the place.

On a Sunday morning around 10AM, there was plenty of parking in the area. We came early enough to beat the major crowd; we still had to wait for about 15 minutes, but not bad for a party of 6. We ordered mimosas--theirs come in a pint glass (the more, the merrier), beignets (of course!), and we all picked different breakfast dishes. There was a lot to choose from the menu...being Filipino, I even got excited to see "longganisa" (Fiipino breakfast sausage) on the menu. I was tempted to order it, but since it was my birthday, I should try something different. I ordered the Eggs Benedict Special (instead of ham, it was roast beef) from the Specials of the Day. The beignets were good, but not good enough to constantly crave for, and sadly, I didn't enjoy my Eggs Benedict Special.

Even though I didn't enjoy my main dish, I would still come back here for breakfast/brunch if I was in the Potrero Hill area. Love the Mimosa Pints! And the staff is friendly and attentive. But I would definitely order something else...no Eggs Benedict Special for me anymore!

excerpts: I'm glad to see from other reviews that the beignets are still good.
beignets.author: Barbara B.
beignets.review:
Years ago, this was a favorite breakfast spot for me, in the original hole-in-the-wall location on 18th St.  I'm glad to see from other reviews that the beignets are still good.  

I hadn't been to the new location, as I'm rarely in that area, but recently stopped by for a mid-morning weekday breakfast.  Unlike some other reviewers, I found the service to be just fine -- I was handed a menu as soon as I sat down, my order was taken promptly, and my coffee cup was refilled without my asking whenever it needed to be.  Although I'm decidedly middle-aged,  I experienced none of the "hipster disdain" that I sometimes encounter from unhappy servers.

The food was as good as I'd recalled.  I had biscuits and gravy; the gravy was nicely flavored with sausage bits, the biscuits were fluffy, and there was exactly the right ratio of gravy to biscuits.  The coffee was also very good.

While I wouldn't travel out of my way to eat at Just for You, I'll certainly stop in again if I'm in the vicinity and hungry for a good Southern breakfast.

excerpts: After eating at Just for You nearly every weekend, and often twice on Fridays, I was ready to compare the beignets to "the real thing".
So while in New Orleans I stopped by Cafe du Monde excited to try theirs.
Um, well, I have to say, I'm a bit disappointed to report that Just for You's beignets are just for me.
beignets.author: Angela G.
beignets.review:
After eating at Just for You nearly every weekend, and often twice on Fridays, I was ready to compare the beignets to "the real thing". So while in New Orleans I stopped by Cafe du Monde excited to try theirs. Um, well, I have to say, I'm a bit disappointed to report that Just for You's beignets are just for me. Seriously, they are *better* than "the real thing" at Cafe du Monde. 

Oh, and besides that, I love their breakfast and the staff is adorable. Love that I've now become a regular, and they recognize me! :)

excerpts: The beignets ARE amazing.
Nice and crisp on the outside and soft in the middle.
The cornmeal pancakes are also delicious.
Too bad the breakfast burrito is pathetic.
The egg and potatoes are cooked well enough, but there is no salsa, no hot sauce, no flavor.
Besides the beignet, there is nothing that I can't make at home.
Its a shame since I love brunch
and I love brunch places (especially ones that are close).
But eh...whatever.
beignets.author: Siao W.
beignets.review:
Aw man...I wish this place was better! I keep giving it chances, but I have to accept the fact that this place is average. The last time I was here, I was irked by the "hostess" front man. I put my name on the list and checked that either the counter or table would be fine. Nobody else checked the counter even though it was clearly available. He comes out and says the counter was available, looks at the list, and calls out my name. As I start walking towards the door, he starts individually asking each name before me whether they wanted the counter seat. Hello!! You already called my name!!! Somebody obviously took the seat. I don't have a problem waiting, but don't call my name and give the seat to someone else. That's bad form!
     Besides that, the food is average overall. The beignets ARE amazing. Nice and crisp on the outside and soft in the middle. The cornmeal pancakes are also delicious. Too bad the breakfast burrito is pathetic. The egg and potatoes are cooked well enough, but there is no salsa, no hot sauce, no flavor. Besides the beignet, there is nothing that I can't make at home. Its a shame since I love brunch and I love brunch places (especially ones that are close). But eh...whatever.

excerpts: - beignets (3 for $4.75): these were tasty.
big square pockets of dough heavily dusted with powdered sugar.
beignets.author: Cindy W.
beignets.review:
just for you is not just for me. it was just ok. maybe because it was super hot that day and we had to wait a long time, or maybe because i was annoyed by the fly that darted about our food. that and overall the food, honestly, was just good, not great. 

- beignets (3 for $4.75): these were tasty.  big square pockets of dough heavily dusted with powdered sugar. these were nice and light. 

- greg's scramble ($10.50), 3 eggs scrambled with spinach, onions, garlic, cheese + meat of choice - chicken apple sausage. and you choose a bread - corn bread! the corn bread was big thick and buttery, yum. the egg scramble was savory with good sized clumps of spinach.

- huevos rancheros  ($8.95) + home fries (+$2.50), 2 eggs on a tortilla, smothered in special sauce, black beans, cheddar cheese, all topped in a red sauce. visually, it wasn't what we were expecting. the red sauce was a big sloppy amoeba on top of the eggs and tortillas (pseudo quesadilla). i guess it just wasn't as appetizing.

- coffee ($1.50): regular stuff though it was nice you could get a cup while waiting for a table. i really needed the coffee.

- orange juice ($3.50/$4.50): kinda pricey but i guess they charge more for odawalla.

maybe i should have tried the french toast or wafflles or had more sleep to be less grouchy when i come here. that and if i had a fly swatter in hand.

excerpts: the beignets were ok.
they didn't taste like cafe du monde's and as far as i'm concerned
, that is what a beignet is so i was disappointed by them as well.
but not enough to give it the one star review.
the beignets were three star.
but i wasn't there for the beignets
and i'll never set foot in this place again for what they did to those eggs with those oysters.
beignets.author: Will R.
beignets.review:
i met my girlfriend in new orleans back in january and almost immediately she started raving about the hangtown fry from this place. i need to go to san francisco with her and eat this incredible breakfast. it will change my mind about breakfasts.

it was disgusting. and that's not just eight months of being over-hyped on a dish talking. the oysters weren't fried - they were just warm and squishy and juicy and their bitter oyster juices were sloshing into the scramble with no cornmeal dusted and fried boundaries. what the fuck? 

the beignets were ok. they didn't taste like cafe du monde's and as far as i'm concerned, that is what a beignet is so i was disappointed by them as well. but not enough to give it the one star review. the beignets were three star. but i wasn't there for the beignets and i'll never set foot in this place again for what they did to those eggs with those oysters.

excerpts: A full menu, including the beignets everyone mentions, with varieties of omelets and egg dishes, plenty of sides.
Despite being quite full it wasn't as noisy as many places would be with the same crowd, probably because of the high ceilings.
Only negatives: the back room is a bit dark, and I found the coffee a little weak.
But the food was terrific, the service was great, and the people-watching is superb.
beignets.author: Mark P.
beignets.review: Located in an unassuming storefront that gives the impression this is nothing more than a coffee shop, this full breakfast joint is clearly popular with the neighborhood. At 9:30 a.m. on a Saturday morning it was full, but there was still a table in the back. A full menu, including the beignets everyone mentions, with varieties of omelets and egg dishes, plenty of sides. Despite being quite full it wasn't as noisy as many places would be with the same crowd, probably because of the high ceilings. Only negatives: the back room is a bit dark, and I found the coffee a little weak. But the food was terrific, the service was great, and the people-watching is superb.

excerpts: We started with an order of beignets as an appetizer (at breakfast...
ya gotta love that)...and they were amazing!
I had a chicken apple sausage scrambler with potatoes and homemade raisin bread toast...and ordered a side of pico de gallo to mix with the eggs.
YUM!
I think the pico de gallo was made to order...
it tasted that good.
Our server was efficient but slightly out of it...perhaps he'd had a hard night.
IT HAPPENS.  :-)
Atmosphere is fun and the neighborhood is eclectic.
Do yourself a favor and get some food at
Just For You Cafe...you will be glad that you did!
It's one more reason that I need to visit SF more than once a year!
beignets.author: Eric H.
beignets.review: Our friend Matty introduced us to Just For You Cafe.  He said it was one of his favorites for breakfast.  HE WAS SOOOOO RIGHT!  This place is the BOMB...probably the best breakfast I've ever had in the City.  We started with an order of beignets as an appetizer (at breakfast...ya gotta love that)...and they were amazing!  I had a chicken apple sausage scrambler with potatoes and homemade raisin bread toast...and ordered a side of pico de gallo to mix with the eggs.  YUM!  I think the pico de gallo was made to order...it tasted that good.  Our server was efficient but slightly out of it...perhaps he'd had a hard night.  IT HAPPENS.  :-)  Atmosphere is fun and the neighborhood is eclectic.  Do yourself a favor and get some food at Just For You Cafe...you will be glad that you did!  It's one more reason that I need to visit SF more than once a year!

excerpts: They have the BEST beignets.
There's usually a long wait for a table on the weekends but so worth it.
beignets.author: J L.
beignets.review: This place is amazing! They have the BEST beignets. There's usually a long wait for a table on the weekends but so worth it.

excerpts: We waited maybe five minutes for a table, and the beignets arrived quickly.
I have no basis for comparison, but it was a good start.
The volume of the place was unreal.
beignets.author: Beth V.
beignets.review:
We waited maybe five minutes for a table, and the beignets arrived quickly.  I have no basis for comparison, but it was a good start.  The volume of the place was unreal.  My gentleman caller had the griddle cakes, and I the Fritatta of the decade, which was very good, although flat and round like a pancake as opposed to the slice I had been expecting from previous fritatta experiences.

My concerns lay in the plate clearing.  We must have been forgotten, because our plates sat in front of us for 15 minutes (I checked my watch) before being cleared.  As we had the Sunday papers with us, I was fine with this, but under other circumstances, this would be enough to drive me over the edge.  The whole experience had a charm to it (even though you may not be able to tell from this review) and I plan to return.

excerpts: they also have some fancy things like beignets (french doughnuts).
beignets.author: roy d.
beignets.review:
Great place for brunch on the weekends. they serve eggs and bacon, pancakes type breakfasts.

they also have some fancy things like beignets (french doughnuts). No fancy coffee just regular coffee.

usually a line so you will have to wait

excerpts: The beignets were just like what beignets should be:  warm, slightly crisp on the outside, chewy and airy on the inside, covered in confectioners sugar, and reaching up from the plate they're on with barely invisible tendrils of butter and grease to strangle your carotid artery right there in the restaurant.
beignets.author: Jay M.
beignets.review:
Apparently there has been a change in staff -- as some others have noted -- but my brunch was quite tasty when I went yesterday.  The Greg's scramble was nicely done (if I really want to nitpick, I could say it would have benefited from a touch more salt, but I don't want to nitpick, so I won't).  

The beignets were just like what beignets should be:  warm, slightly crisp on the outside, chewy and airy on the inside, covered in confectioners sugar, and reaching up from the plate they're on with barely invisible tendrils of butter and grease to strangle your carotid artery right there in the restaurant.

I had a little bite of oatcake, and it was good.  I'm not sure I've ever had an oatcake before, so I can't really compare it to much, but I couldn't complain.

The service was prompt, the coffee was always full, and the food came out in short order.  There's still a line outside, and everyone else seemed happy, so give it a shot, and see how you fare.

excerpts: Get the beignets.
beignets.author: Julia H.
beignets.review:
YUM.  Get the beignets.  

All the other eggs dishes are delish.  Mine was poached egg with bacon and tomatoes on english muffin. I wanted to have everything.  The crab benedict was awesome too.

Be prepared to wait...there are benches but you're waiting in the best weather of SF.  Put your name on the list and drink the coffee they leave out for you or go inside and get pint size mimosas.  oh yeah.  get it in ya.

I'll be going back.

excerpts: You'll want to be really hungry anyway because as soon as that plate of beignets hits your table, it'll all be worth it.
In case you don't know, beignets are fried
dough puffs covered in powdered sugar.
They are heaven on a plate.
Ok - They weren't as good as the ones in New Orleans.
But hey, this isn't New Orleans.
beignets.author: Chelsea T.
beignets.review:
I went here on a Saturday morning at around 1:30. (Yea, yea. I said SATURDAY morning.) There was about a 15 minute wait, but the neighborhood  is cool, and killing time while you wait is no problem. You'll want to be really hungry anyway because as soon as that plate of beignets hits your table, it'll all be worth it. In case you don't know, beignets are fried dough puffs covered in powdered sugar. They are heaven on a plate. Ok - They weren't as good as the ones in New Orleans. But hey, this isn't New Orleans. This is SF and I'll take what I can get.

The menu here is amazing. Too many choices, and everything sounds great. Cornmeal pancakes? I'm happy to know such heavenly things exist here on earth. 

After studying the menu for way too long, I had a scramble with goat cheese and artichoke hearts. I went a little crazy and added sun dried tomatoes. They might be the best eggs I've ever hung a lip over. You get to pick between cornbread, biscuits, or a scone for your bread. How to decide?? I had the cornbread, which held the form of a giant brick. Not the best I've ever had. Kind of crumbly, and not greasy enough for my taste. But what it lacked in texture, it made up for in girth.

I think my favorite thing about this place is the condiments. Each table comes equipped with maple syrup, a plethora of hot sauce choices (Cholula, Tabasco, AND Crystal), and - here's the kicker - a vase FULL of butter chips!  Fuck yea. Here I can eat all the butter chips I want and not get the hog stare from the server.

excerpts: The plain and simple delicious Beignets are nice light and fluffy.
beignets.author: sonia m.
beignets.review:
This is a cute spot.  There is a bit of a wait, but it is bearable.  I have found that I like many dishes, but I am trying new dishes until I find that something I love to reorder again and again.  I did sample my friends Hangtown Fry (oyster scramble) and I think I did love it.  The oysters were lightly pan fried before it was prepared in a scramble and it was damned good.  We also washed breakfast down with huge glasses of mimosa's.  Nice!  They bake their own breads, and I love the raisin bread.  The potatoes aren't so good, and I often have to fix up my grits.  I do prefer my grits creamy and sometimes cheesy.  These are stark white corn grits.  The plain and simple delicious Beignets are nice light and fluffy.  I anticipate trying a Po Boy Sandwich upon my next visit.

I hope my rating isn't too harsh.  I just think a good breakfast spot should master either its potatoes are grits.  Overall I like this place!

excerpts: With that said, I really came to Just for You to try their beignets and have some good times with my mom for mother's day.
I loved the local vibe that
Just For You has.
This cafe isn't hidden too deep within the dogpatch, but can be easily missed as you drive down third.
I ordered myself the Crabby Benny - which is just crab cakes and poached eggs sandwiched between two pieces of toast.
This was pretty good, but I prefer SAVOR's version better.
My boyfriend ordered the longaniza plate, which he loved.
Being a connoisseur of Longaniza, I found Just for You's style of this Filipino Sausage very unique.
It had a mesquite flavor to it
- reminded me of Lay's BBQ chips.
Although they are not the conventional longanizas, they were pretty good.
Overall, the beignets are worth the trip across the city.

Recommendations: 
Beignets
Order of Longaniza on the side
beignets.author: Lisa T.
beignets.review:
I don't know why they named this joint "Just for You." If this place is really for me, they would serve garlic fried rice and egg with my longaniza. (Sorry I had to point that one out. That's just the Filipino cravings in me...lol) 

With that said, I really came to Just for You to try their beignets and have some good times with my mom for mother's day. I loved the local vibe that Just For You has. This cafe isn't hidden too deep within the dogpatch, but can be easily missed as you drive down third. I ordered myself the Crabby Benny - which is just crab cakes and poached eggs sandwiched between two pieces of toast. This was pretty good, but I prefer SAVOR's version better. My boyfriend ordered the longaniza plate, which he loved. Being a connoisseur of Longaniza, I found Just for You's style of this Filipino Sausage very unique. It had a mesquite flavor to it - reminded me of Lay's BBQ chips. Although they are not the conventional longanizas, they were pretty good. No lie. 

Overall, the beignets are worth the trip across the city. As for the rest of the food, I am sure you can find something similar in your own neck of the woods. 

Recommendations: 
Beignets
Order of Longaniza on the side

excerpts: The beignets remind me of the ones I had in New Orleans.
(They put a ton of powdered sugar on them.)
I had the Hangtown Fry which was good, but there were a few too many oysters for me.
beignets.author: Joann C.
beignets.review:
Only a 15 min. wait for brunch on Saturday morning!  They even had a carafe of coffee outside for people waiting.  The waitstaff is extremely efficient and attentive.  The beignets remind me of the ones I had in New Orleans.  (They put a ton of powdered sugar on them.)  I had the Hangtown Fry which was good, but there were a few too many oysters for me.  Next time, I'm going to try the eggs benedict which I saw and wish I had ordered.  

Thus far, one of my favorite places for brunch in the city.  It's a nice casual place to have a relaxing brunch.

excerpts: Fresh beignets were pretty awesome, but my scrambled egg was bland and too wet for my taste.
I had 3 egg scrambled with chicken apple sausage, and it was so so.
Not something I'd wait for 20-30 min to get.
People seemed nice and service was very fast and prompt though.
Love their efficiency and beignets but not scrambled eggs too much.
beignets.author: Yoko S.
beignets.review:
My friend and I had brunch there today.  Wait was reasonable (about 20 min), and we were seated rather promptly and service was good since we were seated at bar.

Fresh beignets were pretty awesome, but my scrambled egg was bland and too wet for my taste.  I had 3 egg scrambled with chicken apple sausage, and it was so so.  Not something I'd wait for 20-30 min to get.  People seemed nice and service was very fast and prompt though.  Love their efficiency and beignets but not scrambled eggs too much.

If I'd go there again, maybe I'll try their French toast.  They looked pretty good.

excerpts: I cannot get enough of the Beignets and the delicious menu.
Sure you have to wait if you have a group because the space is small
beignets.author: Dave S.
beignets.review:
Oh my god thank god I don't live near Just For You.  If I did I would weigh 800lbs because the brunch food is delicious.  I cannot get enough of the Beignets and the delicious menu.  Sure you have to wait if you have a group because the space is small but that's part of the charm of this Dog Patch icon.

I love how there are signs here that would probably make some Noe Valley parents flip their lids.  The stollers one cracks me up so bad but yet, it is so true.  Don't bring your huge honking stroller.  I hate those things and show a little respect with the cell phone.  When did people become so entitled with their cell phones.  Anyway I digress, go to Just For You for the food, charm and atmosphere.  I have always had a great experience there!

excerpts: and i know everyone keeps raving about them... but omg the beignets.
they are massive.
and amazing.
the perfect ending to a meal. or start.
or meal in itself.
beignets.author: Haley F.
beignets.review:
i was taken here randomly ages ago and keep coming back. its this tiny bit of querky southern style diner heaven in the middle of the dogpatch, which is, lets just say, not the nicest area in the city, for all that its 'up and coming.' 

the menu is hilarious to read, and the food is amazing to eat. i took my mother here and she also was wowed by it all. reasonable well priced, filling, good portions, fun atmosphere. theres often a bit of a wait, especially on weekends when everyone in the city goes out for brunch, but its worth every second.

and i know everyone keeps raving about them... but omg the beignets. they are massive. and amazing. the perfect ending to a meal. or start. ... or meal in itself. any excuse. 

a quote from the menu 'Grits! just like you had in prison!' because i totally remember that one time... i mean.... ;)

go. eat. love. repeat.

excerpts: The beignets are good, but basically they're just fresh donuts with powdered sugar.
Our server was lovely and cheerful, and the coffee was good and plentiful.
beignets.author: Adam Z.
beignets.review:
Really impressive brunch! We arrived at 10:30 am on a sunny Sunday and only had to wait 15 minutes. There is free coffee outside while you're waiting, but you need to go inside to get a paper cup near the register. ("Otherwise the whole neighborhood helps themselves to coffee and the cups blow away.")

I had the Greg's Scramble with chorizo, which is hands down the best scramble I've had in SF. Biscuits are good as are the home fries. The beignets are good, but basically they're just fresh donuts with powdered sugar. (3 for $4.) Our server was lovely and cheerful, and the coffee was good and plentiful.

excerpts: Beignets are good.
Pancakes good.
French toast good.
Hangtown fry good.
beignets.author: Kenneth K.
beignets.review:
Great place for a weekend brunch.  The breakfast burrito is good.  Beignets are good.  Pancakes good.  French toast good.  Hangtown fry good.  Grits with cheese GOOOOOD!

The only thing that isn't good..... the wait.  But what do you expect?  With the food being so damn good, you're gonna have to wait.

excerpts: we ordered 3 beignets and mimosas to start.
both were great.
the beignets were plain (not filled) with tons of powdered sugar on top.
beignets.author: Jay R.
beignets.review:
01.02.13 with 1 other.

small place, delicious food. good brunch spot, but i suggest small groups

we ordered 3 beignets and mimosas to start. both were great. the beignets were plain (not filled) with tons of powdered sugar on top. the mimosas were with fresh juice and in a pint glass.

i ordered the home fry special with scrambled eggs, it had a good balance of potatoes, veggies and egg.

excerpts: the beignets alone are worth it!
beignets.author: Amy S.
beignets.review:
Made my second visit here today... totally awesome!
Not only are their wait staff oh so nice. The food is super delicious and so clean tasting. They make their own bread and lots of other items, that are so fresh it will blow your mind 

Today I went with their po-boy with shrimp. Not only were the shrimp perfectly breaded the sandwich itself was filled with the most beautiful veggies I've seen this time of the year! 

All I can say is I know the dog patch sounds far... the beignets alone are worth it!

excerpts: Beignets are huge (who doesn't love fried dough).
beignets.author: Ken p.
beignets.review:
Excellent Weekend Brunch local.

The portions are big. Beignets are huge (who doesn't love fried dough).  The green sauce on the huevos rancheros is hot hot hot.

The reason for the 3,  it is a bit pricey.

Great hangover stop for sure.

excerpts: I like the beignets just fine, although they are rather like injecting a bolus of sugar and fat directly into your veins.
Which, you know, sometimes is just what you want.
But I digress.
The menu and signage are entertaining, and the decor is something diverting to look at before you get your coffee and are fit for company.
Overall the breakfast fare is quite good; I have to say that their Hollandaise sauce was way more like soup and rather disappointing, but everything else I've had has been nice.
beignets.author: Heather R.
beignets.review:
This is one of those places that make me wish Yelp did fractional stars, as I'm having a very hard time choosing between three and four stars here. I think it's a solid three-and-a-half. 

Service can be painfully slow and ineffective, especially when they are crowded (which is often, it seems like. They are a pretty small place). That is my biggest beef with the place. There's often a wait, cause they are popular, and it seems like they have a hard time keeping up when they are busy. A party any bigger than 4 is not terribly feasible here although it can be done.

On the plus side, they have grits ("that white pasty stuff you had in prison"), a relative rarity in San Francisco. I like the beignets just fine, although they are rather like injecting a bolus of sugar and fat directly into your veins. Which, you know, sometimes is just what you want. But I digress. The menu and signage are entertaining, and the decor is something diverting to look at before you get your coffee and are fit for company. Overall the breakfast fare is quite good; I have to say that their Hollandaise sauce was way more like soup and rather disappointing, but everything else I've had has been nice.

excerpts: These things - which the other reviews tell me are called beignets - are amazing.
They are some sort of puff pastry with powdered sugar melting on them.
Sort of like a donut, but not, sort of like cream puff crust, but not, sort of like...
I don't know.
Whatever they are, they are amazing.
They are the best hot.
They were pretty good left over too, but they were fantastic hot.
The more I type about them, the more I want to go over the hill and get more.
They are that good.
If you go here and don't try them then you are stupid.
beignets.author: Dee B.
beignets.review:
My Father visited recently and my household decided to do an early morning breakfast with him.  We wanted something close to the house (Potrero Hill) and good old trusty yelp sent us to Just for You Cafe.  

We got there around 8:15am and there was no line.  We got seated right away.  Those people who got there at 9am had quite a wait.  On the upside, they have hot coffee sitting out on the sidewalk (the waiting area) for anyone who might have been freezing in what this city jokingly calls 'summer.'  

The food was good.  I had the corn beef hash with poached eggs.  Kate's (in the lower haight) still is the best I've ever had, but this was far from bad.  The other food (omelets) went over really well, and the pancakes looked fabulous.  Refills were slow but the restaurant was packed.  The servers seemed a bit stressed and overwhelmed rather than forgetful.  They brought the check without asking if we wanted dessert so we had to correct that - this place has these...things.  I've never encountered them before, but yelp told me I had to order them.  I trusted in you, yelp.

Yelp was right.  These things - which the other reviews tell me are called beignets - are amazing.  They are some sort of puff pastry with powdered sugar melting on them.  Sort of like a donut, but not, sort of like cream puff crust, but not, sort of like...I don't know. Whatever they are, they are amazing.  They are the best hot.  They were pretty good left over too, but they were fantastic hot.  The more I type about them, the more I want to go over the hill and get more.  They are that good.  If you go here and don't try them then you are stupid.  Seriously.

I will most definitely be back.  

Notes of interest:
 
They don't let strollers in the restaurant.  You've got to leave them out on the sidewalk.

Cash or (wtf?) personal check only.

They have two small (two top) tables outside but when we were there they were used as a waiting area rather than for service.

excerpts: But the Beignets were the real winners, perfectly fluffy with a light doughy taste and the right amount of powdered sugar on top.
All in all a reasonable, good, interesting dinner.
beignets.author: Jeff V.
beignets.review: Drove over last night for an early dinner at 6pm, found parking easy and had no problem grabbing a table.  A bottle of Miller for $2 served in a frosty mug was a nice start, the server was better than fantastic, and decided to try the Jambalaya with a Beignet side.  Jambalaya was not what I expected, but only because it was prepared differently.  Imagine a rice dish with meat and vege's almost like Chinese Fried Rice, but with a bit of Southern tang.  Very nice, very light (which of course is unusual for Jambalaya) and a nice selection of hot sauces to spice it up a bit.  But the Beignets were the real winners, perfectly fluffy with a light doughy taste and the right amount of powdered sugar on top.  All in all a reasonable, good, interesting dinner.

excerpts: $4 - one order of 3 beignets, which are also HUGE, about the size of the palm of your hand.  drowned in powdered sugar.
beignets.author: Josie M.
beignets.review:
$7.95 - chorizo con huevos:  scrambled eggs and chorizo with grits and cinnamon toast.  toast is a pass (very dry), eggs and chorizo were ok, not as good as sunrise cafe.

$8.95 - cowgirl bfast (2 HUGE pancakes, 2 eggs, 2 sausage)  the spicy sausage is crazy spicy.  solid standard fare.

$4 - one order of 3 beignets, which are also HUGE, about the size of the palm of your hand.  drowned in powdered sugar.  i wish the dough was more sweet instead of the sweetness only being on the surface.

service is quick and attentive, however i did notice pockets of disgruntled customers that were not acknowledged for a good 20 minutes.

i would come back for the sheer fact that they serve bfast all day.

parking is more of a biatch then you would expect.

excerpts: It's running by Just For Your Cafe with my marathon training group at 9AM Saturday morning on the 17th mile and getting the tantalizing, arousing and enchanting aroma of warm Beignets smothered in sugar and served with warm syrup, and of warm coffee and the sound of the spoon stirring in the milk
- Beignets powdered with sugar (their speciality and my vice and best way to win my stomach... and hence, me heart!)
- Frittata of the Decade (Can't go wrong with the all veggie goodie with zucchini, mushrooms, onion, garlic, spinach & tomato, topped with cheddar cheese)

- Chilli Scramble (and they don't kid when they say "chilli")
- Pancakes (you can beat my pancakes anytahm!)
- Chorizo Con Huevos (Perfect for oiling away that nasty hangover but watch it!
It is spicy, fattening and greasy as hell)
- A PINT...
I'll say that again...
A PINT of mimosa!
- Coffee

(run-o-the-mill but satisfying)
- Great service and the ladies behind the counter are funny, treat you like family and really look after you
- Great energy to the place with mostly locals frequenting it
- Lots of parking if you're driving and
beignets.author: Amit S.
beignets.review:
OMG! OMG! OMG! OMG! OMG!

You know the worst kind of torture? 
- Worse than the Avada Cadavra curse used by "he-who-must-not-be-named" on "he-with-the-weird-scar-on-his-forehead"?
- Worse than Stupefy, Imperius, Expelliarmus AND Obliviate put together??

It's running by Just For Your Cafe with my marathon training group at 9AM Saturday morning on the 17th mile and getting the tantalizing, arousing and enchanting aroma of warm Beignets smothered in sugar and served with warm syrup, and of warm coffee and the sound of the spoon stirring in the milk..... DROOL!

THE FIRST LOVE:
- Two eggs any style with:
   + bacon (classic!)
   + Louisiana sausage (hot n spicy... like moi!)
   + Chicken apple sausage (as if mom were cooking it!)
   + Longanisa (Oink! Oink! on the grease and fat!)
   + Creole Crab Cake (umm!)
- Beignets powdered with sugar (their speciality and my vice and best way to win my stomach... and hence, me heart!)
- Frittata of the Decade (Can't go wrong with the all veggie goodie with zucchini, mushrooms, onion, garlic, spinach & tomato, topped with cheddar cheese)
- Chilli Scramble (and they don't kid when they say "chilli")
- Pancakes (you can beat my pancakes anytahm!)
- Chorizo Con Huevos (Perfect for oiling away that nasty hangover but watch it! It is spicy, fattening and greasy as hell)
- A PINT... I'll say that again... A PINT of mimosa!
- Coffee (run-o-the-mill but satisfying)
- Great service and the ladies behind the counter are funny, treat you like family and really look after you
- Great energy to the place with mostly locals frequenting it
- Lots of parking if you're driving and the T-Third stops a block away and if you're a runner like me, run here!

THE HEARTACHE:
- They only take cash so daddy's plastic don't gonna work here, baby. There is an ATM in the liquor store next to this place
- There is almost always a wait (25-30 mins) but they serve coffee and the place on the opposite corner serves Blue Bottle coffee... shh!
- Place is compact so its a bit tight if you're sitting at the bar
- That said, if you're 1 to 2, sit at the bar. If you're bigger, ask for a table
- I live in the Inner Sunset, so either I take the T-Third to get there (its on 22nd Street at 3rd Street) or I go here as I'm mid-way through my run (F@#K!) 

THE NOTES:
- Leave any attitude outside or at home. Don't complain about the wait or the small space
- This place is laid back and the hosts treat you like you were eating in their kitchen... be nice and tip well
- Look at all the art and signs on the wall.. frigging awesome!
- If you see me run by, throw me a Beignet will you?... pretty please!

... and yes, I'm currently reading Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows... Accio Beignet!

excerpts: Oh, did I mention you need to come here for the beignets?
Three for $4.00 is a steal
beignets.author: Will C.
beignets.review:
I've been here three times in the last six months - which is like a treat since I hardly ever drive into SF on weekdays and have no business to be in the Potrero Hill district of the city. The weekend brunch menu is very "full-filling" and you definitely won't leave there feeling like you didn't get your money's worth! Oh, did I mention you need to come here for the beignets? Three for $4.00 is a steal and I can't seem to find any place else on the left coast that sells them outside of Cafe DuMonde in Louisiana. 

Word up to the wise: weekend brunch starts getting crowded at around 10:15am and don't forget to observe the "turn off cell phone" signage!

Also, CASH ONLY y'all !!!!!!! Drop by the ATM if need be before going here!

Remind me next time though that after having a gigantic meal at this establishment that the bike ride back to AT & T Park to sit in my seats at the SF Giants game by 1:05pm will take a little longer than usual on my full stomach!

excerpts: We didn't try the beignets but they looked really tasty.
beignets.author: Abby P.
beignets.review:
The eggs and potatoes are delish. We didn't try the beignets but they looked really tasty. Even though the place was slammed our server was really hustling to keep everyone happy, which is always appreciated.

The wait was insane though. So when I factor the goodness of the potatoes by the pain in the butt hour wait. I decided on 3 stars. Go at either 9am or 2pm but I guess that's the rule for everywhere for Sunday brunch.

excerpts: One taste of the sugary beignets and the yummy omelettes with thick toast and your choice of grits or potatoes, and you will be hooked
- planning your next trip back.
beignets.author: Melanie T.
beignets.review:
I really like this place - top for me on the list of great breakfast joints in the city.

We had to wait a good ole' 45 minutes to be seated and had to wait outside and let me tell you - it was freezing! However, they do have a little table outside with warm coffee for everyone to enjoy while waiting.

So yes this place is really busy on the weekends and you might have a long wait outside, rain or shine - but it is sooooooo worth the wait.

One taste of the sugary beignets and the yummy omelettes with thick toast and your choice of grits or potatoes, and you will be hooked - planning your next trip back.

excerpts: This place has yummy beignets!
beignets.author: Nina L.
beignets.review:
This place has yummy beignets!  MMmm...

I also enjoyed their homemade cornbeef hash, which is shredded and mixed with their home fries (large potato cubes).  Coupled with eggs over-easy, it was a yummy combination.  

Make sure you bring cash ands switch your cell phone to vibrate.

excerpts: One word: beignets!
It's hard to find good beignets in the city (and even in the Bay Area), but Just For
You does it right.
Their beignets are pillowy puffs of perfection, with just the right amount of powdered sugar on top.
Your taste buds will sing.
A caveat: don't order three beignets at once like I did.
Even though I was voraciously hungry at the time, I felt like my stomach was going to explode by the time I finished.
I think I even fell asleep on the muni when I was going home...but anyways.
Unlike Lay's potato chips, with beignets, you can just have one!
beignets.author: Christine T.
beignets.review:
Their breakfast is just okay. Hence, the middle of the road rating. Why, then, do I keep coming back here? One word: beignets! It's hard to find good beignets in the city (and even in the Bay Area), but Just For You does it right. Their beignets are pillowy puffs of perfection, with just the right amount of powdered sugar on top. Your taste buds will sing. A caveat: don't order three beignets at once like I did. Even though I was voraciously hungry at the time, I felt like my stomach was going to explode by the time I finished. I think I even fell asleep on the muni when I was going home...but anyways. Unlike Lay's potato chips, with beignets, you can just have one!

As an aside, their menu is very entertaining. Yes, you read that right. For those who are easily amused and/or like sarcasm, you'll have to check it out for yourself.

excerpts: Where else can you get a correct breakfast burrito and scrumptious beignets in the same meal?
Just For You has seriously tasty food, generous portions, friendly service, and easy parking.
Oh - and the line isn't ridiculous, even on the weekend.
Are we still in San Francisco?
I'm their newest fan!
beignets.author: Rebecca O.
beignets.review: Where else can you get a correct breakfast burrito and scrumptious beignets in the same meal? Just For You has seriously tasty food, generous portions, friendly service, and easy parking. Oh - and the line isn't ridiculous, even on the weekend. Are we still in San Francisco? I'm their newest fan!

excerpts: I Just come here for the beignets!
They are doughy and that's what I look for in my little doughnuts.
Breakfast is bleghhhh and not much to get excited about.
beignets.author: MiSa S.
beignets.review: I Just come here for the beignets! They are doughy and that's what I look for in my little doughnuts. Breakfast is bleghhhh and not much to get excited about.

excerpts: The New Orleans style coffee w chicory they serve is a nice treat and goes down quite well with the beignets.
Yes, the beignets are perfect.
Little nubbins of fluffy fried dough with powdered sugar on top.
Impossible to feel bad looking at (and quickly devouring) a plate of their beignets.
The food itself won't win any awards, but it's very fresh, clean-flavored classic Americana fare.
Only down-side is the rushed service.
Honestly, that's the other side of waiting in line for a table, but once you're seated they want to get you out as fast as possible.
The upside is that waits are never ridiculously long (yes Outerlands, I'm looking at you) even on a perfect sunny sunday San Francisco morning.
beignets.author: Rebecca P.
beignets.review:
Agree with nods to super good, large-portioned, non-pretentious, no-attitude service brunch/breakfasts.  The New Orleans style coffee w chicory they serve is a nice treat and goes down quite well with the beignets.
Yes, the beignets are perfect. Little nubbins of fluffy fried dough with powdered sugar on top. Impossible to feel bad looking at (and quickly devouring) a plate of their beignets.
The food itself won't win any awards, but it's very fresh, clean-flavored classic Americana fare.
Only down-side is the rushed service. Honestly, that's the other side of waiting in line for a table, but once you're seated they want to get you out as fast as possible. The upside is that waits are never ridiculously long (yes Outerlands, I'm looking at you) even on a perfect sunny sunday San Francisco morning.

excerpts: :) Great place for breakfast/brunch - although get here early and beat all the hipsters trying to calm their hangovers with fluffy beignets.
Great that they are also serving dinner as well - and there is never a wait!
I am definitely a fan
beignets.author: Christian S.
beignets.review: I love that Just for You serves Filipino longganiza (Sausage) for brunch - that in itself makes this a great place in the Dogpatch :) Great place for breakfast/brunch - although get here early and beat all the hipsters trying to calm their hangovers with fluffy beignets. Great that they are also serving dinner as well - and there is never a wait! I am definitely a fan

excerpts: Eat here and we can discuss our rehab plans over a big plate of beignets
beignets.author: Cortney E.
beignets.review: The huevos rancheros here are TO DIE FOR!  The fact that they serve breakfast all day long also makes them one of my favorite SF staples.  I haven't tried their lunch or dinner yet, because I simply can't pull myself away from their amazing breakfast menu.  I know, I know... I am an addict, but at least I admit it!  Eat here and we can discuss our rehab plans over a big plate of beignets :)

excerpts: One word: Beignets.
Get them, because they are delish.
A Dogpatch favorite that attracts "regulars.
Good food, good portions, plenty of selection when you are indecisive.
It's casual dining in a comfortable space.
The pre-meal line and wait is likely to be long.
So get there early.
Pair that with fairly priced, consistent food, and it's easy to see why Just For You keeps people coming back for more.
beignets.author: Alex H.
beignets.review: One word: Beignets. Get them, because they are delish. A Dogpatch favorite that attracts "regulars." Good food, good portions, plenty of selection when you are indecisive. It's casual dining in a comfortable space. The pre-meal line and wait is likely to be long. So get there early. Pair that with fairly priced, consistent food, and it's easy to see why Just For You keeps people coming back for more.

excerpts: The decor is nothing special but the breakfast menu with crab cakes, home made bread and beignets was a surprise.
The staff was very gregarious and people from adjacent tables all conversed with us, complete strangers.
It was warm and welcoming and I will certainly be back soon and often.
beignets.author: Ken B.
beignets.review: This really is one of those great finds. A cook in another restaurant gave me a card saying he worked in both places. The decor is nothing special but the breakfast menu with crab cakes, home made bread and beignets was a surprise. The staff was very gregarious and people from adjacent tables all conversed with us, complete strangers. It was warm and welcoming and I will certainly be back soon and often.

excerpts: And yes--the beignets are so-o-o good.
Try them with the jam.
beignets.author: fi l.
beignets.review:
I've been to this place countless times and it's always good.

I've always had good (maybe not always great) service.  They may not be extra-chatty, but I don't mind that.  I'd rather have my coffee constantly topped-off in silence than asked how I'm doing.  One time, all I had to do was look at the overhead fan (it was chilly inside) and without asking, they turned it off for me.

The food is consistently good and the portions more than enough.  And yes--the beignets are so-o-o good.  Try them with the jam.  And I don't know where else I can get grits.

The only reason why it doesn't get 5 stars is because there's nothing on the menu that I MUST have or crave.  Just For You is more like my good old stand-by, versus my destination.

The wait can be long on the weekends for brunch...put your name in and hope it isn't a cold day in the Dogpatch.

excerpts: A quaint and cozy spot in the Dogpatch with AWESOME beignets with a heavy (not light) dusting of powdered sugar.
Heavy dustings of anything sweet, for me, is a good thing.
beignets.author: Alice L.
beignets.review:
A quaint and cozy spot in the Dogpatch with AWESOME beignets with a heavy (not light) dusting of powdered sugar.  Heavy dustings of anything sweet, for me, is a good thing.  Schmear it with some raspberry preserves...yummmm...

They've also got great fish tacos on their lunch menu.  Oh...and their bleu scramble's pretty damn good as well.  Come to think of it, everything I've ever had there has been rather enjoyable.

Note: don't be "scurred" of 3rd Street...Newcomb is at least 2 miles down...

excerpts: It offers a plentiful selection, serving a number of unique dishes--wonderfully crisp beignets, oatmeal pancakes, unusual scramblers and omelettes.
beignets.author: Margo C.
beignets.review:
Yesterday, I made my second pilgrimage to Just For You.  I do not return to restaurants that I don't like.  So, that tells you something right away.  But, I cannot bring myself to give this place more than 3 stars.  If I could, I would give it a solid 3.5.

To Just For You's credit, this little Dogpatch cafe has style.  It is homey and cute.  It offers a plentiful selection, serving a number of unique dishes--wonderfully crisp beignets, oatmeal pancakes, unusual scramblers and omelettes.  Hell, the menu is even written in a cute way (with little jokes and comments beside the dishes).

But, let's face it.  Breakfast is the easiest meal to make and to make well.  So, if you are going to rack up points for breakfast with me, you have to really excel at making it.  Your menu must offer options that I could not make or would not try at home, kids.  And, Just For You falls short of this bar.

If you are feeling lazy, or just want some good, basic fare outside of your own kitchen, this place is great.  But, if you are looking for a "knock your socks off" breakfast in the city, seek it elsewhere.

Ps.  It's cash only.
Pps.  There may be a wait.

excerpts: Yay for having beignets.
beignets.author: Jon G.
beignets.review:
I really really wanted to like this place more than I did, so much so that I've been several times, weekends and weekdays.

Yay for having grits. Yay for having beignets. Yay for general deliciousness. 

Boo for having extraordinary wait times on the weekend. Boo for having staff so overworked that they don't actually get a chance to talk to you for 20+ minutes *after* you sit down. 

The food is great. The space is too small, and the service as a result suffers. If I go there on weekends nowadays, I eat before I go.

excerpts: After reading all the yelp reviews about their famous beignets
i just had to try 'em....
SCORE!!!!
They remind me of a smaller version of the funnel cakes u get @ G.A. (great america~wait is it even called that anymore?
LOL).
Bottom line they were yummy in my tummy..
It's small on the inside
but there's an outdoor patio which is great when it's nice outside.
We didn't wait long either to get seated.
I ordered the chorizo con huevos and it was goooood.
I'm definitely a fan of this place.
beignets.author: Eli S.
beignets.review: Wanted to try a new brunch spot for Mother's Day and found this place on yelp. After reading all the yelp reviews about their famous beignets i just had to try 'em....SCORE!!!! They remind me of a smaller version of the funnel cakes u get @ G.A. (great america~wait is it even called that anymore? LOL). Bottom line they were yummy in my tummy..It's small on the inside but there's an outdoor patio which is great when it's nice outside. We didn't wait long either to get seated. I ordered the chorizo con huevos and it was goooood. I'm definitely a fan of this place.

excerpts: The beignets are a must try - they were the perfect appetizer split 2 ways prior to my greg's omelet with chicken apple sausage!
My boyfriend loved this place too, the new mexico green chiles in his huge breakfast burrito were a hit.
This place is reasonable, delicious, and better than most of the places in the Marina - we have some pretty great places over here too...
but this is the best overall.
Also, family friendly...and you gotta love the free coffee outside while you are waiting in the cold!
beignets.author: Michelle N.
beignets.review: This place is sooo delicious! Let me preface my review by saying that I live as far away from Just For You Cafe as you could and still live in the city. After making the trek out here, I have to say it was well worth it! The beignets are a must try - they were the perfect appetizer split 2 ways prior to my greg's omelet with chicken apple sausage! My boyfriend loved this place too, the new mexico green chiles in his huge breakfast burrito were a hit. This place is reasonable, delicious, and better than most of the places in the Marina - we have some pretty great places over here too...but this is the best overall. Also, family friendly...and you gotta love the free coffee outside while you are waiting in the cold!

excerpts: The beignets are crazy good and I always go for the scrambles.
The only thing I don't like?
The loooong wait to get a table.
But, that's what happens when you are this good.
beignets.author: Ariane M.
beignets.review: The food is amazing--good old American breakfast food.  Total comfort.  And I love the atmosphere.  Warm and cuddly.  Especially good on a rainy Sunday.  The beignets are crazy good and I always go for the scrambles.  The only thing I don't like?  The loooong wait to get a table. But, that's what happens when you are this good.

excerpts: If you really want to bust a gut, get the spicy chili verde huevos with a side of grits and top if off with some beignets.
You might need to be rolled out of the front door but it might be worth it.
beignets.author: Faith S.
beignets.review: Any place with grits is okay by me. Good place to blow your diet. If you really want to bust a gut, get the spicy chili verde huevos with a side of grits and top if off with some beignets. You might need to be rolled out of the front door but it might be worth it.

excerpts: I have to admit that I was really craving beignets when I came here
beignets.author: Leslie H.
beignets.review:
The food is good but I thought it was expensive for what you get.  I have to admit that I was really craving beignets when I came here and I was disaapointed-- not really like the small light and fluffy ones I've had at Cafe De Monde or Powderface in Oakland.  

I'll go here again and see if my first impression was way off base. So many people have raved about this place so maybe it was just me being particularly picky that day.

excerpts: you can order the beignets to go, just don't wear black
beignets.author: Jon H.
beignets.review:
If I could eat here every day I would, but I don't think I would be able to fit through the door after a while!


Amazing food, wonderful real San Francisco people. 

Wish I had enough room for pie.

p.s.
