you can order the beignets to go, just don't wear black

excerpts: The beignets are wonderful (whats not to like, fried bread with powdered sugar).
The menu is to the point, but you have your choice of a lot of sides.
The staff bend over backwards to give you good service in the midst of the madness.
We ate at the counter and watched the fry cooks workout, what a show.
Everything was hot, fresh, and tasty.
The wait was 35 minutes at prime time
so next time I will go a little earlier or maybe on a weekday.
Couldn't figure out why we were stuffed before our eggs were gone.
Could it have been the beignet appetizer?
beignets.author: Deborah T.
beignets.review: Really good basic home cooked breakfast food.  The beignets are wonderful (whats not to like, fried bread with powdered sugar).  The menu is to the point, but you have your choice of a lot of sides.  The staff bend over backwards to give you good service in the midst of the madness.   We ate at the counter and watched the fry cooks workout, what a show.   Everything was hot, fresh, and tasty.  The wait was 35 minutes at prime time so next time I will go a little earlier or maybe on a weekday.  Couldn't figure out why we were stuffed before our eggs were gone.  Could it have been the beignet appetizer?

excerpts: We ordered the beignets to share
and I had the blue cheese scramble
and my friend ordered the eggs benedict.
First off, these were the WORST beignets I've had.
I can't say that I'm an expert but these tasted bitter, like they were fried in oil that hadn't been changed in a very long time.
They barely had any flavor and they were just greasy squares of dough with powered sugar heaped on top.
The beignets at Angeline's in Berkeley are way better.
beignets.author: Bella L.
beignets.review:
I find it very hard to believe that this place has four stars. Came here with a friend after a long night of dancing with a hankering for some good brunch. She wanted to try this place based on the reviews on Yelp and yelpers haven't failed me yet so I was excited.

We got there and the line was friggin' long, which I can deal with if the food is good (Mama's!). So we wait and wait forever, and then with 3 people in front of us on the list, we duck into the convenience store next door to find some cold medicine for my friend because she was coming down with something. I swear we were gone for less than 5 minutes and when we came out her name was crossed off the list! We told the guy manning the waitlist what had happened, and he said he would work us back into the list. A few minutes later he comes out and we look at him eagerly and he says to us "I'll get you guys next". Then the next time he comes out to call names he COMPLETELY forgot about us! If you're going to seat us next, we appreciate it and will wait, but don't tell us you're going to seat us and then completely FORGET about us! If our best bet was to put our names back on the list, TELL US instead of having us wait around when you're never going to seat us. When I realized the guy completely forgot about us I put my name on the list and we were finally seated. I think in total we waited over an hour in line.

We ordered the beignets to share and I had the blue cheese scramble and my friend ordered the eggs benedict. First off, these were the WORST beignets I've had. I can't say that I'm an expert but these tasted bitter, like they were fried in oil that hadn't been changed in a very long time. They barely had any flavor and they were just greasy squares of dough with powered sugar heaped on top. The beignets at Angeline's in Berkeley are way better. Definitely not worth the calories.

Next, my blue cheese scramble arrived and it looked straight up nasty, like barf. There were lots of vegetables and chunks of blue cheese and the serving was tiny - it didn't look like they used 3 eggs to make that scramble to me! The home fries were barely crispy and didn't have much flavor. I eyeballed my friend's benedict and it looked pretty rough around the edges as well. Her orange juice looked like it had been diluted with dishwater... or something. Both of our plates arrived at our table lukewarm. Unacceptable!

Left $35 poorer and grossed out. I'm sticking to Mama's for brunch!

excerpts: and of course the beignets are awesome.
the atmosphere is fun and cute, you can watch what's going on in the kitchen, but the wait is sometimes long and the price is a little high in my opinion.
beignets.author: Sarah J.
beignets.review:
i really like this place. i love the super thick toast, and the grits are good, and there are so many interesting omelets and scrambles and other things. and of course the beignets are awesome. 
the atmosphere is fun and cute, you can watch what's going on in the kitchen, but the wait is sometimes long and the price is a little high in my opinion.

excerpts: We had our helpings of beignets at 1:30pm.
beignets.author: Julissa C.
beignets.review: I must admit, I came here just for the beignet's! But the service top notch, too. The Beignet's (which I can only compare to the ones at Cafe Du Monde in NOLA) were light, fluffy and crispy. They were mouth-watering, awesome fresh beignet's. MMMMM... I expect to go there soon for breakfast one day, too. We had our helpings of beignets at 1:30pm.

excerpts: I've found out the trick to Just for You's beignets.
As a Baton Rouge native and former New Orleans resident, I have noticed that the beignets can be somewhat off.
When it is raining or drizzling out, the beignets are excellent.
If it's sunny, better to skip them.
It's always humid in Louisiana
I would prefer if the beignets were served with a powdered sugar shaker, as they always are in Louisiana.
Sometimes the sugar doesn't cover the top of the beignet and sometimes it's all over the plate but not all over the beignet.
It's nearly impossible to get powdered sugar off the plate with a beignet.
beignets.author: Jen L.
beignets.review:
I've found out the trick to Just for You's beignets. As a Baton Rouge native and former New Orleans resident, I have noticed that the beignets can be somewhat off. Sometimes they are great and sometimes they are a bit yeasty.

However, I have found a pattern to the problem and a simple reason behind it. Apparently, beignet quality is determined partly by ambient humidity. When it is raining or drizzling out, the beignets are excellent. If it's sunny, better to skip them. It's always humid in Louisiana so it's not a problem there.

I would prefer if the beignets were served with a powdered sugar shaker, as they always are in Louisiana. Sometimes the sugar doesn't cover the top of the beignet and sometimes it's all over the plate but not all over the beignet. It's nearly impossible to get powdered sugar off the plate with a beignet. If it does not come from above it doesn't stick.

Other food there is not humidity sensitive and some of it is pretty good. I don't find many places here that offer grits and sometimes grits really hit the spot. (And no, I have never been to prison.) Always grits with cheese, please. The crab cake omelet is tasty and I like the scramble with blue cheese and artichoke hearts.

Check the back of your grocery receipts for Just for You coupons.

excerpts: They have beignets where are these huge donut-y things that we didn't order
beignets.author: Melissa M.
beignets.review:
A friend and I stumbled upon this place in a kind of somewhat deliberate scooter-ride kind of way. We sat at the counter where there was great service and we got to see some of the food being prepared. They have beignets where are these huge donut-y things that we didn't order but I have been thinking about ever since.

Very cute, cozy and in a part of town that I never go to, so it was fun to feel like we were getting away.

excerpts: Also: yeah, the beignets are AWESOME.
beignets.author: Anna C.
beignets.review:
Yum! Really good breakfast/brunch fare. I definitely want to come back and try something more adventurous (I had eggs, homefries and biscuits which were all delicious but the menu had a ton of other great-looking options). The ride over to the Dogpatch on the 48 was quick and provided some great views. The wait was kinda long, but it was Sunday morning and you can pick up the newspaper next door while you wait.

Also: yeah, the beignets are AWESOME.

excerpts: Will have to come back if only to try the beignets.
beignets.author: Marie W.
beignets.review: Came here for a late lunch the other day. Pretty quiet around that time, only a few other tables were occupied. I had Ian's chicken strips plate, which was outstanding. Chicken was tender with crispy breading and it came with grilled green beans and creamy garlic mashed potatoes (drools). The bf had a bbq beef po'boy, which he said was okay but he wasn't a huge fan of the spicy sauce. We also had an order of the hush puppies which were pretty good. Service was great so no complaints on  that end. Will have to come back if only to try the beignets.

excerpts: First, let me get the obligatory beignets mention out of the way.
The beignets are great.
Get some no matter what else you order.
As a main breakfast dish, get the pancakes; their cornmeal or oatmeal pancakes are some of the best I've had.
beignets.author: Mark B.
beignets.review:
Just for You is the first business that showed me Dogpatch is more than a frightening industrial wasteland. Looking down from the 20th Street overpass, Dogpatch doesn't appear to be the most inviting of places, even in the daytime. Since the time I first moved here, though, its constant renovation has begun to yield some more welcoming buildings. The sparsely-warehoused area right around Just for You feels like it was created exclusively to be visited on Sunday mornings for walks in the park with your dog. It's almost enough to make me want to go out and GET a dog. But that's not really the point of the review, I guess. 

First, let me get the obligatory beignets mention out of the way. The beignets are great. Get some no matter what else you order. As a main breakfast dish, get the pancakes; their cornmeal or oatmeal pancakes are some of the best I've had. In my experience restaurant pancakes are usually either "okay" or "terrible," so this makes them that much better.

The scrambles and the Mexican breakfast dishes are hit-or-miss. I've had them when they are pretty good and the flavors work very well together, and other times when they come out surprisingly bland. They're never awful, but the pancakes are a better deal and more reliable.

Even if the food was terrible, though, I would probably still go here for the ambience. It is always busy, but they're careful with their limited seating, so it's never quite as cramped as you're afraid it will be. The ever-changing neon posters and amusingly caustic signs plastered over the walls should be too jarring for a relaxing breakfast, but it really defines the place's visual style. A thousand times better than the pallid beach-with-seagulls-and-reeds scenes you usually wind up with at breakfast-y restaurants. And they have thick, squat coffee cups, which I enjoy beyond all reason and justification.

excerpts: And of course, we didn't forget the beignets!!
How do you say that?
Silent "t"?
Those  were delicious!!
Powdered sugar with syrup sprinkled on the beignets are to-die-for.
If you haven't had beignets before, go here!
beignets.author: Annette Y.
beignets.review:
I give this place a 4.5. We were pleasantly surprised how short  the line was to get into this place. We found this place on YELP (THANKS YELP!) and read  we would have to wait in a long line to be seated. I think we scored due the rain, but our wait was only 10 min or so. When we first stepped in, I could tell why there's always such a long wait. This place is small....only 7 tables or so, but a very at- home warm welcoming atmosphere. Cute, colorful, friendly is how I'd describe it.

We were greeted by the host who asked if we'd like to sit at the counter. At first, we thought no, but then we realized we'd get to sit near the the cooks & see all dishes come out. I know most of you would agree, sitting near the steamy kitchen is a big no no, but not for us. How lucky were we??! Seriously.  I had no idea what to order. We read Yelp reviews & everything sounded delissshhh. But after ooking at the all the food come out..that helped me make my final decision! I ordered the Greg Scramble with chicken apple sausage. YUMMY! The veggies were FRESH! Spinach, garlic, & onions..MMmmm. I think that was my most favvv. of all that we ordered. We also ordered cornmeal pancakes. Super yummy. And of course, we didn't forget the beignets!! How do you say that? Silent "t"? Those  were delicious!! Powdered sugar with syrup sprinkled on the beignets are to-die-for. If you haven't had beignets before, go here! Theirs are delicious. 

This place is pretty close the Giants stadium so if you're up for breakfast before heading out to the game, this is the spot to check out. Loved it! But .5 marked off because it's just too small for me. :( 

I wouldn't suggest going here if you're with a group greater then four or else you'll have to wait since most of their tables only seat 2. But I definitely recommend this place.

excerpts: The beignets were awesome.
Food was excellent in general.
The ham is cut and cooked like bacon, or the bacon is so thick it's like a piece of ham.
I like that it's in a slower part of the city, less traffic, at least at the time we were there,
no wait, no fuss, friendly and lively atmosphere.
beignets.author: Andy B.
beignets.review: The beignets were awesome.  Food was excellent in general.  The ham is cut and cooked like bacon, or the bacon is so thick it's like a piece of ham.  I like that it's in a slower part of the city, less traffic, at least at the time we were there, no wait, no fuss, friendly and lively atmosphere.

excerpts: i would slap someones baby if it even reached for my beignets.
beignets.author: eric f.
beignets.review:
come hungry, leave fat.  i usually get two meals out of brunch here.

Alice P is right on about the biscuits, they are more like rolls, but they are good, i usually get them.  they will fill you up quick though.  the cinnamon raisin bread is good too.

the wait can be long though on a weekend, and you may have trouble getting a table for a group larger than 4.  weekend brunch offers more dishes though, so it's worth the wait.  (pay for a coffee inside and sip while you wait.)

i would slap someones baby if it even reached for my beignets.  they's good.

i usually hate reading long reviews, but i need to give credit to the character of the staff here.  we're talking about honesty in the customer service industry... in 2010:

the first time i came here i sat at the bar.  dude next me eating by himself.  waitress approaches him... she remembers him from the last time he was there, she had accidentally overcharged him (by some negligible amount) and wanted to give him back the difference.  any other place would have ate up the difference and laughed the whole way to the bank!  just for you is awesome.

excerpts: My breakfast-mates had the beignets and said they were amazing.
I didn't taste them because I know a new addiction when I see it.
beignets.author: S T.
beignets.review: I knew this place was Just For Me as Adam Ant was playing as we were seated! The frittata was delicious. The home fries were okay. My breakfast-mates had the beignets and said they were amazing. I didn't taste them because I know a new addiction when I see it.

excerpts: but I'll give it 5 stars anyway due to the piping hot beignets smothered in powdered sugar.
My black sweater was covered in powdered sugar, leaving one to believe that beignets aren't my ONLY addiction.
beignets.author: Krista C.
beignets.review: Several weeks ago, I embarked on a beignet hunt... I found Just For You.  Like most things, I put off my visit and just by happenstance yesterday, some friends and I walked by and sat down for brunch.  Service was iffy but I'll give it 5 stars anyway due to the piping hot beignets smothered in powdered sugar.  My black sweater was covered in powdered sugar, leaving one to believe that beignets aren't my ONLY addiction.

excerpts: Oh my, I did not know beignets could be so delicious!
I love this place and wish I could go more often
but it's bit far from everything.
(Probablllllllllllllly a good thing that I can't.
Not sure how long I could fit in my jeans if I could go back as often
beignets.author: JR Kaz K.
beignets.review:
Oh my, I did not know beignets could be so delicious!  I love this place and wish I could go more often but it's bit far from everything.  (Probablllllllllllllly a good thing that I can't.  Not sure how long I could fit in my jeans if I could go back as often as I wish lol.)  

I usually get the "cowgirl" special (2 pancakes, two eggs and sausage/bacon strips).  I give the sausage/bacon to my fiancé since I don't eat pork but I'm always stuffed with what's left.   

Staff is friendly and service is quick which is nice when you wake up having a major craving for pancakes :) 

Make sure you get the little punch card.  Always nice to get a free breakfast to a place you know you are going to come back to!

excerpts: One word: BEIGNETS!!!
They are so good!
And cinammon free which makes them real beignets!
They come warm and melt in your mouth.
Despite being very popular the wait does not seem to ever be very long for 2 people (parties of 4 or more seem to wait quite longer).
The waitress was super nice, very attentive, coffee always refilled.
Parking is easy around that neighborhood.
Go around 10am to beat the brunch crowd.
Great great Potrero place.
Note they only take cash or checks, but there is a liquor store next door with an ATM.
beignets.author: Jean-Francois R.
beignets.review: One word: BEIGNETS!!! They are so good! And cinammon free which makes them real beignets! They come warm and melt in your mouth. Despite being very popular the wait does not seem to ever be very long for 2 people (parties of 4 or more seem to wait quite longer). The waitress was super nice, very attentive, coffee always refilled. Parking is easy around that neighborhood. Go around 10am to beat the brunch crowd.  Great great Potrero place. Note they only take cash or checks, but there is a liquor store next door with an ATM.

excerpts: We also got the beignets - boring, the bakery I worked at in high school did better fried dough.
The service  was over attentive and some how totally in efficient.
Three servers came to take our drink order and yet one drink was forgotten.
Maybe it was an off day, but it this place seemed to be lacking in L-O-V-E.
beignets.author: Bryna M.
beignets.review: If you a vegetarian don't even bother heading to this place.  Everything of interest on the menu includes some sort of meat product.  I was pretty disappointed with what I got - two eggs over easy, grits and cornbread.  The cornbread was the only good thing out of the three.  We also got the beignets - boring, the bakery I worked at in high school did better fried dough.  The service  was over attentive and some how totally in efficient.  Three servers came to take our drink order and yet one drink was forgotten.  Maybe it was an off day, but it this place seemed to be lacking in L-O-V-E.

excerpts: Oh, and the beignets.... well, let's just not get started on what they did to my mother.
We'll save that for therapy.
beignets.author: Elena N.
beignets.review:
or as my mother says "the place with the scooooonnness". Yes, she gets this dreamy (I refuse to use the term "orgasmic" and "my mother" in the same sentence) drawn out voice when talking about this place. I was looking for brunch places to take my folks on their recent visit, and this place is just down the road from me, and I thought, why not? The folks are always wanting to go to the "real San Francisco places" and it's hard not to get more real than the Dogpatch. So glad we did. We went around 9am during the week, so parking wasn't too bad - but I would guess that weekend brunch might be a parking headache. But we got seated right away and literally drooled for the next 15 minutes over the menu. My dad got the chorizo scramble, my mom got 2 eggs with apple turkey sausage and the (infamous, for my mom anyway) blueberry scone, and I got Greg's scramble with chorizo. The chorizo was on the mild side, but no complaints with the eggs - nice and fluffy. The Greg's scramble was a nice mixture of stuff along with the chorizo but I probably could have done without the parmesan on top. But that's probably my fault in thinking parmesan and chorizo would go well together. The place itself is nice and homey feeling, the coffee was excellent.

Oh, and the beignets.... well, let's just not get started on what they did to my mother. We'll save that for therapy.

excerpts: I especially liked their beignets.
When they bring them to you they are hot, fluffy, and covered in powdered sugar.
Their crab po'boys were excellent; the crab was delicious.
I would definitely go back here, especially for breakfast.
beignets.author: CHERRYL H.
beignets.review: I have never had Cajun food in my life and I woke up one morning craving it.  I went on yelp and found this place.  I am so happy I went there.  This place is very quaint and welcoming.  The staff is very friendly and the food was delicious. I especially liked their beignets. When they bring them to you they are hot, fluffy, and covered in powdered sugar.  Their crab po'boys were excellent; the crab was delicious.  I would definitely go back here, especially for breakfast.

excerpts: Service was good, but the beignets were just ok.
beignets.author: JJ S.
beignets.review: Service was good, but the beignets were just ok.

excerpts: One thing I did like was the beignets.
Everything else was just ok.
I could probably make most of the food at home.
beignets.author: H. A.
beignets.review: I've been here twice and i don't think its amazing. It's convenient if you live around the area and has decent food. One thing I did like was the beignets. Everything else was just ok. I could probably make most of the food at home.

excerpts: The beignets were amazing,delicious and cheap.
There must be an entire box of powdered sugar on each plate of those things.
beignets.author: Max S.
beignets.review: This place served me some of the best food I've ever had. The beignets were amazing,delicious and cheap. There must be an entire box of powdered sugar on each plate of those things. The reuben was the best I've had in my life. The corned beef was very very fresh and amazingly cured. It had no fat on it and was the perfect size. Same goes for the BLT, perfect slices of bacon. I love the style of this place too

excerpts: At this point, desperate, I went for beignets.
Finally!
Yummy beignets.
Fresh, soft, fluffy, good.
No microwave in sight for those, at least not this time.
beignets.author: Jennifer P.
beignets.review:
I guess two and a half stars is as close as we can get to "average" here on good ole Yelp.  I'm just sad that Just For You is "average" now.  Years ago, on Potrero Hill, it was exceptional.  I'm not sure what happened, but it's saddening.  You'll note from my other reviews that I very rarely write negative reviews, I am usually a "if you've got nothing good to say, say nothing at all" kind of girl.  But watching a SF institution slide is too painful...

OK.  Here we go.  The primary problem seems to be related to the microwave.  If we could steal the microwave, maybe we could bring Just For You back to life.  On my final visit, I ordered 4 things, hoping each time to find something I could eat.  Breakfast Burrito- rubbery, overcooked, dry eggs wrapped in a flour tortilla and microwaved into oblivion.  Only the green chile sauce made a bite go down.  Next, tried the biscuits and gravy.  As a southerner and lover of biscuits, I know that it is a capital offense to microwave a biscuit.. but there it went, into the microwave, and out it came like a molten rubber hockey puck.  Covered with gelatinous cold goo.  So, I tried a scone.  Sadly, microwaved until I could bend it in half without breaking it.  At this point, desperate, I went for beignets.  Finally!  Yummy beignets.  Fresh, soft, fluffy, good.  No microwave in sight for those, at least not this time.  Which is probably why they took 20 minutes, but so be it.  

That was it, the last visit to Just For You after 10 years of slow decline.  It's just such a shame that a cute place, with an interesting and funny menu, a SF standy has gone so low.  I am painfully aware that there are bad days in any restaurant, but when it gets to be bad years, at some point you just have to let go.  At least there will be one less person in line now, right?  *sigh*

excerpts: Go for the beignets.
They are spectacular.
Chewy and hot on the inside with a slight crunch and sweet and gooey with powdered sugar on the outside.
Yow.
Worth the trip just for that.
Rest of breakfast is pretty dull.
beignets.author: Liboo K.
beignets.review: Go for the beignets. They are spectacular. Chewy and hot on the inside with a slight crunch and sweet and gooey with powdered sugar on the outside. Yow. Worth the trip just for that. Rest of breakfast is pretty dull.

excerpts: Beignets are especially delish.
As are the huevos rancheros.
Good service and some outdoor seating (especially nice in "sunny" Potrero Hill!)
beignets.author: Kristin P.
beignets.review: Great brunch place.  Beignets are especially delish.  As are the huevos rancheros.  Good service and some outdoor seating (especially nice in "sunny" Potrero Hill!)

excerpts: I will try them again for the beignets.
Also, this is the only brunch place in SF that I've found that has Hangtown Fry on the menu!
That's the one thing I'll concede about
Just For You, the menu is pretty extensive for breakfast.
beignets.author: kathy c.
beignets.review: I went fairly late for brunch on a weekend, and thankfully there was no wait. Parking was a breeze. The ambiance, while homey, felt more run down and thrown together than cute. The service was fantastic, but  there were only a few other tables at the time. I was not that impressed with the omelet I had. I will try them again for the beignets. Also, this is the only brunch place in SF that I've found that has Hangtown Fry on the menu! That's the one thing I'll concede about Just For You, the menu is pretty extensive for breakfast.

excerpts: Start with the beignets, then have breakfast.
beignets.author: Arlene C.
beignets.review: Start with the beignets, then have breakfast. I had the crab cake benedict, which didn't seem to have enough crab taste. Get one of the egg combos with the cornbread. The grits are good here. Serious kinda place, so no foolin' around. Besides, the people watching you will make you feel guilty if you do anything other than ...order, eat, & leave. Usually a line, so have patience Grasshopper.

excerpts: Eggs and grits and grits and eggs, and beignets.
Two-for-one breakfast coupons in the Guardian and Weekly, too.
Miss it at the top of Potrero Hill, but Dogpatch is close enough.
beignets.author: Laurel B.
beignets.review: Eggs and grits and grits and eggs, and beignets.   Two-for-one breakfast coupons in the Guardian and Weekly, too.  Miss it at the top of Potrero Hill, but Dogpatch is close enough.

excerpts:
The beignets are better then Elite Cafe (By a long shot)
The Biscuits are real.
beignets.author: Mark C.
beignets.review:
This place is wonderful.. 

The beignets are better then Elite Cafe (By a long shot)
The Biscuits are real.
The Coffee has Chicory 

This place is the real thing, good n'olins style food, good price. You have to try this place out. 

Seriously.. Go.. Really.. Its all that.

excerpts: Seeking something sweet, try their beignets perfectly crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside, dusted with powdered sugar.
Try any one of their daily specials or stick to your breakfast favorites of eggs, choice meats and fresh home fries potatoes.
Seeking the healthy stuff, get a big helping of yogurt, granola and fruit for all for about ten dollars.
They also have lunch items, and up until about a month ago are now open for dinner.
So check these guys out, you will not be sorry!
beignets.author: Cynthia G.
beignets.review: If breakfast food is what you fancy, even at 1 pm in the afternoon, then Just for You is definitely a place you should check out. Eating there is like having a home-cooked meal, but not at home. The staff is friendly and the atmosphere cozy and eclectic. As for the food, practically everything is made fresh; from the bread they bake everyday to the freshly squeezed grapefruit juice. Seeking something sweet, try their beignets perfectly crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside, dusted with powdered sugar. Try any one of their daily specials or stick to your breakfast favorites of eggs, choice meats and fresh home fries potatoes. Seeking the healthy stuff, get a big helping of yogurt, granola and fruit for all for about ten dollars. They also have lunch items, and up until about a month ago are now open for dinner. So check these guys out, you will not be sorry!

excerpts: in addition to the frittata, i ordered a side of beignets.
i personally am not a fan of doughnuts, but this really did some justice.
crisp on the outside, pillowy fluffy goodness on the inside.
not to mention it's covered with powdered sugar.
beignets.author: ann.ie k.
beignets.review:
i wish there were more breakfast places like this in la.  this place was splendid!  very cozy and hip without trying too hard.

i had a tough choice because for the first time (in a long time) there were so many more choices for vegetarians!  i ended up getting the "frittata of the decade" with home fries and a biscuit.  the frittata was fluffy.  i was surprised being that there was sauteed veggies (zucchini, onions, tomatoes, spinach, mushrooms) inside.  home fries were perfect!  the biscuit was great- plentiful too!

in addition to the frittata, i ordered a side of beignets.  i personally am not a fan of doughnuts, but this really did some justice.  crisp on the outside, pillowy fluffy goodness on the inside.  not to mention it's covered with powdered sugar.  yummmmmy!

my cousin had ordered the cow girl (2 eggs, 2 bacon/sausage, and 2 pancakes).  you have a choice between buttermilk or buckwheat pancakes.  she chose the buckwheat.  i've sampled some nasty cardboard tasting buck wheat pancakes before so i was a but hesitant to try hers.  dude.  let me say that this is far from cardboard and probably the first time i've seen buck wheat pancakes look (and taste) light and fluffy.

this is definitely a go to place for me now when i'm up here in the bay.  if only my stomach was bigger i would of ordered and eaten more!

excerpts: Be sure to try the beignets (I like them with a little maple syrup - DEEEEElicious).
The oatmeal pancakes are also surprisingly tasty (and don't feel as evil as the buttermilk).
We've experienced some spotty service and climate control issues a few times (otherwise 5 stars) - overall a fabulous find.
beignets.author: rachel m.
beignets.review: Just For You is a gem - they knock out a solid breakfast menu (at very reasonable prices). There's almost always a wait, but it's worth it. Be sure to try the beignets (I like them with a little maple syrup - DEEEEElicious). The oatmeal pancakes are also surprisingly tasty (and don't feel as evil as the buttermilk). We've experienced some spotty service and climate control issues a few times (otherwise 5 stars) - overall a fabulous find.

excerpts: at the end of the meal, we ordered the beignets.
they looked and smelled so good...
but when i tasted them, they kinda tasted a little odd.
like they had some kind of weird alcohol flavoring?
beignets.author: vlad k.
beignets.review:
restaurant 1 of 50

this is a funky place to get breakfast with quirky signage and a lot of good stuff on the menu.  it's a bit out there, but close to muni.  there was a lot of people shuffling around outside, so i expected a crazy wait, but it actually wasn't too bad.  biscuits and gravy were BOMB!  the green chili sauce... not so bomb... in fact, kinda gross actually.  why was it sweet?!

at the end of the meal, we ordered the beignets.  they looked and smelled so good... but when i tasted them, they kinda tasted a little odd.  like they had some kind of weird alcohol flavoring?  maybe we just got a bad batch.

i def wanna go back again and try some of the other stuff they serve.

excerpts: I followed them from the top of Potrero Hill to Dogpatch and I would go even farther for the beignets, pancakes and egg dishes.
So here is the running arguement with my breakfast companion, am I any less masculine because I order the Cowgirl?
beignets.author: Seamus M.
beignets.review: I followed them from the top of Potrero Hill to Dogpatch and I would go even farther for the beignets, pancakes and egg dishes. So here is the running arguement with my breakfast companion, am I any less masculine because I order the Cowgirl?

excerpts: We had Beignets, Eggs Beneficts and Chorizo con huevos, and they were all very good!
It was a great meal to start the weekend!
beignets.author: Sophia L.
beignets.review: 4.5 stars.  i have to give them extra 0.5 star because its' so nice of them providing coffees for people wait for tables. We had Beignets, Eggs Beneficts and Chorizo con huevos, and they were all very good!  It was a great meal to start the weekend!

excerpts: 3 stars because all of the food here is just okay EXCEPT the beignets.
the beignets are outstanding!
little pillows of perfectly sweet air.
best beignets
i've had to date!
beignets.author: Regina C.
beignets.review: 3 stars because all of the food here is just okay EXCEPT the beignets. the beignets are outstanding! little pillows of perfectly sweet air. best beignets i've had to date!

excerpts: The beignets are the best I've had.
Hangtown fry is awesome.
The sausages are awesome too.
5 stars if it weren't for the hour long wait.
Also, I'm not feeling the coffee a this place.
Chicory?
Tastes like RAID to me.
Aside from that though this is a good place to get your morning grub on.
beignets.author: Brian H.
beignets.review: The wait here is ridiculous but the food is well worth it if you're not in a hurry. The beignets are the best I've had. Hangtown fry is awesome. The sausages are awesome too. 5 stars if it weren't for the hour long wait. Also, I'm not feeling the coffee a this place. Chicory? Tastes like RAID to me. Aside from that though this is a good place to get your morning grub on.

excerpts: 4-lots and lots of comfort food including beignets.
which were out of this world.
5-amidst all the egg and meat drenched omelettes which do sound good if i did partake in all that, they have one completely VEGAN dish!
and its amazingly amazing.
beignets.author: Kat R.
beignets.review:
why 5 stars you say? well let me count the ways.  this was a perfect brunch location for j and i meeting in the city to dish.

1-very accessible location and even street parking.  enough said.
2-very cute atmosphere.
3-bitterness and sarcastic menu.  this wins 2 stars right there.  they are sassy and i like it.
4-lots and lots of comfort food including beignets.  which were out of this world.
5-amidst all the egg and meat drenched omelettes which do sound good if i did partake in all that, they have one completely VEGAN dish!  and its amazingly amazing.  tofu and stir-fried veggies, broccoli, onions, mushrooms.  

yes there was definitely food coma for quite some time that day.

excerpts: Breakfast started off on a high note as we dove right into the beignets... warm, sugary and a little doughy in the middle.
mmm.
I also ordered the Frittata of The Decade... who could resist with a name like that?
It's not your typical frittata (a little more like a scramble) but it tasted great
so it made no difference to my mouth.
Along with home fries cooked to a crisp (just the way I like) and a serving of your choice of toast, this meal will fill you up right at a good price.
I'll definitely be back... hopefully many more times.
beignets.author: James C.
beignets.review: An excellent breakfast/lunch spot with a broad menu that's sure to satisfy. There'll be a modest wait before you can get a seat but go with a good friend and the time will fly by. Breakfast started off on a high note as we dove right into the beignets... warm, sugary and a little doughy in the middle. mmm. I also ordered the Frittata of The Decade... who could resist with a name like that? It's not your typical frittata (a little more like a scramble) but it tasted great so it made no difference to my mouth. Along with home fries cooked to a crisp (just the way I like) and a serving of your choice of toast, this meal will fill you up right at a good price. I'll definitely be back... hopefully many more times.

excerpts: they're beignets
are pretty good
(i didn't think cafe
du monde was all that anyway!)
but they're

egg dishes are solid, cornmeal and oatmeal pancakes are SO damn tasty (sorta crunchy on the outside but light and fluffy on the inside), i love their sausages, fruit bowls are always fresh, and their home fries are some of the best i've had in the city (lots of SF places don't seem to fully grasp the concept of homefries).
the menu's pretty extensive (they've even got grits- YUM!!!!!), but
beignets.author: Bird B.
beignets.review:
just for you is an awesome awesome place for brunch.  i've only ever had typical brekkie/brunchy stuff here and they know how to do it up right.  they're beignets are pretty good (i didn't think cafe du monde was all that anyway!) but they're egg dishes are solid, cornmeal and oatmeal pancakes are SO damn tasty (sorta crunchy on the outside but light and fluffy on the inside), i love their sausages, fruit bowls are always fresh, and their home fries are some of the best i've had in the city (lots of SF places don't seem to fully grasp the concept of homefries).  the menu's pretty extensive (they've even got grits- YUM!!!!!), but surprisingly everything we've tried has been really good as opposed to some of those places that offer way too much but does it all half-assed.  

it gets crowded but if you go a little after prime brunch time, there's usually a table avbl (the ones outside aren't bad on a sunny dogpatch day) and i particularly like sitting at the counter, ol' skool.
service is remarkably efficient considering how busy this place gets.

excerpts: I'll be back for the creole crab cakes, the bread and the beignets.
Loving it.
beignets.author: Annie Y.
beignets.review:
Gruyere? wildflower honey? aioli? arugula??...no presense on an SF brunch menu??? With so many brunch places in the city, I wondered how this diner was surviving. 

Driving up to the eatery, my first impression was that this place was a hipster hangout. A line of "just rolled out of bed, i don't give a shit but I somewhat do with these Ray Bans, skinnys and flannel scarf" patrons were waiting in line to get their breakfast on. Stepping into the diner however, I noticed how the cozy tones and funky posters combined with the aromas of powdered sugar and cinnamon made this spot instantaneously amicable. I ordered a Beignet to share with a friend. It was huge, warm, fluffy and extremely delicious. I could of eaten two of these, drank my coffee and been in state of complete bliss. I did however, want to try more items. I went with a grilled catfish fillet, scrambled eggs, grits and cornbread combo. Talk about a lot of food!  I liked that the catfish was prepared grilled instead of fried. My love hate relationship with carbs also fully appreciated and then fretted over the extensive bread options (cornbread, cinnamon raisin, scone, english muffin, toast, wheat) and choice of grits or homefries (I chose grits). The bread here is homemade. The quality of the classic diner fare was not sacrificed with quantity. Prices are also very reasonable with most menu items under $10. This place beats Serpentine (aka what's up with the communal table between two restrooms) across the street in my book. 

One or two cons about this place: Coffee contributes extensively to my ability to enjoy breakfast. I wish they served better coffee here. Also, this place takes only cash or check. A friend was visiting me from NYC....you can figure out the rest. Anyway, these aren't reasons enough to deter continuous visits. I'll be back for the creole crab cakes, the bread and the beignets. Loving it.

excerpts: The beignets are a must!!!
They are huge, fluffy, crispy and piping hot!
So good!
I could eat an whole order by myself!
I had the fried egg sandwich on home made bread with home fries.
Although they forgot the cheese, it was still delicious.
My bf had the sweet scramble.
It came with veggies, sausage and roasted red peppers that gave it a sweet kick.
Anothr delicious dish.
I highly recommend this place for breakfast lovers... only recommendation.. get the beignets and one other entree..
the portions are huge!!!
And either go super early or late to avoid lines..
beignets.author: Denise L.
beignets.review: This place made it to my lists of favorite breakfast spots!! The food was delicious!! I loved the extensive menu!! So much to chose from! The beignets are a must!!! They are huge, fluffy, crispy and piping hot! So good! I could eat an whole order by myself! I had the fried egg sandwich on home made bread with home fries. Although they forgot the cheese, it was still delicious. My bf had the sweet scramble. It came with veggies, sausage and roasted red peppers that gave it a sweet kick. Anothr delicious dish.! I highly recommend this place for breakfast lovers... only recommendation.. get the beignets and one other entree.. the portions are huge!!! And either go super early or late to avoid lines..

excerpts: I ordered the beignets and the soup of the day which was potato leek the beignets where perfect and so was the soup.
Everything went down hill from there.
The food was over priced for what we got my eggs where soggy and tasteless and burned in some parts and home fries where over seasoned and some where undercooked.
The corn bread was dry.
It's a sure bet we won't be coming back here again.
beignets.author: Melissa H.
beignets.review: My husband and I stopped for breakfast here, on New Year's Eve. We knew service would be slow since it was a holiday and there was a line of people waiting to be seated. Nonetheless, we decided to sit outside where we wouldn't have to wait for a table. We sat got the menus but once we wanted to order our food and our drinks, the server who seemed to have completely forgotten about us took about 25 min or more to actually come outside. Once we actually ordered it took about another 20 min to get our drinks only, mind you I had a hot chocolate and my husband the house coffee. The hot chocolate came from a package with water pretty disgusting and well the coffee was cold. I ordered the beignets and the soup of the day which was potato leek the beignets where perfect and so was the soup. Everything went down hill from there. The food was over priced for what we got my eggs where soggy and tasteless and burned in some parts and home fries where over seasoned and some where undercooked. The corn bread was dry. It's a sure bet we won't be coming back here again.

excerpts: The beignets are the main reason why I come to this place.
The rest of the food is good and fresh, but I wouldn't come here if it weren't for those deep fried crispy chewy suckers covered in powdered sugar.
Mmm so good.
There is always a huge crowd, but I've never had to wait more than 15 minutes for a party of two.
Their turnaround is fast.
beignets.author: Michelle M.
beignets.review: The beignets are the main reason why I come to this place.  The rest of the food is good and fresh, but I wouldn't come here if it weren't for those deep fried crispy chewy suckers covered in powdered sugar.  Mmm so good.  There is always a huge crowd, but I've never had to wait more than 15 minutes for a party of two.  Their turnaround is fast.

excerpts: Regardless of which fad diet you are on or which triathlon you are training for, the beignets are a must.
I wish it were a little closer to me
so I could walk there and is the only reason I don't go more often.
beignets.author: Faisal M.
beignets.review:
Get here early but the wait is worth it. Nothing fancy except the great food and friendly service.
Regardless of which fad diet you are on or which triathlon you are training for, the beignets are a must.
I wish it were a little closer to me so I could walk there and is the only reason I don't go more often.

excerpts: Greg's Scramble is pretty good too and the Beignets are pretty awesome.
Real great comfort food Southern Style!
beignets.author: Karin A.
beignets.review: Yummy, yummy, yummy!  Superb Oatmeal Pancakes, love em love em.  Greg's Scramble is pretty good too and the Beignets are pretty awesome.  Real great comfort food Southern Style!

excerpts: we just had drinks and beignets.
Weird neighborhood.
beignets.author: Danielle E.
beignets.review: Cute atmosphere, food looked good we just had drinks and beignets. Weird neighborhood.

excerpts: If you're familiar with beignets, then these are the only items on the menu to avoid.
Otherwise, feast yourself on oyster po-boys (my lady's fav), lovely breakfast dishes, and an always-on-the-mark atmosphere and service (not too friendly, not too lame).
Good stuff happening out there in the burgeoning dogpatch.
beignets.author: Libby T.
beignets.review: My girlfriend and I have two places that come into mind every time we want to eat-and Mabel's is one of them. The food is comfort at best, with a distinctive twist to southern and California basics. If you're familiar with beignets, then these are the only items on the menu to avoid. Otherwise, feast yourself on oyster po-boys (my lady's fav), lovely breakfast dishes, and an always-on-the-mark atmosphere and service (not too friendly, not too lame). Good stuff happening out there in the burgeoning dogpatch.

excerpts: Two reasons this place gets four stars from me - amazing beignets and can it be true?
REAL New Mexico green chile!
If they served cream with their coffee instead of milk, I'd probably give 'em five stars.
beignets.author: N J.
beignets.review: Two reasons this place gets four stars from me - amazing beignets and can it be true? REAL New Mexico green chile! If they served cream with their coffee instead of milk, I'd probably give 'em five stars.

excerpts: the beignets are mandatory (enjoy them with a mug of hot cocoa).
they have raisin toast.
beignets.author: jennifer y.
beignets.review:
love it.

the chili scramble hits the spot like you just wouldn't believe.
the ambiance is terrific.
the beignets are mandatory (enjoy them with a mug of hot cocoa).
they have raisin toast.

excerpts: The beignets may well be a skosh better than the ones at - dare
I say it - Cafe du Monde!
I had a scramble which was really good, and the grits were divine.
beignets.author: Elaine U.
beignets.review: Pretty yum, I'd say. The beignets may well be a skosh better than the ones at - dare I say it - Cafe du Monde!  I had a scramble which was really good, and the grits were divine.

excerpts: The beignets are better than the one's at Cafe Du Monde in New Orleans.
I haven't had one meal I haven't enjoyed.
They are consistent, portions are plenty, their service is respectful, and breakfast is served all day!
I haven't tried anything other than the breakfast items
so I can't speak for the rest of the menu.
This is a must if you have visitors.
Arrive early on weekends, b4 9am.
We're going here before heading over to see Wicked at the Orpheum for breakfast at dinner time!
Perfect evening!!!
beignets.author: Lissette I.
beignets.review: There's a reason why this place consistently receives 4 stars. IT'S THE BEST Breakfast restaurant in SF. The only reason I didn't give it 5...it's tiny location. The beignets are better than the one's at Cafe Du Monde in New Orleans. I haven't had one meal I haven't enjoyed. They are consistent, portions are plenty, their service is respectful, and breakfast is served all day! I haven't tried anything other than the breakfast items so I can't speak for the rest of the menu. This is a must if you have visitors. Arrive early on weekends, b4 9am. We're going here before heading over to see Wicked at the Orpheum for breakfast at dinner time! Perfect evening!!!

excerpts: The beignets are great, but as a vegetarian, the bkfast options are kinda weak.
The place is pleasant enough, but that tofu dish is lame.
beignets.author: Lesley G.
beignets.review: The beignets are great, but as a vegetarian, the bkfast options are kinda weak.  The place is pleasant enough, but that tofu dish is lame.

excerpts: The signature beignets are awesome.
Otherwise the standard good, consistent brunch food.
Perfect for my local brunch place, but sometimes I cook better at home.
Cash only, and often a long wait.
beignets.author: Janet S.
beignets.review: The signature beignets are awesome.  Otherwise the standard good, consistent brunch food.  Perfect for my local brunch place, but sometimes I cook better at home.  Cash only, and often a long wait.

excerpts: Not a secret any more, but still worth a trip over for the beignets and great big plates of eggs and other breakfast delights.
http://www.justforyoucafe.com/
beignets.author: D.C. C.
beignets.review: Great breakfast and lunch spot in the Dogpatch.  Not a secret any more, but still worth a trip over for the beignets and great big plates of eggs and other breakfast delights.  http://www.justforyoucafe.com/

excerpts: The beignets rock.
beignets.author: Keith R.
beignets.review: Bring a jacket, reading material, and perhaps a snack for your long wait for a table (hot coffee is complimentary). The beignets rock.

excerpts: The specials are usually varied enough and tasty -- and if you're in the mood for something special, I recommend the beignets..
Fluffy pillows of new orleans donuty goodness..
So good!
Besides, there's always easy parking in the hood.
beignets.author: Dennis Y.
beignets.review: Yes, it's a trek for me to make it all the way out to the Dogpatch, but I don't care.. I love the food and the folks at Just For You..    The specials are usually varied enough and tasty -- and if you're in the mood for something special, I recommend the beignets..  Fluffy pillows of new orleans donuty goodness..  So good!  Besides, there's always easy parking in the hood.

excerpts: The beignets weren't totally cooked through and a little too gigantic for my taste, best ones I've had so far in SF have to be Universal Cafe.
The scramble was pretty good and the potatoes were okay, some big chunks were still kind of hard.
I didn't get to try the wine or champagne but for $4 I should have.
beignets.author: Jen C.
beignets.review: It's probably 3 stars for me but the prices bump it up to 4 stars.  I think reading all the Yelp reviews totally overhyped this place for me.  It was just a tiny bit better than alright.  The beignets weren't totally cooked through and a little too gigantic for my taste, best ones I've had so far in SF have to be Universal Cafe.  The scramble was pretty good and the potatoes were okay, some big chunks were still kind of hard.  I didn't get to try the wine or champagne but for $4 I should have.

excerpts: The beignets are amazing unless you're one of the Olsen twins and the only meat on your bones is on your fucking ass.
Otherwise, suck in the calories, baby.
beignets.author: Tracy Y.
beignets.review:
Oh man. I hate telling people how great this place is because the line can be bad enough as it is. Sigh.

It's awesome! I've been going here since it was a dinky little rat hole on Potrero Hill! (No, no, no rats. But it was a hole.)

The beignets are amazing unless you're one of the Olsen twins and the only meat on your bones is on your fucking ass.  Otherwise, suck in the calories, baby. It's worth it.

P.s. They serve grits. "Just like you got in prison," they brag. I shit you not.

excerpts: Once seated.. I was charged up and ready to take down molto coffee, beignets and a Greg's "who no longer works there any more" scramble with Chirozo.
BRING
IT ON
Just 4 U..
I'm hungry.
Anyway.. I digress.
Scramble was yummy and fresh as was the coffee and OJ.
Problem with the story gets back to the service..
Homeboy forgot the beignets..
so you lose a star.. sorry kids..
maybe next time.
beignets.author: Tom C.
beignets.review: After doing some research I decided to hit "Just 4 U" for a weekend breakfast.  I was pleasantly surprised as the wait was much shorter than expected.  Once seated.. I was charged up and ready to take down molto coffee, beignets and a Greg's "who no longer works there any more" scramble with Chirozo.  BRING IT ON Just 4 U.. I'm hungry.  Anyway.. I digress.  Scramble was yummy and fresh as was the coffee and OJ.  Problem with the story gets back to the service.. Homeboy forgot the beignets.. so you lose a star.. sorry kids.. maybe next time.

excerpts: The beignets are awesome - always made to order and piping hot.
I always get the hangtown fry (scrambled eggs, bacon, oysters and onions).
Pure perfection.
Service is really good too.
beignets.author: David H.
beignets.review: I love this place.  I want to marry it.  The beignets are awesome - always made to order and piping hot.  I always get the hangtown fry (scrambled eggs, bacon, oysters and onions).  Pure perfection.  Service is really good too.

excerpts: Best beignets I've had since Cafe Du Monde in New Orleans.
Near perfection in a beignet
and I have tried about 10 other places that have tried and haven't come close.
The rest of the breakfast was just average for me.
So eggs, potatoes and biscuit get three stars and beignet gets five stars, which makes this a four star for me.
beignets.author: Emily O.
beignets.review: Best beignets I've had since Cafe Du Monde in New Orleans. Near perfection in a beignet and I have tried about 10 other places that have tried and haven't come close. The rest of the breakfast was just average for me. So eggs, potatoes and biscuit get three stars and beignet gets five stars, which makes this a four star for me.

excerpts: The specials are great, the beignets, crabcakes and other "Leeziana" delicacies make me smile.
Yum!
beignets.author: Andrew S.
beignets.review: Ever since the Crescent City Cafe closed years ago, this has been my go-to spot for yummy Cajun brunch. I even moved in down the block to be close by! (okay, not *totally* true). The specials are great, the beignets, crabcakes and other "Leeziana" delicacies make me smile. Yum!

excerpts: I only take a star off because the highly lauded beignets weren't as fantastic as I expected and the service was pretty unattentive.
But eggs, bacon, potatoes, OJ were deliciousness!
beignets.author: Elena S.
beignets.review: Pretty awesome kitschy brunch place in an unlikely neighborhood.  They served up great food for a very hungry crowd.  I only take a star off because the highly lauded beignets weren't as fantastic as I expected and the service was pretty unattentive.  But eggs, bacon, potatoes, OJ were deliciousness!

excerpts: And the beignets are heavenly....
beignets.author: Suepattra M.
beignets.review: House specialty scramble -  Hangtown Fry: fried oysters, slices of bacon, onion, and scrambled egg.  Yummy washed down with freshly squeezed o.j. and guaranteed to cure *any* hangover. It's been put to the test many a time and has consistently passed with flying colors. :-) And the beignets are heavenly....

excerpts: I started out with some beignets, which were amazing!
The biggest things I have ever seen drowning in powdered sugar.
beignets.author: Alicia J.
beignets.review: This restaurant was the victim of my Sunday Fun Day. I had a delightful little meal here. The food was delicious. I started out with some beignets, which were amazing! The biggest things I have ever seen drowning in powdered sugar. I also dabbled in the crab cake Benedict (perfectly cooked crab and egg) and the amazing, creamy biscuits and gravy. The portions were huge (I was able to pass along my little heaven to my hung over friend who spent breakfast sleeping in my car). Did I mention the erroneous selection of condiments, I am talking in the upper teens...a little delight for everyone. Also a plus is the mimosa served in a pint glass- much classier than the often too small $8 mimosa served in a champagne flute.

excerpts: First off, the beignets were SO good!!!!
Now when we got there, there was a wait, no biggie!
We finally get seated after sipping on some Blue Bottle Coffee from across the street & we order.
Now, the food was pretty darn good & again those beignets were SO good & HUGE!!!
My ONLY REAL disappointment were the grits; after putting butter in them & the BF putting crumbled blue cheese in his, we could not get ANY flavor out of them at all!!!
They tasted like watered down Malt O' Meal crap (for some good grits hit up Brenda's on Polk & Eddy) & we just let them be!
However everything else was SO could!
They Chili Cheese Scramble on the VERY tasty corn bread was AWESOME!!!
beignets.author: Rob L.
beignets.review: First off, the beignets were SO good!!!! Now when we got there, there was a wait, no biggie! We finally get seated after sipping on some Blue Bottle Coffee from across the street & we order. Now, the food was pretty darn good & again those beignets were SO good & HUGE!!! My ONLY REAL disappointment were the grits; after putting butter in them & the BF putting crumbled blue cheese in his, we could not get ANY flavor out of them at all!!! They tasted like watered down Malt O' Meal crap (for some good grits hit up Brenda's on Polk & Eddy) & we just let them be! However everything else was SO could! They Chili Cheese Scramble on the VERY tasty corn bread was AWESOME!!!

excerpts: All hail the beignets!
Soft, piping hot homemade delectable donuts dusted with powdered sugar.
I think I have died and gone to heaven -- and that's just for starters.
Just For You makes their own homemade sausage and their breakfast omelets are out of this world.
But by far my favorite thing to order is the Crabby Benny -- crab eggs benedict on top of toast.
There's usually a short wait for a table, but don't despair --
they've got self-serve coffee out on the sidewalk.
Just For You is absolutely my favorite place for brunch.
beignets.author: Katie B.
beignets.review: All hail the beignets! Soft, piping hot homemade delectable donuts dusted with powdered sugar. I think I have died and gone to heaven -- and that's just for starters. Just For You makes their own homemade sausage and their breakfast omelets are out of this world. But by far my favorite thing to order is the Crabby Benny -- crab eggs benedict on top of toast. There's usually a short wait for a table, but don't despair -- they've got self-serve coffee out on the sidewalk. Just For You is absolutely my favorite place for brunch.

excerpts: High ratings just for having very fresh beignets.
Seriously.
Their breakfast was very delicious too.
Been there twice will return without hesitation and when I have a ride.
beignets.author: Adrian N.
beignets.review: High ratings just for having very fresh beignets.  Seriously.  Their breakfast was very delicious too.  Been there twice will return without hesitation and when I have a ride.

excerpts: The food is decent but the beignets push it over the top.
There's typically a wait on the weekend
so put your name on the list and grab a coffee from across the street.
beignets.author: Clayton K.
beignets.review: I'm giving just for you cafe 4 stars because its my breakfast joint.  The food is decent but the beignets push it over the top.  There's typically a wait on the weekend so put your name on the list and grab a coffee from across the street.

excerpts: Their beignets are awesome.
They serve Filipino longanisa, which is slightly less greasy than my mom cooks them, but still good with half the fat.
Their counters - though adds some character to the place, a challenge to sit at for the vertically challenged.
Their service is about as friendly as you can get for being hurried.
Which is by the way, a good thing, because after waiting 45 minutes, you want your food ...
NOW.
All in all, a cozy neighborhood brunch experience, and apparently now open for dinner.
I'll definitely be back.
beignets.author: Jean A.
beignets.review: I hate waiting in line for brunch places, which is like ... everywhere in San Francisco.  That being said, this was worth the wait.  Here's the skinny.  They serve complimentary coffee outside while you wait.  (But you can also head across the street to Piccino's for the good stuff.)  Their plates are gigantic.  Their beignets are awesome.  They serve Filipino longanisa, which is slightly less greasy than my mom cooks them, but still good with half the fat.  Their counters - though adds some character to the place, a challenge to sit at for the vertically challenged.  Their service is about as friendly as you can get for being hurried.  Which is by the way, a good thing, because after waiting 45 minutes, you want your food ... NOW.   All in all, a cozy neighborhood brunch experience, and apparently now open for dinner.  I'll definitely be back.

excerpts: Love their Beignets.
Have bunch with my other friends there last Sunday.
Good that they were there early... it took 45 mins for us to have a table.
Small place with nice food and waiters.
For sure will go there again.
beignets.author: zoom z.
beignets.review: Love their Beignets. Have bunch with my other friends there last Sunday. Good that they were there early... it took 45 mins for us to have a table. Small place with nice food and waiters. For sure will go there again.

excerpts: The beignets are out of this world!
Even later that day when we had left overs, they were still great.
Also, they made my eggs, egg whites without any problem!
Super friendly and coffee was good, hot, fresh and kept flowing.
Very casual, laid back and fun.
beignets.author: Liz L.
beignets.review: Fabulous food, service, ambiance, excellent parking... looking forward to coming back!  The beignets are out of this world!  Even later that day when we had left overs, they were still great.  Also, they made my eggs, egg whites without any problem!  Super friendly and coffee was good, hot, fresh and kept flowing.  Very casual, laid back and fun.

excerpts: The beignets are as good as it gets outside of the ones I've tried in NOLO!
Love them and the lightness of the my fish/potatoes/biscuit brunch.
The coffee was just okay though.
beignets.author: Stacey H.
beignets.review: The beignets are as good as it gets outside of the ones I've tried in NOLO! Love them and the lightness of the my fish/potatoes/biscuit brunch. The coffee was just okay though.

excerpts: I was super excited to find beignets in SF but the food is soo good
I forgot all about them.
beignets.author: jeff p.
beignets.review: Loves it! I was super excited to find beignets in SF but the food is soo good I forgot all about them. The crab cake Po Boy is amazing!

excerpts: Hate the chairs, love the beignets.
It's a real love-hate relationship, but with so many menu choices, beignets and damn good strawberry jam, and actual quality bacon, the love almost always wins out.
beignets.author: Eclipse T.
beignets.review: Hate the wait, love the food.  Hate the service, love the coffee.  Hate the chairs, love the beignets.  It's a real love-hate relationship, but with so many menu choices, beignets and damn good strawberry jam, and actual quality bacon, the love almost always wins out.

excerpts: and I need to try those beignets...
beignets.author: Jess D.
beignets.review: Looks like I was lucky enough not to have went to this place for the first time during breakfast. I went there a few days ago for brunch... on a Thursday. There was no wait-- and the waiters were ready to take my order. Almost too ready. They seemed a little annoyed that I wasn't ready. I'm sorry it was my first time there, I'd like to take a minute to decide what I would like to eat first, thank you. Anyways, I had a very delicious omelet with chicken apple sausage and biscuits and grits. I was very happy! Although the service is a little rude, I would definitely go there again just because I love going to breakfast...and I need to try those beignets...

excerpts: We started with some beignets, which were really good, but not the best I've had.
I actually think the ones at the Grand Lux Cafe in Chicago are the best!
The Hangtown Fry was awesome!
I loved the flavor of the oysters.
It's a very hardy meal.
Everyone else's meals around me looked delicious too.
I would love to come back for more, but the line is so long....
beignets.author: Diana S.
beignets.review: This is one of my favorite brunch places. The lines suck, but I thought the food was worth it. We ended up sitting at the tiny counter. We were so hungry when we finally got seated. We started with some beignets, which were really good, but not the best I've had. I actually think the ones at the Grand Lux Cafe in Chicago are the best! The Hangtown Fry was awesome! I loved the flavor of the oysters. It's a very hardy meal. Everyone else's meals around me looked delicious too. I would love to come back for more, but the line is so long....

excerpts: Beignets are beyond awesome and don't be caught yappin' on your cell phone in here or you will be treated like a piece of trash which would serve you right anyways.
Always crowded at peak times and there is one of those nice little yellow notepads to sign your name on outside when the crowd is swelling out this tiny hole.
The cowboy, which includes chicken apple sausage, has to be one of the best things on the menu.
(UPDATE)
I did not realize they are now open for dinner, so I may update this review after trying out the new part of the menu!
beignets.author: Bowser J.
beignets.review: A great hole in the wall place to brighten this questionable neighborhood, one of which I used to live in. Now the early bird special is a great deal for those that live around and want a great cheap breakfast. Beignets are beyond awesome and don't be caught yappin' on your cell phone in here or you will be treated like a piece of trash which would serve you right anyways. Always crowded at peak times and there is one of those nice little yellow notepads to sign your name on outside when the crowd is swelling out this tiny hole. The cowboy, which includes chicken apple sausage, has to be one of the best things on the menu. (UPDATE) I did not realize they are now open for dinner, so I may update this review after trying out the new part of the menu!

excerpts: We did a little searching on  yelp and saw the great reviews and numerous mentions of beignets.
The beignets were as good as everyone said!
So delicious...
I would drive back up to SF just for the beignets.
beignets.author: Patty L.
beignets.review:
DELICIOUS!

I had a friend visiting from out of town and she wanted to grab a classic brunch. We did a little searching on  yelp and saw the great reviews and numerous mentions of beignets. So off we went

The beignets were as good as everyone said!  So delicious...I would drive back up to SF just for the beignets.

The mimosas came out in very generous sized glasses and tasted more champagne than oj. In other words the mimosas were great! ;-)

I had the frittata of the decade which was good nothing too special but nonetheless tasty. My friend got the french toast and Louisiana sausage
which she was very happy with.

Will definitely be making a trip back here soon

excerpts: I love the beignets.
I love the grits, oatmeal pancakes, croque monseiur, biscuits.
They have amazing home-baked bread.
It makes the best toast.
And their coffee is good and strong.
Overall, the food is healthy, fresh,  rich, and hearty.
Yum!
beignets.author: Lita F.
beignets.review: Just For You is a wonderful breakfast place on the weekdays.  It's probably very crowded on the weekends.  And remember, it's only open until 3pm!  Anyway, I've found Just for You to be quiet, cozy, and serving great food.  I love the chili scramble.  I love the beignets.  I love the grits, oatmeal pancakes, croque monseiur, biscuits.  They have amazing home-baked bread.  It makes the best toast.  And their coffee is good and strong.  Overall, the food is healthy, fresh,  rich, and hearty.  Yum!

excerpts: But what really keeps me coming back is the coffee and beignets afterward.
Mmm Mmm..
oh my.
My mouth is watering just thinking about it.
beignets.author: Richard K.
beignets.review: Perfect weekday lunch spot if you need a break from work to chill out in the sun with a Mimosa and a crab-cake sandwich. But what really keeps me coming back is the coffee and beignets afterward. Mmm Mmm..oh my. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.

excerpts: The beignets are a must have and the frittatas are great.
Parking is also easy if you don't live in the area.
beignets.author: Dave L.
beignets.review: One of my favorite breakfast/brunch places in the bay area.  The entire staff is extremely friendly and the food is consistently good.  The beignets are a must have and the frittatas are great.  Parking is also easy if you don't live in the area.

excerpts: Okay, the beignets are lovely, too, but oh, those pancakes.
I want them to have my babies.
I want to elect them to office.
They're THAT good.
beignets.author: Fawn F.
beignets.review: I can, will, and do cross town for JFY's amazing cornmeal pancakes. I have no idea whether anything else on the menu is any good, because I can never get past the pancakes -- they are just sublime and there's no way around it. Well, once I got some kind of omelette with veggies and cheese, and it was quite nice and large and tasty, but it wasn't a giant cornmeal pancake slathered with raspberry jam with crispy bacon on the side. Okay, the beignets are lovely, too, but oh, those pancakes. I want them to have my babies. I want to elect them to office. They're THAT good.

excerpts: I love the beignets!
They are the reason I've gone back, despite the long wait.
beignets.author: Katrina C.
beignets.review: I love the beignets! They are the reason I've gone back, despite the long wait.

excerpts: Five stars for being so unique, not-over crowded, and the only place with beignets in SF (correct me if I'm wrong).
Chickory in the coffee and all.
I love when I feel like I've been transported to another place.
Add some heat and humidity, you could be in New Orleans here.
beignets.author: Val U.
beignets.review: Five stars for being so unique, not-over crowded, and the only place with beignets in SF (correct me if I'm wrong).  Chickory in the coffee and all. I love when I feel like I've been transported to another place. Add some heat and humidity, you could be in New Orleans here.

excerpts: Everyone raves about the beignets, but the cornmeal pancakes were awesome.
I highly recommend getting them.
beignets.author: Daniel Q.
beignets.review:
Every visit here has been great (both food and service).  I love this place.  I wish all the hipsters would stop coming here so I could get a table without a huge wait, though.

Daniel

P.S. Everyone raves about the beignets, but the cornmeal pancakes were awesome.  I highly recommend getting them.

excerpts: Yes, the  Beignets totally rock.
You can even order them in less than 3s.
I love that I can get a sandwich with a side of excellent salad and not just fries.
Don't order the biscuits unless you get them with gravy.
They are dry dry dry.
I will admit that I like my biscuits on the buttery side.
The specials are really great and not just what didn't sell from yesterday.
Corned Beef Hash is homemade and
not that canned junk
so places like to pass off.
It can get crowded, but that's what happens when you have great comfort food.
I want to give them 5 stars but the service isn't as good as it used to be.
Not sure why, but if you need a refill or or your order doesn't come shortly after the rest of the table, flag someone down or you could be waitin' a while.
beignets.author: Stephanie R.
beignets.review: Okay this is my favorite local breakfast place. Yes, the  Beignets totally rock. You can even order them in less than 3s. I love that I can get a sandwich with a side of excellent salad and not just fries. Don't order the biscuits unless you get them with gravy. They are dry dry dry. I will admit that I like my biscuits on the buttery side. The specials are really great and not just what didn't sell from yesterday. Corned Beef Hash is homemade and not that canned junk so places like to pass off. It can get crowded, but that's what happens when you have great comfort food. I want to give them 5 stars but the service isn't as good as it used to be. Not sure why, but if you need a refill or or your order doesn't come shortly after the rest of the table, flag someone down or you could be waitin' a while.

excerpts: The beignets were excellent (though, can you really screw up a beignet?).
I'd give them a solid 5 and the rest of it a 3.
My advice, order some beignets to go and eat them somewhere else.
beignets.author: Tom R.
beignets.review: I sat at one of their outdoor tables on an absolutely perfect day.  There wasn't much of a wait, the service was fine, and I found parking with ease.  So I was in a pretty good mood to begin with. The "Special Frittata" was a disappointment however.  The meat in it was overcooked but the veggies were raw.  Tasted like someone's first attempt at making an omelet. The home fries and cinnamon raisin toast were tasty, and filling.  The beignets were excellent (though, can you really screw up a beignet?). I'd give them a solid 5 and the rest of it a 3.  My advice, order some beignets to go and eat them somewhere else.

excerpts: Great, great food (the Beignets were sinful!), and the service was so lovely and courteous
beignets.author: Rollio R.
beignets.review:
Just lovely...

my gf and I were out trying to discover a new brunch place to call our own...I can't believe we live in Potrero Hill and have never been here before!

Great, great food (the Beignets were sinful!), and the service was so lovely and courteous, the atmosphere was special (interesting cubano music playing while in a Southern homestyle cooking restaurant).

This is our new favorite, and I highly recommend stopping by for breakfast if you haven't already...

excerpts: They also push the beignets very hard with every order, which are nothing special.
beignets.author: Geae D.
beignets.review: Always a very long wait, due to the trendiness. This means the waitstaff is rushed to the point of rudeness, bluntly telling you to get out of the way if you are standing in the wrong area (the whole place is small and not well-designed, so there is always bottlenecking in the narrow passways between tables). The food is very expensive for what you are given. The quantity is fine, but the quality could be better. When they were out of ingredients for an order at my table, instead of asking if we'd like an alternate, they just substituted ingredients, and when we pointed it out the waiter got huffy. They also push the beignets very hard with every order, which are nothing special.

excerpts: Bottomless mimosas and fresh outta the fryer beignets!
It doesn't get better than this unless you're at Cafe Du Monde in NOLA.
You GOTTA check out their weekend brunch and trust me, order the Beignets.
I only go to Protero Hill for two things: Food at Elizas and and brunch at Just For You.
beignets.author: Shauna B.
beignets.review: Bottomless mimosas and fresh outta the fryer beignets! It doesn't get better than this unless you're at Cafe Du Monde in NOLA. You GOTTA check out their weekend brunch and trust me, order the Beignets. I only go to Protero Hill for two things: Food at Elizas and and brunch at Just For You.

excerpts: I love their beignets - some of the best I've had in quite a while.
Recently had the Eggs Benedict....pretty good, but honestly, nothing to write home about.
Prior had the Biscuits & Gravy and those were above average.
Extremely rich and filling, so be warned before you order this meal.
And prior had their Burger & Fries which was also very good.
If memory serves me well I have eaten their B'fast Burritto, the Cowboy, Cowgirl, Huevos Rancheros and a number of other entrees over the many years I've been in Potrero.
To me this is one of the better b'fast
beignets.author: Anon Y.
beignets.review:
Been here several times over the course of many years. Decided to write a review today because I have most recently been there 3 times in the past 2 weeks. 

I love their beignets - some of the best I've had in quite a while. Recently had the Eggs Benedict....pretty good, but honestly, nothing to write home about. Prior had the Biscuits & Gravy and those were above average. Extremely rich and filling, so be warned before you order this meal. And prior had their Burger & Fries which was also very good. If memory serves me well I have eaten their B'fast Burritto, the Cowboy, Cowgirl, Huevos Rancheros and a number of other entrees over the many years I've been in Potrero. To me this is one of the better b'fast places around - the menu is so extensive that it's truly hard to make a decision, especially when you're hung over. 

I recommend going here for sure

excerpts: yes, it's not super cheap- usually $10-15 per person per entree, not including drinks + sides + beignets.
beignets.author: Zoe L.
beignets.review: on sundays when i get out of bed before noon + have enough energy to wait around in line, i come here.  there's always a wait, but the place really gets slammed after 11:30.  hardest part is choosing one thing from the menu- so many items look good.  service is excellent; friendly + fast + great w/refills.  yes, it's not super cheap- usually $10-15 per person per entree, not including drinks + sides + beignets.

excerpts: The only place i've seen beignets on a menu in SF.
Wait!!
The only place they serve champagne in a beer glass for $4!
It was noon and i was drunk again, hahaha.
I was sitting at the bar with my current gf and the owner was so sweeeeet, she gave me an extra beignet, hiiiiii, laissez les bon temps rouler...
beignets.author: Damien J.
beignets.review: oulala, i really like it.  The only place i've seen beignets on a menu in SF.  Wait!! The only place they serve champagne in a beer glass for $4! It was noon and i was drunk again, hahaha. I was sitting at the bar with my current gf and the owner was so sweeeeet, she gave me an extra beignet, hiiiiii, laissez les bon temps rouler...

excerpts: I especially love the homemade biscuits & beignets!
All the dishes are as great as the witty comments on the menu. :-)
beignets.author: Michelle E.
beignets.review: I'm a breakfast food luv-ah, so I'm in heaven when I go to JFY 'cause they serve breakfast all day. I especially love the homemade biscuits & beignets! All the dishes are as great as the witty comments on the menu. :-)

excerpts: As good as I hear those beignets are, we have never gotten them.
I always opt for the catfish fillet next to my two eggs, potatoes and corn bread.
That or bacon.
Very good stuff.
beignets.author: Bill M.
beignets.review:
I live right around the corner and have a 5 year old who wakes up at 6:30am every morning. Weekends too. So we never have a problem walking right in and getting a table at Just For You. In fact, our only problem is waiting for it to open on weekends.
