We go here about once a week, mostly for breakfast. As good as I hear those beignets are, we have never gotten them. I always opt for the catfish fillet next to my two eggs, potatoes and corn bread. That or bacon. Very good stuff. They also will make a Mickey Mouse pancake with strawberry and grape eyes, nose and mouth.

Marcella is usually there as our waitress. She usually talks to our daughter about princesses. Really sweet.

The burgers are good too.

excerpts: The beignets are the best I've had outside of New Orleans, and it's nice to have some grits and eggs just like back home.
The biscuits are nothing special; tasty and flakey, but  were dry, but it was almost 1pm so they may have just sat around too long.
Note that is is cash only and there is really no where else around as a backup, so don't head over unless you are OK for a wait.
beignets.author: Wino K.
beignets.review: Great place for breakfast.  There is usually a wait on weekends, and the service can be a little spartan and generic but the food is fantastic.  They put out some coffee for those who are waiting outside which is nice (though the coffee should be better).  The beignets are the best I've had outside of New Orleans, and it's nice to have some grits and eggs just like back home.  The biscuits are nothing special; tasty and flakey, but  were dry, but it was almost 1pm so they may have just sat around too long.  Note that is is cash only and there is really no where else around as a backup, so don't head over unless you are OK for a wait.

excerpts: The beignets are awesome!
The menu has some humor on it and quite diverse.
A lot of homemade stuff i.e. breads (lots of choices like scone, cornbread, wheat, biscuit, etc).
Their eggs menu is simple, you get eggs, bread, home fries or grits, and then an add on like a homemade patty etc
I loved the coffee (but then again I was hungover), but my food was a bit cold -
I'm thinking because their customers kept leaving the door open
OR they cooked mine first and my friends took longer to make.
The biscuits were "ok", not as buttery and flavor able as I had hoped.
The homemade hamburger patty was a bit bland too unfortunately, but my friends who ordered their specials like the corned beef or roast beef scrambled loved it .
I definitely want to come back to explore more, and its nice to have a good environment!
beignets.author: Neville B.
beignets.review: First place to eat on New Years Day.  My two friends intro'd the place.  Seems to be very popular since there was  a line out the door right when we sat down....we came just in time.  Parking isn't too bad first of all.  Customer service is great:  looks you in the eye, gets "it" on refilling coffee and drinks.  The beignets are awesome!  The menu has some humor on it and quite diverse.  A lot of homemade stuff i.e. breads (lots of choices like scone, cornbread, wheat, biscuit, etc).  Their eggs menu is simple, you get eggs, bread, home fries or grits, and then an add on like a homemade patty etc.   I loved the coffee (but then again I was hungover), but my food was a bit cold - I'm thinking because their customers kept leaving the door open OR they cooked mine first and my friends took longer to make.  The biscuits were "ok", not as buttery and flavor able as I had hoped.  The homemade hamburger patty was a bit bland too unfortunately, but my friends who ordered their specials like the corned beef or roast beef scrambled loved it .  I definitely want to come back to explore more, and its nice to have a good environment!

excerpts: BEIGNETS BEIGNETS....
i LOVE THE BEIGNETs here!
beignets.author: Tess C.
beignets.review: cute little place for brunch... BEIGNETS BEIGNETS.... i LOVE THE BEIGNETs here!

excerpts: I really enjoyed it and want to go back to try the people-raving-beignets and other stuff.
beignets.author: Faye P.
beignets.review: Beautiful, warm, sunny afternoon in the dogpatch. My friend and I moseyed over to Just for You Cafe and sat outside to drink up the noontide sunshine. The menu is large. You basically look at it and find yourself wanting at least one thing from each category. So making a decision can be difficult if you have a liking for it all. I had the pleasure of the New Mexican Green Chile Cheeseburger on toast and was slightly afraid of the 'fire' 'fire' 'yowza!' warnings next to the green chile option...So the waitress kindly offered to put it on the side. It was different to eat a burger on toast, but I must admit that the toast was pretty good and I liked the creole mustard spread. To eat the green chile alone was spicy, but once you slather it on the burger, I didn't find it to be that hot and just kept adding more. Sure, you may sweat a little but maybe the 'fire' 'fire' was unwarranted. I really enjoyed it and want to go back to try the people-raving-beignets and other stuff.

excerpts: yummy breakfasts (you should've seen me grubbing away in front of my computer), yummy beignets (better than powderface), not so exciting coffee (go to sundance for that!)
beignets.author: Jill k.
beignets.review: yummy breakfasts (you should've seen me grubbing away in front of my computer), yummy beignets (better than powderface), not so exciting coffee (go to sundance for that!)

excerpts: if I'm craving beignets:)
beignets.author: Winnie L.
beignets.review: Went on a Saturday morning around 10am and had to wait less than ten minutes for a table. The place was a little bigger than I thought with a few tables in the back.  Lots of choices on the menu and nice wait staff.  They make sure your coffee cup is never empty.  I got the Cowboy (french toast, eggs, and bacon) and hubby got Greg's scramble with chorizo.  The portions were good and satisfying.  This is also the place I go to if I'm craving beignets:)

excerpts: If you order the beignets -- steaming hot, smothered with powdered sugar, and well worth the wait -- then make sure you eat them right away.
For lunch, get the clam chowder, which is chock full of clams.
Fantastic service -- all of the waitstaff I encountered were friendly, helpful, and seemed super excited to be working there.
beignets.author: A. T.
beignets.review: If you order the beignets -- steaming hot, smothered with powdered sugar, and well worth the wait -- then make sure you eat them right away. For lunch, get the clam chowder, which is chock full of clams. Fantastic service -- all of the waitstaff I encountered were friendly, helpful, and seemed super excited to be working there.

excerpts: The beignets are totally worth trying too.
Finally - you can park here really easily which is a definite plus.
beignets.author: Urbo O.
beignets.review: This place is a really good weekend brunch place if you don't mind waiting a few minutes (and have cash - no credite here)  - they usually have free coffee out front while you wait, or my MO, go across and down the street to the corner cafe with the blue bottle coffee (mmmmm).  Anyhoo, Just For You has the BEST biscuits!  And they do have good coffee of their own.  I usually get their greek omelet which is really tasty.  I have had fairly good service for a reeeeallly busy place.  The beignets are totally worth trying too.  Finally - you can park here really easily which is a definite plus.

excerpts: I love beignets, I love potatoes mixed with veggies cheese and poached eggs on top.
I love Just for You Cafe, and you will too.
beignets.author: Arnold S.
beignets.review: I love beignets, I love potatoes mixed with veggies cheese and poached eggs on top. I love Just for You Cafe, and you will too.

excerpts: Make sure you order the beignets!
They do a stellar lunch as well.
A bit on the expensive side, but worth it.
beignets.author: David D.
beignets.review: Awesome breakfast and brunch.  I do breakfast meetings....and Sunday brunch.  Expect a short wait on the weekends.  Make sure you order the beignets!   They do a stellar lunch as well.  A bit on the expensive side, but worth it.

excerpts: We called the waiter back to order the beignets after last-minte deliberation.
like others have said, fried dough and sugar, can't really mess that up too bad.
I thought the crabcakes had too much vinegar, there was definitely something that wasnt' right about them, the grits were decent, but I'm a northern boy, so I don't speak from any experience.
My compantion thought the cornbread good enough to box up after only being able to devour half of it, aparently her egg scramble was better than my benny.
I'd be willing to check this place out again,
but maybe when i'm in a lazier mood, and there isn't a parade of half-naked brazilians luring me out the door.
cash only
beignets.author: shawn g.
beignets.review: Checked out this place the morning of the carnival parade.  Our party of three had a slight wait, and we're engaged in conversation too much to take advantage of the free coffee while you wait, but I did notice others partaking.  the seating was a little cramped, but the coffee and water came promptly.  After getting a few chuckles out of their irreverent menu, I ordered the Crab Benny.  We called the waiter back to order the beignets after last-minte deliberation.  like others have said, fried dough and sugar, can't really mess that up too bad.  I thought the crabcakes had too much vinegar, there was definitely something that wasnt' right about them, the grits were decent, but I'm a northern boy, so I don't speak from any experience.  My compantion thought the cornbread good enough to box up after only being able to devour half of it, aparently her egg scramble was better than my benny.  I'd be willing to check this place out again, but maybe when i'm in a lazier mood, and there isn't a parade of half-naked brazilians luring me out the door.  cash only

excerpts: You isn't exciting for vegans, but between the many eggy options, the old school brunch diner atmosphere and the coveted Beignets, this place is a winner for you Ovo Lacto's.
Love the Dogpatch and it will love you back.
beignets.author: Alex D.
beignets.review: right now, in my hallway, sits a styrofoam container and a bike helmet. inside the styrofoam container is a beignet, belonging to the same person who forgot his bike helmet after a sunday brunch at Just For You. I'm only willing to give this place three stars because my vegan meal was neither brunch nor satisfying, but my egg and dairy loving friends had a great time. It's too bad that Just For You isn't exciting for vegans, but between the many eggy options, the old school brunch diner atmosphere and the coveted Beignets, this place is a winner for you Ovo Lacto's. Love the Dogpatch and it will love you back.

excerpts: Great salads, omelets, frittatas, smokin french toast and beignets.
Pretty good staff everytime
I have been there -
ok
it might not be one of those
"it's all about the service" places, but I know that walking in
AND I have never had anyone do less than a great job as our server.
And I have been tons of times, so
I would think I have had the chance to be disappointed, but I haven't.
If I wasn't watching my girlish figure,
oh boy you would see me there a little more often.
Of course, if you have never been, get there early because there's always an insane wait, but it is worth it.
And if you are there early enough to have the fresh pot of coffee (before they run out of the cream, that is) outside while you wait for a table, even better.
I am so happy this place is in my hood.
Oh, I think this place is only open on weekends.
I could be wrong but I have never checked weekday.
beignets.author: Isa L.
beignets.review: Best hangover breakfast this side of the Mississippi.  Not sure if that's true, but it sure feels like it when I'm there for the medicine that cures what ails me.  Ok, it's definitely greasy spoon, but good.  Have never had a bad food experience.  Everything is really good - and for the dishes, they are all perfectly executed.  Great salads, omelets, frittatas, smokin french toast and beignets.  Pretty good staff everytime I have been there - ok it might not be one of those "it's all about the service" places, but I know that walking in AND I have never had anyone do less than a great job as our server.  And I have been tons of times, so I would think I have had the chance to be disappointed, but I haven't.  If I wasn't watching my girlish figure, oh boy you would see me there a little more often.  Of course, if you have never been, get there early because there's always an insane wait, but it is worth it.  And if you are there early enough to have the fresh pot of coffee (before they run out of the cream, that is) outside while you wait for a table, even better.  I am so happy this place is in my hood.  Oh, I think this place is only open on weekends.  I could be wrong but I have never checked weekday.

excerpts: servers are friendly, beignets are the best!
beignets.author: rien d.
beignets.review:
servers are friendly, beignets are the best!  (although i don't remember them being so large @ cafe dumonde in naw'lins)

it's also the first time I've tried grits - not too bad.

excerpts: Okay, not really, but where else can you get fabulous beignets AND one of the tastiest breakfast burritos around?
Just for
You is a treat.
Of course, there's always a line on weekends, but it goes pretty quickly.
If you try the vegetarian breakfast burrito, you'll understand why I like to call this place "Breakfast Burrito For You".
beignets.author: Shalom G.
beignets.review: It's like traveling the world over breakfast.  Okay, not really, but where else can you get fabulous beignets AND one of the tastiest breakfast burritos around?  Just for You is a treat.  Of course, there's always a line on weekends, but it goes pretty quickly.  If you try the vegetarian breakfast burrito, you'll understand why I like to call this place "Breakfast Burrito For You".

excerpts: and i think the beignets are yumm...
fluffy on the inside and warm.
beignets.author: Lily C.
beignets.review: been here twice and have not been disappointed. as a breakfast-lover, i must say that JUST FOR YOU does the trick.  and i think the beignets are yumm...fluffy on the inside and warm.

excerpts: they split an order of beignets - which were really huge and covered in a mound of powdered sugar.
beignets.author: Toisha T.
beignets.review: to be fair, i should note that i went here when i had a head cold. had tea and a scone - they do give you a huge cup of tea, but the scone wasn't really a scone, it was more like a slice of cake - so i was sad that it was missing that nice sconey hard outershell. we got there at 10:30 so we didn't have a real problem getting a seat. the other people i was with both loved their dishes, eggs benedict and turkey apple sausage w/ a much raved about cornbread. they split an order of beignets - which were really huge and covered in a mound of powdered sugar.

excerpts: because if it was i would be hugely obese due to their delicious beignets.
beignets.author: adams l.
beignets.review: just for you is the business. fortunately it's not near my house because if it was i would be hugely obese due to their delicious beignets.

excerpts: occasionally a side order (beignets or extra sauce, etc) is forgotten and needs to be re-ordered or taken off the bill.

*
on the beignet flipside, occasionally you get beignets you didn't order, and that don't go on your tab, thus preserving the tally on what must be some sort of universal beignet balance sheet.
mmmmm.
beignets.author: m l.
beignets.review:
these guys consistently serve tasty breakfast and lunch dishes. the coffee's good, the parking's reasonable, but on the weekends the wait will turn some people away.  unlike my review of burma superstar - which i don't think is worth the wait - something about standing around drinking free coffee and chatting with friends in the potrero sunshine makes waiting for a table here A-OK.  perhaps it's because people frequently ditch before their names are called, and the wait is usually only 20-30m or so, even around 11:30. 

service can be a bit slow, and i've (very rarely) had food that was fast out of the kitchen but slow to get to me, which is always a downer. occasionally a side order (beignets or extra sauce, etc) is forgotten and needs to be re-ordered or taken off the bill. however, i've seen them accomodate large groups and weird requests, so extra points in their favor there. 

the benedicts, scrambles, huevos, biscuits and gravy are all great; the grapefruit juice is fantastic.  

if i could give 3.5 stars i would; 3 stars due to occasionally harried, diffident service, but the food is always fab, and i keep going back.

**updated 12/08 to add to the above**
on the beignet flipside, occasionally you get beignets you didn't order, and that don't go on your tab, thus preserving the tally on what must be some sort of universal beignet balance sheet. mmmmm.

excerpts: I really wanted to save room for the beignets that I heard so much about, but my serving was huge and those longanisa were sooo good.
So, 4 stars for the food minus one for the bad table and sporadic service.
beignets.author: Rey L.
beignets.review: This is one of those places that I always pass by, heard of, but never seem to come to mind when looking for a breakfast place. But this weekend, a friend suggested it and away we went. It's every bit as cute inside as it looks on the outside. Unfortunately, tables for 3 seem to be hard to come by as group after group of twosomes behind us kept getting seated while we cooled our heels outside. Finally we got a table in Siberia - the last table on a banquette waaay at the back. Got coffee service right away, but didn't see our waitress again for another 20 minutes. When she finally came back, we asked for her opinion on some items on the menu, which she couldn't give because - get this - she is allergic to wheat and can't eat 99.9% of the items offered. I went for the Cowboy (2 eggs, French toast, and sausage/bacon). I was very excited to see that they offered a Filipino sausage called longanisa (yum!) which they allowed me to substitute for the Cowboy sausage. Overall, the food was great. I really wanted to save room for the beignets that I heard so much about, but my serving was huge and those longanisa were sooo good. So, 4 stars for the food minus one for the bad table and sporadic service.

excerpts: the beignets were about the size of my shoe.
it sort of looked like somone just tore a huge fistfull of dough and threw in in the deep fryer.
beignets.author: john m.
beignets.review:
pretty good. as long as you are expecting diner quality.

my hangtown fry was okay with only two oysters. the big jumbo kind, granted.  But I prefer the small to medium oysters.  The oysters are breaded and fried so it's hard to get that crispyness with giant oysters.

the beignets were about the size of my shoe.  it sort of looked like somone just tore a huge fistfull of dough and threw in in the deep fryer.  of course fried dough is gonna taiste good no matter what i guess.

I would give this place another try, they do bake there own bread, the food just wasn't well put together and was kind of sloppy.

excerpts: the beignets are delicious!
wait staff is super friendly.
and prices just right.
beignets.author: meadow m.
beignets.review: i love this place!  a good friend lives in the neighborhood and everytime i am there we definitely make sure to go to just for you for breakfast.  the beignets are delicious!  wait staff is super friendly. and prices just right.

excerpts: Great breakfast spot, with beignets that are to die for.
The menu changes weekly with creative specials, always consistent food.
Avoid peak hours, the wait can be pretty long, but at least it's on the warmer side of town in a great little area.
beignets.author: Buckeye W.
beignets.review: Great breakfast spot, with beignets that are to die for.  The menu changes weekly with creative specials, always consistent food.  Avoid peak hours, the wait can be pretty long, but at least it's on the warmer side of town in a great little area.
